articles.title: Gorsuch on Expanding Sex Discrimination Protections to Cover Trans, Gay Individuals: âMassive Social Upheavalâ
articles.subtitle: The United States Supreme Court on Tuesday heard oral arguments on two cases that ask the court to expand the sex discrimination protections in the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to cover homosexuals and transgenders.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: âOf course, there are,â Gorsuch said. âThatâs not the question, Mr. Cole.â âMr. Cole, the question is a matter of the judicial role and the modesty in interpreting statutes that are old. And thatâs the question he posed,â Gorsuch said. âNobody is questioning, and he certainly did not, the legitimacy of the claims and the importance of them,â Gorsuch said. âThe question is about judicial interpretation,â Gorsuch said. âIf you wish to address it.â Cole said that the Plaintiff was not asking to change the definition of sex as it was defined in 1964 but argued that it was because of his sex as a man who wanted âto presentâ as a woman that caused the termination. Gorsuch responded that the case could be close on the âtextualâ review of the 1964 law but that social implications are much broader. He said: At the end of the day, should he or she take into consideration the massive social upheaval that would be entailed in such a decision, and the possibility that â that Congress didnât think about it. That is more effective â more appropriate a legislative rather than a judicial function? But Cole argued transgenders are not âdisruptive.â âSo, first of all, federal courts of appeals have been recognizing that discrimination against transgender people is sex discrimination for 20 years,â Cole said. âThereâs been no upheaval.â âAs I was saying, there are transgender male lawyers in this courtroom following the male dress code and going to the menâs room and the Courtâs dress code and sex-segregated restrooms have not fallen,â Cole added. Bostock v. Clayton County Georgia and Altitude Express, Inc. v. Zarada were brought by homosexual men who claimed they were fired because of their sexual orientation. âSo the notion that somehow this is going to be a huge upheaval, we havenât seen that upheaval for 20 years, thereâs no reason you â you would see that upheaval,â Cole said. âTransgender people follow the rule thatâs associated with their gender identity.â âItâs not disruptive,â Cole said. In previewing the cases, Steven D. Schwinn, professor of law at the University of Illinois Chicago John Marshall Law School, said that the courtâs ruling âmatters deeply to the estimated 11.3 million LGBTQ adults in the United States.â But âemployers, the government and their amici argue that the plaintiffâs reading of Title VII would so âexpandâ the concept of âsexâ that employers would not know show to comply, and courts would not know how to enforce it.â Schwinn wrote: Moreover, the defendants and their amici argue that the plaintiffsâ reading of Title VII could mean the end of things like sex-specific restrooms and locker rooms and this could actually undermine Title VII by threatening other sex specific practices and institutions that are designed to provide an equal playing field between men and women. These cases are Bostock v. Clayton County Georgia, No. 17-1618, Altitude Express, Inc. v. Zarda, No. 17-1623, and R.G. &G.R. Harris Funeral Homes, Inc. v. EEOC, No. 18-107 in the Supreme Court of the United States. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter R.G. & G.R. Harris Funeral Homes, Inc. v. EEOC centers on a man who was fired after he announced he had changed his name and would now be coming to work as a woman. The businessâs sex-specific dress code required women to wear skirts as their work uniform. Justice Neil Gorsuch had an exchange with David Cole, attorney for Aimee Stephens, who was William Stephens for the six years he worked at the funeral home, first as an apprentice and then as a funeral director and embalmer. Cole said that Stephens would have been fired even if he complied with the dress code for women in the funeral home because he was a man, a clear case of sex discrimination, he argued. Gorsuch said: I guess I â Iâd just like you to have a chance to respond to Judge Lynch in his thoughtful dissent in which he lamented everything you have before us, but suggested that something as drastic a change in this country as bathrooms in every place of employment and dress codes in every place of employment that are otherwise gender neutral would be changed, that that â that thatâs an essentially legislative decision. âJudge Lynch is a very thoughtful judge and â and wrote a very thoughtful opinion that I â I think he probably regretted having to write,â Gorsuch said. âWhat do you say to him?â Cole said: I say that recognizing that transgender people have a right to exist in the workplace and not be turned away because of who they are does not end dress codes or restrooms. There are transgender lawyers in this courtroom today.

articles.title: Protesters Swarm Max Roseâs Office Over His Support of Impeachment
articles.subtitle: Protesters on Monday swarmed Rep. Max Roseâs (D-NY) office over his newfound support of the partisan-fueled impeachment inquiry.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Rose â who represents New Yorkâs 11th district, which Trump won by ten percentage points in 2016 â recently caved and announced his support for an impeachment inquiry. âI will support and I will defend the United States Constitution, and it is for that reason that I intend to fully support this impeachment inquiry and follow the facts,â he told supporters at a town hall last week. âIâm gonna follow these facts wherever they lead, no matter the consequences,â he added. Protesters â who chanted âHey, hey! Ho, ho! Max Rose has got to go!â swarmed his office on Monday alongsideÂ Staten Island GOP Chairman Brendan Lantry and New York State Republican Chairman Nick Langworthy. âThe president won this district by almost 11 percentage points, the people of Staten Island and Brooklyn and this district spoke loud and clear, (Rose) is going to face a wrath of those constituents next November, mark my words,â Langworthy said at the protest, according to MSN. Lantry added: Instead of focusing on doing his job and focusing on the important issues like improving our infrastructure, making New York competitive despite oppressive taxes and regulations, or lowering the cost of prescription drugs, Max fell in line with the most radical elements of the Democratic Party. âItâs insulting the left is questioning our decision of whom we voted for,â one voter said:  âMax Roseâs constituents overwhelmingly voted to elect President Trump, but Max just canât let it go: heâs absolutely obsessed with impeaching Trump and overturning his constituentsâ choice in the 2016 election,â Congressional Leadership Fund (CLF) spokesman Calvin Moore said in a statement. âMax Rose has no intention of delivering on any of the issues voters elected him on, as long as he can team up with radical left for one more Hail Mary pass at removing Trump from office, no matter the cost,â he added. Rose defended his decision to back the inquiry on Monday. âI didnât fight our enemies overseas so that our leaders would invite them to interfere in our elections back home,â he said. âItâs disappointing to see the Republican Party put China and Russia ahead of America,â he continued. âMy job is to get the facts, not play politics â and thatâs exactly what Iâm going to do.â Rose is not the only lawmaker who has faced protests over support for the impeachment inquiry. Protesters surrounded Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) at the Reno airport last week, demanding her to âstop the impeachmentâ of Trump:  Additionally, Trump supporters greeted House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) in South Carolina on Friday, holding up signs reading, âImpeach Pelosiâ:  Internal polling spells trouble for vulnerable Democrats in key congressional districts. According to National Republican Congressional Committee (NRCC) polling, the majority of voters do not consider Trumpâs phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky an impeachable offense.

articles.title: Arrest Made in Death of Amber Guyger Trial Witness
articles.subtitle: An arrest has been made in the murder of Amber Guyger witness Joshua Brown.
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: Brown testified in the trial that resulted in the conviction of Guyger, the former Dallas Police Officer who is now in prison for the murder of Botham Jean. USA Today reported that Brown was found âshot to deathâ in a parking lot Friday, and NBC News reports that a suspect in Brownâs death was arrested today. The suspect, 20-year-oldÂ Jacquerious Mitchell, says Brown was allegedly killed as a result of an altercation in a drug deal gone bad. Mitchell claims 22-year-oldÂ Thaddeous Green shot Brown, fatally wounding him. Police suspect a third man, 32-year-old Michael Mitchell, was the getaway driver after the alleged shooting. Green and Mitchell are still on the run and police consider both to be âarmed and dangerous.â The NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, together with a number of community leaders, âhad called for an independent investigation into Brownâs death and the Dallas police departmentâ prior to todayâs arrest. There is no word yet on whether the independent investigation will still be sought. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Trump Campaign Claims Victory in Battle with Leftist Mayor Over Minneapolis Rally Expenses
articles.subtitle: The Trump campaign claimed victory late Tuesday in its battle with Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey, a first term Democrat elected in 2017 who wanted the campaign to pay more than $500,000 in security expenses for Thursdayâs rally at the Target Center.
articles.author: Michael Patrick Leahy
articles.content: âThe arena in Minneapolis has been fully approved. The Target Center has backed off cancelling the contract, which means President Trumpâs Keep America Great rally will go on as scheduled,â Trump 2020 campaign manager Brad Parscale said in a statement issued on Tuesday afternoon. âConsistent with our original agreement with the venue, the Trump campaign has not agreed to pay any additional funds. We look forward to seeing everyone Thursday night,â Parscale concluded. The Trump campaign criticized Freyâs action in a statement released on Monday evening: The radical leftist mayor of Minneapolis, Jacob Frey, is abusing the power of his office and attempting to extort President Trumpâs re-election campaign by conjuring a phony and outlandish bill for security in an effort to block a scheduled Keep America Great rally. Democrat Mayor Frey is using the bogus security charges to pressure the Target Center, site of the contracted October 10, 2019 rally, into preventing Minnesota residents from exercising their First Amendment rights in support of President Trump. Freyâs city government preemptively informed the Target Center that it would be responsible for $530,000 in security and other costs related to the event. The Target Center attempted to pass the costs on to the Trump campaign under threat of withholding the use of the arena. The Trump campaign informed the Target Center that the U.S. Secret Service is solely responsible for coordinating security and that withholding the use of the arena would be viewed as a breach of contract and result in court action. Additionally, the ridiculous sum of $530,000 is more than 26 times the estimated security costs for a 2009 Target Center health care rally held by President Barack Obama. Police officials estimated that the costs then were around $20,000. Again, the costs are a matter between the city and the Secret Service. On Tuesday morning, President Trump blasted Frey in a tweet:   The battle lines between critics and supporters of the president have been drawn in Minnesota â a critical 2020 battleground state that President Trump lost by a narrow margin of about 44,000 votes â since his election in November 2016. The Trump rally in the Target Center on Thursday is expected to accelerate that battle, asÂ WCCO reported: On Monday afternoon, a small coalition of protesters turned out to say their numbers will be much larger on Thursday. âWe invite all Minnesotans to join us to oppose Trumpâs racist agenda, his anti-people agenda,â Tracy Molm, of the Anti-War Committee, said. Earlier Monday outside Target Center, a small group chanted, âNo Trump, no KKK, no racist USA,â ahead of holding a press conference regarding planned protests Thursday. The coalition said they plan to protest peacefully, but they believe Trump will target U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar during his rally. Theyâre worried that militia and anti-Muslim groups will follow the president to Minneapolis. âWe believe this will be the case this week as this president comes to continue to further pin neighbors against one another,â Jaylani Hussein, executive director of CAIR, said. Supporters of the president, includingÂ âmembers of the Minneapolis Police Federationâ and a number of grassroots conservative groups, are expected to turn out in large numbers outside as well as inside the Target Center rally.

articles.title: Former Transgender Woman on Sex Change Regret: People Are âDe-Transitioning in the Hundredsâ
articles.subtitle: Inside the United States Supreme Court on Tuesday, justices heard oral arguments on whether Section VII the Civil Rights Act of 1964 protecting individuals from discrimination because of their sex applies to homosexuals and transgenders.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: But as attorneys made their pitches in the courtroom, Walt Heyer was making his own case about the lies being told about gender dysphoria on the steps of the High Court. Heyer has credibility on the subject: In his 40s he started taking hormones, had gender reassignment surgery and lived as Laura Jensen for eight years. âIt all started when I was four-years-old and my grandmother started crossdressing me and I enjoyed it very much,â Jensen said. âBut that cross dressing started a confusion within me about who I was.â âAnd it was in 1944 before we had any words like gender dysphoria,â Heyer said. âI was just a confused kid that was being affirmed by my grandmother who actually caused me to have this tremendous confusion, which started this journey to transgenderism,â Heyer said. Heyer said it was when he starting studying to be a counselor that he uncovered the truth about his own life. âI wanted to be a therapist,â Heyer said. âSo I studied at U.C. Santa Cruz and realized in studying the books in the stacks that people who identified with gender identity disorder had mental disorders.â âAnd I thought weâre not approaching this from the right direction,â Heyer said on the steps of the Supreme Court. âWe need to be addressing the co-morbid problems that are causing people to believe theyâre a different gender.â âIt seems to be compassionate to me to reach out to those people and actually guide them in the right direction and not fill their bodies with hormones and cut body parts off and rearrange everything in their lives so their lives are totally destroyed,â Heyer said. Heyer, who has lived as a married man for the past 21 years, has a website, sexchangeregret.comÂ that he said hundreds of thousands of people have visited. âToday we have a worldwide ministry that reaches over 300 million people a year and people now are de-transitioning in the hundreds,â Heyer said. Heyer also wrote about his life in USA Today earlier this year: I was 50 when I had the breast implants removed, but the next few years were spent in confusion and counseling. In 1996, at the age of 55, I was finally free from the desire to live as a woman and changed my legal documents back to Walt, my biologically correct male sex. I still have scars on my chest, reminders of the gender detour that cost me 13 years of my life. I am on a hormone regimen to try to regulate a system that is permanently altered. Had I not been misled by media stories of sex change âsuccessâ and by medical practitioners who said transitioningÂ was the answer to my problems, I wouldnât have suffered as I have. Genetics canât be changed. Feelings, however, can and do change. Underlying issues often drive the desire to escape oneâs life into another, and they need to be addressed before taking the radical step of transition. After de-transitioning, I know the truth: Hormones and surgery may alter appearances, but nothing changes the immutable fact of your sex. Heyer told people gathered at the Supreme Court â many there to protest for homosexual and transgender rights â that he has compassion for people who are struggling with their gender dysphoria but that true compassion calls for telling them the truth. âI have tremendous compassion for those people who are struggling deeply with their identity and we all need to love them and have compassion for them,â Heyer said. âBut compassion isnât filling them with hormones; cutting off body parts.â âItâs addressing the issues that are causing them to feel that way,â Heyer said. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter

articles.title: Nolte: No Legitimate Media Would Accept Adam Schiffâs Impeachment Lies and Secrecy
articles.subtitle: We have impeachment witnesses testifying in secret. We have transcripts of that testimony kept secret. We have Democrats refusing to allow Republicans to question a secret (fake) whistleblower. We have selective leaks of this secret testimony. We have the ringleader behind all of this, Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA), secretly conspiring with the fake whistleblower. And all of this is occurring within the framework of overturning a presidential election.
articles.content: We all know why Democrats and the media want the whistleblower to be allowed to hurl rocks and tomatoes from behind a maskâ¦ This removes the right of the accused to question the motives and integrity of his accuser. Imagine if we had never met Julie Swetnick and Christine Blasey Ford, the two liars who accused then-Supreme Court Nominee Brett Kavanaugh of sexual assault. Without the opportunity to question them and learn about their histories, the phony charges they leveled probably would have brought Kavanaugh down. Thatâs what Democrats want to avoid, and no one can blame them. Politics is tough stuff. I get thatâ¦ But what we are seeing from the media is a total abdication of every journalistic standard as they defend the secret proceedings behind a presidential coup orchestrated by a man who has made a cottage industry out of lying to the media about having the goods on Trump. Can you imagine Chuck Todd and Jake Tapper, or anyone else who pretends to be a journalist, if some anonymous whistleblower downloaded on Barack Obama and Republicans responded with secret hearings where Democrats were not even allowed to question the accuser? Can you imagine Republicans holding secret impeachment proceedings to take down Obama using secret testimony? The media would literally be on television jumping up and down on their desks demanding transparency. And they would be 100 percent right. But we no longer have a media. All we have is a mob of coup plotters frustrated as hell over the failure of the Russia Collusion Hoax, backed by billions of corporate dollars, and who are willing to do everything in their sinister power to facilitate the removal of a duly elected president in almost total secrecy, willing to be serially lied to by an Adam Schiff, willing to violate every norm that makes our Constitution, our judicial and political system the envy of the world â¦ just to get Drumpf. Follow John Nolte on Twitter @NolteNC. Follow his Facebook Page here.  There is no way a legitimate media would ever be okay with any of this. Throughout this entire Ukraine Hoax, Schiff has lied to the media, misled the media with selective leaks, over-promised on supposed bombshells â like what we would learn from the Ukraine call transcript that ended up being a big dud â and Schiff is right now working in the kind of partisan secrecy that literally reeks of a banana republic. And stillâ¦ Our corrupt media do not care. In fact, they are aiding and abetting this fascist secrecy. A legitimate media would be screaming from the rafters for all witness transcripts to be released, not just to them but to the public. A legitimate media that truly believed in ânormsâ and âdemocracyâ would demand that witnesses testify in public, would demand that the name of the phony whistleblower be released, would demand that a Â process as serious as impeachment be every bit as transparent and public as previous impeachment efforts in the television age â meaning the impeachment will be televised. How did our media become so corrupt and so un-American that they are facilitating this secret coup attempt, not only with their silence in the face of this unprecedented secrecy, but with propaganda-nonsense about how dangerous it would be for the whistleblower to be identified.

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Fundraises With Misleading Email About Pregnancy Story
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) sent a fundraising email Tuesday evening in which she repeated a claim that she had been fired from her first teaching job for being âvisibly pregnant.â
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: However, new evidence that has emerged in the past several days â from left-wing, right-wing, and mainstream media sources â has cast doubt on that claim. In the subject line of her email, Warren claimed: âBy June I was visibly pregnant â and the principal told me the job Iâd already been promised for the next year would go to someone else.â She continued: âMy story is not unique. And now, right-wing media outlets are dismissing my story â and in doing so, dismissing many similar stories of other women who have also been affected by pregnancy discrimination.â The implication was that the principal fired herÂ because of her pregnancy. Warren has repeated the same story on the campaign trail and the debate stage for several months. However, in a video interview from 2007 highlighted by Jacobin writer (and Democratic Socialists of America member) Meagan Day last Tuesday, Warren said that she chose to leave her job after her first year because she lacked the necessary qualifications and decided, while pursuing the necessary graduate level education courses, that she did not want to continue. âI actually didnât have the education courses, so I was on an âemergency certificate,â it was called,â Warren recalled. Â âAnd I went back to graduate school, and took a couple of courses in education, and said, âI donât think this is going to work out for me.ââ She then added: âAnd I was pregnant with my first baby, so I had a baby, and I stayed home for a couple of years.â Warren never mentioned anything about being fired. On Monday, the Washington Free Beacon published notes from county school board meetings showing that Warrenâs contract had been renewed unanimously for a second year, but that she chose to resign â a decision the board accepted âwith regret.â Late Monday evening, CBS News published a story in which Warren stuck to her story about being let go for being pregnant, saying she had only opened up more fully about her life when entering politics. The mainstream news network also found contemporaneous newspaper accounts from 1971 that reported Warren had left her job voluntarily. In her fundraising email, Warren cited one of two teachers quoted in the CBS News story, who said: âThe rule was at five months you had to leave when you were pregnant. Now, if you didnât tell anybody you were pregnant, and they didnât know, you could fudge it and try to stay on a little bit longer. But they kind of wanted you out if you were pregnant.â She left out that the teachers also told CBS News that they âdonât remember anyone being explicitly fired due to pregnancy during their time at the school.â Warren, who raised nearly $25 million in the third quarter, trailing only Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) among Democratic presidential candidates, has used this fundraising tactic before. In November 2017, she raisedÂ cash off President Donald Trump calling her âPocahontas,â referring to her false claims of Native American ancestry. By 2019, she had to apologize. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Dem Rep. Cicilline: We Need to Have Impeachment Vote âBefore the End of the Yearâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: On Tuesdayâs broadcast of CNNâs âSituation Room,â Representative David Cicilline (D-RI) stated that he thinks there needs to be a vote on impeaching President Trump before the end of this year. Cicilline said, âI think it needs to happen quickly. â¦ I think before the end of the year. I think before the end of the year, for sure. We cannot allow the president to obstruct Congress, to try to run out the clock. We have the whistleblower who has provided this information. We have the presidentâs own admission to the misconduct. We have this transcript of the phone call, in which itâs laid out, plain and simple. Thereâs really no additional evidence you need. Weâre being very careful to collect more.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: Watchâ Feminist Speaks Against Transgender Ideology: âI Will Not Submitâ
articles.subtitle: Feminists must escape from the sexual and political abuse inflicted by the men who dominate the transgender ideology, a feminist author declared Tuesday at a demonstration outside the Supreme Court.
articles.author: Neil Munro
articles.content: âA man can never be a woman,â Natasha Chart told the crowd and the cameras. âA lesbian can never be male â¦ I will not be forced to lie, I will not submit,â she said. She spoke from a stage where her broad alliance of feminists, lesbians, and conservatives explained their shared political opposition to the transgender ideology. Their anti-transgenderism speeches were delivered as several lawyers for the transgender movement told the Supreme Court judges that the government must embrace transgenderism. That ideology demands that the government outlaw any legal or civic recognition of the complementary sexual and biological differences between legally equal men and women. Chart, a feminist writer at FeministCurrent.org, used her speech to urge other feminists to walk away from the men who dominate the transgender ideology: Iâve been told that I am not a nice, inclusive person for saying that the law needs to be able to recognize sex. And not just me, but all the women who donât believe that human beings can change sex. Weâve been, weâve even been accused of perpetrating genocide. Itâs funny because five years ago, I first started seeing lesbians were being publicly shamed, sexually harassed, and demonized by straight men calling themselves lesbians. These men also tended to call themselves progressives, feminists â¦ They keep telling us now that they are absolutely indispensable to the womenâs movement, and we cannot do without them. Everyone can always see this behavior, and they always get away with it. I didnât think â and I still donât â that sexually harassing lesbians is a good way to be inclusive. So I objected. It turns out itâs a firing offense on todayâs left to complain about men sexually harassing lesbians if that man says he feels like heâs a lesbian. That harassment still goes on, and if anything, it has gotten worse. Women share shocking screenshots with me from lesbian dating apps, which are now just simply packed wall-to-wall with men. These men have even started getting womenâs [social media] profiles suspended for saying no to them and refusing to recognize their gender and validate their feelings. Across social media, womenâs accounts and access to public conversation is under permanent, constant surveillance for offenses against men claiming to be women, with catastrophic penalties for refusing to lie for them to spare their feelings. Is that nice behavior? What about my feelings? What about the feelings of all the women who have lost all access to public conversation on social media? I saw that President [Barack] Obama made several moves to end single-sex facilities for women and girls through executive branch orders and funding threats. His administration and now the entire Democratic congressional caucus made a point of insisting on an end to womenâs rights to bodily privacy from men whenever we are outside our homes. If a woman complains that a man has dropped his trousers in front of her at a job, the left will shout âMe Too!â in solidarity, and heâll be cancelled. If a woman complains because he dropped his trousers in front of her at a gym locker, but he says heâs a woman, theyâll cancel her. Is that kind? Was it inclusive when the women who objected to that [trouser dropping] were fired for it? Women are still being fired if they dare to say anything against this. Anywhere on the left, some of us may be fired for the offense of appearing at this [alliance]Â gathering today. None of the women at liberal organizations can say no to this [transgender] agenda or their peers will destroy them, and that makes their consent to this [transgender ideology] â their support for it â as meaningful as a hostage statement. Last night, aÂ woman wrote to me, a progressive reporter who is outspoken and not shy to hold unpopular opinions, to ask for a quote for this [transgender legal] case. And after she got my reply, she said to me, she wrote, âI just met Aimee [Stephens, the plaintiff in the lawsuit], she prepares for tomorrow, she is a woman.â And I asked her, âIn what way is Stephens a woman?â And she said, and I quote, âItâs not a matter of what I think.â And Iâm here [to protest] for her [the reporter] today, even though she probably really dislikes me. It is the right of all women to speak publicly and be able to petition our government for the redress of our grievances and be able to participate openly in the public sphere. I have seen numerous women banned from social media for pointing out that gender transition treatments leave children sterile for life at ages where they canât possibly consent to such permanent decisions. But a generation of quirky, stereotype-rejecting kids â many of whom would grow up to identify as lesbian, gay, or bisexual, many of whom are autistic â are being sterilized as minors now. And the only crime that the left or social media companies seem to recognize in this is the crime of women objecting to the wholesale sterilization of vulnerable children. For that, we get accused of âpromoting genocide.â There are doctors in the U.S. who will go to work today and oversee the chemical castration of little boys, who will put 14-year-old girls into menopause, and give troubled young girls cosmetic mastectomies. And I object â and for that, Iâm considered dangerous. Iâve seen public calls for every type of harm against those of us who object to the end of womenâs sex-based rights or who object to the sterilization of children. To the people who say â¦ the only meaningful type of violence [they recognize] is that I refuse to call a man âshe.â Still others insist it is violent of me to associate withÂ conservatives, in spite of the fact that gender activists associate with lots of conservatives, and Iâve never seen anyone have a problem with that. Itâs almost like women who say no to these men [who say they are transgender] are just going to be wrong, no matter what we do. Sisters, when a man puts you under constant surveillance and retaliates whenever you say no, and huffs about being indispensable, and he makes you lie toÂ spare his feelings, and he always puts you in the wrong â no matter what â that is not a partnership. Itâs abuse. Plan a way out before it gets worse. It will get worse. In closing, to echo my sisters in the U.K., a man can never be a woman. A lesbian can never be male. My name is Natasha Chart from New York state. I will not be forced to lie. I will not submit. The primary victims of the transgender ideology are teens â including some who would otherwise mature into lesbian women or gay men. But there is no media focus b/c feminists & progressives want more TGs & the L&G groups are steered by transgender donors. https://t.co/bD7c8UNSZe â Neil Munro (@NeilMunroDC) September 23, 2019  Transgender Facts: In general, the transgender ideology says a personâs legal and civic recognition as a man or a woman is determined by their âgender identity,â not by their biology. The ideology also insists that men and women are more or less interchangeable, and it objects to the publicâs view of the two sexes as simultaneously different, complementary, and equal. The transgender advocates want to impose their ideology on Americans by establishing âtransgender rightsâ laws, which would require the Department of Justice to penalize individuals and groups who insist that biology determines male or female status â and also shapes peoplesâ likely political, civic, and personal priorities. Polls show the transgender ideology is deeplyÂ unpopular, especially amongÂ women andÂ parents. In 2017, former President Barack Obama told NPR that his promotion of the transgender ideology made it easier for Donald Trump to win the presidency. MultipleÂ pollsÂ show that most Americans reasonablyÂ wishÂ to help and comfort peopleÂ who think they are a member of the opposite sex, even as they alsoÂ rejectÂ the transgender ideologyâs claimÂ that peopleâs legal sex is determined by their feeling of âgender identity,â not by biology. A U.K. surveyÂ showsÂ a similar mix of sympathy for people who say they are transgender alongside lopsided opposition to the ideology. The transgender movement is diverse, so its different factions have competing goals and priorities. It includes sexual liberationists,Â progressives, feminists who wish toÂ blurÂ distinctionsÂ between the two sexes, and people who glamorize theÂ differencesÂ between the two sexes. It includes high-profileÂ children, people who areÂ tryingÂ to live as members of the opposite sex, troubled teenage girls trying toÂ fleeÂ womanhood, and people trying to âde-transitionâÂ backÂ to their sex. It also includes men whoÂ demandÂ sex fromÂ lesbians, masculineÂ autogynephilesÂ who say they are entitled to womenâs rights, alpha malesÂ who insist they are the natural leaders of women,Â parentsÂ eagerÂ to support their childrenâsâ transgender claims, wealthyÂ donors,Â politicians, politicalÂ professionals,Â revenue-seeking drug companies,Â surgeons, and medical serviceÂ providers. Transgender advocates claim that two million Americans say they are transgender to a greater or lesser extent. But very fewÂ peopleÂ who describe themselves as transgender undergo cosmetic surgery of the genitals. Only about 4,118Â AmericansÂ surgically altered their bodies in hospitals from 2000 to 2014 to appear like members of the opposite sex, according to a pro-transgender medical study.Â A PentagonÂ reportÂ commissioned by former Defense Secretary James Mattis said that ârates for genital surgery are exceedingly low â 2% of transgender men and 10% of transgender women.â Yet the gender ideology isÂ rapidly gainingÂ power, aided byÂ huge donations from wealthy individuals and medical companies. In Ohio, for example, in February, a judge forced the parents of a teenage girl to giveÂ up custodyÂ so she can begin a lifetime of drug treatments and surgery that will allow her to appear as a male. The progressive push to bend Americansâ attitudes and their male and female civic society around the idea of âgender identityâ has already attacked and cracked many of the popular social rules that help Americans manage the cooperation and competition among and between complementary, different, and equal men and women. These pro-gender claims have an impact on different-sex bathrooms, sheltersÂ for battered women, sports leagues for girls, hiking groups for boys,Â K-12Â curricula, university speech codes,Â religiousÂ freedoms, freeÂ speech, the social status ofÂ women, parentsâ rights in childrearing, childrenâsÂ safety, practices to help teenagers, health outcomes, womenâsÂ idealsÂ ofÂ beauty, culture and civil society, scientific research, prisonÂ safety, civic ceremonies, schoolÂ rules, menâs sense of masculinity, lawÂ enforcement, military culture, and childrenâs sexual privacy. Progressives use the near-universal sexual rejection of transgender people to justify their demand that government sneak another sexual revolution into Americans' lives & communities. The goal is ending "compulsory heterosexuality" & the "gender binary." https://t.co/En8OHnfmXA â Neil Munro (@NeilMunroDC) September 6, 2019

articles.title: Pelosi Vows to Hold Trump âAccountableâ After Refusal to Comply with Impeachment Probe
articles.subtitle: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) responded Tuesday to President Donald Trumpâs refusal to cooperate with an impeachment inquiry sparked by a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint, stating: âMr. President, you are not above the law.Â You will be held accountable.â
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: âFor a while, the President has tried to normalize lawlessness. Now, he is trying to make lawlessness a virtue,â Pelosiâs statement read.Â âThe White House letter is only the latest attempt to cover up his betrayal of our democracy, and to insist that the President is above the law.â âThis letter is manifestly wrong, and is simply another unlawful attempt to hide the facts of the Trump Administrationâs brazen efforts to pressure foreign powers to intervene in the 2020 elections.Â  Despite the White Houseâs stonewalling, we see a growing body of evidence that shows that President Trump abused his office and violated his oath to âprotect, preserve and defend the Constitution,ââ it added. âMr. President, you are not above the law. You will be held accountable.â Earlier Tuesday, the White House sent a letter to PelosiÂ stating it refuses to cooperate with the probe and blasted it as âillegitimate and unconstitutional.â The letter, written by White House Counsel Pat Cipollone, accused the speaker of attempting to âoverturn the resultsâ of the 2016 presidential election. âGiven that your inquiry lacks any legitimate constitutional foundation, any pretense of fairness, or even the most elementary due process protections, the Executive Branch cannot be expected to participate in it,â the letter read. âBecause participating in this inquiry under the current unconstitutional posture would inflict lasting institutional harm on the Executive Branch and lasting damage to the separation of powers, you have the President no choice. âConsistent with the duties of the President of the United States, and in particular his obligation to preserve the rights of future occupants of his office, President Trump cannot permit his Administration to participate in this partisan inquiry under these circumstances,â it added. Pelosi launched the impeachment probe against President TrumpÂ on September 24th after a partisan CIA officer accused the president in a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint of asking Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to look into allegations of corruption against former Vice PresidentÂ Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden. Both presidents have denied any pressure was applied to probe into the Bidens, and in a nod to transparency, the White House released a transcript of the world leadersâ call to illustrate no wrongdoing occurred. âWe had I think good phone call. It was normal. We spoke about many things, and I â so I think and you read it that nobody pushed me,âÂ Zelensky, flanked by President Trump, told reporters at the United Nations last month.

articles.title: Kris Kobach Calls Out Kansas Sanctuary City: You Are âBreaking Federal Lawâ
articles.subtitle: United States Senate candidate Kris Kobach is calling out a Kansas sanctuary city, demanding they drop their policy of shielding criminal illegal aliens from deportation and committing to lead the fight to defund sanctuary cities nationwide.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: This week, Roeland Park, Kansas Police Chief John Morris announced his departmentâs new sanctuary policy that bans police officers from turning criminal illegal aliens over to the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agency for deportation. During a press conference on Tuesday, Kobach called on the Roeland Park Police Department to drop the policy and vowed to defund sanctuary cities nationwide if elected to the Senate in the stateâs 2020 senatorial race. Kobach said: It is a sad day for Kansas when one of its cities puts the interests of illegal aliens over the safety of its own citizens. When ICE seeks custody of an illegal alien it is almost always because the alien has a criminal past or is a known gang member. Roeland Park is now going to be releasing those illegal aliens onto the street. The Roeland Park policy severely restricts its officers from sending this information. The city is breaking federal law by adopting this policy, but unfortunately federal law doesnât include penalties for cities that disobey it. As Senator, I will push to restrict federal funds to sanctuary cities that put American lives in danger. Many lives have been taken by illegal aliens in Kansas. This sanctuary policy increases the chances that more lives will be lost. Kobach detailed recent cases where Americans have been killed by illegal aliens in the Kansas City metro area, including a March 2016 quadruple homicide allegedly committed by illegal alien Pablo Antonio-Vitorino, the September 2016 killing of Johnson County Sheriffâs Deputy Brandon Collins by illegal alien Adrian Espinosa-Flores, and the death of Amanda Bixby in February 2007 at the hands of illegal alien Ricardo De-Leon. Angel Dad Dennis Bixby said he is forever separated from his daughter Amanda because of illegal immigration in Kansas: There will be no more birthdays, no holidays, no wedding for me to give her away, and no grandchildren. City council members should ask themselves how they would respond to a grieving parent or family when they are asked why they so callously approved this policy. For years, Kobach has sought to ban sanctuary cities in Kansas. One of Kobachâs opponents in the GOP primaryÂ  Senate, Susan Wagle â who has been Kansas Senate President since 2013 â previously blocked his 2017 effort to outlaw sanctuary cities in the state in 2017. The legislation passed out of committee with majority support, but Wagle failed to ever bring the bill to a vote. Full Disclosure: Kris Kobach writes a weekly column for Breitbart News. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Overtakes Joe Biden in Real Clear Politics Average
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) has surpassed Joe Biden (D) in the current Real Clear Politics average, marking the first time Biden has lost his lead since announcing his presidential bid.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The current Real Clear Politics average shows Warren narrowly edging out Biden with 26.6 percent support to Bidenâs 26.4 percent support. The change follows weeks of Warren slowly gaining on Biden in both national and early primary state polls. Both candidates hold a double-digit lead over Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), who is currently averaging 14.6 percent. The RCP average also reflects Sen. Kamala Harrisâs (D-CA) continued fall, showing Mayor Pete Buttigieg (D) taking her formerly held fourth place position with 5.6 percent support to the California senatorâs 4.4 percent. The average shows Andrew Yang (D) in sixth place with 2.8 percent support, followed by Beto OâRourke (D) with two percent support. The remaining candidates are averaging less than two percent:  Twelve candidates will participate in the Democrat debate in Westerville, Ohio, on October 15.

articles.title: The Show Will Go On â Minneapolis Trump Rally Approved Despite Arena Security Dispute
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trumpâs Thursday rally in Minneapolis will continue as scheduled, a dispute over an exorbitant security fee having been resolved.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âWe look forward to seeing everyone Thursday night,â said Trump campaign manager Brad Parscale in a statement announcing the news. Despite the management of the Target Center threatening to cancel the arena contract, they backed down after the Trump campaign threatened Monday evening to sue in response. âConsistent with our original agreement with the venue, the Trump campaign has not agreed to pay any additional funds,â Parscale said. Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey tacked on a $530,000 security fee and other costs to the Target Center for the scheduled event on Thursday that the Target Centerâs management, AEG Management TWN, tried to pass onto the Trump campaign. The campaignâs lawyer threatened to sue for a breach of contract. âThis last-minute squeeze seems to be nothing but a pretextual political effort with serious First Amendment ramifications,â a letter read from the Trump campaignâs lawyer to the Target Centerâs management firm. Frey was not pleased with the news that Trump was planning a rally, saying that the president was not welcome. âWhile there is no legal mechanism to prevent the president from visiting, his message of hatred will never be welcome in Minneapolis,â Frey said in a September statement.

articles.title: Hillary: Maybe We Need âRematchâ with Me and Trump, âI Can Beat Him Againâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: During an interview aired on Tuesdayâs broadcast of âPBS NewsHour,â former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton remarked that maybe there should be a ârematchâ between her and President Trump, and âobviously, I can beat him again.â Hillary said, âYou know, it truly is remarkable how obsessed he remains with me. But this latest tweet is so typical of him. Nothing has been more examined and looked at than my emails. We all know that. So, heâs either lying or delusional, or both. There was no subpoena, as he says in a tweet this morning. So, maybe there does need to be a rematch. I mean, obviously, I can beat him again. But, just seriously, I donât understand, I donât think anybody understands what motivates him, other than personal grievance, other than seeking adulation.â (h/t Mediaite) Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: MSNBC, Washington Post to Co-Host November Democrat Presidential Debate
articles.subtitle: MSNBC announced Tuesday that it will co-host the fifth Democrat presidential primary debate in Georgia next month with the Washington Post.
articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.content: The debate, scheduled to take place in primetime on November 20,Â will air live on MSNBC and across the Radio One network. The debate will also be streamed onÂ MSNBC.com and the Washington Postâs website,Â as well as across mobile devices via NBC News and the Washington Postâs mobile apps and Radio Oneâs digital platforms. In order to qualify for the fifth presidential debate, as laid out by the Democratic National Committee, candidates must reach at least three percent in four qualifying state or national polls or five percent in two qualifying state polls. Candidates must also reach a donor threshold withÂ contributions from 165,000 unique donors, including 600 unique donors in 20 states. According to an unofficial NBC News survey, eight candidates have already qualified, includingÂ former Vice President Joe Biden, Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ), South Bend Mayor Pete Buttigieg, Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA), Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), billionaire Tom Steyer, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), and tech entrepreneur Andrew Yang. Former Housing and Urban Development Secretary JuliÃ¡n Castro, Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), and former Texas Rep. Robert Francis âBetoâ OâRourke, have reached the donor threshold, but have yet to meet polling requirements. The specific location, venue, format, and moderators will be announced at a later date, according to MSNBC. Follow Kyle on Twitter @RealKyleMorris and Facebook.

articles.title: Florida Democrat Distributes Condoms with Her Photo to Celebrate âCome Out with Prideâ
articles.subtitle: A Florida Democrat state representative who was once a Planned Parenthood regional director is distributing condoms with her photo on them to draw attention to Orlandoâs LGBT âCome Out with Prideâ event.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: âItâs a fun way to talk about courageous discussions,â state Rep. Anna Eskamani toldÂ OrlandoÂ Weekly. âAs a lawmaker, it should be one of our responsibilities, to break the stigma around sexuality and health.â   Eskamani, who is promoting state Comprehensive Sex Education (CSE) â a Planned Parenthood-sponsored program that embraces abortion and gender ideology â said, âIf I had it my way we would teach comprehensive & age-appropriate sexual health education in Florida & anyone who needed it would get free condoms.â  The Democrat lawmaker said she paid for the condoms herself. âWe only ordered 250 of them,â she said. âI paid for them out of my own pocket. Iâm sensitive to using public dollars, so I did spend my own money on them.â âTheyâre not for voting,â she insisted. âItâs focused on Pride, public health, and making sure we can have time talking about these often difficult subjects.â Eskamani said, as a former regional director of Planned Parenthood of Southwest and Central Florida, she is very familiar with the high transmission rates of HIV in transgender individuals. âWith very high HIV transmission rates, it means we need to address this crisis head on, and talk about complex sexual health education topics, like easy access to the tools needed to make healthy decisions,â she said. âI canât think of a better tool than free condoms to get the conversation started.â In April, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) releasedÂ guidance with warnings about the high prevalence and risk of HIV among transgender individuals. âTransgender women and men are at high risk for getting HIV,â stated CDC in the guidance letter signed by physicians of the agencyâs National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention. âAccording toÂ current estimates, about 1 in 7 (14%) transgender women have HIV, and the percentage is much higher among black/African American (44%) and Hispanic/Latina (26%) transgender women,â CDC states. âAn estimated 3% of transgender men have HIV.â

articles.title: âLatin Kingsâ Gang Leader Freed by âFirst Step Actâ Is Wanted for Murder
articles.subtitle: A notorious leader of the âAlmighty Latin Kingsâ gang is now on the run after allegedly stabbing a man to death in Rhode Island, just nine months after being released from federal prison thanks to the âFirst Step Act.â
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: In February, 41-year-oldÂ Joel Francisco â dubbed the âCrown Princeâ of the Latin Kings gang in 2005 â was released from federal prison after President Donald Trump signed into law the First Step Act, promoted by a coalition of Democrats, Republicans, and progressive and libertarian nonprofits. According to an investigative report by the Providence Journalâs Brian Amaral and Katie Mulvaney, Francisco was convicted in 2005 for dealing crack cocaine and powder cocaine. The conviction was Franciscoâs third drug conviction and therefore he was given a mandatory life sentence in federal prison. After Trump signed the First Step Act into law, though, Francisco had his life sentence for crack dealing reduced and he was released in February of this year, along with the other 3,100 convicts released this year by the new law. Before his release, Francisco pleaded with the court that he had turned his life around, noting his taking part in rehabilitation programs in prison, which advocates of the First Step Act readily cited to make their case that even violent convicts could be reformed and thus released. On July 13, about six months after being released from prison, Francisco was accused of breaking into the home of his ex-girlfriend. When police arrived at the womanâs house, they found Francisco standing on her porch and a pocket knife in the nearby bushes that he had allegedly used to cut a window screen. Francisco was subsequently charged with domestic violence. Then, three months later on October 2nd, Francisco was accused of stabbing to death 46-year-old Troy Pine at a hookah lounge in the Federal Hill neighborhood. Since the alleged murder, Francisco has been on the run. Police, as Amaral and Mulvaney note in their Providence Journal report, had warned of such a scenario before the First Step Act allowed Francisco to be released from prison. âSome criminals deserve to spend their lives incarcerated,âÂ Providence Police Department Deputy Chief Thomas Verdi told the Providence Journal. âJoel is one.â The Providence Police Department is asking anyone with information on Francisco and his whereabouts to contact (401) 243-6332. In November 2018, Breitbart News reported that the First Step Act would result in the release of thousands of drug traffickers from prison despite their dealing deadly drugs such as fentanyl and heroin. A report this year by Fox Newsâs Tucker Carlson stated that the First Step Act had successfully released about 240 sex offenders, nearly 60 convicted murderers and assailants, as well as almost 1,000 inmates convicted for drug crimes. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Bernie Sanders to âChange the Natureâ of His Campaign After Heart Attack
articles.subtitle: White House presidential candidate Sen.Â Bernie SandersÂ (I-VT) revealed Tuesday that he will reduce the amount of time he spends on the campaign trail for the foreseeable future after suffering a heart attack.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: Speaking to reporters outside his home in Burlington, Vermont, the senator said that while he intends to continue âactively campaigning,â he plans to âchange the nature of the campaignâ in order to ensure âI have the strength to do what I have to do.â  According to the presidential candidate, he was participating in roughlyÂ âfive or six meetings a day, three or four rallies and town meetings and meeting with groups of people.â âI donât think Iâm going to do that,â said Sanders. Last Wednesday, Sandersâ campaign announced the 78-year-old underwent a heart procedure for a blocked artery and had canceled events âuntil further notice.â Sanders experienced chest discomfort during an event last Tuesday for which he sought medical evaluation for. His doctors said two stents were inserted into Sandersâs heart and that he was âconversing and in good spirits.â On Friday, Sanders was released from the hospital and took to Twitter to give his supporters an update on his condition. âI want to thank the doctors, nurses, and staff at the Desert Springs Hospital Medical Center for the excellent care that they provided. After two and a half days in the hospital, I feel great, and after taking a short time off, I look forward to getting back to work,â he tweeted.

articles.title: Kasich: GOP Should Be Calling for Impeachment Inquiry
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: OnÂ Tuesdayâs broadcast ofÂ CNNâs âAnderson Cooper 360,âÂ former Gov. John Kasich (R-OH) said Republican lawmakers should be calling for the impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump to continue. Cooper asked, âGovernor, Kasich whatâs if going to take for other Republicans on the Hill to actually speak their minds on this? Assuming that there are some who, you know, believe what the president did was wrong that it was wrong to ask China to investigate the Bidens, a repressive regime like China not known for their fair and impartial investigations at the very least, is it going to take just them sensing a groundswell among Republican voters?â Kasich said,âI think so, Anderson. Look, this is the thing that I have a hard time understanding. We know how bad this is. We know what the president did was wrong. Why wouldnât everybody want to get to the bottom of this?â He added, âIf the United States was withholding something that was critical to Ukraine, who had Russians located inside of their country, and gobbling up pieces of territory, you would think that they would say: âOf course we should have an inquiry. Of course we should get to the bottom of this.â And as we see here as every report, every day, there is just more and more connections that are so troubling. But the end of the day, youâve got to have this inquiry. And frankly these Republicans ought to be calling for it. Itâs the fair and right thing to do for America.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Elizabeth Warrenâs Workers Plan Will Provide Back Pay to Illegal Aliens
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), a leading 2020 Democrat presidential primary candidate, is vowing to âfightâ for back pay for illegal aliens.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: As part of Warrenâs âEmpowering American Workers and Raising Wagesâ plan, illegal aliens who have worked illegally in the United States â sometimes by stealing Americansâ identities and Social Security numbers â would become eligible to receive back pay for their previous work by amending theÂ National Labor Relations Act. Warren writes: Ensuring employers canât exploit undocumented workers and drive down standards for all workers: The 2002 Supreme Court case Hoffman Plastic Compounds v. NLRB held that an undocumented worker could not receive the backpay he was owed from an employer who had violated the NLRA. That 5â4 ruling is wrong and denies millions of undocumented workers redress for illegal firings or other retaliatory conduct by an employer. The case encourages employers to hire undocumented immigrants and exploit them in numerous fields, including construction and manufacturing, which could lower wages for all workers. I will fight to amend the NLRA to end this form of exploitation and ensure that all workers are protected. [Emphasis added] Despite her platform of populist economic patriotism, Warren has committed to driving up foreign competition against Americaâs working and middle class in the U.S. labor market by providing amnesty for 11 to 22 million illegal aliens, increasing current legal immigration levels, and decriminalizing illegal immigration. Warren Undercuts Populist Agenda with Donor Class Immigration Planhttps://t.co/RAdJlUT44k â John Binder ð½ (@JxhnBinder) August 28, 2019  Absent from Warrenâs workers plan is a mandate and punishment for employers and businesses who hire illegal aliens over American citizens, as well as a reform to the H-1B visa program whereby Americans are readily replaced by foreign visa workers to increase profit margins for multinational corporations. Warren has not endorsed mandatory E-VerifyÂ â a system that prevents businesses from hiring illegal aliens over Americans â though it would decrease foreign competition against Americans, especially those most vulnerable to competing against illegal aliens in the labor market. In contrast to Warren is President Trumpâs populist-nationalist âBuy American, Hire Americanâ agenda, which has sought to increase interior immigration enforcement to tighten the labor market and delivered wage hikes for Americaâs blue-collar and working class. Unlike Warren, Trumpâs latest national immigration plan includes a nationwide mandate of E-Verify to prevent Americans from being forced to compete for jobs against illegal aliens. Today, there are at least eight million illegal aliens holding American jobs in the U.S. economy that would have otherwise gone to American workers and legal immigrants. In most cases, these illegal workers obtain fraudulent work authorization documents orÂ stealÂ American citizensâ identitiesÂ in order to take jobs. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Kangaroo Court: Democrat Impeachment Inquiry Becomes âClown Showâ
articles.subtitle: The impeachment inquiry process so far is akin to a âkangaroo courtâ led by Democrats already convinced President Donald Trump is guilty of wrongdoing, Republicans said Tuesday.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content:
House Democrat leaders pursuing the investigation are intent on pushing Trump out of office by any means necessary, Republican lawmakers and the White House argued. House Democrats have carried out the entire process behind closed doors since the beginning of the impeachment inquiry last month. The Democrats have even refused to hold a full House vote on authorizing an impeachment inquiry, just as lawmakers did when Congress opened investigations with Presidents Richard Nixon and Bill Clinton. Trumpâs supporters in Congress argue that such a vote is necessary to legitimize the inquiry per the recognized standards of previous impeachment efforts and to give Republicans certain rights in the process, such as the ability to issue subpoenas for witnesses. The White House challenged House Democrats in an October 8 letter to the Speaker and committee chairmen pursuing the impeachment inquiry. The White House argued it would not cooperate in the ongoing impeachment investigation and dismissed the proceedings as a mock court focused on overturning the 2016 election results. Republicans say conducting an impeachment inquiry without a full vote in the House is a departure from previous impeachment inquiries under Nixon and Clinton. Witnesses called to testify in the so-called impeachment inquiry so far have done so in closed sessions with lawmakers. Republicans have accused House Democrats of cherry-picking and mischaracterizing evidence, and refusing to release information they say obliterates their accusations of wrongdoing. House Democrats last week leaked text messages provided by one of the witnesses, former U.S. special envoy to Ukraine Kurt Volker, that appeared damaging to the president, but Republicans said the release of the entire transcript of Volkerâs remarks would disprove their allegations. House Freedom Caucus Chairman Andy Biggs (R-AZ), slammed the Democrats for holding âsecret hearingsâ and called on them to release the transcript of Volkerâs testimony: After claiming for more than two years that Donald Trump colluded with the Russians to influence the 2016 election, Adam Schiff and his band of Democrats are back to their old tricks of manufacturing evidence to fit their narrative. This time, however, they are holding secret hearings to prevent the American people from learning the facts and deciding for themselves.

â¦ They have leaked portions of the transcript and select documents from the Volker deposition in a desperate attempt to deceive the country. The American people deserve transparency, and we are calling on these chairmen to immediately deliver the full and complete transcript immediately. The president on Tuesday announced that he would not let Ambassador Gordon Sondland testify to Congress later that day as scheduled. Rep. Lee Zeldin (R-NY), a supporter of the president, called the inquiry a âkangaroo courtâ and a âclown showâ: As far as the administration goes, if they donât want to send Amb. Sondland here because this is a kangaroo court, because there has not been a vote once on impeachment inquiry, because minority does not have any rights for subpoenas, because the president doesnât have the right to have counsel present to ask questions, for subpoena power, to present evidence. This entire thing is a political charade. Itâs a clown show. Rep. Matt Gaetz (R-FL) called House Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff (D-CA) âCaptain Kangaroo.â âWhat we see in this impeachment is a kangaroo court, and Chairman Schiff is acting like a malicious Captain Kangaroo,â he said. House Democrats have also denied President Trumpâs counsel the ability to attend depositions, briefings, and interviews. It is also unclear whether or not the presidentâs counsel will be permitted to object to testimony or introduce evidence. House Democrats are also considering having the first official who filed a whistleblower complaint against Trump testify remotely with his face and voice obscured so that Republican lawmakers and staffers would not be able to find out his identity. A lawyer for the whistleblower told Breitbart News on Tuesday that the official, or any others they represent, do not intend to come forward publicly, raising the prospect that an impeachment inquiry of Trump would be prompted entirely by an anonymous official who is reportedly a Democrat and had a working relationship with a 2020 Democrat candidate. The mainstream media has downplayed or flat out ignored that the impeachment proceedings have not met the recognized standards of other similar efforts. The Democrat-led House Committees on Oversight and Reform, Intelligence, and Foreign Affairs are pursuing the impeachment of Trump. Schiff and the chairmen of the other two panels argue that Trump attempted to coerce Ukraine into investigating Joe Biden and his son in exchange for foreign aid, a claim denied by the U.S. president.

articles.title: Female Athlete on Competing with Men on Soccer Field: âWhy Try?â
articles.subtitle: A female high school athlete said on Tuesday that having to compete with men on the field crushes the dreams of women athletes.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: Grace, a soccer and softball player, spoke out in front of the Supreme Court on Tuesday as the justices heard arguments about whether federal anti-discrimination laws should apply to âsexual orientationâ and âgender identity.â Grace, a high school junior, said, âsports have always been a critical part of my life.â With her parentsâ support, she grew to become a competitive athlete. She spoke as activists yelled, âGo home, homophobe!â âI believed that when they told me if I worked hard enough, I could do anything,â she said to the crowds, âthat being a girl isnât a limitation, that if she believes she can, she will.â Soccer, Grace said, âtaught me discipline, the rewards that come with a hard work ethic, and, most importantly, itâs taught me what leadership looks like.â But, Grace added that, after spending hours of training and practice and giving up social activities in order to compete with other top-level athletes, âYou make it to the field and you see a high school boy across from you. Not as a coach, not as an assistant, but as a player.â âItâs confusing,â she asserted. âYour entire teamâs focus and motivation is lost and defeated before you even start.â Grace said that her teamâs spirit of âYes, we can!â was quickly replaced by âWhy try?â She explained that when the boyâs hitting ability gave the opposing team an edge of a couple of runs, her team of female athletes could not recover and ended up losing. Grace observed how allowing biological men to play womenâs sports is defeating the goal of an âequal playing fieldâ federal law is supposed to protect. She said many female athletes who have to compete against males will lose out on sports scholarships to colleges. A recent study in Sweden hasÂ shownÂ thatÂ biological males who claim to be transgender women still retained considerable advantages over biological females in strength and muscle mass, even after a full year of hormone therapy. âDespite the robust increases in muscle mass and strength in [transgender men], the [transgender women] were still stronger and had more muscle mass following 12 months of treatment,â the researchers said. âThese findings add new knowledge that could be relevant when evaluating transwomenâs eligibility to compete in the womenâs category of athletic competitions.â In another study, researchersÂ concludedÂ that male athletes who claim to be female hold an âintolerableâ advantage over biological female athletes. Three professors â two in bioethics and one in physiology â noted the International Olympic Committee (IOC) is allowing âtransgender womenâ to compete against biological females if their testosterone is below 10 nmol/L. However, even that level is âsignificantly higherâ than that of biological females, they asserted. The researchers also stated that âindirect effects of testosterone will not be altered by hormone therapy.â âFor example, hormone therapy will not alter bone structure, lung volume or heart size of the transwoman athlete, especially if she transitions postpuberty, so natural advantages including joint articulation, stroke volume and maximal oxygen uptake will be maintained,â they explained. âWe conclude that the advantage to transwomen afforded by the IOC guidelines is an intolerable unfairness,â state the professors.

articles.title: Eric Trump Mocks Democrats: âAbsolute Clown Showâ
articles.subtitle: Appearing Tuesday on the Fox News Channelâs The Story withÂ Martha MacCallum, Eric Trump called the Democrats an âabsolute clown showâ during his remarks on the formal impeachment inquiry targeting his father, President Donald Trump, and the roster of rival candidates vying to replace him in the White House.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: A partial transcript is as follows: MARTHA MACCALLUM: Whatâs your reaction that John Durham has asked to expand his investigation. He needs more agents, he has a longer timeframe than they originally thought when they started this whole thing. ERIC TRUMP:Â This corruption in D.C. is unbelievable. Again, my father said we have the greatest economy in the history of this country. Our country is doing phenomenally well. The Democrats are trying to do everything they can to distract against the fact that we have 3.5% unemployment, the lowest unemployment in the history of this nation. He has done an unbelievable job. Itâs an absolute clown show. This is a clown show because they know they donât have any people left to run against my father in 2020. They know theyâre going to lose. Nancy Pelosi jumped the gun. She doesnât know what to do at this point. Theyâre floundering in the wind. And honestly, I think if they keep this up, I think itâs guaranteeing my father re-election. The fundraising numbers we have coming in right now are out of control.

articles.title: Economists: Americaâs Elite Pay Lower Tax Rate Than All Other Americans
articles.subtitle: The wealthiest Americans are paying a lower tax rate than all other Americans, groundbreaking analysis from a pair of economists reveals.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: For the first time on record, the wealthiest 400 Americans in 2018 paid a lower tax rate than all of the income groups in the United States, research highlighted by the New York Times from University of California, Berkeley, economistsÂ Emmanuel Saez and Gabriel Zucman finds. The analysis concludes that the countryâs top economic elite are paying lower federal, state, and local tax rates than the nationâs working and middle class. Overall, these top 400 wealthy Americans paid just a 23 percent tax rate, which the Timesâ op-ed columnistÂ David Leonhardt notes is a combined tax payment of âless than one-quarter of their total income.â This 23 percent tax rate for the rich means their rate has been slashed by 47 percentage points since 1950 when their tax rate was 70 percent. (Screenshot via the New York Times) The analysis finds that the 23 percent tax rate for the wealthiest Americans is less than every other income group in the U.S. â including those earning working and middle-class incomes, as a Times graphic shows. Leonhardt writes: For middle-class and poor families, the picture is different. Federal income taxes have also declined modestly for these families, but they havenât benefited much if at all from the decline in the corporate tax or estate tax. And they now pay more in payroll taxes (which finance Medicare and Social Security) than in the past. Over all, their taxes have remained fairly flat. [Emphasis added] The report comes as Americans increasingly see a growing divide between the rich and working class, as the Pew Research Center has found. Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO), the leading economic nationalist in the Senate, has warned against the Left-Right coalitionâs consensus on open trade, open markets, and open borders, a plan that he has called an economy that works solely for the elite. âThe same consensus says that we need to pursue and embrace economic globalization and economic integration at all costs â open markets, open borders, open trade, open everything no matter whether itâs actually good for American national security or for American workers or for American families or for American principles â¦Â this is the elite consensus that has governed our politics for too long and what it has produced is a politics of elite ambition,â Hawley said in an August speech in the Senate. That increasing worry of rapid income inequality is only further justified by economic research showing a rise in servant-class jobs, strong economic recovery for elite zip codes but not for working-class regions, and skyrocketing wage growth for the billionaire class at 15 times the rate of other Americans. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Progressives Slam YouTube Star for Coming Out as Transgender
articles.subtitle: A heterosexual woman who declared herself âtransgenderâ is getting hate mail from transgender activists who usually say everyone should be liberated to change their âgender identity,â flip their sexual orientation, and escape the male-female âbinary.â
articles.author: Neil Munro
articles.content: âDo I think Iâm transgender? Yes, a 1,000 percent. Do I identify with my natural-born gender? A thousand percent,â said YouTube star Trisha Paytas, in a video that includes advertisements forÂ tickets to her late-October events in San Francisco and Los Angeles. âSo, I think thatâs where Iâm at, and I feel really free and liberated.â Paytas quickly apologized when critics claimed her transgender claim ridiculed the transgender movement. The EOnline.com entertainment site reported: In a tearful YouTubeÂ video, the star says that she is âoverwhelmed by the amount of backlashâ her candid video received. âI canât apologize for who I am and how I feel and it sucks that we live in this world and Iâm just not allowed to identify as a man because of how I look,â she added. âItâs triggering. Itâs PTSD of when I said that I was, like, bisexual.â âPaytasâs video is super, duper problematic,â says an earnest post at Popdust.com, which continues: One Twitter user compiled a list of justÂ someÂ of the statements Paytas made that led me to shout at my screen. These include assertions like âI am transgender because I wish I had a penis so that my assertiveness would be respected and I wouldnât be thought of as a bitch,â and also, âI CHOOSE to identify as boy.â No doubt about it, Paytasâs video is a trainwreck, and I understand where all the transgender] backlash is coming from. The way she talks about and misidentifies transgenderism dilutes its seriousness, and the visibility of her platform poses a danger for actual transgender people whoÂ needÂ to be taken seriously in order to get the medical and psychological assistance they need. â¦ Paytas has every right to express herself as gender nonconforming. Sheâs more than welcome to present herself as male. But that does not make her transgender. Transgender people donât choose to be transgender. Nobody chooses to have gender dysphoria. So many transgender issues revolve around access toÂ healthcareÂ procedures to correct the underlying issue of dysphoria. It is not a choice.  Her video earned her over 84,000 downvotes â and a shipload of publicity:  She posted a tearful apology video:  But the progressives who power the transgender ideology are not pushing sexual liberation. They are imposing a regime of sexual autonomy that would deny people the right to use the social rules that humans have gradually evolved to manage the cooperation and competition between the two complementary and equal legal sexes. The radical goals were recently endorsed byÂ the Americal Psychological Society, whichÂ awarded a prizeÂ in 2018 toÂ an article calling for a cultural revolution that ends the dominant role of heterosexuality in society: There are enormous costs to maintaining the gender binary. These costs include the myriad negative consequences of gender stereotyping and prejudice. For these reasons, the gender binary should be replaced by a conception of gender/sex that stresses multiplicity and diversity, including a multiplecategory (rather than binary) system, whose categories are not mutually exclusive (one can identify as more than one), fluid (oneâs identity can change across time), and allow for the possibility that gender is viewed as irrelevant to the self. To change the publicâs view that heterosexuality is the normal and best path for most people, the pro-transgender progressives have adopted a strategy of using their allies in universities, media, and marketing to first downplay the linguistic, legal, and civic distinctions between the two sexes.
