For example, progressives are using the vague idea ofÂ  âgenderâ to bury the obvious notion of âmale or female.â This rhetorical carpet-bombing has also encouraged the claim that men who live as women possess a âfemale penisâ â and it denies women the right to call themselves transgender if they also love men.

articles.title: Dem Rep. Khanna: I Expect Judiciary Committee âWill Actâ on Impeachment, Weâll Have Vote Before Yearâs End
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: During an interview with CNN on Tuesday, Representative Ro Khanna (D-CA) predicted that the House Judiciary Committee âwill act on articles of impeachmentâ and the House will vote on impeachment before the end of the year. Khanna said, âI expect that the House, before the end of the year, will have a vote on impeachment.â He later added, âI now expect that the Judiciary Committee will act on articles of impeachment. Itâs not a positive thing for this country. Impeachment is a process that is very, very divisive. But heâs left the Judiciary Committee and the speaker with really no choice.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: McSally: I Hope Trump Reconsiders Northeast Syria Withdrawal
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: On Tuesdayâs broadcast of the Fox News Channelâs âThe Story,â Senator Martha McSally (R-AZ) stated that she hopes President Trump reconsiders his decision to withdraw troops from northeast Syria. McSally said, âIâm glad that President Trump took action against ISIS in an innovative way, unlike President Obama. We used a small number of people on the ground, advising this force, the SDF, with our airpower, and they were able to roll back the caliphate. So, we cannot tolerate a NATO ally now coming in and mowing them down. That is just not the right message, and itâs not good for the safety of America. So, I really hope itâs reconsidered.â McSally added that Congress needs to do whatever it takes to deter Turkey from destabilizing the region. Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: EU Must Learn âLanguage of Powerâ, Needs Army of 60,000: Eurocrat
articles.subtitle: The EUâs incoming security chief has said the bloc needs a standing army of 60,000 soldiers that Brussels can deploy around the world.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: Josep Borrell said at aÂ European Parliament hearing into his candidacy as vice president for foreign affairs and security on Monday:Â âThe European Union has to learn to use the language of power.â The 72-year-old Spanish socialist continued that the European lawmakers should âreinforce the EUâs international role and further our military capacity to actâ. He called for Brussels to raise the number of troops to at least 55,000 to 60,000. Such a force would be larger than the standing armies of Portugal (35,000) or the Netherlands (43,000). âWe should pull our national sovereignties together to multiply the power of individual member states. And I am convinced that if we donât act together, Europe will become irrelevant in the new coming world,â he added. Brussels currently has âbattlegroupsâ of 3,000 soldiers from across militaries of EU Member States, according to The Telegraph. The battlegroups are on standby every six months but have not, to date, been used. To increase those forces by twenty-fold and make them permanent, Brussels would need the unanimous support of Member States.  Brexit Party leader and MEP Nigel Farage raised the alarm over the calls for a permanent EU army. He said: âThe EU is now aiming for an army of 60,000 and incoming foreign policy boss Josep Borrell says: âthe EU has to learn to use the language of power.â âWhen will Remainers stop lying about the intentions of this dangerous, undemocratic state?â In 2015, then-leader of the Liberal Democrats Nick Clegg called the notion of an EU army a âdangerous fantasyâ and ridiculed Mr Farage for saying that the force was the next step in EU empire-building. However, in November 2017, Eurosceptics were proven right when the majority of EU nationsÂ signedÂ theÂ Permanent Structured Cooperation process (PESCO). The document is instrumental to European Defence Union plans which were devised by outgoing President of the European Commission Jean-Claude Juncker, who supportsÂ the foundation of a âfully-fledgedâ EU army by 2025. Last year,Â French President Emmanuel Macron called forÂ a âreal European armyâ to âprotect ourselves with respect to China, Russia and even the United States of Americaâ. German ChancellorÂ Angela MerkelÂ and theÂ European Commission enthusiastically backed the idea. Pro-Brexit group Veterans for Britain has warned that even when the UK leaves the EU, it could still get pulled into defence projects with the bloc. Senior figures met with the European Research Group on Tuesday to brief the group of Eurosceptic Tories on the defence implications of the proposed withdrawal treaty. A Veterans for Britain source told the Express:Â âThe Prime Minister may have got rid of the backstop but that was not the only thing that was wrong with the Withdrawal Agreement. âThe defence element is a serious threat to our sovereignty but this issue has been completely overlooked.â ERG Chairman Steve Baker said the UK must âescape commitments to the EUâs Defence Union. Many of us are concerned but itâs not too late to preserve the independence of our Armed Forces.â

articles.title: Nunes: House Intel Committee âHas Become Like This Secretive Impeachment Committee But with No Rulesâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Jeff Poor
articles.content: Tuesday on Fox News Channelâs âTucker Carlson Tonight,â House Intelligence Committee ranking Republican Rep. Devin Nunes (R-CA) noted the procedure employed by House Democrats in its so-called impeachment inquiry of President Donald Trump is proceeding unlike impeachment efforts in the past and with rules. That according to the California Republican does not allow for a fair process for both sides. Partial transcript as follows: CARLSON: Congressman, thanks so much for coming on. So if Iâm understanding this correctly, the White House is saying once you make it official, we will cooperate, but not until then. NUNES: Well, the House Intelligence Committee has become like this secretive impeachment committee but with no rules. And so I donât blame the White House for saying, look, weâll just see you in court. Weâre not going to â weâre not going to provide you any witnesses. Weâre not going to provide you any documents and unless the House of Representatives votes, like has been the tradition, if not, you can hold us in contempt and weâll see you in court in a matter of months, maybe important months. CARLSON: But now as a procedural matter, is it true or is it not? I mean, youâre the sitting member, that the House in order to have an impeachment you have to have a vote, right? Leadership canât just say thereâs an impeachment, there has to be a vote. NUNES: Right? You canât â I mean, traditionally, we donât â the House makes its own rules. OK. So one could argue that theyâre just making up the rules as they go along. But we do have tradition. Right? And you have precedents. And itâs relatively recent, right? You had the impeachment of Bill Clinton, and the impeachment of Richard Nixon. So if youâre really going to truly get this through the House, open up an investigation, pass it, vote to impeach a President, send it to the Senate for trial, you have to have a system of government where you have something that is fair, where both sides can actually go out and gather evidence. CARLSON: Right. NUNES: And thatâs what doesnât exist today and I think the White House has a very good point, because as someone whoâs been in all these meetings, I can tell you, I think it was described today as a kangaroo court and thatâs probably being nice. CARLSON: Yes, if youâre going to have an impeachment, letâs have a vote. You know, itâs a democracy. We vote on things here, like we always used to. Follow Jeff Poor on Twitter @jeff_poor

articles.title: U.N. Commissioner Takes Democracy to Task: âPolicymakers Need to Listen to Protester Demandsâ
articles.subtitle: The United Nations High Commissioner on Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet, has queried the response of international lawmakers to the demands of climate protesters, lamenting some people on the streets had problems with democracy.
articles.author: Simon Kent
articles.content: Speaking in Sydney, Australia, during a local academic oration on Wednesday,Â Bachelet expressed disappointment that the demands of the few are met with so little action by elected representatives. ABC News reports she claimed, pointing to the Extinction Rebellion demonstrations happening in 60 cities around the world, people would only continue to disengage if their participation was not met with âresponsive and responsible policies.â Extinction Rebellionâs plan to spray 1,800 litres of fake blood on the treasury did not get off to the best start pic.twitter.com/c2WYHM2Tuc â Sam Francis (@DavidSamFrancis) October 3, 2019  âPolicymakers need to listen to their [Extinction Rebellion] demands,â she said. âLeaders â not just political leaders, but social and business leaders too â can and should encourage greater participation and involvement by young people, whose lives will be shaped by the issues that are coming to the fore right now. âRather than fuelling cynicism about the value of participation, they could and should be encouraging people to advocate policies that align with our most important personal convictions and ideals.â This is the second time in the space of a month the former president of Chile has urged the world to stop and listen to climate protesters and do as they are told. An activist carries a placard with an image of Greta Thunberg as he protests on Whitehall, by Downing Street during the second day of climate change demonstrations by the Extinction Rebellion group in central London, on October 8, 2019. (BEN STANSALL/AFP via Getty Images) As Breitbart News reported, she previously claimed climate change will cause serious âharm to Human Rightsâ as well as producing âpowerful conflictsâ among peoples. One year after beginning her mandate, Bachelet said âclimate change has been a reality for a long time,â and in order to address it, nations much âtake concrete measures to comply with the Paris Agreements.â âI know that climate change will generate, voluntarily or not, restrictions and harm to peopleâs rights,â she said in an interviewÂ publishedÂ with the Spanish news agency EFE. âOf course, it is not nature that violates human rights, but when people have to move because of drought, lack of food, or fight for water, powerful conflicts will be generated,â she added.

articles.title: Pakistan PM: âI Wish I Could Follow Xiâs Exampleâ and Purge Hundreds of Politicians
articles.subtitle: Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan told an audience in Beijing on Tuesday that he would like to launch a mass police action to send â500 peopleâ to prison for corruption, emulating Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
articles.author: Ben Kew
articles.content: Speaking at the China Council for Promotion of International Trade during his second official visit to the country, Khan said that he had learned from Xiâs anti-corruption crusade. âOne of President Xi Jinpingâs biggest crusade[s] has been against corruption,â he said, according to remarks picked up by the IndoAsian News Service. Khan added that he had âheard that some 400 ministerial-level people had been convicted on charges of corruption and put behind jail in the last five years in China.â Khan claimed that legal proceedings in Pakistan were âvery cumbersomeâ and it was, therefore, difficult to purge politicians the way that Xi had done using his totalitarian powers. âI wish I could follow President Xiâs example and put 500 corrupt people in Pakistan in jail.â he continued, explaining that corruption was one of the biggest impediments to investment in the country. Pakistanâs Prime Minister Imran Khan (2nd L) talks to Chinese President Xi Jinping (2nd R) during their meeting at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse in Beijing on October 9, 2019. (PARKER SONG/POOL/AFP via Getty Images) Following his rise to power in 2012, Xi launched an anti-corruption crusade that saw around 1.3 million people, ranging from the Communist Party elite down to local officials, charged with a variety of crimes. Among those detained and disappeared into prison were many political rivals within the Party. Kahn, the former cricketer turned politician, went on to effusively praise Chinaâs achievements over the past few decades, with more than half the population lifted out of poverty and becoming the second-largest economy in the world. âWhat inspires me most about China is the way they have lifted 700 million people out of poverty in 30 years,â he said. âThis has never happened in human history.â China has historicallyÂ beenÂ a close ally of Pakistan. BeijingÂ celebrated Khanâs election after he ran on a campaign of improving relations with both China and India by promising to resolve tensions over the disputed Kashmir region. It is the second time that Khan has visited China in the space of a year. The Pakistani prime minister made his first official visit in November last year. During that visit, he made no secret of his admiration for the communist regime, declaring that he wanted to âlearnâ from the countryâs âphenomenal achievements.â âOur country is very impressed with the way China has progressed. Chinaâs phenomenal achievements are worth emulating. No other country has tackled poverty and corruption the way China has tackled it,â he said at the time. âPakistan wants to learn from Chinaâs experience in poverty alleviation and curbing corruption.â Follow Ben Kew onÂ Facebook, Twitter atÂ @ben_kew,Â orÂ email him at bkew@breitbart.com.

articles.title: Nickelback Sees 500% Increase in Music Streams After Trump Tweet
articles.subtitle: Rock band Nickelback saw itâs 2005 hit song âPhotographâ spike in popularity and sales, after a politically charged tweet by President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Nate Church
articles.content: Last week, Trump took aim at Democrat presidential hopeful Joe Biden, and his dubious ties to the Ukraine. The tweet featured a video in which Biden claim innocence, followed by the iconic shot of Nickelback lead singer ChadÂ Kroeger holding up a photograph edited to show Biden, his son, and a Ukrainian gas company executive. Amid the chaos of the Democrat impeachment inquiry, the internet at large embraced the meme â with many commenting that tweeting Nickelback at all should be an âimpeachable offense.â    In response to the now-famous tweet, Nickelback pushed Twitter to remove it on copyright grounds. Nevertheless, the activity threw the pop rock band back into the proverbial spotlight. Overnight, streams of their music â âPhotograph,â especially â skyrocketed. Within a week, the surge reached 569%. And while it might not be grounds for impeachment unless you tongue is lodged firmly in cheek, it is a well known fact that being forced to listen to Nickelback constitutes actual punishment.

articles.title: Fashion Notes: Melania Trump Is Demure in Manolo Blahnik Snakeskin Stilettos
articles.subtitle: First Lady Melania Trump was demure as she attended events this week at the White House with United States Military officials and breaking ground on a federal project.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: On Monday evening, Mrs. Trump attended a dinner alongside President Trump for U.S. Military officials and their spouses â posing for photos in an appropriately patterned deep blue and red cocktail dress by Jason Wu and suede Manolo Blahnik stilettos. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (Mark Wilson/Getty Images) (Mark Wilson/Getty Images) (Mark Wilson/Getty Images) (Mark Wilson/Getty Images) (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster) (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster) (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (Mark Wilson/Getty Images) (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster â Edited by Breitbart News) For Tuesday, Mrs. Trump chose an Alexander McQueen-esque black overcoat and a pair of black snakeskin Manolo Blahnik stilettos. The coat and heels are a classic wardrobe essential for Melania Trump, who generally sticks to a uniform of beautifully crafted coats and stilettos for the winter season. Of course, there are exceptions, like when Mrs. Trump visited Wyoming this past week and wore casual Ralph Lauren-inspired activewear ensembles with sweaters, J Brand skinny jeans, and puffer coats. The photos of Mrs. Trumpâs Wyoming visit are easily some of the most breathtaking portraits she has ever posed for, looking as though they were ripped from the pages of Vogue for a Bruce Weber fashion spread. (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) (@FLOTUS via Twitter) John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Report: Trey Gowdy Joins Trumpâs Legal Team to Fight Impeachment
articles.subtitle: Former Rep. Trey Gowdy (R-SC) has reportedly signed on to serve as outside counsel to President Donald Trump as part of his efforts to fight the House Democratsâ impeachment inquiry.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: An unnamed administration official confirmed the move to the Associated Press on Tuesday evening. Gowdy, who retired from Congress last year, represented South CarolinaâsÂ 4th Congressional District for eight years. The former lawmaker served as House Oversight Committee chairman and oversaw the investigation into former Secretary of State Hilary Clinton and the events surrounding theÂ 2012 terror attack inÂ Benghazi, Libya. Since leaving Washington, D.C., Gowdy joined the law firm Nelson Mullins Riley & Scarborough and signed on as a Fox News Channel contributor. The development came after the White HouseÂ sent a letter to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) confirming it will not cooperate withÂ the impeachment probe, branding itÂ âillegitimateâ and âunconstitutional.â The letter, written by White House Counsel Pat Cipollone, accused the speaker of attempting to âoverturn the resultsâ of the 2016 presidential election. âGiven that your inquiry lacks any legitimate constitutional foundation, any pretense of fairness, or even the most elementary due process protections, the Executive Branch cannot be expected to participate in it,â the letterÂ read. âBecause participating in this inquiry under the current unconstitutional posture would inflict lasting institutional harm on the Executive Branch and lasting damage to the separation of powers, you have the President no choice. âConsistent with the duties of the President of the United States, and in particular his obligation to preserve the rights of future occupants of his office, President Trump cannot permit his Administration to participate in this partisan inquiry under these circumstances,â itÂ added. Pelosi responded later Tuesday to President Trump with a letter of her own, vowing to hold him âaccountable.â âThis letter is manifestly wrong, and is simply another unlawful attempt to hide the facts of the Trump Administrationâs brazen efforts to pressure foreign powers to intervene in the 2020 elections,â the California Democrat wrote. âDespite the White Houseâs stonewalling, we see a growing body of evidence that shows that President Trump abused his office and violated his oath to âprotect, preserve and defend the Constitution.â âMr. President, you are not above the law. You will be held accountable,â she concluded. Pelosi kicked off the probe against President TrumpÂ late September after a partisan CIA officer accused the president in a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint of asking Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to look into allegations of corruption against former Vice PresidentÂ Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden. Both have denied any pressure was applied to probe into the Biden family, and in a nod to transparency, the White House released a transcript of the presidentsâ call to show no wrongdoing occurred. On Tuesday, theÂ Washington Examiner reported that the so-called âwhistleblowerâÂ â who had been previously outed as a registered DemocratÂ â in fact, had a previously âprofessional relationshipâ with a 2020 Democrat White House hopeful.

articles.title: UK Parliament Suspended For Second Time in Two Months, Ending Longest Session in Centuries
articles.subtitle: The Westminster Parliament was suspended Tuesday evening, potentially closing a period of bitter acrimony over whether the longest session in British history should end, an argument which ended up in the UK Supreme Court last month.
articles.author: Breitbart London
articles.content: The prorogation â Westminster jargon for being suspended, pending the commencement of a new session â is the second in as many months, after the first enacted at the start of September was annulled by the Supreme Court after a series of legal challenges by anti-Brexit campaigners. Yet after reportedly taking further legal advice and even consulting with the Supreme Court which ruled against the previous suspension, Parliament has now been suspended again, the constitutional ceremony taking place Tuesday evening. The Speaker of the House of Commons and members were summoned to the Lords where the royal notice setting out the suspension was read out. Having run fromÂ June 21st 2017 to October 8th 2019, the session was the longest in British history â the next longest having taken place in 17th century English parliament before the modern state of the United Kingdom had come to exist. Under more normal circumstances parliamentary sessions are suspended annually and last less than 400 days â this session lasted 839. Unlike the first effort to close Parliament, the ceremony prompted little media attention and was attended by only a handful of Parliamentarians. Parliamentarians have met some criticism over their attendance at the reactivated Parliament, after protesting the last prorogation was restricting their ability to hold the government to account. British newspaperÂ The Express reports the remarks of Tory MP Michael Fabricant, who said of the opposition failing to turn up to debates despite having dragged the government through the courts to be able to do so: âSo opposition MPs opposed prorogation âto better scrutinise the Government on Brexitâ. âYet, when that opportunity arises, most of them are absent. What utter hypocrisy.â

articles.title: Britons Back No Deal if EU Rejects Johnsonâs Proposals
articles.subtitle: A poll shows a plurality of Britons want Prime Minister Boris Johnson to deliver Brexit on October 31st without a deal if the EU does not agree to new exit proposals.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: The ComRes poll revealedÂ 42 per cent of Britons agree with the statement: âIf the EU doesnât agree to Boris Johnsonâs proposals for a Brexit deal, the UK should leave on 31 Oct without a deal.â Forty per cent disagree. The poll also showed that more people would feel âangryâ (40 per cent) than ârelievedâ (37 per cent) if the UK does not leave on Halloween. These results followÂ another ComRes surveyÂ showing Britons would blame Brussels, Remainer MPs, and the UK Parliament more than Prime Minister Johnson if there was another delay. European leaders have all but officially rejected the prime ministerâs revised withdrawal deal. Leo Varadkar, prime minister of the Republic of Ireland, said on Tuesday night: âI think itâs going to be very difficult to secure an agreement by next week, quite frankly.â On Monday night, a well-placed source in Number 10 told The Spectator that: âThe negotiations will probably end this week.â A Downing Street source said that following a telephone call between Prime Minister Boris Johnson and German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Tuesday, it was apparent that âa deal is essentially impossible not just now but everâ. Chancellor Merkel was reported to have said that âthe UK cannot leave without leaving Northern Ireland behind in a customs union and in full alignment foreverâ. âShe made clear a deal is overwhelmingly unlikely and she thinks the EU has a veto on us leaving the Customs Union,â the source told media. Merkel Says Deal âOverwhelmingly Unlikelyâ, as Brexiteer Says EU âSetting up Narrative You Canât Leaveâ https://t.co/XvAYNJHsLe â Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) October 8, 2019  The prime minister has until October 19th to agree on an exit treaty with the bloc or be forced by the Benn Act to seek another delay. However, the prime minister has said that he would not ask to extend Article 50.Â The Number 10 source said that the governmentâs legal team is looking into loopholes in the Benn Act which would allow the UK to deliver Brexit, as promised, on October 31st. Michael Gove, the minister in charge of Brexit preparations, said that the country was ready for a clean-break Brexit on October 31st. Mr Gove wrote in his readiness report, which covers areas including medicine, travel, and trade, that âwe can now confidently say that the UK is prepared to leave the EU without a deal on 31 October. It shows that we are ready to honour the promises that were made to the British people, and we will grasp the opportunities that so many voted for three years ago.â On Wednesday, the Bank of England said that its financial systems were ready for a no-deal Brexit.Â The UKâs central bank said that temporary permissions, legislation, and other preparations have been made to âensure that households and businesses will be able to use existing and new services from EU financial institutionsâ. Delingpole: Hurrah for Chancellor Merkel â Saviour of Brexit! https://t.co/BWrdOP2eJI â Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) October 9, 2019

articles.title: Donald Trump: âWe Will Winâ in 2020 Against Democrat âCon Artistsâ
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump vowed Wednesday to beat Democrats in 2020, arguing they only cared about getting him out of office and hurting Republicans.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âThe Do-Nothing Democrats are Con Artists, only looking to hurt the Republican Party and President,â he wrote on Twitter. âTheir total focus is 2020, nothing more, and nothing less. The good news is that WE WILL WIN!!!!â The president commented as Democrats continued to push for impeachment and reports emerged about one of the government âwhistleblowersâ having a professional relationship with one of the 2020 Democrat presidential candidates. âThe Whistleblowerâs facts have been so incorrect about my âno pressureâ conversation with the Ukrainian President, and now the conflict of interest and involvement with a Democrat Candidate, that he or she should be exposed and questioned properly,â Trump wrote. âThis is no Whistleblower.â Trump questioned why the Inspector General of the Intelligence Community failed to stop what was obviously a partisan inquiry. âThe Whistleblower has ties to one of my DEMOCRAT OPPONENTS,â he wrote. âWhy does the ICIG allow this scam to continue?â The White House issued a sharp rebuke to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi in a letter outlining theÂ âlegal and constitutional flawsâ in the Democratâs impeachment inquiry. âPresident Trump and his administration reject your baseless, unconstitutional efforts to overturn the democratic process,â the eight-page letter read. As the process continues, the Trump team is gearing up for a full-scale war against the Democrat-led effort for impeachment. Former South Carolina Rep. Trey Gowdy is expected to join the Trump legal defense team for impeachment as an outside counsel, according to reports Wednesday night. The Do Nothing Democrats are Con Artists, only looking to hurt the Republican Party and President. Their total focus is 2020, nothing more, and nothing less. The good news is that WE WILL WIN!!!! â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 9, 2019  â¦..The Whistleblowerâs lawyer is a big Democrat. The Whistleblower has ties to one of my DEMOCRAT OPPONENTS. Why does the ICIG allow this scam to continue? â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 9, 2019  The Whistleblowerâs facts have been so incorrect about my âno pressureâ conversation with the Ukrainian President, and now the conflict of interest and involvement with a Democrat Candidate, that he or she should be exposed and questioned properly. This is no Whistleblowerâ¦.. â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 9, 2019

articles.title: Ted Cruz on China, NBA: âThis Really Shows How China Tries to Use Economic Coercionâ to Force American Companies into Censorship
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Wednesday, Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) weighed in on the National Basketball Association (NBA) apologizing to communist China after the Houston Rocketsâ general manager expressed support for the pro-democracy movement in Hong Kong in a now-deleted tweet. Cruz said in his appearance on CNBCâs âSquawk Boxâ that Chinaâs pressure on the NBA is an example of how the country âtries to use economic coercion and blackmailâ to force American companies to âengage in censorship.â âThere is big money in China,â Cruz explained. âThe NBA, NBA teams make a whole lot of money broadcasting in China, having subscriptions, having online subscriptions, having fans there. That being said, I think this really shows how China tries to use economic coercion and blackmail to get American companies to engage in censorship.â âThe NBA should be better than that,â he added on the league caving to Chinaâs pressure. Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Alleged Robber with âAssault Rifleâ Killed by Good Guy with a Gun
articles.subtitle: An alleged robber with an âassault rifleâ was killed Tuesday by a good guy with a gun in an Apple store in Dallas, Texas.
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: Fox News reportsÂ the suspect allegedly walked in about 2:30 a.m., through a door that was open for construction personnel to enter and exit. The suspect was described as being armed with an âassault rifleâ and wearing body armor. He was shot and fatally wounded after unsuccessfully attempting to disarm the storeâs security guard. A Dallas Police press release summarized the incident: The suspect, described as an adult Black male, attempted to disarm the security officer but was unsuccessful. The security officer was able to pull his weapon and fired multiple times striking the suspect. The suspect ran for a short distance and collapsed in the rear alley. The responding officers administered aid to the suspect prior to his transport to an area hospital where he was pronounced deceased. CBS DFW published an Apple statement on the incident: âThe loss of life is a tragedy and we are grateful that no one else was involved. Apple cares deeply about the safety of our customers and employees and we are committed to providing a secure environment for all who enter our stores.â AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: NYT: Schweizer Calls for Biden Investigation into Ukraine and China
articles.subtitle: In a bombshell 1,200-wordÂ New York TimesÂ op-ed, investigative author Peter Schweizer called for the federal government to investigate Joe and Hunter Bidenâs dealings in Ukraine and China after laying out a devastating fact-pattern of transactions.
articles.author: Jerome Hudson
articles.content: Schweizer, who serves as the president of the Government Accountability Institute and is a Breitbart senior contributor, revealed thatâ¦. In December 2013, Joe and Hunter Biden flew aboard Air Force Two to China; less than two weeks after the trip, Hunterâs firm, Rosemont Seneca Partners, which he founded with two other businessmen in June 2013, finalized a deal to open a fund, BHR Partners, whose largest shareholder is the government-run Bank of China, even though he had scant background in private equity.(Representatives of the fund claim that the timing of the deal and the Bidensâ trip to China was coincidental). Thus far, the firm has invested about $2.1 billion, according to its website. â¦ With the Russian invasion of Crimea in 2014, Joe Biden became point person in Ukraine as well. That same year, Hunter Biden landed a board position with the Ukrainian energy giant Burisma Holdings. Despite having no background in energy or Ukraine, the vice presidentâs son was paid as much as $50,000 a month, according to financial records. (He left the board in early 2019). â¦ The Bidens are hardly alone. President Trumpâs transportation secretary, Elaine Chao, and her husband, Senator Mitch McConnell, are being accused of having profited from their commercial ties to Beijing. In 2004, the two had a net worth of about $3.1 million, according to public disclosures. Three years later, the range was $3.1 million to $12.7 million. The next year, their net worth rocketed to $7.3 million to $33.1 million. âLast month, the House Oversight and Reform Committee started an investigation into whether Secretary Chao has leveraged her government positions to benefit her family. But so far there is no investigation into Joe and Hunter Biden,â Schweizer wrote. âDefenders claim there must first be proof that a law was broken to open an investigation. Thatâs exactly backward. Congress can and should conduct an inquiry to determine whether anything illegal occurred.â The bestselling author called for a âWashington Corrupt Practices Act,â which he says would create a legal standard that âclearly shuts down foreign influence and self-enrichment for some of Americaâs most powerful families on both sides of the aisle.â Peter SchweizerâsÂ Secret EmpiresÂ was first in-depth investigative work to uncover the details behind how Hunter BidenÂ received millions of dollars from Burisma Holdings while his father, then-Vice President Biden, steered $1.8 billion in aid money to Ukraine. Jerome Hudson isÂ Breitbart News Entertainment Editor andÂ author of the bestselling book 50 Things They Donât Want You to Know.Â Order your copy today. Follow Jerome HudsonÂ on TwitterÂ @jeromeehudson.

articles.title: Donald Trump: America Invading the Middle East âWorst Decision Ever Madeâ
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump defended his desire to end U.S. military engagement in the Middle East on Wednesday.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âGOING INTO THE MIDDLE EAST IS THE WORST DECISION EVER MADE IN THE HISTORY OF OUR COUNTRY!â Trump wrote in all-caps on Twitter, noting the United States spent $8 trillion dollars in the ongoing wars and subsequent security in the region. âThousands of our Great Soldiers have died or been badly wounded,â he wrote. âMillions of people have died on the other side.â Trump argued the United States was drawn into invading Iraq by George W. Bush under a âdisproven premiseâ of the threat of weapons of mass destruction. âNow we are slowly & carefully bringing our great soldiers & military home,â he wrote. âOur focus is on the BIG PICTURE! THE USA IS GREATER THAN EVER BEFORE!â President Trump has faced opposition from the foreign policy establishment in Washington for his efforts to remove troops from Iraq, Afghanistan, and Syria and bring them home. âThe stupid endless wars, for us, are ending,â he wrote on Twitter, defending his decision to move 50-100 troops away from the Turkish-Syrian border. Trump announced plans to withdraw 7,000 troops from Afghanistan in December 2018 and in August he announced the withdrawal of over 5,000 troops. Ideally, the president would like to reduce the number of troops in AfghanistanÂ to 8,600 but peace talks with the Taliban blew up in September. Speaking to reporters on Monday, Trump said he would continue to pursue an âend gameâ in the Middle East, despite criticism from both political parties. âWeâre willing to do what we have to do, but there has to be an end game,â Trump said. âAnd if you stay, itâs going to be the same thing. Eventually, youâre going to have to leave.â

articles.title: Texas County Declares âSecond Amendment Sanctuaryâ Status
articles.subtitle: Commissioners in Hood County, Texas, declared âSecond Amendment Sanctuaryâ status on Tuesday, vowing to stand with their sheriff if he refuses to enforce federal gun control laws.
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: NBC DFW quotesÂ a portion of the âSecond Amendment Sanctuaryâ resolution, which states, âCommissioners Court affirms its support for the duly elected Sheriff of Hood County, Texas, in the exercise of his sound discretion, and affirms its resolve to support decisions by our Sheriff to not enforce any unconstitutional firearms restrictions against any citizen.â WFAA reported Hood County Sheriff Roger Deeds speaking in support of the resolution, saying, âIâm not going to stand by as a sheriff for this county and they are not going to stand by as the commissionersâ court of this county and let Second Amendment rights be violated,â Deeds said. âThis is all about the right to keep and bear arms.â Hood County resident Rick Palmer voiced support for the resolution: âI look at my handguns, my rifles in my safe, they donât jump out and shoot nobody.â Palmer went on to suggest there could be war if the government ever makes a serious attempt at taking away firearms. On September 12, 2019, Democrat presidential hopeful Robert âBetoâ OâRourke said, âHell yes, weâre going to take your AR-15.â On September 13 OâRourke made clear that his confiscatory plan for AR-15s would be âmandatory,â not voluntary. The National Shooting Sports Foundation reports there areÂ 16 million-plusÂ privately owned AR-15s in the U.S. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Veterans Urge Federal Retirement Plan: âNo Underwriting of the Chinese Threat with Our Moneyâ
articles.subtitle: A group of prominent military veterans wrote a letter on Monday urging all American pension funds to refrain from investing in Chinese companies.
articles.author: John Hayward
articles.content: âThe Chinese Communist Party [CCP] celebrated last week seventy years of its misrule of the people of China,â the authors wrote, referring to Chinaâs recent National Day commemoration. âIncreasingly, the CCPâs horrific repression at home is accompanied by growing aggression abroad and threats to the United States of America.â The signatories said companies that provide Communist China with the means of oppressing its citizens are âenablersâ of its terrible conduct. This includes companies that help China maintain its totalitarian âsocial creditâ system, violate U.S. and international sanctions, illegally develop disputed islands in the South China Sea, and improve its military capabilities with advanced weapons. âToday, such Chinese companies are being underwritten â in many cases unwittingly â by American pension funds and other institutional and individual investors,â the letter noted. âThere is at least $6 trillion that investors passively invest in the benchmarked Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) All-Country World Index, which has 6% of its portfolio (shortly going to 7% or another $60 billion) invested in the stocks of Communist Chinaâs corporations.â âWorse yet, the federal retirement systemâs Thrift Savings Plan is set up to mirror this MSCI index starting next year,â the letter continued. âIf that happens, U.S. government employees â past and present, military and civilian â risk having their pension funds underwrite the Chinese Communist Partyâs malevolent enterprises.â âIt is especially intolerable to those of us who have proudly served the Nation in uniform that our retirement investments will help its enemies threaten our comrades-in-arms and the country we love,â the signatories declared. âWe call on President Trump to prevent the Thrift Savings Plan from being tapped by companies tied to the Chinese Communist Party and thereby ensure that federal retirees will not wind up financing our foes,â they wrote. The letter was signed by retired veterans U.S. Army Lt. Gen. William âJerryâ Boykin, U.S. Air Force Lt. Gen. Thomas McInerney, U.S. Air Force Brig. Gen. Robert Spalding, Lt. Col. Allen West, Col. Darrell Smith, and Gunnery Sgt. Jessie Jane Duff. West is also a former member of the House of Representatives. The authors of the letter are not alone in asking the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board (FRTIB) to refrain from investing in Chinese companies. Sens. Marco Rubio (R-FL) and Jeanne Shaheen (D-NH) published a similar appeal at CNBC on September 30, noting that it would have been âunthinkableâ to compel American military personnel and government employees to invest in Soviet companies during the Cold War. Rubio and Shaheenâs article named several of the companies to which Boykin, McInerney, and their fellow signatories alluded, including surveillance technology firm Hikvision, the Aviation Industry Corporation of China, and telecom corporation ZTE. âAmericaâs investors should never be a source of wealth funding the Chinese Communist Party at the expense of our nationâs future prosperity,â the senators declared. Rubio and Shaheen wrote a letter of their own to FRTIB chairman Michael Kennedy in late August, asking him to reverse the decision to invest in Chinese enterprises and explain how that decision was originally reached. The Trump administration is currently considering restrictions on investment portfolio money flowing into China, prominently including the portfolios of U.S. government retirement funds. The Chinese government has indicated such a move would disrupt trade talks and prompt Beijing to retaliate.

articles.title: CNNâs Camerota Pushes Dem Rep. Himes on Impeachment: âWhat Are You Waiting for?â
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: During Wednesdayâs âNew Dayâ on CNN, host Alisyn Camerota pressed Rep. Jim Himes (D-CT) on impeachment, asking him what the House Democrats are waiting for when it comes to voting on articles of impeachment given that House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) believes there is ample evidence of obstruction of justice against President Donald Trump. Camerota asked Himes why not vote on articles of impeachment now, to which Himes said House Democrats âneed an opportunity to talk to the witnesses who were in the room.â âSpeaking of articles of impeachment,â Camerota posed, âit sounds as though Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi now believes there is ample evidence of obstruction of justice given that the Ambassador Gordon Sondlandâs appearance was canceled, given this letter and that there is evidence of asking a foreign power for help investigating a political rival in the upcoming election. Weâve all seen the transcript. So, what are you waiting for? Why not vote on the articles of impeachment now?â â[I]mpeachment is a serious thing, Alisyn, and we need an opportunity to talk to the witnesses who were in the room,â Himes replied. âLook, despite what the president is saying, the whistleblower complaint is very specific and it is fully corroborated as you point out by the so-called transcript that the White House put out there, and by the way, by the president himself, who looked into a whole bunch of television cameras and said, âHey China, you too ought to investigate Joe Biden.â You know, youâre right, the facts arenât really much in dispute here but you know, you donât rush to judgment.â âWeâve got to do away with a lot of the absolute baloney that people like the secretary of state of the United States of America have been putting out there so the American people understand the facts about what is happening here,â he later added. Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: San Diego City College Labels âMAGAâ as âCovert White Supremacyâ
articles.subtitle: San Diego City College hosted an event allegedly examining âwhite supremacyâ earlier this month, which labeled âMake America Great Againâ as an instance of âcovert white supremacy.â
articles.author: Alana Mastrangelo
articles.content: An event examining instances of âwhite supremacyâ atÂ San Diego City College referred to the phrase, âMake America Great Againâ as an instance of âcovertÂ white supremacyâ that is currently âsocially acceptable,â according to a reportÂ by Campus Reform. The event, entitled âConfronting White Supremacy through the Arts,â included aÂ white supremacy âpyramid,â which separated âovert white supremacyâ from âcovert white supremacy,â suggesting that, for example, the difference between âKKKâ and âMake America Great Againâ is that one is âovertâ racism, which the other is âcovert.â Along with the KKK, instances of âovertÂ white supremacyâ also included âlynching,â âthe N-word,â âswastikas,â âhate crimes,â and âNeo-Nazis,â among others. Instances of âcovert white supremacy,â listed just below the examples of âovert white supremacyâ on the pyramid, included: âCome join us in confronting White Supremacy through studentsâ performances,â read a promotional flyer for the event, according to Campus Reform. âPrior to the performances, guest speakers will set the stage and contextualize what white supremacy is, its areas of activity, and how rampant it is in our society, curriculum, mindsets, and media.â The âConfronting White Supremacy through the Artsâ event was reportedly hosted by co-directors of the World Cultures program at SDCC, professors Michelle Chan and Maria-Jose Zeledon-Perez. According to the report, the school alsoÂ distributed a vague and peculiar âwhite supremacy wheel,â which broke down the origins of white supremacy on a global scale. The wheel, entitled, âGlobal System of White Supremacyâ delinted Economics, Education, Entertainment, Labor, Law, Politics, Religion, Sex, and War as instances of global âwhite supremacy.â While it is not clear what exactly was discussed at the white supremacy seminar,Â San Diego City College studentÂ Daimeon Rodriguez told Campus Reform that he attended part of the event, where he witnessed students putting on performances that involved rapping, poems, and singing, which included words âthat were directed towardsÂ the current administrationâ and its supporters. âI hadÂ my MAGA hat on campus and had to hide it in worry of being threatened or targeted with speech or allegations again by another student,â said Rodriguez. âSome of the [performance] topics included some of the misinformation about people like me [Trump supporters].â You can follow AlanaÂ Mastrangelo on Twitter at @ARmastrangelo and on Instagram.

articles.title: Hillary Clinton: âNo Evidenceâ that Joe, Hunter Biden âDid Anything Wrongâ
articles.subtitle: Appearing Tuesday onÂ PBS NewsHour, failed presidential candidate Hillary Clinton defended former Vice President Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden, against allegations of corruption in China and Ukraine, claiming there is âno evidenceâ that the pair âdid anything wrong.â
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: A transcript is as follows: JUDY WOODRUFF: Former Vice President Joe Biden clearly a part of [the Ukraine matter]. His name came up during [the Trump-Zelensky] call. Whether he did or didnât do anything wrongÂ â and thereâs no proof that he didÂ â President Trump keeps bringing that up, is there an optical problem for Joe Biden because he son was in a position to be making a lot of money from a company that was in a foreign country? HILLARY CLINTON:Â You know, Judy, this is the goal of the Trump strategy: It is to raise questions. There is no evidence that either one of them did anything wrong. Could there be a question of judgment about his son? Well, thatâs fair game. But there is absolutely no evidence, and there will not be any evidence, that Joe Biden did anything wrong. Enough with these wild unfounded conspiracy theories. Using the help of foreign governments to interfere in our election and to undermine people who have been in the public eye for a long time and I hope the American people reject this, as they should. In recent days, President Donald Trump has suggested China and Ukraine investigate alleged corruption committed by the Biden family.Â As Breitbart News extensively reported, Hunter Bidenâs investment company scored aÂ $1.5 billion investment dealÂ with the Bank of China after traveling with his father on Air Force Two to the country in 2013. Further,Â then-vice presidentÂ Biden forced out former Ukrainian prosecutor Viktor Shokin as he was investigating the gas giant Burisma Holdings, which was paying Hunter Biden $83,000 monthly as a member of its board, despite his lack of expertise in the energy sector. Biden laterÂ boastedÂ before the Council of Foreign Relations last year that he had threatened to withhold $1 billion in U.S. aid unless the prosecutor was fired. Clinton may have a personal dog in this fight, as the Biden allegations first came from a book by Peter Schweizer â investigative journalist, president of the Government Accountability Institute, and senior contributor to Breitbart News â called Secret Empires: How the American Political Class Hides Corruption and Enriches Family and Friends. The book functions as a spiritual sequel to SchweizerâsÂ Clinton Cash: The Untold Story of How and Why Foreign Governments and Businesses Helped Make Bill and Hillary Rich. That bookâs findings, confirmed even by Democrat-friendly corporate media, became a major problem for her campaign and may have helped in the decline of The Clinton Foundation.

articles.title: Graham: Trump Showing Mentality âThat Paved the Way for 9/11â on Syria
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: On Wednesdayâs broadcast of the Fox News Channelâs âFox & Friends,â Senator Lindsey Graham (R-SC) stated that President Trumpâs tweet about withdrawing troops from northeast Syria âis the pre-9/11 mentality that paved the way for 9/11,â and if the U.S. pulls out, âthe Kurds are in a world of hurt, and ISIS comes back, and President Trump will own it.â Graham said, âThatâs a pre-9/11 mentality that the Mideast is no concern to us. â¦ And this is the pre-9/11 mentality that paved the way for 9/11, whatâs happening in Afghanistan is no concern to us. So, if he follows through with this, it would be the biggest mistake of his presidency. I would argue for him to go back to the status quo. The safe zones were working, patrolling with Turkey and international forces to protect the Kurds and Turkey is the way to go. If we pull out, the Kurds are in a world of hurt, and ISIS comes back, and President Trump will own it.â He added, âThis is Obama. Obama did the same thing in Iraq.â Graham later stated, âWell, itâs a lie that the â that ISIS has been defeated. The caliphateâs been destroyed, but it will reemerge.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: Minnesota AG Keith Ellison Rips into Religious Freedom: âLicense to Discriminate Against LGBTQ Folksâ
articles.subtitle: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison is vowing to fight a courtâs ruling that upheld the right ofÂ wedding videographers to create videos in keeping with their faith beliefs about marriage.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: In an op-ed at the StarTribuneÂ last week, Ellison toreÂ into the three-judge panel of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit, which recently ruledÂ in favor of St. Cloud Christian videographers Carl and Angel Larsen. The coupleÂ claimedÂ the right to create videos that are consistent with their faith beliefs about marriage between one man and one woman. Ellison announced he will go back to trial to prove âLGBTQ discrimination is not free speech,â he said, as he accused the Larsens of using their faith beliefs as a front to be able to discriminate against LGBT individuals. âBusiness ownersâ free speech and beliefs are already fully protected under the First Amendment,â Ellison wrote. âWhat they want is a license to discriminate against LGBTQ folks.â  According to Ellison, the âright to be free from discrimination in publicâ is of greater value than religious liberty, though he also claims the First Amendment assures âno law canâ tell people what they can believe. Ellison claimedÂ the Eighth Circuit panel is simply telling the Larsens and their video company, Telescope Media Group, âit can hide behind âfree speechâ to discriminate against LGBTQ couples.â âWeâre not letting it go unchallenged,â he asserted, but added appealing the decision to the U.S. Supreme Court would not be a realistic option: [T]he current makeup of that court means weâre not likely to win, because the court would have to accept Telescopeâs fairy tale as true, since there are no other actual facts on record at this early stage of the case. A loss there would make this kind of discrimination against LGBTQ people the law everywhere in America. Instead, the best path forward is to take the case back to federal district court. There, weâll be able to help the trial court establish a set of facts based in reality. Then, if it ends up on appeal again, including before the Supreme Court, the appellate courts will have to accept those facts as true, not Telescopeâs fanciful story. Ironically, Ellison believes his path is one that keeps âhonoring the First Amendment, which allows everyone to believe what they want.â President Donald Trump will holdÂ a Keep America Great rally in Minneapolis Thursday. Minnesota is a key battleground state in the 2020 presidential election.

articles.title: Vermont City Council Gives Green Light to Non-Citizen Voting
articles.subtitle: City council members in Burlington, Vermont, passed a resolution in a 10-2 vote on Monday, which would allow non-citizens to vote in local elections.
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: Councilman Adam Roof, who sponsored the resolution, argued that non-citizens are still residents of the city and should be allowed to vote regardless of whether or not they are U.S. citizens. âThe right to vote is more important now than ever before,â Roof told WCAX-TV. âAll residents have the right, in my eyes, to participate in the local democratic process, and the highest level of participation in that process is being able to cast your vote.â But not everyone on the council was supportive of the resolution.Â Council President Kurt Wright, one of the two council members to vote against the measure, said he voted against the resolution because he believes voting is a privilege reserved for American citizens. âI think thatâs important. I would not expect to move to another country and not become a citizen and expect to be voting in their elections,â said Wright, a Republican. âWe voted on this just a few years ago and the citizens of Burlington voted significantly against it so Iâm not supportive of this proposal.â Burlington, which is the hometown of 2020 Democrat presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), is home to 42,000 people and is considered the largest city in Vermont, according to estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau. It also hosts the University of Vermont, which hosts at least 10,000 undergraduate students. The resolution needs approval from the state legislature before it can become law, the Associated Press reported.

articles.title: Rand Paul: Trump Made the Right Decision in Syria
articles.subtitle: Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) on Tuesday applauded President Trumpâs decision to move about 50 American soldiers in northern Syria away from a frontline in a pending war between Turkey and Syrian Kurdish forces.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: âIt reminds me of President Reaganâs decision after the bombing in Beirut that having a few hundred soldiers in the middle of the war, theyâre not necessarily a deterrent but often a tripwire to a larger conflagration and so I really think the president is making a wise decision,â he told reporters on a conference call. âIâm of the opinion go big or go home and thereâs no reason to be putting a couple dozen soldiers in the middle of oncoming armies,â he added. âSo I think the presidentâs made a wise decision, and I for one am very supportive of it.â He slammed Republicans criticizing the president over his decision as neoconservatives who ânever met a war they didnât like.â âThese are the people who never met a war they didnât like. Never met a war they wanted to end, never met a war they once declared victory from. And so no it doesnât surprise me. But I guess the onus is on those people to explain what the national interest is in Syria for us,â he said. âAll these same people who wanted to stay were advocates for getting into the middle of this Syrian civil war. They were all advocates for toppling Gaddhafi, they were all advocates for toppling Hussein, theyâve been wrong about everything in foreign policy for the last several decades,â he added. âTheyâve gotten us involved in quagmire after quagmire, extraordinarily expensive, I agree with the president that the expense in both blood and treasure is disproportionate, something I think most Americans would actually agree with president that this is not a war that our national interest is at stake.â A senior National Security Council official told reporters on Tuesday that the American troops, which number about 50 in northern Syria, would be redeployed elsewhere in Syria, contrary to reports suggesting that Trump with withdrawing all U.S. troops there. During the height of the U.S.-led war against the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS), there were about 2,000 U.S. forces in Syria. The administration has pushed to reduce that to a presence of about 400. Paul said the backlash over moving 50 troops within Syria shoes the âlunacyâ of the war caucusâ criticism. âThis goes to the lunacy of the war caucus yelling and screaming over moving 50 soldiers.Â  For Goodness sakeâs they want to lose 50 in the wake of a 600,000 person Turkish Army. Who are these armchair generals?â he said. Paul argued the approximately 50 forces are not a deterrent âto anybody.â âWe have a lot of different scattered special forces in those areas, but we have no deterrent to anybodyâ¦itâs not like we have a big army there to deter Turkey from coming in,â he said. He also said the U.S. could not be responsible for all the refugees that would result from a Turkish offensive or refugees who are currently residing in Turkey. âIf we were to deter Turkey from coming in, whoâs going to be responsible for all those refugees? Thereâs like three million refugees â are we going to be responsible for them forever? The president makes a good point on the captured ISIS fighters and families â are we going to house 90,000 people until the end of time?â he said. âWhen are the Europeans going to step up and do anything?Â When are they locally going to do something? The Turks have at least stood up and said theyâre going to do something about it, so I think the presidentâs made the right decision and anybody advocating, telling the president or demanding that the president leave 50 troops in place is somebody who really hasnât thought through the consequences,â he said. Paul also slammed Democrats who have are for foreign policy restraint but are not backing up the president on his decision. Even the supposedly anti-war, ultra-progressive Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) criticized Trump for moving the 50 U.S. troops from northern Syria. Paul chalked it up to âTrump Derangement Syndromeâ: I think that why you hear such a uniform racket going after the president is the Democrats go after the president because of Trump derangement syndrome. They donât like him politically, and weâre in the middle of a continuous campaign. And so there are Democrats who probably do think it was ill-advised to be in the middle of the Syrian civil war but theyâve gone quiet or dormant since their preoccupation is more with expressing their displeasure for Trump. âThe Republicans are actually more predictable in the sense that the neo-con hawks in our party really, like I said, never met a war they didnât like,â he said. Follow Breitbart NewsâÂ @Kristina_Wong.

articles.title: Facebook Rejects Biden Campaignâs Request to Ban Trump Ad
articles.subtitle: Facebook has rejected a request from former Vice President Joe Bidenâs 2020 campaign to remove a video advertisement by President Donald Trumpâs re-election campaign that highlights allegations of corruption against Biden and his son, according to a report.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: CNN on Wednesday published Facebookâs response to the Biden campaign in which it explains itsÂ decision is âgrounded in Facebookâs fundamental belief in free expression, respect for the democratic process, and belief that in mature democracies with a free press, political speech is already arguably the most scrutinized speech there is.â The ad condemns Biden for previously threatening to withhold $1 billion in aid to Ukraine unless the eastern European country fired a prosecutor reportedly probing into an energy company which Bidenâs son, Hunter, served as a board member. The 30-second clip, titled âBiden Corruption,â is running on several national cable networks and online. To run the ad, the presidentâs 2020 campaign spent $8 million, while the Republican National Committee (RNC) chipped in $2 million.  Biden campaign spokespersonÂ TJ Ducklo responded angrily to Facebookâs decision, calling itÂ âunacceptableâ and said that the flow ofÂ âobjectively false information to influence public opinion poisons the public discourse and chips away at our democracy.â He did not comment on the substance of the adâs claims. Last Monday, CNN announced it had rejected to run the ad,Â claimingÂ the video âdoes not meet our advertising standards.â âSpecifically, in addition to disparaging CNN and its journalists, the ad makes assertions that have been proven demonstrably false by various news outlets, including CNN,â the network said in a statement. Tim Murtaugh, Trump 2020 campaignâs communications director, ripped into CNNâs decision, accusing the network of âspend[ing] all day protecting Joe Biden in their programming.â â[I]tâs not surprising that theyâre shielding him from truthful advertising too, and then talking to other media outlets about it,âÂ MurtaughÂ toldÂ the Daily Beast of the former vice president. âOur ad is entirely accurate and was reviewed by counsel, and CNN wouldnât even describe to us what they found objectionable.Â This isnât a cable news channel anymore, itâs a Democrat public relations firm.â

articles.title: Lawmakers Urge Visa, Mastercard to Drop Facebook Libra Cryptocurrency
articles.subtitle: Two Senate Democrats have reportedly urged payment processors Visa, Mastercard, and Stripe to drop out of their partnership with Facebookâs new Libra cryptocurrency.
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.content: Business Insider reportsÂ that Sen. Sherrod Brown (D-OH) and Sen. Brian Schatz (D-HI), have written a letter asking payment processors Mastercard, Visa, and Stripe to reconsider their involvement with Facebookâs new digital cryptocurrency Libra. The Libra digital currency was started by Facebook and is designed to be used for online purchases and digital money transfers. Libra will be led by a group of different firms via the non-profit group the Libra Association and is planned to be launched in 2020. Visa, Mastercard, and Stripe are three of the 27 firms that comprise the Libra Association. The letter sent by the senators to the payment processors focused on a report from the Wall Street Journal which claimed that Visa and Mastercard were reconsidering their involvement with the project. The letter states: We urge you to carefully consider how your companies will manage these risks before proceeding, given that Facebook has not yet demonstrated to Congress, financial regulators â and perhaps not even to your companies â that it is taking these risks seriously. Although the project has yet to fully launch and was only announced in June, itâs already lost a major firm this week with PayPal announcing its departure from the Libra association. PayPal did state that itÂ âremains supportive of Libraâs aspirations,â but would no longer be involved in the project. President Trump has previously criticized the virtual currency stating that it will have âlittle standing or dependability.â  The European Union also began an official investigation into Libra over competition concerns in August while French finance minister Bruno le Maire said that France âcannot authorizeâ Libraâs development in Europe over consumer risk concerns. Lucas Nolan is a reporter for Breitbart News covering issues of free speech and online censorship. Follow him on TwitterÂ @LucasNolanÂ or email him atÂ lnolan@breitbart.com

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Touts Plan to Address âEnvironmental Racismâ
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) on Wednesday unveiled her plan to address âenvironmental injusticeâ and âenvironmental racism,â which includes a $1 trillion investment into minority communities affected by âindustrial pollution.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Warren argues that âjusticeâ plays a massive role in properly addressing the climate change âcrisis,â citing studies that suggest that black and Hispanic families are disproportionately affected by air pollution caused by white people: A more recent study found that while whites largely cause air pollution, Blacks and Latinxs are more likely to breathe it in. Unsurprisingly, these groups also experience higher rates of childhood asthma. And many more low-income and minority communities are exposed to toxins in their water â including lead and chemicals from industrial and agricultural run-off. Warren calls this phenomenon âenvironmental racismâ and concludes that âenvironmental injustice is the result of decades of discrimination and environmental racism compounding in communities that have been overlooked for too long.â She previewed her plan in a video clip featuring far-left âSquadâ member Rep. Rashida Tlaib (D-MI). âWe need a government thatâs on the side of familiesânot giant corporations polluting our communities. @RashidaTlaib and I walked through 48217, the most polluted zip code in Michigan, and talked with the families living every day with the effects of pollution,â Warren tweeted alongside the clip: We need a government that's on the side of familiesânot giant corporations polluting our communities. @RashidaTlaib and I walked through 48217, the most polluted zip code in Michigan, and talked with the families living every day with the effects of pollution. pic.twitter.com/LsXlZQza7r â Elizabeth Warren (@ewarren) October 8, 2019  Like Warrenâs other proposals, her environmental injustice plan weaves in aspects of her other campaign promises. For instance, Warren says her housing plan will provide an assistance program, aimed to get impoverished families out of poor, pollution-ridden neighborhoods and into the âneighborhood of their choice.â She also pledges to invest one-third â or $1 trillionÂ â of her climate change investment âinto the most vulnerable communities,â although she does not specify what the $1 trillion will be spent on, specifically. Like most of Warrenâs plans, her environmental injustice proposal involves the implementation of another tax. In this instance, it is the âSuperfund Waste Tax.â Her plan states: There are over 1300 remaining Superfund sites across the country, many located in or adjacent to frontline communities. So-called âorphanâ toxic waste clean-ups were originally funded by a series of excise taxes on the petroleum and chemical industries. But thanks to Big Oil and other industry lobbyists, when that tax authority expired in 1995 it was not renewed. Polluters must pay for the consequences of their actions â not leave them for the communities to clean up. Iâll work with Congress to reinstate and then triple the Superfund tax, generating needed revenue to clean up the mess. The presidential hopeful even weaves in Medicare for All as part of her broader proposal, arguing such a system will âmake it easier for the federal government to quickly tailor health care responses to specific environmental disasters in affected communities when they occur.â Warren also reiterates her pledge to âensure that employers and our government honor the promises they made to workers in fossil fuel industries.â âIâve fought for years to protect pensions and health benefits for retired coal workers, and Iâll continue fighting to maintain the solvency of multi-employer pension plans,â she said. âAs president, Iâll protect those benefits that fossil fuel workers have earned.â However, Warrenâs role in crafting a petition to the Supreme Court on behalf of LTV Steel â which helped the companyâs âfight against a congressional requirementÂ  that it pay millions of dollars into a fund for its retired coal minersâ health careâ âÂ calls her promise into question. âAs Iâve traveled this country, Iâve heard the human stories from frontline communities. Families where many people have cancer. Coastal communities facing the threat of rising sea levels. Ruined land and poisoned water,â Warren tweeted. âThese communities need justiceâand I will stand with them,â she added: Industrial pollution has been concentrated in communities of color due to decades of discrimination and racismâand a system that puts corporate profits before people. We need big, structural change, focused on and led by members of those communities. â Elizabeth Warren (@ewarren) October 9, 2019  As we work to enact the #GreenNewDeal, I'll make sure that frontline community leaders who know best what their neighborhoods need are elevated in my White House and lead the way toward the big, structural change we need. They've been doing this work for decadesâwe should listen. â Elizabeth Warren (@ewarren) October 9, 2019  But we must ensure that we honor our commitments to fossil fuel workers as we transition to the new green economy. We'll ensure that new jobs have similar wages and benefits. And I'll fight to protect the pensions and benefits that they've earned. â Elizabeth Warren (@ewarren) October 9, 2019  As Iâve traveled this country, Iâve heard the human stories from frontline communities. Families where many people have cancer. Coastal communities facing the threat of rising sea levels. Ruined land and poisoned water. These communities need justiceâand I will stand with them. â Elizabeth Warren (@ewarren) October 9, 2019

articles.title: Hillary Clinton: Impeachment Is the âOnly Appropriate Remedyâ to Trumpâs âAbuse of Powerâ
articles.subtitle: Hillary Clinton resurrected the Russia narrative during a stop on herÂ Gutsy Women tour, partially blaming her 2016 loss on foreign interference and concluding that pursuing impeachment is the âonly appropriate remedyâ to address President Trumpâs âunconstitutional abuse of power, his contempt of Congress, and his obstruction of justice.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The failed presidential candidate tweeted a video from a Washington, DC, stop of her Gutsy Women tour and resurrected the Russian narrative, alluding to GOP-Russia âcollusionâ and expressing strong support for the Democrat-led House impeachment inquiry. At the DC stop of our Gutsy Women tour, I laid out why impeachment is the only appropriate remedy for the administration askingâor outright extortingâforeign countries to intervene on his behalf in our elections: pic.twitter.com/uSNgPukfiK â Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) October 9, 2019  All bets are off. If foreign governments think they can tilt the playing field as they did against me, which was a deliberate, well planned out effort laid out in an indictments against Russian military actors and their alliesâ Well, you know, Republicans seem to think that, âOk, so far Russiaâs playing on the red team. You know. So we like it. Weâre not going to stand up against it.â Well, whoâs to say that next week theyâre going to be playing on the blue team? Itâs crazy my friends. However, Clinton failed to mention the well-documented Ukrainian efforts to sink Trump and boost her campaign. The former secretary of state continued, calling the partisan-fueled impeachment inquiry the âappropriate remedyâ to the âserious assault on our democracy that is apparently asked for.â âSo impeachment is the appropriate remedy, and it is such a serious assault on our democracy that is apparently asked for, aided and abetted by not only the president but his allies who seem not to either care or understand how deeply dangerous this is,â Clinton said. âI am all in favor of what the House is doing and gathering the evidence and making the case because this president has to be held to account because of his unconstitutional abuse of power, his contempt of Congress, and his obstruction of justice,â she added. President Trump suggested on Tuesday that âCrooked Hillaryâ should join the race âto try and steal it away from Uber Left Elizabeth Warrenâ on the condition of explaining âall of her high crimes and misdemeanors including how & why she deleted 33,000 Emails AFTER getting âCâ Subpoena!â Clinton replied, âDonât tempt me. Do your job,â fueling speculation that she is considering another presidential run. I think that Crooked Hillary Clinton should enter the race to try and steal it away from Uber Left Elizabeth Warren. Only one condition. The Crooked one must explain all of her high crimes and misdemeanors including how & why she deleted 33,000 Emails AFTER getting âCâ Subpoena! â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 8, 2019  Clinton recently floated the possibility of a rematch on PBS NewsHour: You know, it truly is remarkable how obsessed he remains with me. But this latest tweet is so typical of him. Nothing has been more examined and looked at than my emails. We all know that. So, heâs either lying or delusional, or both. There was no subpoena, as he says in a tweet this morning. So, maybe there does need to be a rematch. I mean, obviously, I can beat him again. But, just seriously, I donât understand, I donât think anybody understands what motivates him, other than personal grievance, other than seeking adulation. Clinton is expected to host âDinner and a Conversationâ in her Washington, DC, home this month in partnership with the Democratic National Committee (DNC) and Womenâs Leadership Forum, adding to the speculation of another presidential bid on the horizon.

articles.title: Nolte: Ronan Farrow Claims Hillary Clinton Pressured Him to Kill Weinstein Story
articles.subtitle: One of the many news-making revelations in Ronan Farrowâs upcoming book,Â Catch and Kill, is that he received pressure from Hillary Clinton to back off his reporting on Harvey Weinstein.
articles.author: John Nolte
articles.content: The far-left Hollywood Reporter, which received an advanced copy of the book, naturally buried this bombshell under no fewer than 20 paragraphs and a headline that says nothing about Madame Clinton. What we also learn is that while Weinsteinâs move to leverage his relationship with Hillary Clinton was successful in putting pressure on Farrow, Weinstein was not able to leverage his relationship with filmmaker Woody Allen (Weinstein financed and produced a number of Allenâs films) to help him with Farrow. Allen, who is Farrowâs father, reportedly told the soon-to-be-disgraced mogul, âJeez, Iâm so sorry. Good luck.â Hereâs the relevant Hollywood Reporter excerpt (emphasis mine): Weinstein also attempted to leverage his long-term relationship with Hillary Clinton to pressure Farrow, he writes. In summer 2017, while Farrow was trying to lock down an interview with Clinton for his foreign policy book â while also still working on the Weinstein story â he received a call from Clintonâs publicist, Nick Merrill, who told him that the âbig storyâ Farrow was working on was a âconcern for us.â Then, in September 2017, according to an email cited in the book, Weinstein wrote to Deborah Turness, the ex-president of NBC News who now runs NBC News International, to propose a docuseries on Clinton. âYour Hillary doc series sounds absolutely stunning,â Turness responded. Weinsteinâs tentacles even stretched to Farrowâs own estranged father. Days before theÂ TimesÂ story broke, Weinstein is said to have called Allen on a film set in Central Park, soliciting advice about how to deal with his son. Allen declined: âJeez, Iâm so sorry. Good luck.â Please note that Merrill is Hillaryâs longtime publicist. He works for her, and it seems unlikely he would do such a thing without her instructions. Whatâs more, as of now, Merrill has not denied the reporting. To understand just how awful Hillaryâs behavior is here, you have to keep in mind the context of the time, of what was happening in 2017. To begin with, as Breitbart News reported in December 2017, there are credible reports Hillary Clinton had known about Weinsteinâs alleged sexual misconduct and abuse going back to her failed 2016 presidential campaign. From the far-left New York Times: [T]wo prominent women said they warned Mrs. Clintonâs team.
