In 2016, Lena Dunham, the writer and actress, said she was troubled by the producerâs visible presence during Mrs. Clintonâs presidential run, hosting fund-raisers and appearing at campaign events. â¦ âI just want you to let you know that Harveyâs a rapist and this is going to come out at some point,â Ms. Dunham said she told Kristina Schake, the campaignâs deputy communications director. She recalled adding, âI think itâs a really bad idea for him to host fund-raisers and be involved because itâs an open secret in Hollywood that he has a problem with sexual assault.â â¦ Ms. Dunham said she also warned Adrienne Elrod, a spokeswoman for Mrs. Clinton who was leading efforts with celebrity campaigners. As far as Ms. Dunham could tell, the campaign had not responded to her concerns about Mr. Weinstein. Weeks before Election Day, the producer helped organize a star-packed fund-raiser: anÂ eveningÂ on Broadway with Julia Roberts, Anne Hathaway and others. But even without this reporting, what we also know is that Weinsteinâs alleged misconduct and abuse were no secret in Hollywood and Washington, DC. Report after report after report confirm that âeveryone knew,â but no one did anything because 1) Weinstein had the power to make or break your Hollywood career and 2) Weinstein raised a ton of money for Democrats â most especially, the Clintons; most especially, Hillary Clinton. On top of that, at the time, it was no secret Farrow was working on what would be a Pulitzer-winning Weinstein exposÃ©. Everyone knew because Farrow was reaching out to everyone to put the story together. According to Farrow, Weinstein understood this report could completely destroy his life, career, and reputation (which it did), and so, the Oscar-winning producer went so far as to try to intimidate Farrow, using everything from spies to threats aimed at Farrowâs employers at NBC News. Farrow says Weinstein told NBC he would expose the networkâs top star, Matt Lauer â Â meaning the alleged sexual misconduct that eventually unraveled the Today Show anchorâs career. For the record, NBC News denies being threatened with Lauer. Nevertheless, NBC did refuse to run Farrowâs Weinstein story. Eventually, the far-left news outlet sent its own reporter and his bombshell story down the road to the New Yorker, where Farrow would not only win a Pulitzer, but launch the #MeToo movement that took down Lauer anyway. Anyway, this Hillary Clinton bombshell could not come at a worse time for the two-time presidential loser, a time when she appears to be seriously flirting with the idea of a 2020 rematch with President Trump. She might want to remember that during their 2016 battle, Trump was not afraid to remind voters that Hillary played a leading role to personally destroy the women who claimed to have been raped, abused, molested, and mistreated by her husband, former President Bill Clinton. Follow John Nolte on Twitter @NolteNC. Follow his Facebook Page here.

articles.title: Beto OâRourke on âWhistleblowerâ: âWhatever Political Bias He or She May Have Is Immaterialâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content:
Wednesday, 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Robert Francis âBetoâ OâRourke discussed the Axios reportÂ that claimed the President Donald Trump-Ukraine whistleblower had previously worked in an unnamed 2020 Democratic presidential candidateâs campaign. OâRourke said he was not âawareâ of the whistleblowerâs identity or if the person had worked in his campaign, adding their political bias âis immaterial to the charge thatâs been leveledâ against Trump. âAre you aware if this whistleblower has a professional tie to you or your campaign?â âMSNBC Liveâ host Hallie Jackson asked.

âNo, not that Iâm aware of, donât know the identity of the whistleblower and really know what you have reported and what Iâve read in the newspapers,â OâRourke responded. âBut I really think whatever political bias he or she may have is immaterial to the charge thatâs been leveled against the president, one that has been confirmed by, as you just reported, the inspector general, reconfirmed in the reconstructed transcript that has been released, a transcript that initially was put on an NSC server to keep it from distribution so that we would not find out.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Poll: Republicans, Independents Unconvinced by Democratsâ Impeachment Ploy
articles.subtitle: A poll released Wednesday found that Republicans and independent voters remain unconvinced by Democratsâ ploy to impeach President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: A Morning Consult/Politico poll found that 50 percent of American voters reportedly support impeaching Trump. Forty-four percent of American voters said that they do not support an impeachment inquiry, while six percent do not know or have an opinion on the Democratsâ impeachment inquiry. Eighty-eight percent of Democrats favor House Democrats impeaching Trump and removing him from office. However, the survey reveals that Republicans and independents do not largely approve of House Speaker Nancy Pelosiâs (D-CA) move to impeach the president. Eighty-three percent of Republican voters oppose impeachment and Senate removal of Trump, while 12 percent favor removing him from office, and five percent remain unsure about whether to impeach him. Republican votersâ strong support for Trump may make it harder for Democrats to successfully remove him from office through a Senate impeachment trial. Further, independent voters remain unsure over whether Congress should impeach Trump and remove him from office. Forty-three percent of independent voters approve of the House impeaching and the Senate removing him from office, while 43 percent oppose impeachment and removal from office, and 13 percent remain unsure whether to impeach Trump. Only Democrats voters said that having their representative back impeachment would make it more likely for them to vote for their reelection. Sixty-eight percent of Republicans said that their lawmaker backing impeachment would make it less likely for them to vote for their representative. Thirty-five percent of independents said that their lawmakerâs support for impeachment would make it more likely for them to back impeachment, while 32 percent said it would make it less likely, and 23 percent remain unsure whether their representativeâs backing of impeachment would make it more likely for them to vote for their lawmaker. The poll comes after a survey conducted for the National Republican Congressional Committee (NRCC) found that 59 percent of voters in congressional swing districts do not view Trumpâs call with Zelensky as an impeachable offense. The Morning Consult/Politico poll surveyed 1,991 registered voters from October 7-8 with a margin of error of two percent. Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: Houston Rockets Fan Arrested in China for Threatening to Burn National Flag
articles.subtitle: Chinese authorities have arrested a Houston Rockets fan who threatened to burn Chinaâs national flag â an illegal act in the communist country that can result in up to three years behind bars.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: CNN reported that the 25-year-old man used Chinese social media to make the threat and goaded authorities to âcome and arrest him:â Authorities in Chinaâs northeastern Jilin province said that the man, Howard Wang, was accused of publishing âinsults directed against the national flagâ on Weibo, Chinaâs equivalent to Twitter. Wang was arrested shortly afterward and the case is being investigated, local police said in a statement. Wangâs social media post was published Sunday, a few days after longtime Rockets General Manager Daryl Morey sent a tweet in support of months-long anti-government protests in Hong Kong. The Rockets have been arguably the most popular NBA franchise in China since the team drafted Chinese superstar Yao Ming in 2002. Yao played his entire NBA career in Houston. Moreyâs now deleted tweet angered both the NBAâs Chinese partners and U.S. politicians who accused the league of putting a priority on profit, instead of American values such as free speech. NBA commissioner Adam Silver released a statement on the controversy: âValues of equality, respect and freedom of expression have long defined the NBA â and will continue to do so,â Silver said. âThe NBA will not put itself in a position of regulating what players, employees and team owners say or will not say on these issues.â As CNN reports, âSilverâs response drew the ire of Chinese authorities and many angry citizens who said they would no longer support the Rockets. Some said they wouldnât buy Rockets gear unless Morey resigned.â In addition, several Chinese retailers and businesses have suspended ties to the Rockets, according to CNN. A photograph of Wang shows him wearing a mask and a patch over one eye â symbols that have become synonymous with the ongoing Hong Kong uprising in support of democracy. Another photo shows him holding the Chinese flag and a lighter. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter

articles.title: China Accuses Apple of âGuiding Hong Kong Thugsâ
articles.subtitle: China has criticized tech giant Apple for allowing an app that tracks Hong Kong police and protests on the iPhone app store. The Chinese Communist Party newspaper accused Apple of âguiding Hong Kong thugsâ by making the app available. Apple originally pulled the app, but returned it after massive backlash against bowing to the demands of communist China.
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.content:
TheÂ New York Post reportsÂ that tech giant Apple has come under criticism from China over an app that allows users to track the location of Hong Kong protests and police activity. The app, which Breitbart News reported recently wasÂ removed from the app store, was returned after a backlash from Apple customers and supporters of free speech, to the displeasure of the communist Chinese government.

When the HKmap Live app was removed, Apple told the developers that:Â âYour app contains content â or facilitates, enables, and encourages an activity â that is not legal â¦ specifically, the app allowed users to evade law enforcement.â The company behind the Hong Kong app argued that other apps have taken exception to these rules as they simply provide location data, if these rules were to be applied universally location-based apps such as Waze would also be banned. Appleâs argument was that the app is used solely to track police activity and protest movements. Messages on the app read: âAfter the tear gas was applied, the police officer immediately returned to the police station.â Another read: âFour flashing lights parked at the police station door.â Following backlash against the Silicon Valley giant, the decision was reversed several days later. Now the Chinese Communist Partyâs main newspaper has criticized Apple withÂ the Peopleâs Daily stating that the was designed by an outside supplier and available on Appleâs online store and that it âfacilitates illegal behavior.â The Peopleâs Daily questioned if Apple wasÂ âguiding Hong Kong thugs.â The Chinese Communist Party has ramped up efforts to crack down on protests in Hong Kong recently, pressuringÂ Hong Kongâs Cathay Pacific Airways and the National Basketball Association in the United States to side against protesters. Recently, video game developer Blizzard recently bannedÂ HearthstoneÂ eSports champion Ng Wai âblitzchungâ Chung, a native of Hong Kong, for making comments in favor of the pro-democracy protests in the city. Apple has a history of bowing to censorship demands from the communist Chinese government. In 2017, the company removed anti-censorship and VPN privacy apps from the Chinese app store at the governmentâs request. Lucas Nolan is a reporter for Breitbart News covering issues of free speech and online censorship. Follow him on TwitterÂ @LucasNolanÂ or email him atÂ lnolan@breitbart.com

articles.title: Wisconsin Democrat Gov. Tony Evers Signs Order Declaring âIndigenous Peopleâs Dayâ
articles.subtitle: Wisconsin Democrat Gov. Tony Evers signed an executive order declaring the second Monday of October, which is recognized as Columbus Day at the federal level, as âIndigenous Peopleâs Day.â
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: Evers signed the measure at the Indian Community School in Franklin, Wisconsin, on Tuesday, WISN reported. âThrough this executive order, we recognize and appreciate our tribal nations and Indigenous people and their resilience, wisdom, and the contributions they make to our state,â Evers said of the signing. âNative Americans in Wisconsin and throughout our country have suffered unjust treatmentâoften at the hands of our governmentâand today is about recognizing that Wisconsin would not be all that it is without Indigenous people,â he continued. Wisconsin houses 11 federally-recognized Native Nations, according to the executive order, which affirms their sovereignty and recognizes the âsignificanceâ of indigenous people in the region. Although the declaration is of importance to the tribes in the area, some people have disagreed with the measure being scheduled on Columbus Day. âI think itâs political correctness run amok,â Milwaukee Alderman Bob Donovan said, adding that he thinks Columbus Day should be observed separately. âI am not at all opposed to recognizing Native Americans, indigenous peoples to the Americas. No problem whatsoever. But I do have a problem when itâs done at the expense of Christopher Columbus and Italians,â Donovan said. Wisconsin is not the first state to enact an executive order recognizing Native Americans on the same day as Columbus Day. Oklahoma Republican Gov. Kevin Stitt signed legislation in April recognizing Columbus Day as âNative American Day,â the Hill reported.

articles.title: Dennis Rodman Offers Help with NBA-China Rift: âI Know a Thing or Two About Diplomacyâ
articles.subtitle: Former NBA star and self-appointed diplomat Dennis Rodman suggested on Wednesday that he could play a role in alleviating the festering tension between the NBA and China, telling NBA commissioner Adam Silver, âI know a thing or two about diplomacy.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Rodman â widely known for forging a friendship with North Koreaâs dictator Kim Jong-un â pleaded with Silver in a tweet on Wednesday, suggesting that he could be of service in deescalating the growing tensions between the NBA and China. âCommissioner Adam Silver, I know a thing or two about diplomacy,â Rodman said in the video clip. âBook me a ticket to Shanghai with you. Ambassador Rodmanâ:  Rodmanâs plea follows days of controversy sparked by Rockets GM Daryl Morey, who tweeted support for Hong Kongâs pro-democracy movement last week. âFight for Freedom. Stand with Hong Kong,â the now-deleted tweet read. As a result, the Chinese Basketball Association suspended its relationship with the Houston Rockets. While Morey followed up with a pair of apologetic tweets, the NBA ultimatelyÂ sided with the Chinese government: We recognize that the views expressed by Houston Rockets General Manager Daryl Morey have deeply offended many of our friends and fans in China, which is regrettable. While Daryl has made it clear that his tweet does not represent the Rockets or the NBA, the values of the league support individualsâ educating themselves and sharing their views on matters important to them. We have great respect for the history and culture of China and hope that sports and the NBA can be used as a unifying force to bridge cultural divides and bring people together Rockets Owner Tilman Fertitta also pushed back on Moreyâs initial remarks. âListenâ¦.@dmorey does NOT speak for the @HoustonRockets,â Fertitta wrote. âOur presence in Tokyo is all about the promotion of the @NBA internationally and we are NOT a political organizationâ:  ESPN followed suit, tap dancing around the issue in order to refrain from further escalating the tension between the two entities. As Breitbart News reported: According to a report from Deadspin, ESPNâs Senior News Director Chuck Salituro sent aÂ memoÂ to all staffers telling them to avoid talking about the political situation between Hong Kong and mainland China. Deadspin was also told that senior ESPN executives were monitoring all shows as they discussed the news of the day. ESPNâs reticence to talk about the massive and endemic human rights violations stands in stark contrast to the networkâs all-out support for the NBAâs boycott of North Carolina because of the Tar Heel Stateâs transgender bathroom law. It is not yet clear if Silver will respond to Rodmanâs request, but it is true that the former reality TV and NBA star has positioned himself as a diplomat in recent years. The White House reportedly thanked Rodman over the summer, specifically âfor his role in advocating for diplomacy between North Korea and the U.S.â

articles.title: Defense Intelligence Agency Employee Arrested for Alleged Leaking
articles.subtitle: A Defense Intelligence Agency employee was arrestedÂ Wednesday for allegedly leaking information to reporters and charged withÂ two counts of willful transmission of national defense information.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: The employee, Henry Kyle Frese, 30, possessed top-secret clearance at the DIA, and is alleged to have leakedÂ classified information, including details of weapons systems, to two journalists in 2018 and 2019. According to the Department of Justice, Frese was seemingly involved in a âromantic relationship for some or all of that period of timeâ in which he allegedly transmitted the information. One of the reporters wrote at least eight articles using information from at least five intelligence reports, which were leaked by the DIA worker, according to the indictment. He reportedly evenÂ re-tweeted a link to one of the articles that the reporter wrote using the information he had given to her. In April 2018, after Frese accessed one of the intelligence reports, the reporter sent him a private message on Twitter asking if he would be willing to speak with another journalist, who worked at another outlet owned by the same company. Frese replied that he would help if it could help advance the first reporterâs career because he wanted to see her âprogress.â The government also intercepted a call in September during which Frese allegedly read classified national defense information to the second journalist, according to court documents. âFrese was caught red-handed disclosing sensitive national security information for personal gain,â said John Demers, theÂ Assistant Attorney General of the National Security Division. âThe unauthorized disclosure of TOP SECRET information could reasonably be expected to cause exceptionally grave harm to the national security of the United States,â the Justice Department said in a press release. Frese is the sixth individual to be charged with leaking to reporters or the public in the last two years. The Associated Press contributed to this report.

articles.title: University of Nevada, Reno TPUSA Member: Assistant Dean Compared Us to âWhite Supremacyâ
articles.subtitle: University of Nevada, Reno student Kendall Rice told Breitbart News that her Turning Point USA (TPUSA) group received push-back from schoolâs assistant dean, who sent out an email likening the organization â which recently hosted its annualÂ Black Leadership Summit in Washington, D.C. â to âwhite supremacy.â Rice spoke to SiriusXMâs Breitbart News Daily host Alex Marlow on Wednesday for the showâs weekly TPUSA campus report.
articles.author: Alana Mastrangelo
articles.content: âThe assistant dean sent out an email,â said Rice, â[which] stated TPUSA was a hate group, that we were linked with supremacy groups â that we were definitely not allowed on campus â that we should not be tolerated, and that all students and students and faculty should push back against us.â â[The email] was received by all professors â all faculty,â continued Rice, who added that at the end of the email, the assistant dean encouraged administrators to pass the propaganda along to their students as well. Listen below:  A section of the assistant deanâs purported email reads as follows: Please warn your students that these hate groups are active. I also suggest that, when appropriate, you create meaningful dialogue around the subject in your classrooms. These can be difficult conversations, but we must be willing to engage in them. Moreover, we need to create discourses in our classrooms that can counter some of the false and misleading information students are receiving from some of these groups. âOn October 7th, the local chapter of Turning Point USA will host the visit of Charlie Kirk,â continued the email, claiming that Kirkâs group is linked to white supremacy. âSeveral colleagues in CLA [College of Liberal Arts] and other colleges are collaborating with student organizations that are planning an alternative event or teach-in on the same day.â Rice mentioned, however, that members of the campus community who were critical of TPUSA had never made an effort to speak with the conservative students, to find out what they really believe in. âNo one ever talked to us, so they would never know who we are actually,â said Rice. âWe all have strong moral characters. This is why itâs so upsetting â we all come from a good place in our hearts. Weâre all very loving people, we genuinely love every single person.â âAnd by promoting hate against us on campus â through this email â there was constantly always something around the corner. I would go to class, and there would be posters with our logo â[they] put, âUNR protects racists, conservative groups are a place for white supremacists,â stuff like this.â âIt was slander, everywhere I went, every single lecture hall, every building,â said Rice, âand it is to be believed that itâs coming down from the highest points of position in this university, and theyâre encouraging students and teaching them that itâs okay to silence conservatives on campus.â One week before the Kirkâs scheduled appearance at UNR, a leftist student approached a TPUSA recruiting table, where group members were promoting the upcoming event. âThis individual came up to us, and he started acting aggressive, arguing with us,â explained Rice. âAt one point â his body language was just very uneasy. We had valuables on the table â my laptop and a portable speaker. We started taking those off the table, in fear that he might do something.â âAnd the minute we took off our last valuable thing, the individual just came at us and flipped the table,â said Rice. âOur table was destroyed, coffee went everywhere. I know coffee went all over our pants, and the individual just ended up running away.â The incident was caught on video, and later posted to Kirkâs Twitter account.  According to the University of Nevada, Reno Police Department, the man âwas arrested for Destruction of Property and Disturbing the Peace. He was taken to the Washoe County Jail.â âI applaud our campus police for acting so quickly and diligently to hold this person accountable,â said Rice, âbut that was only our campus police, the university didnât do anything.â Marlow mentioned that the left has changed the definition of âwhite supremacist.â âThe definition of white supremacy used to be you actually had to think white people are superior to other races,â said Marlow. âNow [the definition] is simply, you are a right-of-center person and you donât hate the president, even if youâre a black person. Remember, Candace Owens is a âblack white supremacist,â according to the left.â Rice added that despite all of the slander being directed toward her group, it did help with TPUSA recruitment, as students have witnessed first-hand the propaganda being promoted by the left, which in turn, has motivated conservative students to see to it that their voices are not silenced. âBecause colleges are controlled by leftist faculty and students, I initially thought there was going to be less conservative [students], but as I started getting out there and recruiting, there was a lot more than I thought,â noted Rice. âMany of them did not have a voice on our campus and were afraid to speak up,â she added, âbut by doing this event, it allowed me to recruit them on my team and help other conservatives that did not have a voice before.â You can follow Alana Mastrangelo on Twitter at @ARmastrangelo and on Instagram.

articles.title: Outrage as Speaker Bercow and EU President Bypass UK Govt to Stop Full Brexit
articles.subtitle: The new President of the European Parliament confirmed he has entered into talks with his British counterpart Speaker John Bercow on how to prevent the UK fully leaving the European Union, a move which has outraged prominent Brexiteers.
articles.author: Oliver JJ Lane
articles.content: Speaking to the Parliament plenary session on Wednesday, the newly selected President of the European Parliament David Sassoli revealed that as well as meeting with Britainâs Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Tuesday in London, he had also engaged in apparently secret talks with the notoriously anti-Brexit speaker of the Commons, John Bercow. Far from being a simple meeting of equivalent role-holders from two Parliaments, the Presidentâs comments made clear the two men had come to agreement on working together to stop a full Brexit â what he called a âchaotic exitâ. Sassoli told the chamber: ââ¦This morning I also had a fruitful discussion with speaker Bercow in which I set out my view that any request by British institutions of an extension of prorogation of Parliament should allow the British people to give their views, be it in a referendum or a general election. Speaker Bercow and I were very much on the same wavelength regarding the importance of our respective Parliaments in managing Brexit.   âWe share an awareness that a chaotic exit of the United Kingdom from the European Union would work to the detriment of citizens on both sides, I do trust that no deal can be avoided at the end of the day. The European Union nonetheless has adopted all the necessary measures to prepare for the consequences should it occur.â Brexit leader Nigel Farage signalled his fury at this development, writing: âSassoli confirms a meeting with John Bercow in which they agreed to work to prevent a clean break Brexit. What right does the Speaker have to do this? Disgraceful!â Mr Farageâs comments were followed up by Brexit Party chairman Richard Tice who questioned whether Sassoli even had the authority to enter into such talks, and by MEP Belinda de Lucy who directed her scorn directly at the chair in the session. She said: âLet me make this very clear Mr Sassoli, you have no right to go and speak with the UK Speaker and have conversations that are directly interfering into our domestic politics. It exposes your intentions to intervene at all levels to stop Brexit. It is immoral; shame on you.â John Bercow, the speaker of the House of Commons who as a convention of the house is allowed to retain his seat in parliament without actually having to fight any elections, has emerged since the 2016 Brexit referendum from his proper position as a neutral arbiter of Parliamentary business to a central figure in the anti-Brexit resistance. Such is his respect among anti-Brexit activists, he was last week named as a potential caretaker Prime Minister in an anti-Brexit coalition government, should that faction succeed in bringing down the Boris Johnson government.

articles.title: Brexit Party Tops Poll in Most Trusted to Be on Side of British People
articles.subtitle: The Brexit Party is trusted more than any other party or politician to be on the side of the British public.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: Britons put the Brexit Party ahead of 15 other politicians and parties as the most âon the side of the British peopleâ, with 31 per cent, in an IpsosMORI poll. The partyâs leader Nigel Farage was the third-most trusted in that respect, withÂ 29 per cent. The top five considered to be âmore on the side of the British Establishmentâ were: the Conservative Party (42 per cent), Prime Minister Boris Johnson (36 per cent), âMPs who want to remain in the EUâ (35 per cent), judges (32 per cent), andÂ âMPs who want to leave the EU without a dealâ (31 per cent). The survey also found that trust in politicians and parties to put the nation first when it comes to Brexit is at a low of 17 per cent.  Despite the Brexit Party being the most trusted political party to represent the people, Prime Minister Boris Johnson has again ruled out an election pact with Mr Farage. Centrist Tory MP and Remainer Damian Green told The Guardian on Wednesday that Johnson said he would not go into a pact with the Brexit Party. He also claimed the prime minister said he would not make leaving the EU in a clean-break a manifesto pledge. âWe went in to say that no deal as the prime aim of government policy would be unacceptable in a manifesto and we were reassured that wasnât the prime ministerâs aim, that he still wants to get a deal now and still thinks that would be the best outcome. He has no intention of putting a no-deal policy in a manifesto,â Mr Green said. Last month, Mr Farage announced that he would run as a parliamentary candidate in the next General Election. The Brexit Party leader says that the prime minister would need a strategic election pact to win a substantial majority for Brexit. Mr Farage predicted such a partnership could lead to up to a 100-seat majority. âHere is a way for Boris to get a big, workable majority. Weâre happy to help with that,â Mr Farage said in late September. âWeâre the party that believes in a clean-break Brexit because thatâs the only way that we can honour the referendum, and weâve said that if Boris Johnsonâs party goes for a clean-break then, of course, we ought to have a non-aggression pact.â

articles.title: Dem Rep. Garamendi: We Should Put Impeachment Inquiry Resolution on the Floor
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: On Wednesdayâs âCNN Newsroom,â Representative John Garamendi (D-CA) called on the House of Representatives to have a vote on a resolution for an impeachment inquiry on the House floor. Garamendi said, âI do think that itâs time for us to put a vote on the floor, a resolution for the inquiry, structured in such a way that it can move forward with full power of the Congress behind it. I think thatâs probably going to come in the next week or so. That will further strengthen Congressâ hand.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: DCCC Raises $27.4 Million in Third Quarter
articles.subtitle: The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee (DCCC) raised $27.4 million in the third quarter amid the partisan-fueled impeachment efforts in the House.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The House Democratsâ campaign wing reported $27.4 million in the third quarter, just $2.1 million more than Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT), who raised more than any other Democrat candidate in the third quarter. While the DCCC, which experienced a mass exodus of staffers over diversity-related concerns during the summer, sees the haul as a positive, it is $1.6 million short of the $29 million it raised in the second quarter. According to the DCCC just over half â $14 million â came from small donors. âNow more than ever, we must work to protect and expand our fragile House Majority,â DCCC chairwomanÂ Cheri BustosÂ (D-IL) stated. âThat means keeping up our record-setting pace, continuing our work to engage with a broad coalition of voters across this country, and fighting for the common sense priorities of the American people,â she continued. âThe stakes have never been higher and we will not let up,â she added. The DCCC hopes the haul will assist the Democrats in maintaining control of the House in 2020. As Breitbart News reported, the impeachment inquiry leaves many Democrats in key congressional districts vulnerable. Internal polling signals an uphill battle for impeachment-driven Democrats, showing that voters are more likely to support a Republican candidate over an impeachment-supporting Democrat. The National Republican Congressional Committee (NRCC) poll ultimately found that 59 percent do not view President Trumpâs conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky an impeachable offense. As Breitbart News reported: Fifty-four percent of voters in those Trump-won, Democrat-held districts said they would be more willing to vote for a Republican. Only 38 percent chose a Democrat, giving Republicans a 16-point advantage. Additionally, the majority of voters in these districts â 58 percent â say Democrats have not accomplished much since taking the House, and 62 percent believe that the impeachment inquiry will continue to distract them from achieving promised policy goals. The Trump campaign and Republican National Committee (RNC) have experienced a financial boost following House Speaker Nancy Pelosiâs (D-CA) formal announcement of an impeachment inquiry, raising a combined $5 million in the 24 hours following her announcement and a total of $13 million in the three-day span following her pledge: Voters vote with their walletsâ¦ and we are winning! You can not FAKE NEWS THAT. https://t.co/Ze29Iu0XTh â Brad Parscale (@parscale) September 25, 2019  âIf this weekâs GOP fundraising haul is any indication, Pelosi didnât just drive another nail into the coffin awaiting the Democratsâ nominee next year, she may also be looking at serious losses in the swing House districts that handed her the speakerâs gavel in 2018,â Trump campaign manager Brad Parscale wrote. Additionally, the RNC and Trump campaign announced a massive $125 million fundraising haul in the third quarter, further signaling that impeachment-driven Democrats have cause for concern.

articles.title: Biden Calls for Trumpâs Impeachment â âHe Is Shooting Holes in the Constitutionâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Wednesday, 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful former Vice President Joe Biden at a town hall in Rochester, NH called for President Donald Trump to be impeached. CNN was there with cameras to capture the moment. Biden said, âWith his words and his actions, President Trump has indicted himself by obstructing justice, refusing to comply with the congressional inquiry. Heâs also convicted himself in full view of the world and the American people, Donald Trump has violated his oath of office, betrayed this nation and committed impeachable acts.â He continued, âYou know to preserve our constitution, our democracy, our basic integrity. He should be impeached. Thatâs not only because of what heâs done. To answer whether heâs committed acts sufficient to warrant impeachment is obvious. We see it in Trumpâs own words. We see it in the texts from state department officials that have been made public. We see it in his pulling much of the United States government into his corrupt schemes, individuals within the government, his appointees. But we have to remember that impeachment isnât only about what the presidentâs done. Itâs about the threat the president poses to the nation if allowed to remain in office. One thing about this president is absolutely clear, and I donât think anyone can contradict this, he has seen no limits to his power regardless of what the Constitution says.â He added, âHe believes the entire United States government can be corrupted into furthering his personal political needs. Heâs even willing to hold Congress and congressionally appropriated aid to a foreign nation hostage to his personal political demands. He believes if he does something, itâs legal, period. And perhaps most importantly, he believes there is nothing we can do about it. He believes he can and will get away with anything he does. We all laughed when he said he could stand in the middle of 5th Avenue and shoot someone and get away with it. Itâs no joke. Heâs shooting holes in the Constitution, and we can not let him get away with it.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: WATCH: Beto OâRourke Says Plurality of Texans Support Mandatory AR-15 Buyback
articles.subtitle: Democrat presidential hopeful Robert âBetoâ OâRourke told NPRâs Off Script that a plurality of Texans support a mandatory AR-15 buyback plan.
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: OâRourke told NPR, â49 percent of people in [Texas] believe in a mandatory âassault weaponâ buyback.â He claimed, âOnly 36 percent of Texans oppose that.â OâRourke was then asked whether a mandatory buyback is constitutional. He demurred from answering at first, then was asked the question again, at which time he said he believes a ban on AR-15s would survive judicial scrutiny. He hedged his bet by suggesting the ban should be instituted even if its chances of surviving the Supreme Court is up in the air.  During the September 12, 2019,Â Democrat debate OâRourkeÂ said, âHell yes, weâre going to take your AR-15.â The next day, OâRourke made clear that his confiscatory plan for AR-15s would be âmandatory,â not voluntary. He defended his confiscatory plan byÂ telling NPR that âthe constitution discriminates among weapons.â The National Shooting Sports Foundation reports there areÂ 16 million-plusÂ privately owned AR-15s in the U.S. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Impeachment Inquiry: House Democrats Subpoena Gordon Sondland After Trump Blocks Him from Testifying
articles.subtitle: House Democrat leaders on Tuesday subpoenaed Gordon Sondland, the U.S. ambassador to the European Union, to testify at a deposition and hand over documents related to their impeachment investigation into President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content: The subpoena came hours after the Trump administration ordered Sondland not to appear before a scheduled deposition with the Democrat-led panels conducting the impeachment inquiry. The Associated Press reports: House Democrats have subpoenaed Gordon Sondland, the U.S. European Union ambassador, after he failed to show up at a scheduled closed-door deposition Tuesday morning. The deposition was scheduled as part of House Democratsâ impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trumpâs dealings with Ukraine. Sondland was an intermediary as Trump appealed to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to investigate political rival Joe Biden and his family. Three House committees are demanding that Sondland appear at a deposition Oct. 16. They are also demanding that he produce documents, including communications from his personal device that have been turned over to the State Department but not to Congress. Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA), the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, deemed the decision to prevent Sondland from testifying as âstrong evidence of obstructionâ by Trump. In a statement, Jim McDermott, Sondlandâs attorney, explained: Ambassador Sondland had previously agreed to appear voluntarily today, without the need for a subpoena, in order to answer the committeeâs questions on an expedited basis. As the sitting U.S. Ambassador to the EU and employee of the State Department, Ambassador Sondland is required to follow the departmentâs direction. Sondland was âprofoundly disappointedâ he was unable to testify Tuesday but is willing to appear on short notice if permitted by the Trump administration, his lawyer added. The Democrat-led House Committees on Oversight and Reform, Intelligence, and Foreign Affairs are leading the impeachment probe. In a joint statement issued Tuesday, the chairmen of the House panels vowed to subpoena Sondland. âWe will be issuing subpoena to Ambassador Sondland for both his testimony and documents,â they declared. A July 25 phone call between Trump and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky ultimately triggered the impeachment probe. An intelligence community âwhistleblowerâ filed a complaint alleging Trump pressured Zelensky on the phone call to investigate allegations of corruption against Joe Biden and his son. Trump threatened to withhold aid if Ukraine did not play ball, the âwhistleblowerâ claimed. Sondland has contradicted the quid pro quo claim at the center of the impeachment inquiry. In a text message, the top diplomat clearly said there was âno quid pro quo of any kindâ between Trump and Zelensky. Last week, former U.S. special envoy to Ukraine Kurt Volker provided a series of texts to the House committees. In written testimony, Volker described the communication exchanges as evidence that the Trump administration did not bully Ukraine into investigating Biden or his son. House Democrats, nevertheless, leaked a âsubsetâ of the texts to fuel their impeachment effort. The Democrats used the texts to argue the complete opposite of what Volker testified, saying the communication exchange proves Trump made a quid pro quo offer. Republicans are calling on the House Democrats to release the full transcript of Volkerâs testimony. On Tuesday, Rep. Mark Meadows (R-NC) said making the transcript public would âexonerateâ Trump. Meadows witnessed the more than eight hours of testimony provided by Volker. The impeachment inquiry proceedings are akin to a âkangaroo courtâ led by House Democrats who have cherry-picked and mischaracterized evidence, Republican congressmen argued Tuesday. Rep. Lee Zeldin (R-NY), a member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, noted that the proceedings fall outside the recognized standards of previous impeachment efforts. House Democrats subpoenaed Sondland on the heels of a White House letter to House Democrats announcing that Trump would not cooperate with the impeachment inquiry. Trump and members of his administration âcannot participate in your partisan and unconstitutional inquiry under these circumstances,â White House Counsel Pat Cipollone declared in the letter. Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), the top Republican on the House Intelligence Committee, said he understands the White House decision not to allow Sondland to testify. âThe reason why the State Department decided not to have Amb. Sondland here today is based on the unfair and partisan process that Mr. Schiff has been running,â he told reporters Tuesday. The White House letter said the impeachment probe is akin to an effort âseeking to overturn the results of the 2016 election.â

articles.title: Rihanna: Donald Trump âMost Mentally Ill Human Being in America Right Nowâ
articles.subtitle: Pop superstar Rihanna has suggested that President Donald Trump is the âmost mentally ill human being in America right now,â adding that the presidentâs response to the mass shooting in El Paso in August was âracist.â
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: Rihanna spoke to Vogue for an upcoming November cover story in which she discussed fashion, her music career and politics. .@Rihanna is our November issue cover star! She talks to Vogue about @savagexfenty, that album youâre waiting for, being happy in love, and, oh yes, she has a few choice words for the president. Read the full profile: https://t.co/y0smmdNoO2 pic.twitter.com/ftdLwRIY6L â Vogue Magazine (@voguemagazine) October 9, 2019  âThe most mentally ill human being in America right now seems to be the president,â the singer told Vogue. The magazine asked her about the El Paso shooting in August, in which a gunman killed 22 people at a Walmart. âPeople are being murdered by war weapons that they legally purchase. This is just not normal. That should never, ever be normal,â Rihanna said. She said President Trumpâs characterization of the shooter as mentally ill was racist. âAnd the fact that itâs classified as something different because of the color of their skin? Itâs a slap in the face. Itâs completely racist,â the Grammy-winner said. âPut an Arab man with that same weapon in that same Walmart and there is no way that Trump would sit there and address it publicly as a mental health problem.â Rihanna has frequently used her social media accounts to attack Trump, railing against his immigration policies. The âLove on the Brainâ singer even sent a cease-and-desist letter to Trump last year when her single âDonât Stop the Musicâ was played at one of the presidentâs rallies in Tennessee. Not for much longerâ¦me nor my people would ever be at or around one of those tragic rallies,  so thanks for the heads up philip! https://t.co/dRgRi06GrJ â Rihanna (@rihanna) November 5, 2018  Rihanna recently honored left-wing activist Shaun King at her annual Diamond Ball. But the celebration was criticized by fellow leftists over the way King treated a fellow activist earlier this year. Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Jim Jordan: We Need to Know More About the âWhistleblowerâ â Looks âSuspectâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: During Wednesdayâs âAmericaâs Newsroomâ on Fox News Channel, Rep. Jim Jordan (D-OH) suggested getting more information on the whistleblower who filed a complaint about President Donald Trumpâs phone call with Ukraine regarding former Vice President Joe Biden. Jordan said there is something âsuspectâ about the anonymous whistleblower who had no first-hand knowledge of the call, adding we need to know more about the whistleblower âif weâre ever going to get to the bottom of this.â âThereâs lots of things that have come out in the last day that make this thing even more suspect because the complaint was â thereâs been reporting that says the complaintâs on July 25. â¦ Then thereâs an 18-day time period before that the complaint actually gets filed. So, he does a memo where he talks about the frightening and crazy call that took place between President Trump and President Zelensky,â Jordan outlined. âSo, if it was so frightening and so crazy, why did this whistleblower wait 18 days to file the complaint?â he continued. âThat makes someone wonder. So, I think thereâs lots of questions we have to have and, frankly, we do need to hear about and know more about this whistleblower if weâre ever going to get to the bottom of this. And I think â¦ the American people deserve that when you think about the impeachment of the guy we elected president.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Josh Hawley Calls for Oversight on Chinaâs Influence on American Colleges
articles.subtitle: Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO) is calling on the United States Senate to investigate Chinaâs influence on American education.
articles.author: Tom Ciccotta
articles.content: According to a local news report, Sen. Josh Hawley is continuing his call for a federal investigation into Chinaâs influence on American college campuses. Hawleyâs concerns center on an education group called the âConfucius Institute,â a Chinese-government agency that has built partnerships with American colleges and universities. The Confucius Institute is steeped in controversy. Critics have accused the organization, and by extension, the Chinese government, of seeking control over messaging at American universities. June Tuefel Dreyer, a professor at the University of Miami, claimed that the Confucius Institute told them that they are not allowed to discuss the Dalai Lama, Tibet, Taiwan, Chinaâs military. Martin Davidson, chief executive of the British Council, told theÂ New York Times in 2012 that the Confucius Institute bribes colleges with funding in exchange for control over the campusâ discourse on China. âThe Chinese are very clear on what they are trying to achieve,â Davidson said at the time. âThey want to change the perception of China â to combat negative propaganda with positive propaganda. And they use the word âpropagandaâ in Chinese. But I doubt they have to say, âWeâll only give you this money if you never criticize China.â The danger is more of self-censorship â which is a very subtle thing,â In a letter to leaders at the University of Missouri and Webster University, Sen. Hawley argued that it is inappropriate for do business with an organization would ask them to censor speech. But Confucius Institutes are more than a means of cultural exchange. As Li Changchun, a senior member of the Chinese Communist Party, stated in 2009, the Confucius Institutes are âan important part of Chinaâs overseas propaganda set-up.â Hanban is governed by the leaders of twelve Chinese ministries, including those handling foreign affairs, state media, and propaganda. Partnering universities sign contracts that prohibit them from âtarnishing the reputationâ of Hanban, and Hanban sends teachers and textbooks from China that are designed to promote a positive image of the PRC and suppress any discussion of the âthree Tsâ: Tibet, Taiwan, and Tiananmen Square. These Confucius Institutes are, in short, a tool for China to spread influence and exercise soft power in its rivalry with the United States. Stay tuned to Breitbart News for more updates on this story.

articles.title: Donald Trump Trolls Joe Biden on Corruption During His âImpeachâ Speech
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump on Wednesday ridiculed Joe Biden for delivering a major speech revealing his support for the impeachment of the president.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âSo pathetic to see Sleepy Joe Biden, who with his son, Hunter, and to the detriment of the American Taxpayer, has ripped off at least two countries for millions of dollars, calling for my impeachment â and I did nothing wrong,â Trump wrote on Twitter. The Biden campaign made a big splash of a speech delivered in New Hampshire on Wednesday. âTo preserve our Constitution, our democracy, our basic integrity, he should be impeached,â Biden said, accusing Trump of âshooting holes in the Constitution.â Bidenâs speech immediately drew mockery from the president as politically calculated. âJoeâs Failing Campaign gave him no other choice!â Trump wrote.  The president also shared a video on Twitter highlighting Biden and his son Hunter Bidenâs alleged corruption in Ukraine.  Sen. Elizabeth Warren continues to rise in the polls as Bidenâs big polling lead in the Democrat field continues to fall. Bidenâs campaign responded to Trumpâs comment with a tweet of their own from the former vice presidentâs account. âThanks for watching. Stop stonewalling the Congress. Honor your oath. Respect the Constitution,â Bidenâs account wrote, adding a taunt about Trumpâs tax returns. âAnd speaking of taxpayers, Iâve released 21 years of my tax returns. You?â

articles.title: Rocker Peter Frampton on Democratsâ Trump Subpoena: Just âRaid the F**kersâ
articles.subtitle: Rocker Peter Frampton says attempts by Democrats in Congress to subpoena Trump adminstration officials are a waste of time, suggesting that they should instead just âraid the fuckersâ to find evidence against President Trump.
articles.author: Ben Kew
articles.content: The 69-year-old singer was reacting to recent reports that Democrats in Congress have issued subpoenas against multiple White House officials as part of their impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump. âWhat is the point of a subpoena if, when handed it, you can just say âNoâ and we go, âOk, sorry to bother you,â Peter Frampton wrote on Twitter. âRaid the f_ckers and get what we are asking for!â  Led by Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, Democrats recently opened impeachment proceedings after Trump mentioned former Vice President Joe Bidenâs dubious financial dealings in Ukraine with PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky. According to Pelosi, this amounted to Trump â[abusing]Â his power by pushing UkraineÂ to investigate his political rival.â Frampton later celebrated the number of âlikesâ his tweet received, comparing them to the number received by the actress and model Kate Beckinsale. âWow, I think I almost have as many likes here as @KateBeckinsaleâs bare left toe might get,â he followed up. ââ¦.. Nah!â  Despite being born and raised in the United Kingdom, Frampton became a U.S. citizen in 2011, citing the 9/11 attacks and his desire to vote in American elections as his principal motives for doing so. Follow Ben Kew onÂ Facebook, Twitter atÂ @ben_kew,Â orÂ email him at bkew@breitbart.com.

articles.title: Trey Gowdy Out at Fox News amid Joining Trumpâs Legal Team
articles.subtitle: Former Rep. Trey Gowdy (R-SC) is no longer a contributor for Fox News, a spokesperson for the network confirmed on Wednesday.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Gowdy no longer holds a position as a Fox News contributor â a role he took on after retiring from Congress this year. âTrey Gowdy has been terminated and is no longer a contributor,â a Fox News spokesperson told the Hill on Wednesday. The development follows reports of the former House Oversight Committee chairman joining President Trumpâs legal team in the battle against the House Democratsâ partisan-fueled impeachment efforts. While initially speculatory, the New York Post reports that Gowdy signed on as part of the presidentâs outside legal counsel. Gowdyâs addition follows a series of back-and-forth between the White House and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA). The White House sent a letter â penned by White House Counsel Pat Cipollone â to the speaker, informing her that the executive branch will not comply with the impeachment probe, arguing that the inquiry itself lacks âany legitimate constitutional foundation, any pretense of fairness, or even the most elementary due process protections.â âBecause participating in this inquiry under the current unconstitutional posture would inflict lasting institutional harm on the Executive Branch and lasting damage to the separation of powers, you have left the President no choice,â the letter read. âConsistent with the duties of the President of the United States, and in particular his obligation to preserve the rights of future occupants of his office, President Trump cannot permit his Administration to participate in this partisan inquiry under these circumstances,â it added. Pelosi responded, calling the letter âmanifestly wrongâ and âanother unlawful attempt to hide the facts of the Trump Administrationâs brazen efforts to pressure foreign powers to intervene in the 2020 elections.â âDespite the White Houseâs stonewalling, we see a growing body of evidence that shows that President Trump abused his office and violated his oath to âprotect, preserve and defend the Constitution,â she claimed. âMr. President, you are not above the law. You will be held accountable,â the speaker added. Internal polling suggests that pursuing impeachment will hurt Democrats in vulnerable congressional districts, as the majority of voters in those districts do not view Trumpâs conversation with Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky anÂ âimpeachable offense.â Despite that, Democrats in the House are largely using the conversation as a basis for the impeachment inquiry.

articles.title: Lawyer for Impeachment Inquiry âWhistleblowersâ Worked Under CNNâs Clapper
articles.subtitle: One of the lawyers representing the unnamed âwhistleblowersâ at the center of the impeachment inquiry âreported directlyâ to James Clapper when the CNN analyst served as the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) under the previous administration, the attorneyâs professional biography revealed.
articles.content: The revelation came a day after the Washington Examiner reported that the intelligence community (IC) inspector general (IG) told congressional investigators the first âwhistleblowerâ had a previous âprofessional relationshipâ with an unnamed 2020 Democrat candidate. News reports have also identified the original âwhistleblowerâ as a âregistered Democrat.â Moreover, that âwhistleblowerâ reportedly shared his complaint with the Democrat-led House Intelligence Committee before reaching out to the IC IG, a move that suggests he violated the law. Two âwhistleblowersâ have surfaced accusing President Donald Trump of coercing Ukraine into investigating former Vice President Joe Bide and his son, Hunter, by threatening to withhold aid. The first âwhistleblowerâ is a member of the intelligence community. The same lawyers represent both leakers. Citing the attorneyâs biography published by his current employer, the Federalist revealed that the lawyer used to report directly to Clapper, adding: Charles McCullough, an attorney now representing the whistleblowers with Andrew Bakaj, a former staffer for Sens. Chuck Schumer and Hillary Clinton, was previously the inspector general of the intelligence community (ICIG) at the height of the Clinton email scandal. Now a partner at the Compass Rose Legal Group, McCulloughâs professional biography on the law firmâs website notes that he reported directly to Clapper as ICIG and âoversaw intelligence officers responsible for audits, inspections, investigations.â Clapper, who joined CNN as a national security analyst after leaving government in 2017, was a central figure in perpetuating the Russia hoax against Trump and lied to Congress about mass surveillance on Americans. In an interview with Fox 5 last December, McCullough commended the former DNI, saying, âI enjoyed a very good relationship with Jim Clapper, we got along fabulously.â Clapper is a retired lieutenant general in the U.S. Air Force. The former intelligence community chiefÂ is one of Trumpâs fiercest critics. The âwhistleblowersâ claim that Trump threatened to withhold aid from Ukraine if it refused to investigate corruption allegations against Biden, and his son is at the center of the impeachment probe. According to the âwhistleblowers,â Trump made the so-called quid pro quo offer during a July 25 call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. However, both Trump and Zelensky have denied the âwhistleblowersâ characterization of their conversation. Gordon Sondland, the U.S. ambassador to the European Union, has also said there was not quid pro quo during the call. Michael Atkinson, the IC IG, noted in an August 26 letter that the first âwhistleblowerâ was found to have harbored âpolitical biasâ in favor of a rival political candidate to President Trump. Atkinson did not name the rival.  CNN contributor Clapper served as former U.S. President Barack Obamaâs DNI from August 9, 2010, to January 20, 2017, when Donald Trump took office. On Wednesday, the Federalist linked one of the lawyers representing the so-called âwhistleblowersâ to Clapper.

articles.title: Half of House Republicans Back Move to Censure Adam Schiff
articles.subtitle: More than half of House Republicans have backed a resolution to censure House Intelligence Committee chairman Adam Schiff (D-CA) for fabricating a conversation between President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: One hundred House Republicans have joined a movement to rebuke Schiff by cosponsoring House Freedom Caucus chairman Andy Biggsâ (R-AZ) H. Res. 604, according to a list obtained by Breitbart News. H. Res. 604 would condemn Schiff for retelling a fictional phone call between Trump and Zelensky. Schiff also allegedlyÂ liedÂ about having never spoken to the Ukrainian intelligence officer âwhistleblower.â Congressman Biggsâ legislation has quickly gained support throughout the House Republican Conference. Support for the resolution extends from the House Freedom Caucus conservatives to moderates and House GOP leadership. Two weeks ago, the resolution quickly gained 18 cosponsors. Last Thursday,Â Breitbart NewsÂ reportedÂ 45 House Republicans have cosponsored the resolution. Last Friday, the bill gained 61 cosponsors. On Monday, the resolution had 73 sponsors, and support for the bill has reached triple digits as of Wednesday afternoon. The billâs growing list of Republican sponsors shows the GOP has moved to defend President Donald Trump against House Democratsâ impeachment inquiry. When Biggs sponsored the bill, heÂ saidÂ Schiffâs stunt was âinexcusableâ to âmislead the American public with such a statement.â House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA), House Minority Whip Steve Scalise (R-LA), and House Republican Conference chairwoman Liz Cheney (R-WY) have sponsored the resolution to condemn Schiff. The 100 House Republicans who have cosponsored Biggsâ resolution to condemn Schiff are: Rep. Chip Roy (R-TX) was one of the most recent sponsors to join Biggsâ resolution to condemn Schiff:  McCarthy wrote on Twitter last week: Chairman Adam Schiff has been lying to the American people for years. Now he is so desperate to damage the president that he literally made up a false version of a phone call. Enough is enough. I have signed a resolution to censure Schiff in the House of Representatives:  Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: UF Students Plan #ChompTrump Protest Ahead of âToxicâ Donald Trump Jr. Event
articles.subtitle: Students at the University of Florida are planning to protest Donald Trump Jr. and Kimberly Guilfoyleâs appearance at the school on Thursday, dubbing the protest #ChompTrump.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The presidentâs eldest son and Guilfoyle â a senior adviser to Trump 2020 campaign â are expected to speak at theÂ University Auditorium at 7 p.m. EST as guests of the UF student governmentâs ACCENT Speakers Bureau.  The university faced a tremendous amount of backlash following the announcement, with outraged individualsÂ calling it a âdisgraceâ and a âwaste of money.â ACCENT is reportedly paying the pair $50,000 to speak at the event, which comes from studentsâ activity fees. The reaction spurred UF to defend ACCENTâs decision to invite the duo to speak, reiterating its devotion to âfreedom of expressionâ and ensuring that a âwide variety of viewpoints are heard on campus.â UF stated: The University, in its statement on freedom of expression, has committed itself to ensuring that a wide variety of viewpoints are heard on campus as well as to protecting the First Amendment rights of all those in attendance,â UF said in a statement Wednesday. âThe University believes it is an essential component of its academic mission to foster an environment where divergent ideas, opinions and philosophies, new and old, can be rigorously discussed and critically evaluated.â With Trump and Guilfoyle slated to speak, aggrieved UF students are planning a #ChompTrump protest on the University Auditorium lawn. One event on Facebook, titled âProtest: Say NO to Donald Trump Jr. and Kimberly Guilfoyle,â claims the pairâs appearance is an âinsult to the multicultural organizations that have had their funds stripped away from them by Student Government.â âJoin us at 5:30 PM outside the venue as we #ChompTrump and send a clear message to the Trumps that hatred and bigotry are not welcome on our campus,â the eventâs description reads. Over 400 people marked that they are going to the protest, which begins at 5:30 p.m. EST. âWe do NOT support the usage of our student fees to fund a Trump campaign event on OUR campus and further promote the hateful rhetoric of this Administration,â one of the posts on the eventâs page reads. â#CHOMPTRUMP.â âStudent fees should NOT be used to fund this toxic event,â another post on the page adds. Another group, No Nazis at UF, is demanding UF to cancel the event altogether.  The group is expected to hold its protest in the Turlington Plaza at 5 p.m. EST.  The group also advertised its Wednesday night event of Anti-Don Jr. Sign-Making in anticipation of his Thursday evening appearance.  Despite the protestersâ accusations of a lack of diversity in ACCENT speakers, ACCENT has extended invitations to 33 speakers over the last four years. Of those, âsix have been women and 11 have been people of color,â Gainesville reported.

articles.title: Democrat Gov. Andrew Cuomo Compares Politics to âForeplayâ
articles.subtitle: New York Democrat Gov. Andrew Cuomo made a creepy comparison between sex and politics during a speech at an event in Syracuse on Wednesday.
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: âThereâs a concept in life called foreplay,â CuomoÂ saidÂ at the event, which focused on jobs, according to the New York Post. He tried to relate âforeplayâ to how Syracuse Mayor Ben Walsh and Onondaga County executive Ryan McMahon advocated hard for state funding to revitalize Syracuse and the surrounding area. âIt starts with âHello, how are you today? Everything good? Pleasure to see you,ââ continued Cuomo, drawing some laughter from the crowd. ââOh, by the way, thereâs something else I wanted to mention.ââ The New York Democratâs already off-putting speech got more awkward when he compared his efforts to boost the areaâs economy to âgoing all the way.â ââIâll call you in the morning.â And I did,â he said, laughing loudly at his own joke, according to the Post. CuomoÂ announced an emergency executive order banning the sale of flavored e-cigarettes last month and raised the age for purchasing them from 18 to 21. Cuomo also recently blamed âangry leftistsâ for their roles in trying to impeach President Donald Trump, even though he said 24 hours earlier that he would support impeaching the president.

articles.title: End of the Road? Beto OâRourke Failing to Meet Polling Threshold for November Debate
articles.subtitle: Former Rep. Beto OâRourke has not met the polling threshold for the MSNBC/Washington Post debate in November.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: The Democrat National Committee has required that candidates hit at least three percent support on four qualifying state or national polls, or five percent in two qualifying state polls. NBC News revealed that OâRourke had not yet reached the polling requirement to participate in the MSNBC debate, as well as former Housing Secretary JuliÃ¡n Castro, and Sen. Amy Klobuchar ofÂ Minnesota. Recent polls show OâRourke still struggling. A Quinnipiac poll released Tuesday showed that he was at one percent nationally with a Real Clear Politics average of two percent. Other national polls, such as the Politico/Morning Consult poll and the Economist/YouGov poll show him clearing three percent. OâRourke still has time to make a splash in next weekâs Democrat debate hosted by CNN in Las Vegas. In September, OâRourke earned headlines and attention for promising to take away gun ownerâs AR-15s and AK-47s, but it failed to move him to the top tier of the Democrat field. OâRourke also faces questions about his fundraising. While his fellow candidates have boasted big fundraising numbers for the third quarter, OâRourke has not. âI just donât want to,â he said on Saturday:

articles.title: Exclusive: Trump Administration Not Confident Trade Talks Will Produce An Agreement
articles.subtitle: Trump administration officials are not confident that trade talks this week will produce any agreement to lower trade tensions.
articles.author: John Carney
articles.content: China has sent signals this week that it would accept a smaller trade deal that would involve the U.S. holding off on new tariffs in exchange for purchases of U.S. agricultural goods. On Wednesday afternoon, Reuters reported that China had âlowered its expectationsâ for progress on trade talks in reaction to the Commerce Department blacklisting dozens of Chinese tech companies over human rights violations. Speaking to the press on Wednesday, President Donald Trump said he was not lowering his own expectations for the talks. âIâm driving a tough deal because I have to,â Trump said. âI told that to President Xi. I said, âThis canât be like a 5o-50 deal. If itâs a 50-50 deal, youâre up here and weâre down here. If itâs a 50-50 deal, it doesnât work. This has to be a better deal from our standpoint.â Midlevel officials from the Trump administration and China have been meeting last week and this week to set the stage for the high-level meetings set to begin on Wednesday. But few in the Trump administration are expecting a break-through, according to sources close to the talks who spoke with Breitbart News . Thereâs some concern that the talks could go awry, breaking-off early if China plays hardball. That is what happened in Shanghai this summer when U.S. officials quickly realized that the talks were not going to be productive. After U.S. officials debriefed the president on the talks, President Trump quickly announced a new round of tariff hikes. It was hoped early on that more time and higher tariffs would convince China to come to the next round of negotiations with a more open attitude toward the reforms with regard to forced technology transfer and industrial policy that the U.S. has demanded from the start of the trade fight last year. Those hopes have largely faded over the past two weeks, according to people familiar with the matter. An agreement is still possible, according to people involved in the talks. But it largely depends on what China is willing to negotiate when high-level talks begin Thursday. âIt all depends on whether China is willing to make a deal,â an official said, echoing the words of President Trump from earlier this week. âNot many of us are confident theyâre there yet.â

articles.title: GOP Rep. Collins: Pelosi, Schiff Acting âUn-Americanâ in Impeachment Effort
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Wednesdayâs broadcast of Fox News Channelâs âThe Daily Briefing,âÂ Rep. Doug Collins (R-GA), the ranking member on the House Judiciary Committee, said the way House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) and House Intelligence chairman Rep.Â Adam Schiff (D-CA) are running the impeachment inquiry against President Donald Trump was âun-American.â Collins said, âThe Clinton investigation in theÂ late â90s, the NixonÂ impeachment series, there wasÂ always a fairness issue, and the American people are beginning toÂ see that Nancy Pelosi and Adam Schiff like going behindÂ closed doors where no one canÂ examine what they are doing. Where they can only leak outÂ information that they want toÂ have, and nobody in this countryÂ believes that is American. They believe on a look at it onÂ face value â they might even not likeÂ with the president is doing, but they do not believe that itÂ should be done in an unfair way, and thatâs what sheâs doingÂ right now.â He added, âIf Speaker Pelosi is willing toÂ put her house speakership the House majority on the line on theÂ line, if she is willing to try to interfere in the 2020 election if sheâs willing to goÂ forward to the American peopleÂ and explain to the AmericanÂ people why sheâs being unfair,Â why she is being un-American,Â why she has not asked for dueÂ process, why she doesnât want to do it properly then thatâs the choiceÂ that sheâs going to have toÂ make. But this president has been veryÂ clear in everything he has done. Sheâs the one who is deceiving the American people, and we have toÂ understand if sheâs wanting toÂ do this on obstruction, sheâsÂ doing what I call an Al Green impeachment. She is just writing up things, taking it to the floor to force her members to vote on it.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Refuses to Say if Her Vice President Would Attend Big-Money Fundraisers
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) refused to say on Wednesday if her running mate would refrain from attending big-money fundraisers.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Warren, who has touted her campaign as 100 percent grassroots-funded, refused to say if she would require that her running mate not attend big-money fundraisers. âIs your vice presidential pick going to also try and avoid those high-dollar fundraisers as well?â a reporter asked. Warren refused to answer the question directly, calling it âa little prematureâ and essentially leaving the door open for her potential running mate to attend high-dollar fundraisers, which she prides herself on avoiding. âYou know, I think itâs a little premature to be talking about vice presidential. Weâre still in primary here, and Iâm working hard on this,â she said. But look, I want a vice presidential partner, someone whoâs going to get out there and fight for the same values,â she added:  Warrenâs claims of a 100 percent grassroots-funded campaign have been called into question, particularly following a report that indicated she used millions in leftover funds â $10.4 million â from her 2018 senatorial bid to cushion her presidential campaign. At the time, Warren happily courted big donors and attended fundraisers, causing some to question her commitment to a true grassroots operation. FormerÂ Pennsylvania Gov. Ed Rendell (D) contributed $4,000 to Warren in 2018 and noted her sudden change of heart. As Breitbart News reported: Rendell cohosted a Biden fundraiser earlier this year. To his surprise, the Warren campaign slammed the event as âa swanky private fund-raiser for wealthy donorsâ â despite the fact that Warren benefitted from similar events in the recent past. âShe didnât have any trouble taking our money the year before,â Rendell said, according to the Times. âAll of a sudden, we were bad guys and power brokers and influence-peddlers. In 2018, we were wonderful.â Warren also attended fundraisers hosted by billionairesâÂ specifically Henry and Marsha Laufer. As the New York Times reported: In Florida, she was hosted for an event by the billionaires Henry and Marsha Laufer. In New York, Meyer S. Frucher, the vice chairman of Nasdaq,Â held a reception for her. She was hosted by the âLostâ creator Damon Lindelof and his wife, Heidi, in Southern California. The philanthropist Stephen M. Silberstein had Ms. Warren over to his San Francisco-area home. And as late as the fall of 2018, she visited Silicon Valley, where Karla Jurvetson, a multimillion-dollar Democratic contributor, hosted an event for her. Warrenâs campaign reported $24.6 million raised in the third quarter, less than $1 million short of Sen. Bernie Sandersâ (I-VT) $25.3 million. Approximately 940,000 contributions comprised the third-quarter haul, having an average donation of $26.

articles.title: Planned Parenthood to Spend $45M to Beat Trump, Flip Senate
articles.subtitle: Planned Parenthood announced Monday it expects to spend $45 million or more during the 2020 election season, with the goal of winning the White House and snatching the Senate from Republicans.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: âThe stakes are higher than ever, and weâre coming out more powerfully than ever with the largest investment weâve ever made,â Kelley Robinson, executive director of Planned Parenthood Votes, toldÂ the Hill.  The effort is expected to be focused in the states of Arizona, Colorado, Florida, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin. The nationâs largest abortion business plans to tell voters Republicans have led a âcoordinated attackâ in state legislatures to curb access to abortion with the goal of overturning Roe v. WadeÂ at the U.S. Supreme Court. âTo all the politicians working to take away our rights and undermine access to health care â youâve been warned,â Robinson said. âWe have steadily been building our power over the last decade and we are ready to set the table on our terms. We are fired up, we are engaged, and we are going to win.â Planned Parenthood Action Fund also boastedÂ in a press release, âPlanned Parenthood advocacy and political organizations are an elections powerhouse,â and added: Together, we elected the most pro-choice, pro-reproductive health House of Representatives ever. Together, we helped to put reproductive health champions in control of multiple state legislatures where they can protect our rights and our access to care. We show up and we show out to ensure that all people â no matter how much money they make, where they live, their sexual orientation, etc. â have access to the full range of comprehensive sexual and reproductive healthcare, including abortion,Â no matter what. âWe know we can win,â Planned Parenthood said. âPublic opinion is on our side.â Lila Rose, president of pro-life organization Live Action, said Planned Parenthoodâs announcement of its intention to spend $45 million to help get pro-abortion politicians elected is yet another sign of its âruthless prioritization of politics and their bottom line over womenâs health care.â Rose continued: The nationâs largest abortion chain â which ends the lives of 921 preborn children per day, committing over 300,000 abortions per year â receives about half a billion dollars from tax payers every year thanks to pro-abortion politician. Americans shouldnât be forced to fund a pro-abortion political advocacy group which has chosen to spend tens of millions to secure its government revenue streams while destroying human lives. Planned Parenthood continues to assert, âThis election will determine our access to birth control,â though women are purchasing birth control at many drugstores and supermarkets. The organization described President Donald Trump as someone âwho is determined to crush our reproductive rights.â The group said it plans to work heavily to mobilize young black, Hispanic, and LGBTQ voters. Planned Parenthood recently opted out of the federal Title X family planning funding when the Trump administration decided to enforce the rule that recipients of funds from the program cannot perform or refer for abortions.
