The bill is backed by Facebook, Microsoft, Amazon, WalMart, and other business groups that want to expand their business in India.  Democrats must focus on single-sector bills because of Trumpâs 2016 election, Shahoulian told the pro-migrant progressives at the Georgetown conference: You know, weâve always put everything all together and always, you know, kind of attacked the issue comprehensively. As you know, âComprehensive Immigration Reformâ is the catchword â¦ There was a realization after this administration [got elected] that that was not likely. And so there have now been attempts to try to move things in a more piecemeal kind of fashion, the DREAM Act being one of those things. Shahoulian told Democrats at the Georgetown event that Democrats must offer incentives to get cooperation from GOP legislators. But he provided a very skewed portrayal of the motivations: Many of you know this is the way I think: Democrats and Republicans, liberals and conservatives are kind of wired differently, right? We [Democrats] are wired to be justice-oriented and outcome-orientated, like whatâs the just outcome? How do we get there? And how do we interpret the law to make sure that is it results in the most just outcome? Republicans really come at it by saying, âWhat are the rules? You know, itâs black and white. And did you follow the rules or not follow the rules? What does the law say, and what doesnât it say?â Thatâs just thatâs the way they approach the issues. Once you understand that they have a real legitimate â some of them are motivated by other things â but those who are motivated by just the rule of law. You have to figure out how to deal with that. They get that the rules were antiquated and that there werenât pathways, legal pathways, to really meet our economic needs. But you still have to recognize that people did something unlawful or are here unlawfully. But business groups â and their allies among GOP politicians â merely use this âlegal good/illegal badâ claim as a political fig leaf to conceal their eagerness to hire cheap migrants instead of Americans, Vaughan said. Conservative Americans âcare about the effects of the visa programs on their employment prospects, their taxes, and their communities,â as their ethical priorities expand in circles around their own family, their community, the nation, and then to foreign peoples, she said. Shahouliansâs claim to be âjustice-oriented,â however, did not mention that Democratsâ sense of justice telescopes out beyond Americansâ concerns about their careers and families. In contrast to conservativesâ expanding circles of concern, progressivesâ universalist mindset causes them to prefer caring about the distant peoples from Central America, India, and Africa. This mindset also encourages progressives to prefer foreigners who can strengthen the pro-diversity political party in the United States.

articles.title: Netanyahu: German Synagogue Attack More Evidence of Rising Antisemitism in Europe
articles.subtitle: Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu expressed his shock and anger at Wednesdayâs synagogue attack in Germany, leading a host of Israeli politicians condemning the antisemitic murders.
articles.author: Simon Kent
articles.content: âThe terror attack against the community in Halle, Germany, on Yom Kippur, the holiest day for our people, is another expression of the rising anti-Semitism in Europe,â Netanyahu said in a statement, moments after the holy day ended in Israel (while it was still ongoing in Germany). âIn the name of the Israeli people I send condolences to the families of the victims and wishes for a speedy recovery to the injured,â he went on. âI call on the German authorities to continue to act determinedly against the phenomenon of anti-Semitism.â President Reuven Rivlin said he was âstunned and pained by the terrible antisemitic murders in Germanyâ that were committed during the holiest and most important day of the year for all Jews around the world. He called on German leaders and the entire free world to bring the full force of law against antisemitism and its results. âWe will continue to campaign for education and remembrance in the fight against anti-Semitism which raises its head again and again in Europe and across the world, based on the clear understanding that it is not a problem of the Jews alone, but threatens to destroy us all,â the president said. Two Killed, One Arrested in Shooting at German Synagogue https://t.co/J43iSRLEqV â Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) October 9, 2019  At least two people were shot dead in the eastern German city of Halle on Wednesday, with a synagogue among the targets. The suspect, identified by German media as 27-year-old German Stephan Balliet, filmed the assault and posted the video online. The rampage was streamed live for 35 minutes on Twitch, and eventually seen by some 2,200 people, the online platform said, in a chilling reminder of the mosque attack in Christchurch, New Zealand last March which was also online in real-time. The US Embassy in Berlin tweeted its condemnation of the attack as well. âThis attack is an attack on all of us and the perpetrators must be held accountable. We mourn the victims of this senseless violence,â the tweet read. The embassy announced that 10 Americans were in the synagogue at the time of the attack. Dr. Moshe Kantor, President of the European Jewish Congress has commented that, ââWe are relieved that an even greater tragedy was avoided because of the security around the synagogue which apparently took measures to ensure that the attacker was not able to enter into the premises. However, that Jews observing one of the holiest days of the year were targeted for death should send shock waves in Germany and beyond. âWe need to do more to guarantee these types of attacks do not happen again, by combatting radicalisation, creating tougher law enforcement measures and putting more resources into educating towards tolerance. Our thoughts and prayers are with the families of those killed and wishing the injured a speedy recovery.â On Monday, the Central Council of Jews in Germany condemned German authorities for ânegligenceâ after it released a man whoÂ attempted to run into a synagogue armed with a knifeÂ in central Berlin on Friday evening. AFP contributed to this report

articles.title: Blair Blames Corbyn for Making No Deal Brexit Possible
articles.subtitle: Tony Blair has blamed weak leadership in the Labour Party for making a clean-break Brexit a possibility.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: âTo be very frank, if you had a really strong opposition, I donât think the Government would for a single moment contemplate a no-deal Brexit,â the former Labour prime minister and Remain campaigner said. While not mentioning Mr Corbyn by name, Mr Blair, who took Labour in a progressive-globalist direction for a decade under his leadership, criticised the socialist for turning the party into âhostile territory for centristsâ. âAnd my worry, quite apart from all the other things, is at the moment, the leadership of the Labour Party is essentially a protest leadership and it is not a governing leadership. âIf you want to govern youâve got to have that governing attitude,â Mr Blair said during a Reform Scotland event in comments reported by the Evening Standard. Recent meetings with leaders of the Scottish Nationalist Party (SNP), the Liberal Democrats, and other anti-Brexit parties have revealed LabourâsÂ perceived ineptitude in leading a Remain Rebellion. Notably, cross-party talks have failed over leadersâ unwillingness to accept Mr Corbyn as the interim prime minister of a proposed caretaker government.  Jeremy Corbyn met with the SNPâs IanÂ Blackford, Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson, the Greensâ Caroline Lucas, Plaid Cymruâs Liz Saville Roberts, and Anna Soubry of the Independent Group for Change on Monday to discuss an emergency motion to take over the House of Commons and strengthen efforts against a clean-break Brexit. However, the other parties reportedly objected to making Corbyn the caretaker prime minister, blaming the socialist for getting in the way of stopping no-deal. One Liberal Democrat source told the Metro: âThe position Jeremy Corbyn is taking is that we can have an emergency Government, but only if he gets to lead it. âThey know they donât have the numbers, but they are insistent they wonât work with anyone else. âTheir total unwillingness to work with anyone else makes the Labour Party the biggest barrier to stopping no-deal.â Last month, Blair articulated his lack of confidence in Corbynâs prospects to be the next prime minister when he urged him to block a snap election. Remarking that voters may âfearâ a Corbyn government, he said:Â âThe opposition vote is going to split and under our system, that delivers a comfortable Tory majority.â As well as failing to join the leftist parties under one Remain roof, Labour is also failing to articulate clearly its position on Brexit. A ComRes poll revealed 66 per cent of Britons agreed that âLabourâs Brexit policy is a mystery to meâ. By party, that breaks down toÂ 78 per cent of Leave voters, 59 per cent of Remain voters, and even nearly half â 47 per cent â of Labour voters. A recent ComRes poll puts the Conservatives in the lead with 33 per cent of the vote, a comfortable 16 points ahead of Labour. Labourâs confusing position on Brexit could also cost them votes.Â Corbynâs party hasÂ isolated its core working-class Leave voters by reneging on its pledge to respect the 2016 vote by backing a second referendum. However, some in the party want Labour to go farther left, joining the Liberal Democrats in supporting the cancellation Brexit altogether.

articles.title: Kamala Harris: Members of Trump Administration Are Violating Their Oath to Defend the Constitution
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Wednesdayâs broadcast ofÂ  MSNBCâs âThe Last Word,â 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) said members of President Donald Trumpâs administration were âviolatingâ their oath to defend the Constitution by mounting a defense to the Houseâs impeachment inquiry. On a letter she sent to members of Trumpâs cabinet, Harris said, âTo put everyone on notice, this is a process that is about pursuit of justice and truth and that we are not going to tolerate in our role of oversight any conduct that interferes with that process, and so we are putting members of the cabinet on notice that they have a duty and a responsibility to preserve evidence to protect whistleblowers and the inspectorâs general of the various agencies and cooperate with the process. And frankly, to your point, the letter perhaps is unique because I donât think in recent history weâve seen the need for those kinds of obvious points to be made but with this administration. We canât take anything for granted, especially when weâve seen the highest elected official in our government, Donald Trump actively engaged in the suppress of evidence and the intimidation of witnesses.â When asked about Trumpâs letter to Congress saying they will not corporate with the impeachment inquiry, Harris said, âThis is a moment that highlights the magnificent brilliance of the framers of our constitution and the Founders of our nation who imagined such a moment where there would be an outright and obvious, at this point, abuse of power by one branch of government, in this case, the executive branch and the need therefore for these kinds of checks and balances. So the letter today from Senator Blumenthal and myself and so many others who have stood up to stand for accountability and for our democracy is about living what our Founders imagine might be necessary, which is to have these checks and balances. But that statement is ridiculous and is clearly just another example of members of this administration who frankly are violating their oath.â She added, âI say that purposely. Itâs not like they are ignoring it or overlooking it. They are violating it. They took an oath to defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic. And I think it is clear that there are enemies who are American citizens, enemies to our democracy. This is a moment where everyone should have the courage to stand up and speak to the values of our Constitution and our democracy and our system of justice.â Follow Pam Key On Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Trump Says U.S. Holds âMost Dangerousâ Islamic State Terrorists in Syria
articles.subtitle: Islamic State terrorists held by the Kurds in northeast Syria were removed to U.S. custody ahead of a Turkish attack Wednesday, President Trump confirmed.Â Two men from Britain, alleged members of âthe Beatlesâ Islamic State execution cell, are believed to be amongst those apprehended.
articles.author: Simon Kent
articles.content:
Both CNN and the Washington Post also reported the U.S. military had taken custody of the two fighters, while ABC said they had been transferred to a safe location. Donald Trump took to Twitter to reveal further details: In case the Kurds or Turkey lose control, the United States has already taken the 2 ISIS militants tied to beheadings in Syria, known as the Beetles, out of that country and into a secure location controlled by the U.S. They are the worst of the worst! â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 10, 2019  âWe are taking some of the most dangerous ISIS fighters out and weâre putting them in different locations where itâs secure,â Trump continued later, using an acronym for the Islamic State group. âWe have taken a certain number of ISIS fighters who are particularly bad and weâve wanted to make sure nothing happened to them with respect to getting out,â he said. The U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic ForcesÂ capturedÂ Alexanda Amon Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh in January last year in eastern Syria, and they were held in the north of the country by KurdishÂ forces. Their cell became notorious for capturing, torturing, and murdering Western hostages, including American journalists and aid workers, and was seemingly led by the infamous âJihad Johnâ â real name Mohammed Emwazi. In 2014 and 2015, the militant group held more than 20 Western hostages in Syria and tortured many of them. It beheaded seven American, British and Japanese journalists and aid workers and a group of Syrian soldiers, boasting of the butchery in videos released to the world. WATCH: Jihadi John and Four British Islamic State Militants Plot in Syria

https://t.co/cKnYSLy0fP â Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) September 26, 2017  Kotey and Elsheikh previously spoke of their membership of Islamic State, but denied membership of the brutal execution cell, as Breitbart London reported. Elsheikh, from White City in west London,Â calledÂ the allegations âpropagandaâ and another called the killings âregrettableâ. They argued that press stories about âthe Beatlesâ were fabricated and used as a pretext to have them killed â as âJihadi Johnâ was in aÂ drone strike. âNo fair trial, when I am âthe Beatleâ in the media. No fair trial,â Elsheikh said. He claimed the British governmentâs decision to strip them of citizenship was âillegalâ, exposing them to ârendition and tortureâ, Elsheikh said, âbeing taken to any foreign land and treated in anyway and having nobody to vouch for youâ.

articles.title: Forbidden by Islam: Khamenei Says Nuclear Weapons âHaramâ for Iran
articles.subtitle: Iran rejects the use of nuclear weapons because they are âharamâ and therefore forbidden by peaceful Islam which despises all such âwestern decadence,â Ayatollah SeyyedÂ Ali KhameneiÂ said Wednesday.
articles.author: Simon Kent
articles.content: Radio Farda quoted him as telling a group of academics and high-level scientists of Iranâs rejection of weapons of mass destruction, seeking to ease fears the countryâs scientists could secretly be researching nuclear weapons. He said: In the case of the key and very beneficial nuclear science â¦ when it was paired with a thirst for more power, it resulted in the creation of the nuclear weapon and turned into a major threat to the world and humanity. Although we have always had the ability to tread this path, we declared it haram [forbidden by religion] according to the verdict of the beloved Islam, and therefore there is no reason for us to expend our resources on developing and stockpiling a weapon that is absolutely prohibited [by Islam] to use. Iran vehemently denies having ever sought an atomic bomb and says its nuclear program is for peaceful energy production and medical purposes only. In May last year, President Donald Trump withdrew the United States from an Obama-negotiated 2015 deal that gave Iran relief from sanctions in return for curbs on its nuclear program. The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), the product of protracted negotiations led by then-Secretary of State John Kerry, was widely viewed as the Obama administrationâs signature foreign policy achievement. Withdrawal from the same was a Donald Trump campaign promise. And weâre out. Another promise fulfilled âï¸ âWhen I make promises I keep themâ @realDonaldTrump â Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) May 8, 2018  Khamenei said last week that Tehran will continue abandoning commitments to the deal as long as the U.S. keeps hitting Iran with sanctions. Khamenei also told the crowd of academics they should focus on theirÂ religion and nationality while rejecting any notion of copying the U.S. in any manner. âWe want science but we donât want our universities to be a reproduction of some U.S. university,â Khamenei said. He hailed Iranian achievements in medical science, engineering, nanotechnology and peaceful nuclear energy. âWe live in a different situation than others,â Khamenei said. âWe need to think Iranian, act Iranian and live Iranian and this trend can be accelerated by adopting the Islamic-Iranian Blueprint for Progress.â He explained: âThe path we are taking is neither one of socialism, nor of liberal democracy. We have suggested a third path to save nations from the decadent Western culture.â AlthoughÂ Khamenei works hard to build the case for a peace-loving Iran that would never embrace nuclear weapons, his words directly contradict what he said previously. As Breitbart News reported,Â there is aÂ letter from Khameini thatÂ calls for the development of nuclear weapons. Regardless of whatÂ KhameneiÂ says, in Iran, it is still Khameiniâs order that is deemed supreme. The letter wasÂ written by Khameini inÂ 1988 and released by former President Hashemi Rafsanjani 18 years later, in September of 2006. The missive is at direct odds with Tehran and the Obama administrationâs statements Iran is not seeking a nuclear bomb because it goes against Islam. In his â88 letter, Khameini called for the Islamic Republic to have âthe ability to makeÂ a substantial number of laser and atomic weapons which will be the necessity of the war at that time.â A link to theÂ translation of the original letterÂ was published by the Council on Foreign Relations. In closing his letter, Khameini wrote,Â âBe aware of God and whatever happens, it is His decision.Â Peace be upon pious people.Â Ruhollah Al-Musavi al-Khomeyni.â

articles.title: Eurocrat Verhofstadt Calls Johnson and Brexiteers âTraitorsâ
articles.subtitle: Progressive-liberal MEP Guy Verhofstadt has accused Prime Minister Boris Johnson and fellow Tory Brexiteers of being the âreal traitorsâ.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: The European Parliamentâs Brexit negotiator made the comments after Conservative Eurosceptics and the DUP rejectedÂ the EUâs counter-offer to Prime Minister Johnsonâs Brexit proposal. Mr Vehofstadt said on Wednesday: âI think that the proposal that Boris Johnson exactly one week ago has put forward was not serious at all.â The former prime minister of Belgium then claimed Mr Johnson was playing a âblame gameâ. âThe only one who is not being blamed is Mr Johnson himself apparently,â Mr Verhofstadt said during a session of European Parliament in Brussels. âAll those who are not playing his game are traitors, or collaborators, or surrenderers. âWell, in my opinion, dear colleagues, the real traitor is he or she who would risk bringing disaster upon his country, its economy, its citizens by pushing Britain out of the European Union. That is, in my opinion, a traitor.â Brexit Party leader and MEP Nigel Farage commentedÂ in response to the outburst: âThis man is more unhinged than ever.â Europhile Verhofstadt Smashes Border Wall With Own Head in Bizarre New EU Election Ad https://t.co/mzYpPaZ1Lq â Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) March 28, 2019  While his colleague Martin Daubney responded to the liberal MEP, saying: âMr Verhofstadt, you do not believe in democracy unless it suits you and except for when you win. When you lose, you donât like it.â Mr Verhofstadt is a committed EU federalist known for his bombastic, and at times inflammatory, language. In February, the EP Brexit coordinator suggested Leavers could end up on the guillotine, like the leaders of the French revolution. âI think Gove is Brissot, Boris Johnson is Danton, and Rees-Mogg is compared to Robespierre. But we should not forget that the efforts of these men were not appreciated by the Common Man they claimed to represent because they all ended up on the guillotine,â he had said. The senior liberal politician recently called for the European Union to become an empire. Speaking at a Liberal Democrat rally in the UK before Mayâs European Parliament elections, he said:Â âThe world of tomorrow is a world of empires, in which we Europeans, and you British, can only defend your interests, your way of life, by doing it together, in a European framework, and in European union.â

articles.title: Taiwan President: We Are âFirst Line of Defense for Democratic Valuesâ
articles.subtitle: President of Taiwan Tsai Ing-wen asserted her nation is âthe first line of defense for democratic values,â standing mere miles from its biggest threat in the world, during a speech observing the Republic of Chinaâs National day on Thursday.
articles.author: Frances Martel
articles.content: Taiwan is a fully sovereign nation with a functioning democracy and thriving economy. The Communist Party of China considers it a rogue province of the âmainland,â its term for the legal boundaries of China, and regularly bullies other countries and international institutions to exclude Taiwan from the international community. Tsai encouraged her people to embrace their national identity and values of freedom and democracy as an example to the world. âWe are witnessing Chinaâs rise and expansion, as they challenge free, democratic values and the global order through a combination of authoritarianism, nationalism, and economic might,â Tsai said. âAs the strategic forefront of the Indo-Pacific region, Taiwan has become the first line of defense for democratic values.â âChina is encroaching on us through their sharp power, but as a crucial member of the region, we know that Taiwan must fulfill its responsibilities to the international community. We will not act provocatively or rashly; rather, we will work with like-minded countries to ensure that the peaceful and stable cross-strait status quo is not unilaterally altered,â she added. Tsai, up for reelection this year, also hinted at the political divide in the country naturally caused by elections, urging Taiwanese people to resist divisions that could negatively alter national values. â[W]e cannot be divided amongst ourselves, regardless of party affiliation. No one has a patent on the Republic of China, and no one can monopolize Taiwan,â Tsai affirmed. âThe words âRepublic of China (Taiwan)â are not the exclusive property of any one political party, and that is the overwhelming consensus of Taiwan society.â Tsai responded with a resounding rejection to Chinese Communist Party dictator Xi Jinpingâs call last week for Beijing to annex Taiwan under the âOne Country, Two Systemsâ policy that has plummetted Hong Kong toward severe police repression of free speech: The U.S.-China trade dispute continues. And not far from Taiwan, Hong Kong is on the verge of chaos due to the failure of âone country, two systems.â Nevertheless, China is still threatening to impose its âone country, two systems model for Taiwan.â Their diplomatic offensives and military coercion pose a serious challenge to regional stability and peace. My fellow citizens, when freedom and democracy are challenged, and when the Republic of Chinaâs existence and development are threatened, we must stand up and defend ourselves. The overwhelming consensus among Taiwanâs 23 million people is our rejection of âone country, two systems,â regardless of party affiliation or political position. The Republic of China has stood tall on Taiwan for over 70 years. But if we were to accept âone country, two systems,â there would no longer be room for the Republic of Chinaâs existence. As President, standing up to protect national sovereignty is not a provocation â it is my fundamental responsibility. Xi spoke last week on the dire occasion of the 70th anniversary of communist repression of China and declared that his regime seeks âthe complete reunification of the motherland,â including all ethnic Han Chinese people. âWe must uphold the principles of âPeaceful Reunificationâ and âOne Country, Two Systems,â maintain lasting prosperity and stability in Hong Kong and Macao, promote the peaceful development of cross-Strait relations, unite all Chinese sons and daughters, and continue to strive for the motherlandâs complete reunification,â Xi said. Xi added that the annexation of Taiwan was âinevitable.â American Senator Ted Cruz (R-TX) was present in Taipei Thursday for National Day festivities, the first senator present in 35 years, according to Taipeiâs Ministry of Foreign Affairs. âWe also will stand up against Chinese efforts to undermine Taiwan,â Cruz told reporters, according to the Taipei Times. âThis is a friendship that is incredibly important. This is a military relationship that is incredibly important. This is an economic relationship that is incredibly important.â What a delight to have Senator @tedcruz visiting #Taiwan for our National Day. Senator, your support for freedom & democracy around the world including #HongKong is admired; your all-out support for Taiwan, a front-line state, is greatly appreciated by the people here. JW pic.twitter.com/qpA90QoIoQ â å¤äº¤é¨ Ministry of Foreign Affairs, ROC (Taiwan) ð¹ð¼ (@MOFA_Taiwan) October 9, 2019  Taiwan held a large parade in its capital, Taipei, to celebrate its continued existence in the face of regular harassment and threats from Beijing. The Taiwanese flag also flew in Hong Kong, where the pro-democracy protest movement took a moment to observe the holiday and salute the Republic of China. Some protesters also urged Taiwan not to vote for the opposition Kuomintang (Naitonalist Party), as it maintains friendly relations with the communists. ä»æ¥ã¯ä¸­è¯æ°å½å½æ¶ç¯ã§ããæ¥æ¬ã®å½ä¼è­°å¡ã¨å°åæ¥æ¬äººå­¦æ ¡ã®å­ã©ããã¡ããåãã¦ç¥è³ãã¬ã¼ãã«åå ãã¦ããã¾ããããäºãã®å½æãæ¯ããªãããä»å¹´ã§ï¼ï¼ï¼æ­³ã«ãªãç·çµ±åºã®åãééãã¦ããã¾ãããæ¥æ¬ã®åäººãã¡ã®ç±æã«æè¬ãããï¼ããã¦ãã¤ã¾ã§ãð¹ð¼ðµãç·å¯ãªãã¼ããã¼ã§ããããã«ï¼ pic.twitter.com/B0P80bD7j8 â è¡è±æ Tsai Ing-wen (@iingwen) October 10, 2019  Some have called on Hongkongers not to overuse ROC symbols given the Kuomintangâs authoritarian history in Taiwan and conciliatory cross-straits policy. âIf you vote for the KMT, Taiwan will turn into Hong Kong,â shouts a protester at Sun Yat-sen Park. Photo: HKFP. #hongkong pic.twitter.com/pxsb4B5j4m â Hong Kong Free Press (@HongKongFP) October 10, 2019   Although Taiwan is a fully functional sovereign state, China has pressured the United Nations and its affiliated institutions, like UNICEF and the World Health Organization (WHO), to exclude Taiwan from participation. This has resulted in the world losing millions in donations for human rights, technology, and public health projects that Taipei has attempted to donate, as well as the expertise of Taiwanâs professionals. At the United Nations General Assembly last month, Taiwanâs allies â Guatemala, eSwatini, and Palau â condemned the organization for excluding the country from participation. Follow Frances Martel onÂ FacebookÂ andÂ Twitter.

articles.title: Fox News Poll: Record 51% Back Impeachment and Removing Trump from Office
articles.subtitle: A Fox News poll published Wednesday shows a record 51 percent of respondents support the impeachment and removal of President Donald Trump, a nine-point increase from the news networkâs most previous survey on July 19th.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: The poll shows an additional four percent believe that the president should be impeached yet remain in office, while 40 percent expressed opposition to impeachment in general. Five percent stated they were undecided on the matter. The poll comes as House Democrats are attempting to move expeditiously with an impeachment inquiry against President Trump over a partisan CIA officer mischaracterization the presidentâs summer telephone call with the leader of Ukraine in a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint. Both the credibility of the so-called âwhistleblowerâ and his complaint have come in question as the officer was revealed as a registered Democrat with a previous âprofessional relationshipâ with a Democratic presidential candidate, while his accusations are based on secondhand information. His chief claim is that President Trump pressured Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky to look into allegations of corruption against former Vice President and White House hopeful Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden. Both President Trump andÂ Zelensky have vehemently denied any pressured was applied and the White House released a transcript of their call to illustrate no wrongdoing occurred. As Breitbart News reported, questions regarding the Biden familyâs activities in Ukraine and China continue to swirl: In recent days, President Donald Trump has suggested China and Ukraine investigate alleged corruption committed by the Biden family.Â As Breitbart News extensively reported, Hunter Bidenâs investment company scored aÂ $1.5 billion investment dealÂ with the Bank of China after traveling with his father on Air Force Two to the country in 2013. Further,Â then-vice presidentÂ Biden forced out former Ukrainian prosecutor Viktor Shokin as he was investigating the gas giant Burisma Holdings, which was paying Hunter Biden $83,000 monthly as a member of its board, despite his lack of expertise in the energy sector. Biden laterÂ boastedÂ before the Council of Foreign Relations last year that he had threatened to withhold $1 billion in U.S. aid unless the prosecutor was fired. The Fox News poll found 43 percent support the notion that President Trumpâs comments during the July 25th call with Zelensky were impeachable and 27 percent say that while they were inappropriate, they were not impeachable. Only 17 percent stated his comments were appropriate. The poll surveyed 1,003 registered voters and was conducted by telephone between October 6th-8th.

articles.title: More Remains of Aborted Babies Found in Car Trunk of Ulrich Klopfer
articles.subtitle: Authorities discovered additional remains of aborted babies in the trunk of a car belonging to deceased abortionist Ulrich Klopfer.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: Indiana Attorney General Curtis Hill said his office is investigating the remains that were found in the trunk of a car, while still working on the investigation of the 2,246 aborted remains foundÂ by family members of Klopfer at his home in Illinois after he died. According to WSBT22, Klopferâs family foundÂ the additional remains on Wednesday morning while searching through several of the abortionistâs cars that were stored at a business property in Dolton, Illinois. #NEW: AG Hill says additional remains were found this morning by Will County Sheriff's office. The remains were found in a trunk at a business property in Dolton, Illinois. Investigators found five plastic bags and one box containing the fetal remains. â Max Lewis (@MaxLewisTV) October 9, 2019  âBased on that, the family members contacted authorities in Cook County,â said Hill. âCook County contacted Will County authorities primarily because Will County had experience, vast experience in establishing protocols from the last discovery.â Arriving on the scene, investigators discovered five plastic bags and one box containing the remains of the aborted babies, stored in the trunk of an older Mercedes Benz. Klopfer performed abortions in South Bend, Gary and Fort Wayne, Indiana. In 2015, his medical license was suspended after he allegedly failed to report an abortion performed on a 13-year-old girl. âItâs a shock for everyone,â Hill said, adding his office is attempting to help Klopferâs former patients to determine if any of the remains discovered belong to them. âOur objective, ultimately, is to resolve this with respect and dignity for the remains and it would anticipate that we would add any additional new remains to the mix,â said Hill, according to the report. The priority, he continued, is giving the remains a âproper burialâ and ensuring something like this doesnât happen again. âWe donât want to see fetal remains discarded like so much trash by the side of the road,â said Hill. âImagine, if you will, if we discovered 2,246 remains of adults who were deceased in some type of preservation fluid. Everyone would be freaking out.â In a comment sent to Breitbart News, Susan B. Anthony Listâs State Policy DirectorÂ Sue Swayze Liebel, an Indiana native,Â said the additional discovery is âa stark reminder that the abortion industry profits from the destruction of unborn children and exploitation of vulnerable women on a similar scale every day.â âWe grieve for the little ones denied their very humanity and with the mothers forced to relive the trauma endured at Klopferâs hands, wondering if their child is among his collection of bodies,â she added. âAll of Klopferâs victims deserved so much better.â Vice President Mike Pence, former Indiana governor, has calledÂ for a full investigation into the remains found at Klopferâs home. Several weeks ago, a group of Republican senators introducedÂ legislation that would ensure dignified burials for aborted babies.

articles.title: Susan Rice: Impeachment Inquiry âAbsolutely Necessary at This Pointâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice on Thursday voiced her support of an impeachment inquiry against President Donald Trump. Rice told MSNBCâs âMorning Joeâ that the allegations of Trump seeking a quid pro quo for dirt on former Vice President Joe Biden is âa classic Donald Trump effort to lie, to distort, to confuse.â âI canât begin to quantify the number of abuses that this president has committed in broad daylight,â Rice said, noting Trump recently withdrawing troops from northern Syria and âselling out our Kurdish partners.â She continued, âI support the impeachment inquiry; I think itâs absolutely necessary at this point. But I think itâs wise to let the inquiry play out and the facts emerge and members of Congress can make a decision as to how theyâd vote.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Mark Ruffalo Slams Ellen DeGeneres: âWe Canât Talk About Kindnessâ Until Bush Faces Justice
articles.subtitle: Actor Mark Ruffalo has rebuked Ellen DeGeneresâ call for bipartisan kindness, saying that former President George W. Bush must be âbrought to justice for the crimes of the Iraq Warâ before liberals and conservatives can be friends.
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: The Avengers: Endgame star tweeted Wednesday that âkindnessâ is off the table until President Bush is held responsible for âAmerican-lead tortureâ and Iraqi deaths. Sorry, until George W. Bush is brought to justice for the crimes of the Iraq War, (including American-lead torture, Iraqi deaths & displacement, and the deep scarsâemotional & otherwiseâinflicted on our military that served his folly), we canât even begin to talk about kindness. https://t.co/dpMwfck6su â Mark Ruffalo (@MarkRuffalo) October 9, 2019  âSorry, until George W. Bush is brought to justice for the crimes of the Iraq War, (including American-lead torture, Iraqi deaths & displacement, and the deep scars â emotional & otherwise â inflicted on our military that served his folly), we canât even begin to talk about kindness,â Ruffalo tweeted. The actor was responding toÂ DeGeneresâ call for peace between liberals and conservatives after she was photographed socializing with President BushÂ on Sunday at a Dallas Cowboys game. Ellen DeGeneres was excoriated by left-wing journalists who demanded to know why she was attending the game with the 43rd president. The talk-show host refused to apologize in a clip posted on Twitter, saying thereâs nothing wrong with being friends with someone who holds different political beliefs. Yes, that was me at the Cowboys game with George W. Bush over the weekend. Hereâs the whole story. pic.twitter.com/AYiwY5gTIS â Ellen DeGeneres (@TheEllenShow) October 8, 2019  âHereâs the thing: Iâm friends with George Bush. In fact, Iâm friends with a lot of people who donât share the same beliefs that I have,â DeGeneres explained. âWeâre all different and I think that weâve forgotten that thatâs okay that weâre all differentâ¦ but just because I donât agree with someoneÂ on everything doesnât mean that Iâm not going to be friends with them.â âWhen I say, âBe kind to one another,â I donât mean only the people that think the same way that you do,â she added. âI mean be kind to everyone. Doesnât matter.â Her friendship with Bush has provoked enraged responses from members of the liberal media. Out Magazine railed against the openly gay talk show host, tweeting: âEllen DeGeneres laughing it up with someone who has actively tried to harm our community feels disappointing, irresponsible, and dangerous.â Ellen DeGeneres laughing it up with someone who has actively tried to harm our community feels disappointing, irresponsible, and dangerous. https://t.co/tgGfmCGQ5A â Out Magazine (@outmagazine) October 7, 2019  The progressive Ruffalo has staked out a series of increasingly leftist stances on issues including the Second Amendment and immigration, at one point sayingÂ âwe are a country of illegal immigrants.â Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Nolte: Bernie Claims No Plan to Slow Down, but Itâs Still Probably Over
articles.subtitle: If Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) cannot handle the rigors of a presidential campaign, he cannot handle the presidency, period.
articles.author: John Nolte
articles.content: I know he now says he misspoke about slowing down, but câmonâ¦ We can pretend otherwise. The corrupt news media certainly will. We can also shy away from that truth out of our own sympathy for the 78-year-old. I know I feel for the guy. While I despise Bernieâs socialist policies and fascist vision of a one-government future, on a human level, no one wants to see anyone buckle to the inevitability of old age, if only because such a thing serves as a reminder of our own mortality. Here are the sad factsâ¦ Bernie Sanders had a heart attack last week, and now he has announced he will be forced to slow down his campaign. And then he said he misspoke about slowing, and this whole mess can only mean one thing â¦ itâs over.. Looking tired, defeated, and achingly mortal, Bernie told reporters outside his Vermont home,Â  âI certainly intend to be actively campaigning,âÂ he said. âI think we can change the nature of the campaign a bit, make sure that I have the strength to do what I have to do.â He said he had been doing âin some cases five or six meetings a day, three or four rallies and town meetings and meeting with groups of people.â âI donât think Iâm going to do that,â he added. Prior to last weekâs heart attack, Bernie was a force of nature, a 78-year-old out hustling, pressing the flesh, going a mile a minute with a mind as sharp as a tack. But 78 is still 78â¦ And no matter how fast you run, Father Time is going to catch up to a 78-year-old, and that is exactly what happened. So Bernie will march on, and good for him. He will want to push his issues, set the table with his agenda, speak at the Democrat conventionâ¦ But a man who has a heart attack while campaigning for president is not going to be president. Itâs just too risky. Throwing up in Japan hurt President George H.W. Bush in 1992, age hurt Bob Dole in 1996, age and cancer concerns hurt John McCain in 2008, and Hillaryâs obvious health problems hurt her in 2016. If there is one thing Americans still agree on, it is that a president must be healthy, robust, virile, a physical dynamo. Bernie tried his best to prove he still was, but all he ended up proving is he is mortal â you know, just like the rest of us. Which brings me to Joe Bidenâ¦ Biden is only a year younger than Bernie and nowhere near as vigorous. Already, his eye has filled with blood on national TV, his dentures came loose during a national debate, and his schedule comes closer to banker hours than a man with the physicality required to run the free world. Due to his own health issues, his limited intelligence, his embrace of racists, his own racism, his own gaffes, and the fact that no amount of media spin can remove the layer of slime all over his son Hunter Bidenâs lucrative rent-seeking in Ukraine and China, he has collapsed in the polls. He is no longer the frontrunner. You know, it is as if the political gods are deliberately moving all the pieces into place to ensure clarifying the 2020 presidential election is between President Trump and a fake Indian slash socialist who wants to take away our health insurance, confiscate our guns, and replace us all with more compliant illegal aliens. Follow John Nolte on Twitter @NolteNC. Follow his Facebook Page here.

articles.title: Book Review: America, Guns, and Freedom
articles.subtitle: America, Guns, and FreedomÂ examines the dangers posed by gun control doctors and researchers who seek to push gun control under the guise of âpublic health.â
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: Author Miguel A. Faria, Jr., MD, a neurosurgeon by practice, has keen insight into the dangers facing freedom when those intent on restricting the Second Amendment do so under the banners of safety and healthcare, while enjoying deep financial backing. Fariaâs position is also informed by the fact he was once the editor of the Journal of the Medical Association of Georgia.Â He now uses his trained eye to parse medical journals and healthcare think tanks, warning freedom loving Americans of the dangers posed by doctors, especially large groups of doctors, who share a passion for gun control. For example, he discusses how the American Academy of Pediatrics (APA)ânot exactly a group one might otherwise associate with gun controlâwas part of a âcoalitionâ allegedly seeking âa variety of patient privacy-invading measures [in the early 21st century] in the name of gun safety.â In another part of the book he stresses how certain âpublic healthâ hold to their biases to the point of skewing what their discoveries in favor of gun control. He does this by examining the pro-gun control findings of a 2002 study published in the Harvard School of Public Healthâs Journal of Trauma.Â Faria wrote: Public health researchers ignored the beneficial aspects of gun ownership and concentrated only in obtaining supporting evidence for their long-known thesis that firearm availability is responsible for violence in our society. He also looks at a 2017 study published in Pediatrics, which included teenagers as old as 17 years in reporting 1,300 gun-related deaths of âchildren.â When Faria got into the numbers he saw, â78 percent of the deaths occurred among 13 to 17 year olds; 53 percent were homicides and 38 percent were suicides. Less than 12 percent were accidents involving children 12 or younger.â In other words, the bulk of the homicides involved teenagers who were prime age for gang-related activity and street crime, while the actual group on which the study was ubiquitously focusedâchildrenâconstituted only a small percentage of the deaths. Faria also uses America, Guns, and Freedom, to highlight the life-saving benefits of private gun ownership and concealed carry. He bolsters his examination of these things with the same enthusiasm that he showed in bolstering claims of bias and danger in âpublic healthâ gun control push. America, Guns, and Freedom, is a great read for anyone who wants to understand the myriad threats aligned against the right to keep and bear arms in the 21st century. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkinsÂ or on Instagram @awr_hawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Watch: Inventor of Green New Deal Renounces Eco-Lunacy, Goes Nuclear
articles.subtitle: Before we go to the main event and meet the only Greenie talking sense on climate change and the environment, letâs first catch up with the latest in Climate Stupidâ¦
articles.author: James Delingpole
articles.content: Extinction Rebellion protestors in Germany have been caught green-handed powering their camp with a âplanet-destroyingâ diesel generator â which they tried to hide with wooden pallets. In Berlin, XR cunningly hide the 'planet-destroying' generator powering their camp.pic.twitter.com/qQsWxTl1mf â  (@OptoSean) October 7, 2019  The BBC has been caught lyingÂ againÂ about climate change, this time with a cock and bull story about rising sea levels displacing families in Vietnamâs Mekong Delta. (The real reason is soil subsidence: but that doesnât suit the climate change narrative, obviously) National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) has been caught data-tampering again to make âglobal warmingâ look more ârealâ and scary than it actually is. Disgraced climate âscientistâ, fake Nobel prizewinner and failed litigant Michael Mann has been caught trying to erase from history the well-documented Medieval Warm Period (MWP) using âdubious, revisionist temperature data.â Why are Mann and his co-conspirator Katharine Hayhoe so keen to ditch the MWP? Because between 900 AD and 1200 AD, the world was at least as warm â if not warmer â than it is today. Yet there were no 4 x 4s or planes or factories âpumping out CO2â to make this happen â so gosh, what might this tell us about Anthropogenic Global Warming theory? The BBCâs only politically unbiased interviewer Andrew Neil has totally owned an Extinction Rebellion activist called Zion Lights. (He/she was presumably named after some kind of super potent indica/sativa hybrid you buy on the dark web). Having been Andrew Neiled myself, I do have a tiny smidgen of sympathy for Zion Lights. Except then again I totally donât because Iâm right on the No Deal Brexit thing whereas Zion Lights is totally wrong on her/his/its entire belief system. Extinction Rebellion crusties are currently trying to close down London City Airport. If you listened to Nick Robinsonâs questions on the Today programme this morning â my wife forced me to listen as I drove her to work because she hates me and because she wanted me to see just how much worse the BBC has got since I stopped listening to its drivel a year ago â you would have got the impression that this is perfectly legit and that London Cityâs Airportâs management really should be in the business of having to justify their core business (viz being an airport, where aeroplanes take off and land, with business people and holidaymakers inside) to tone deaf, left-biased BBC reporters. The police have made some arrests, including of some whiny harpie who screeched âYouâre hurting meâ as she was dragged off. âNot enough,â I imagine one or two air passengers are muttering this morningâ¦ âYouâre hurting me!â Two women from Extinction Rebellion are dragged out of London City Airport by police, after failing to break through security into the terminal. pic.twitter.com/Ygo8V877Tq â LBC (@LBC) October 10, 2019  What does all this tell us about climate change? Nothing that we didnât know already: that itâs a bogus cause, invented by dodgy, activist scientists, propped up by mainstream media lies and hysteria and promoted by soap-dodging loons who are not only naive and ill-informed but outrageously hypocritical in the way that they want to end Western Civilisation but still somehow keep their mobile phones poweredâ¦ This is why I was so pleased to meet just about the worldâs only sensible Greenie, Mike Shellenberger. Shellenberger used to be a deep green activist â pushing heavily for renewables â but then saw the light. He still cares about nature very much. But he thinks greenies like Extinction Rebellion are doing more harm than good. I asked him what the red-pill moment was that made him see the light. âSo in the early 2000s I was the co-founder of our original Green New Deal. We called it the New Apollo Project. It was for a $300 billion investment in renewables. And we succeeded. We got President Obama, he did about $150 billion in renewables between 2007 and 2015 but right away we started running into big problems. The first youâre all familiar with: unreliable electricity means you always have to have fossil fuel power plants backing up when the sun doesnât shine or the wind doesnât blow. But the other issue, which had a bigger impact on my heart, is the environmental impact of all those solar and wind farms. So you started having local conservationists raising concerns about the impacts of wind farms on bird and bat species; about the impact of solar farms on our desert tortoise. So you started having environmental consequences of renewables. I started running the numbers. It takes 150 times more land to get the same amount of electricity from a solar farm as from a nuclear plant; 17 times more materials are required for solar than for nuclear; and if you just total up all the used solar panel waste compared with nuclear, solar actually creates 300 times more toxic waste than nuclear. For me it was like, if I care about the environment, why are we not doing more nuclear power? Even if you donât care about climate change. Nuclear has the smallest environmental footprint because it has the highest energy density. So for me my red pill moment was realising that energy density determines environmental impact. A single coke can of uranium provides enough energy for my entire life. Whereas it would require many train cars full of coal, oil or gas; many more of renewables. So that for me was what made me change my mind.â I was very impressed by Shellenberger (who, incidentally, may soon be running for Governor of California). You can hear more from him on my Delingpod podcast and vidcast next Thursday (details here).

articles.title: Giuliani: Salem Witch Trial Would Be âFairerâ Than Trump Impeachment Process â âJust Watch Romaniaâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Jeff Poor
articles.content: Wednesday on Fox News Channelâs âHannity,â former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani, who is now serving as legal counsel for President Donald Trump decried congressional procedure regarding impeachment and called the Salem Witch Trials a âfairerâ process. He also laid details alleged Biden wrongdoing regarding high-ranking officials in Ukraine and urged viewers not just to keep an eye on China but Romania as well. Partial transcript as follows: GIULIANI: Itâs all in here, Sean, a great letter by Pat Cipollone. It lays out about eight violations of the United States Constitution about six violations of the Presidentâs civil rights, my civil rights, Attorney General Barrâs civil rights. I never wanted in my life want to appear to at a Salem Witch Trial, which would actually be fairer than this. Itâs a process without any due process and the fact itâs being enabled by a completely corrupt press corps. I donât know. Do you think we are going to hear on the press that a member of the parliament in Ukraine held a press conference today? The name wasÂ Andriy Derkach. You wonât hear this on the news, ladies, and gentlemen because they censor it. You only hear the news that Dems want you to hear. Derkach publicized documents which he said describe the mechanism getting money by Biden, Sr. This was a transfer of funds for lobbying activities as investigators believe to Joe Biden through a lobbying company. The funds and amount of $900,000, were transferred to the U.S. based company Rosemont Seneca which according to open sources, is affiliated with Biden. The payment reference was for consultative services. Then it goes on to describe another $16.5 million payment â apparently laundered payment â involving both Devon Archer and Hunter, using political and economic levers of power, influencing Ukrainian authorities, and manipulating the issue of providing financial aid, Joe Biden actively assisted closing criminal cases. This is based on a statement today by a parliament member in the Ukraine, a very senior one, saying that Joe Biden actively assisted closing criminal cases into the activity of former Ukrainian Ecology Minister Mykola Zlochevsky, who is the founder and owner of Burisma Group. Let me tell you who are Mykola Zlochevsky are. Heâs a major oligarch. He stole $5 billion from his people. He very suspiciously was allowed to come back. His case got dismissed when they dismiss Hunter Bidenâs case,. Heâs the guy who paid the $16.5 million and the $900,000 to the Bidens â well, it wasnât $16.5 [million]. It was more $8 million to the Biden group. This guy is one of the major criminals of the Ukraine, and heâs now walking around free because Joe Biden got the case dismissed. This gentleman has said that this information should be turned over to the Department of Justice for their own purposes they should investigate it and Iâm going to tell you why Sean. Because they suspect that the President of the Ukraine received a very major bribe in order to tank this case. Iâm not saying Biden was involved in the bride but itâs the only thing he wasnât involved in. This case stinks, they can run away from it all they want. Sean, I want to keep your eye, not just on China. I want you to keep your eye on Romania. Just watch Romania. HANNITY: Let me ask you thisâ GIULIANI: You wonât read it in The New York Times or The Washington Post, but just watch Romania. Follow Jeff Poor on Twitter @jeff_poor

articles.title: Ukraineâs Zelensky: âNo Blackmailâ in Telephone Call with Trump
articles.subtitle: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky reiterated Thursday he felt no pressure to look into allegations of corruption against former vice president and 2020 candidate Joe Biden and his son, Hunter, during a summer telephone call with President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: âThere was no blackmail,â Zelensky told reporters when asked about the July 25th call. âWe are not servants. We are an independent country.â âI donât want to be pulled into this because I understand that my words could impact the elections of the American people,â he added. Zelenskyâs comments come as President Trump has said he has the âabsolute rightâ to suggest world leaders probe corruption in other countries, including the activities of the Bidens in Ukraine and China. âChina should start an investigation into the Bidens, because what happened in China is just about as bad as Ukraine,â the president told reporters last week ahead of a visit toÂ Florida to deliver remarks on Medicare. As Breitbart News reported, Hunter Bidenâs investment firm locked down aÂ $1.5 billion investment dealÂ with the Bank of China after traveling with his father on Air Force Two to the country in 2013. Asked if Ukraine should also probe the Bidens, the president affirmed:Â âI would think that if they were honest about it, they would start a major investigation,â before adding, âNobody has any doubt that they werenât crooked; that was a crooked deal, 100 percent.â As Breitbart NewsÂ reportedÂ earlier this year: Biden forced out former Ukrainian prosecutor Viktor Shokin as he was investigating an energy company calledÂ Burisma Holdings, which was paying Biden [$83,000 monthly] as a member of its board. The former vice president evenÂ boastedÂ to the Council of Foreign Relations last year that he had threatened to withhold $1 billion in U.S. aid unless the prosecutor was fired. (He did not tell the audience about his sonâs role.) Meanwhile, former Vice President Biden has denied he or his son committed any wrongdoing, lashing out at a reporter when asked about the subject last week. During tense exchange at campaign stop in Los Angeles, the former vice president was pressed on whether Hunter Bidenâs role on the board of directors of Burisma Holdings, posed a conflict of interest while he was in government. âItâs not a conflict of interest,â Biden scoffed, before raising his voice. âThereâs been no indication of any conflict of interest, from Ukraine or anywhere else, period. Iâm not going to respond to that.â âLetâs focus on the problem, focus on this man, what heâs doing, that no president has ever done,â he shouted while pointing his finger at the reporter.

articles.title: Jimmy Kimmel Mocks Melania Trump: Digging an âEscape Tunnel or Shallow Graveâ
articles.subtitle: Left-wing late-night talk show host Jimmy Kimmel mocked First Lady Melania Trump and her announcement of a new tennis pavilion at the White House on Wednesday, suggesting that she was instead trying to construct an âescape tunnel or shallow grave.â
articles.author: Ben Kew
articles.content: Melania Trump made the announcement on Tuesday, saying the new structure would beÂ a âtestament to American craftsmanship and skill.â âExciting to break ground on the new tennis pavilion project at the White House today,â she said. âThank you to all who will help in making this legacy piece possible for future first families to gather at and enjoy for years to come.â  Mrs. Trumpâs post caught the attention of Kimmel, who argued that she was actually constructing an âescape tunnelâ or even a âshallow grave.â âAs her husband tries to dig up dirt on his opponents, the First Lady is building a tennis pavilion on the White House lawn â for real,â Kimmel quipped, before showing a photo of Melania putting a shovel in the ground while wearing a pair of stilettos. âAs if theyâre going to be there to enjoy it.â  âThere she is, breaking ground in her most rugged pair of construction stilettos. Sheâs definitely digging an escape tunnel, right? Thatâs either an escape tunnel or a shallow grave.â It is not the first time that Kimmel has suggested that Melania may be trying to escape the White House and her husbandâs clutches. Last June, he similarly mused that a sinkhole on the White House was actually one of her âescape tunnels.â Meanwhile, Kimmel previously faced calls to apologize after mocking Melania Trumpâs Slovenian accent, although he ultimately refused to do so. Follow Ben Kew onÂ Facebook, Twitter atÂ @ben_kew,Â orÂ email him at bkew@breitbart.com.

articles.title: Levin: Dems Are âEviscerating Our System of Lawâ for Trump Impeachment
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Jeff Poor
articles.content: Wednesday on his nationally syndicated radio show, conservative talker Mark Levin, author of âUnfreedom of the Press,â criticized the process by which House Democrats are pursuing impeachment against President Donald Trump. Levin emphasized the necessity of due process in order to have fair and just proceedings. âDue process is necessary,â he said. âThe right to call witnesses is necessary. The right to cross-examine other witnesses is necessary. The right to have counsel is necessary. The right to participate fully in the process is necessary.â He went on to declare this impeachment process, which differs from that of former Presidents Andrew Johnson, Richard Nixon and Bill Clinton, the evisceration of the system of law by House Democrats. âThey used to talk about Russia for two and a half years,â Levin added. âThey used to talk about the Mueller report. They used to talk about volume 2 of the Mueller report. They used to demand grand jury information. They have failed on every single front. So now itâs Ukraine, and they donât intend to fail this time, you see. Because they are going to violateÂ â violateÂ â the procedures that have been in place in the House of Representatives for Andrew Johnson, Richard Nixon, and Bill Clinton. It is they who are eviscerating our system of law. It is they who need to be held to account.â (h/t CR) Follow Jeff Poor on Twitter @jeff_poor

articles.title: Scarborough: âEvery Republican on Capitol Hill Knows Donald Trump Is Not Wellâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Thursday on MSNBCâs âMorning Joe,â host Joe Scarborough commented on President Donald Trumpâs mental stability in light of his actions over the past several months. According to Scarborough, Trump is not âemotionallyâ or âmentally fitâ for his position, claiming âevery Republican on Capitol Hillâ knows it. â[W]hat every Republican on Capitol Hill knows Donald Trump is not well, Donald Trumpâs not emotionally fit to be president, Republicans, and you know it,â stated Scarborough. âHeâs not mentally fit to be president of the United States right now and you know it.â âThere are so many disturbing things, Mika, it is more obvious than ever Donald Trump is neither emotionally or mentally fit to be president of the United States,â he added. âThat is without debate, it really is. Just look at all the actions over the past several weeks and it just keeps getting worse. And the consequences are growing grimmer by the day.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Lawsuit: Former Drexel University Professor Used Federal Research Funds at Strip Clubs
articles.subtitle: Drexel University has agreed to settle a lawsuit for $190,000 after one of its professors allegedly used federal funds to cover a decadeâs worth of his spending habits at local strip clubs.
articles.author: Alana Mastrangelo
articles.content: Former professor and head of Drexelâs engineering department Chikaodinaka âChikaâ Nwankpa spent âhundreds of thousandsâ of federal research dollars over a ten-year period at local strip clubs, according to a report byÂ the Philadelphia Inquirer. Now, the school has agreed to settle a lawsuit for $190,000 to pay back the money that was initially meant forÂ energy, science, and naval research funding at Drexel. According to the report, Nwankpa was hardly covert when submitting his expenses reports, and had filed âseveral improper charges against his federal grants for âgoods an servicesâ billed at âgentlemenâs clubsâÂ including Club Risque and Cheerleaders in South Philadelphia and the Tacony Club between 2007 and 2017.â In addition to strip clubs, Nwankpaâs improper charges also included sports bars and iTunes. After being confronted about his spending habits, the professor â who had spent 27 years teaching in Drexelâs electrical and computer engineering department â admitted to the illegitimate expenses, resigned, and agreed to pay $53,328, which was reportedly far less than his overall tab. âThis is an example of flagrant and audacious fraud, and a shameful misuse of public funds,â said U.S. Attorney William M. McSwain, whose office negotiated the settlement with Drexel. The report added that a university spokesperson said the school reportedÂ Nwankpaâs suspicious spending and cooperated with the investigation into his misconduct. Drexel has reportedly since established additional training for faculty and staff and has revised its standards with regards to auditing. âDrexelÂ takes allegations of unethical or unlawful business conduct on the part of any members of the university community very seriously and remains committed to being in full compliance with all billing regulations and requirements,â said spokesperson Niki Gianakaris, according to theÂ Philadelphia Inquirer. The office for U.S. Attorney William M. McSwain mentioned that the settlement did not prevent the prosecution of Nwankpa. You can follow AlanaÂ Mastrangelo on Twitter at @ARmastrangelo and on Instagram.

articles.title: Ann Coulter: Luckily, Dems Never Have âPersonal, Politicalâ Motives
articles.subtitle: Today we will answer the question: May a president ask a foreign country to investigate corruption if it serves his âpersonal, politicalâ interests?
articles.author: Ann Coulter
articles.content: The âpersonal, politicalâ angle is the last gasp of the impeachment hysterics. (Iâm looking at you, Sens. Rob Portman (Ohio), Susan Collins (Maine), Mitt Romney (Utah) and Ben Sasse (Nebraska).) Yes, Donald Trump is, technically, âpresident,â and, yes, former Vice President Joe Biden used his government position to withhold foreign aid until the president of Ukraine fired a prosecutor looking into a company paying Bidenâs drug addict son millions of dollars for mysterious reasons. But, the impeachment fanatics assert, by asking a foreign leader to assist in an otherwise legitimate corruption investigation, Trump has committed a monstrous crime â because he was pursuing a âpersonal political interest.â To wit: Trump was trying to harm his political opponent, Joe Biden. Apart from the blindingly obvious fact that you canât commit crimes and then escape justice simply by running for president, Democrats take official government action for âpersonal, politicalâ reasons all the time. Frequently, they do so for the sole purpose of harming their political opponents. President Barack Obamaâs IRS investigated and harassed conservative groups for years, using the most fearsome arm of the government to punish political enemies â for personal, political reasons. Then his Department of Justice refused to prosecute the corrupt officials, which, I believe, was again for â yes, it was personal, political reasons. How about the Obama administrationâs endless investigations of Ferguson, Missouri, police officer Darren Wilson? As was obvious from the outset, Officer Wilson had done absolutely nothing wrong when he fatally shot Mike Brown â something even Obamaâs corrupt, subpoena-defying attorney general, Eric Holder, had to concede after reviewing all the evidence. Those massive Department of Justice investigations were undertaken to gin up the Democratic base in order to help Hillary, who proceeded to honor Mike Brownâs mother on stage at the Democratic National Convention. In the most perfect example of a president demanding investigations for no other purpose than serving a âpersonal, politicalâ interest, in 1999, when Hillary was gearing up to run for the Senate from New York against Mayor Rudy Giuliani, President Bill Clinton (her husband) launched investigation after investigation into the crown jewel of the Giuliani administration, the NYPD. If President Clinton had actually cared about police brutality, there were dozens of police forces that should have been probed before heâd ever get to New York. Such as, for example, the city Bill and Hillary lived in. In 1999, as the NYPD was virtually eliminating crime in New York City, there were a grand total of 11 fatal shootings by police officers. Thatâs 0.28 fatal shootings for every 1,000 officers. In Washington, D.C., that year, there were four times as many fatal police shootings â 1.14 per 1,000 cops. In Houston, the number was 1.68. In San Diego, it was 4.36. In the end, Giuliani withdrew from the race to treat his prostate cancer, but when President Clinton was demanding these investigations, Rudy was crushing Hillary both in the polls and in political contributions. Speaking of whom, Hillary used her position as secretary of state to overthrow Libyan strongman Muammar Qaddafi, leading to the murder of a U.S. ambassador and several other Americans in Benghazi, as well as creating the refugee crisis currently engulfing Western Europe â all for her own personal, political reasons. As was dramatically revealed in Hillaryâs email exchanges with her unofficial adviser, Sidney Blumenthal, her motive for deposing Qaddafi was to display her foreign policy chops, apart from that lunkhead Obama, who was, as Blumenthal sneered, âintent on seizing defeat from the jaws of victory.â Blumenthal egged on Hillary to keep the pressure on Qaddafi, promising her a major political win. When Qaddafi was ousted, Blumenthal exulted: âFirst, brava! You must go on camera. You must establish yourself in the historical record at this moment. â¦ You are vindicated.â Soon thereafter, Qaddafi was beaten to death in the desert by rebels who posted graphic video of the murder online. Cackling with delight at the initial reports, Hillary positioned herself alongside Julius Caesar: âWe came. We saw. He died.â Most obviously, the Obama administrationâs entire illegal FBI surveillance of the Trump campaign was undertaken for personal, political purposes. Weâve been waiting for three years to hear some legitimate reason for the FBIâs surveillance of the Trump campaign. At this point, I think itâs fair to say, weâre not getting one. The Obama administration spent millions of dollars and millions of man-hours on a purely political investigation to hurt Trump and help elect Hillary. As long as you mention it, the House Democratsâ investigation of Trumpâs phone call to the Ukrainian president has been undertaken for personal political reasons, too. So was Bidenâs withholding of a $1 billion check from the president of Ukraine to protect his sonâs sleazy business deal. We can play the âpersonal, political motiveâ game all day long! At least when Republicans do it, the Middle East doesnât explode in jihadist fury, the crime rate doesnât skyrocket, people donât die or lose their livelihoods â and thereâs real corruption being exposed.

articles.title: âThey Suckâ â Trump Rips Fox News Poll Showing Record Impeachment Support
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump on Thursday blasted Fox News and several of its on-air employees over its poll that found a record 51 percent of voters believe he should be impeached and removed from office.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: âFrom the day I announced I was running for President, I have NEVER had a good @FoxNews Poll,â the president wrote on Twitter. âWhoever their Pollster is, they suck. But @FoxNews is also much different than it used to be in the good old days. With people like Andrew Napolitano, who wanted to be a Supreme Court Justice & I turned him down (heâs been terrible ever since), Shep Smith, @donnabrazile (who gave Crooked Hillary the debate questions & got fired from @CNN), & others, @FoxNews doesnât deliver for US anymore. It is so different than it used to be.â âOh well, Iâm President!â he added.  The survey comes as House Democrats are attempting to move swiftly with an impeachment inquiry against President Trump that was launched in the wake of a partisan CIA officerâs so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint claiming the president pressured the leader of Ukraine to look into allegations of corruption againstÂ former vice president and 2020 candidate Joe Biden and his son, Hunter. Both presidents have denied any pressure was applied to probe Biden, and in a nod to transparency, the White House publically released a transcript of the world leadersâ July 25th conversation to show no wrongdoing occurred. President Trumpâs Thursday comments are not the first time he has taken aim at Fox News. In late August, the president ripped the news network for allowingÂ Democrats to push their talking points unchallenged. âThe New Fox News is letting millions of GREAT people down!â the president tweeted at the time. âWe have to start looking for a new News Outlet. Fox isnât working for us anymore!â âJust watched Fox News heavily promoting the Democrats through their DNC Communications Director, spewing out whatever she wanted with zero pushback by anchor, Sandra Smith,â he added.

articles.title: Beto OâRourke: Second Amendment Does Not Protect Bazookas, AR-15s
articles.subtitle: Democrat presidential hopeful Robert âBetoâ OâRourke contended in an interview with NPR that the Constitution does not protect ownership of AR-15s and other commonly owned semiautomatic firearms.
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: He toldÂ NPR that âthe Constitution discriminates among weapons,â thereby protecting ownership of some but not others. He suggested the Second Amendment does not allow citizens to âshoulder a bazooka,â nor does it protect ownership of AR-15s and AK-47s. He said, âWhen the Second Amendment was adopted and ratified, it took three minutes to reload your musket. I donât know that the Founding Fathers, the framers of the Constitution, those that pursued that Second Amendment â¦ could have envisioned a weapon designed for war [being available to private citizens].â OâRourke overlooked a couple of important points. First, the military rifle he referenced is not a semiautomatic AR-15, which millions upon millions of Americans own and love, but a fully automatic M16 and/or M4. An AR-15 shoots one bullet per trigger pull, period, while an M-16 and/or M4 can shoot an entire magazine full of ammunition with a single pull of the trigger. (Some versions of the M4 only allow three-round bursts of full auto, but that is still a military option not available in civilian AR-15s.) The second fact OâRourke overlooks is muskets in private possession when the Second Amendment was ratified were military weapons. It was with such muskets that Patriots throughout southern colonies repelled and ultimately defeated the invading British Red Coats. The National Shooting Sports Foundation calculates there are more thanÂ 16 millionÂ privately owned AR-15s in the United States. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Biden Campaign Throws Temper Tantrum over Peter Schweizer NYT Op-ed
articles.subtitle: Joe Bidenâs presidential campaign sent a scathing letter to New York TimesÂ executive editor Dean Baquet for running an op-ed by author and Breitbart senior contributorÂ Peter Schweizer, which laid out the former vice presidentâs pattern of corruption and calling for the federal government to investigate his dealings in both China and Ukraine.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The Biden campaign sent its letter to Baquet Wednesday, expressing outrage for printing âa baseless conspiracy theoryâ and calling Schweizer, author of the bookÂ Secret Empires,Â a âright wing polemicist.â While half of Schweizerâs op-ed inÂ the Times addressed Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) and Transportation Secretary Elaine Chaoâs China ties, the Biden campaign did not seem to take issue with that particular coverage. In the op-ed, Schweizer wrote: In December 2013, Joe and Hunter BidenÂ flew aboard Air Force Two to China; less than two weeks after the trip, Hunterâs firm, Rosemont Seneca Partners, which he founded with two other businessmen in June 2013, finalized a deal to open a fund, BHR Partners, whose largest shareholder is the government-run Bank of China, even though he had scant background in private equity.(Representatives of the fund claim that the timing of the deal and the Bidensâ trip to China was coincidental). Thus far, the firm has invested about $2.1 billion, according to its website. â¦ With the Russian invasion of Crimea in 2014, Joe Biden became point person in Ukraine as well. That same year, Hunter Biden landed a board position with the Ukrainian energy giant Burisma Holdings. Despite having no background in energy or Ukraine, the vice presidentâs son was paid as much as $50,000 a month, according to financial records. (He left the board in early 2019). â¦ The Bidens are hardly alone. President Trumpâs transportation secretary, Elaine Chao, and her husband, Senator Mitch McConnell, are being accused of having profited from their commercial ties to Beijing. In 2004, the two had a net worth of about $3.1 million, according to public disclosures. Three years later,Â the range wasÂ $3.1 million to $12.7 million. The next year, their net worth rocketed to $7.3 million to $33.1 million. The Biden campaign responded to the bombshell op-ed in protest, calling the paper either âblindâ or deceptively sensationalist:  âHowever, it is because of the critical role in our memory, the foundations of which are under assault, that we write to protest how little the New York Times has internalized the sobering lessons of 2016 â particularly after giving top billing today to discredited right wing polemicist Peter Schweizer just this morning,â Deputy Campaign Manager and Communications Director Kate Bedingfield wrote, adding that the outletâs decision to feature the op-ed was âhardly the first example.â Bidenâs campaign accused the Times of spreading âa baseless conspiracy theory advanced by Rudy Giuliani,â referencing the former vice presidentâs role in the firing of a Ukrainian prosecutor who was investigating Burisma holdings, where Hunter Biden was taking in thousands of dollars per month.
