Biden bragged about threatening to withhold military aid during an appearance at the Council on Foreign Relations last year and jovially stated, âWell, son of a bitch. He got fired.â  NeitherÂ Secret EmpiresÂ nor Schweizerâs op-ed attack Biden on this point, yet the campaign appears to believe so. âThis debunked theory speculates that then Vice-President Biden somehow did anything reportedly inappropriate in successfully ridding Ukraine of a corrupt prosecutor, Viktor Shokin, who the Times itself thoroughly explained at the time was derelict and the target of an international effort for removal,â Bedingfield wrote. âWhat was especially troubling about the Timesâs active participation in this smear campaign is that prior to its reporting on the subject by Ken Vogel,Â  this conspiracy had been relegated to the likes of Breitbart, Russia propaganda, and another conspiracy theorist, regular Hannity guest John Solomon,â she argued. Bedingfield accused theÂ TimesÂ of unfairly covering Biden. âThis leaves us with a critical question: are you truly blind to what you got wrong in 2016, or are you deliberately continuing policies that distort reality for the sake of controversy and the clicks that accompany it?â she asked, ultimately demanding that the TimesÂ âpublicly answer for these failures in reporting on this pressing issue fairlyâ and calling for a âpublic editorâ at the paper. A Times spokesperson responded to the letter, maintaining that the outletâs coverage has been âfair and accurateâ andÂ adding that it will âcontinue to cover Joe Biden with the same tough and fair standards we apply to every candidate in the race. âWeâre happy to sit down with Biden advisers anytime to discuss news coverage,â the spokesperson added:

articles.title: Watch Live â ICE Director Matt Albence Holds Press Briefing
articles.subtitle: Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) Director Matt Albence will deliver remarks at the White House on Thursday.
articles.author: Amanda House
articles.content: The event is scheduled to begin at 11 a.m. Eastern.

articles.title: Tulsi Gabbard Considering Debate Boycott, Says DNC and Corporate Media âRiggingâ the 2020 Primary
articles.subtitle: Rep. Tulsi Gabbard (D-HI) announced Thursday she is considering boycotting the October 15 debate to protest the Democratic National Committee and âcorporate mediaâ rigging the 2020 primary against early state voters.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: Gabbard said in a video she tweeted that she has met Democrat voters in Iowa and New Hampshire who have expressed frustration to her that the âDNC and the corporate media are essentially trying to usurpâ their role as voters in choosing who the next Democrat presidential nominee will be. âNow the 2016 Democratic Primary election was rigged by the DNC and their partners in the corporate media against Bernie Sanders,â she said. âIn this 2020 election, the DNC and the corporate media are rigging the election again but this time itâs against the American people in the early voting states of Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina and Nevada,â she added. She said: Theyâre attempting to replace the roles of voters in the early states using polling and other arbitrary methods which are not transparent or democratic and theyâre holding so-called debates which really are not debates at all but rather commercialized reality television meant to entertain, rather than inform or enlighten. So in short, the DNC and the corporate media are trying to hijack the entire election process. So in order to bring attention to this serious threat to our democracy, and to ensure your voice is heard, Iâm seriously considering boycotting the next debate on October 15th. Iâm going to announce my decision within the next few days.  Follow Breitbart NewsâÂ @Kristina_Wong.

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Tops Joe Biden in Another National Poll
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) is leading the Democrat primary field, causing Joe Biden (D) to fall to second place, an Economist/YouGov poll released this week shows.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content:
The poll â taken October 6-8, 2019, among 1500 U.S. citizens (1241 registered voters) â suggests Warren is solidifying herself as the fieldâs frontrunner, besting Biden by four percentage points. Respondents were asked, âIf the Democratic presidential primary or caucus in your state were held today, who would you vote for?â The majority, 29 percent, of registered voters chose Warren, causing Biden to drop to second place with 25 percent support. Warrenâs lead is outside of the +/- 2.9 percent margin of error, further solidifying her position. While Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) maintained his third-place position, he fell to Biden and Warren by double digits, garnering 14 percent support. The remaining candidates did not come close to the top tier, with Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) and Mayor Pete Buttigieg (D) tied for fourth place with five percent support each. Andrew Yang (D) came in sixth place with three percent support, followed by Gov. Steve Bullock (D), who garnered two percent. The remaining candidates saw one percent support or less: #National @YouGovUS/@TheEconomist Poll (RV, 10/6-8):
Warren 29%
Biden 25%
Sanders 14%
Harris 5%
Buttigieg 5%
Yang 3%
Bullock 2%
Klobuchar 1%
O'Rourke 1%
Gabbard 1%
Castro 1%
Booker 1%
Delaney 1%
Steyer 1%
Ryan 0%
Williamson 0%
Bennet 0%
Messam 0%
Sestak 0https://t.co/5MbdsaCOiJ â Political Polls (@Politics_Polls) October 10, 2019  Warrenâs rise to the top has been steady in recent weeks, with the Massachusetts senator officially overtaking Biden in the Real Clear Politics average on Tuesday: For the first time ever, Warren leads Biden in the overall RCP polling average pic.twitter.com/EMduOrXHKP â Ryan James Girdusky (@RyanGirdusky) October 8, 2019  However, the current Real Clear Politics average â as of Thursday morning â shows Biden barely edging out Warren, with 27 percent to her 26.8 percent.

articles.title: NYT to Biden Campaign: Peter Schweizer Holds âNonpartisan Government Watchdogâ Position
articles.subtitle: The New York TimesÂ fired back atÂ Joe Bidenâs campaign Wednesday, defending its decision to run an op-ed by Peter Schweizer, a senior contributor at Breitbart News who also helms a non-profit think tank focused on government accountability.
articles.author: Haris Alic
articles.content: The dust-up started when the Biden campaign sent a letter to the TimesÂ lambasting the outlet for running an opinion piece by Schweizer detailing the numerous instances in which the former vice presidentâs political influence seemed to intersect with the business dealings of his youngest son, Hunter. The letter, which was authored by deputy campaign manager Kate Bedingfield, accused the Times of not having âinternalized the sobering lessons of 2016â by giving âtop billingâ to a âright-wing polemicistâ like Schweizer. âBut todayâs decision is hardly the first example,â Bedingfield wrote, before proceeding to claim the TimesÂ had an âoutsized hand in the spread of a baseless conspiracy theoryâ concerning the Biden family.Â âWhat was especially troubling about the Timesâs active participation in this smear campaign is that prior to its reportingâ¦ this conspiracy had been relegated to the likes ofÂ Breitbart,Â Russian propaganda, and another conspiracy theorist, regularÂ HannityÂ guestÂ John Solomon.â The TimesÂ did not take kindly to the accusation, telling CNN in a statement that its prior âcoverage of the Biden campaign and Hunter Biden has been fair and accurate.âÂ The outlet further added it would âcontinue to cover Joe Biden with the same tough and fair standards we apply to every candidate in the race and weâre happy to sit down with Biden advisers anytime to discuss news coverage.â On the topic of Schweizer, the TimesÂ defended its decision to publish his op-ed, noting that, far from being a âright-wing polemicist,â he had expertise in ethics and public corruption through his position as president of the Government Accountability Institute. âThe op-ed makes an argument that nonpartisan government watchdogs would make, arguing in favor of a law that would prohibit self-dealing by those with government connections,â a spokesperson for the paper said. Bidenâs attack on the Times comes as his sonâs business dealings have spilled into the open amid the impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump. Schweizer, who previously chronicled the troubling fundraising practices of the Clinton Foundation, has been at the forefront of the topic since the publication of his bestsellingÂ bookÂ âÂ Secret Empires: How the American Political Class Hides Corruption and Enriches Family and Friends â in 2018. In particular, Schweizer has exposed how Hunter Biden profited off deals with Ukraine and China that appeared inaccessible to average American businessmen, at the same time his father was responsible for helping formulate the Obama administrationâs policy towards both countries.

articles.title: Marco Rubio Calls for National Security Review of China-Owned App TikTok
articles.subtitle: Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) has called for a national security panel to review TikTok owner Beijing ByteDance Technology Coâs purchase of lip-syncing app Musical.ly over fears that the Chinese government is using TikTok to censor political content.
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.content: Reuters reportsÂ that Sen. Marco Rubio has called on the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) to review the acquisition of social media app Musical.ly by TikTok owner Beijing ByteDance Technology Co. over claims that TikTok is used by the Chinese government to censor certain political content. Rubio stated in a letter to Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin that Chinese-owned appsÂ âare increasingly being used to censor content and silence open discussion on topics deemed sensitive by the Chinese Government and Communist Party.â TheÂ Treasury secretary heads the CFIUS, which reviews mergers such as that of Musical.ly and TikTok to ensure that they do not damage national security. Rubio stated that there was evidence that TikTok in the United States was censoring political content that was ânot in lineâ with the Chinese government. Rubio stated that ChinaÂ âis using these apps to advance their foreign policy and globally suppress freedom of speech, expression, and other freedoms that we as Americans so deeply cherish.â In one example, TikTok has blacklisted popular Christian app pray.com from advertising on its app. A spokesperson for TikTok clarified tha the firm stores all of its U.S. user data in the United States.Â âThe Chinese government does not request that TikTok censor content, and would not have jurisdiction regardless, as TikTok does not operate there,â the spokesperson stated. David Hanke, an attorney with Arent Fox who helped craft a legislative overhaul of the committee last year, stated thatÂ âIt wouldnât be shocking, but it would be atypical,â for CFIUS to review the merger. He added: âIt also would not be the first time CFIUS has blazed new trails over China-specific concerns.â ByteDance purchased Musical.ly for almost $1 billion in December 2017, eventually shutting the app down and revamping its own TikTok app to replace it. The companyâs original app is called Douyin and is similar to TikTok but is only available in China where it complies with local censorship laws. Lucas Nolan is a reporter for Breitbart News covering issues of free speech and online censorship. Follow him on TwitterÂ @LucasNolanÂ or email him atÂ lnolan@breitbart.com

articles.title: Nolte: Ukraine Fallout Turns Tough Guy Joe Biden into Big Crybaby
articles.subtitle: Because he has no good answers for why his neâer-do-well son Hunter was paid a sweet $50,000 a month â a month! â by a Ukrainian energy company, former-tough guy Joe Biden is going the full-crybaby to kill the story.
articles.author: John Nolte
articles.content: So, uhm, what happened to the badass who took on Corn Pop? What happened to the tough guy who was going to beat President Trump like a drum? What happened to the sunglasses and swagger? Iâll tell you what happenedâ¦ Joe Biden got old. And I donât mean number-wise. While Clint Eastwood is still knocking them out of the park at age 89, Joe Bidenâs eye is exploding, his dentures are falling out, and now heâs ranting and raving at the refs because heâs losing the game. On Thursday, the far-left New York Times published an op-ed written by Breitbartâs own Peter Schweizer, author of the recent bestseller Secret Empires. In the piece, Schweizer uses Biden and Sen. Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) as an example of why Congress must pass reforms closing the âglaring loophole [that] provide political families with an opportunity to effectively âoffshoreâ corruption and cronyism.â About Biden, Schweizer lays out the devastating facts: As vice president, Joe Biden served as point person on American policy toward China and Ukraine. In both instances, his son Hunter, a businessman, landed dealsÂ heÂ was apparentlyÂ unqualified toÂ score save for one thing: his father. In December 2013, Joe and Hunter BidenÂ flew aboard Air Force Two to China; less than two weeks after the trip, Hunterâs firm, Rosemont Seneca Partners, which he founded with two other businessmen in June 2013, finalized a deal to open aÂ fund, BHR Partners,Â whose largest shareholder is theÂ government-run Bank of China, even thoughÂ he had scant backgroundÂ in private equity.Â (Representatives of the fund claim that the timing of the deal and the Bidensâ trip to China was coincidental.)Â Thus far, the firmÂ has invested about $2.1 billion,Â according to its website. â¦ With the Russian invasion of Crimea in 2014, Joe Biden became point person in Ukraine as well. That same year, Hunter BidenÂ landed a board positionÂ with the Ukrainian energy giant Burisma Holdings. Despite having no background in energy or Ukraine, the vice presidentâs son was paidÂ as much asÂ $50,000 a month, according to financial records. (He left the board in early 2019.) Why would someone with so little experience be able to command such enormous payments? Joe Biden recently claimed, âI have never spoken to my son about his overseas business dealings.â But Hunter Biden admitted to The New YorkerÂ that on one occasion, they had in fact discussed his work for Burisma[.] Bidenâs responseâ¦? He ran out on his front lawn, shook his fist at the sky, and started yelling at the Times. In a letter addressed to Times executive editor Dean Baquet, Bidenâs deputy campaign manager and comms director Kate Bedingfield freaked out. Hereâs a taste: What was especially troubling about the Timesâs active participation in this smear campaign is that prior to its reporting on the subject by Ken Vogel, this conspiracy had been relegated to the likes of Breitbart, Russian propaganda, and another conspiracy theorist, regular Hannity guest John Solomon. â¦ Despite voluminous work done by the independent press and fact-checkers â including some by The Times â to refute the heinous conspiracy theory that Donald Trump attempted to bully Ukraine into propping-up for him, the paper ran an op-ed by none other than Peter Schweizer, making more malicious claims about the Biden family. This leaves us with a critical question: are you truly blind to what you got wrong in 2016, or are you deliberately continuing policies that distort reality for the sake of controversy and the clicks that accompany it? How sad is that? Biden tried to do the same with Facebook and Twitter after the Trump campaign started running ads about Biden and Ukraine. Twitter has so far said nothing. Facebook told Biden to go pound sand, as did the Times, which released a statement defending the Schweizer op-ed. But is this the behavior of a tough guy? Is this the behavior of a man or a mouse â a mouse with something to hide? If Biden was an actual tough guy, if he still had The Stuff to be president, he wouldnât be crybabying to the refs to stop the fight and declare him the winner. Â If Biden were the swaggering badass he claims to be, he would be out there fighting, heâd be sticking it right back to Trump. Most importantly, he would come out of hiding to address this scandal head on â you know, like a man. Nothing proves this Ukraine scandal is the real deal more than Bidenâs cowardice when it comes to addressing it. Even if a reporter is able to ask him a question about the ridiculous amount of money his son was paid by a Ukrainian energy company, Biden just freaks out. Instead of answering the question, he acts like the reporter just skipped in front of him in line at the Blue Plate Special â he starts screaming and crybabying about how the question isnât fair. Listen, if there were a legitimate reason Hunter Biden was paid $50,000 a month âa month! â by this company, Biden would have already sat down for an extensive interview to lay it all out, or he would have called a press conference to answer all questions. Instead, he is hiding his son in some undisclosed location, when he should have Hunter doing the interview rounds in defense of his own business practices and honor. But Biden canât do that because there are no good answers, so the old man has been reduced to a big whiner, and like a spoiled child caught red-handed, he only has one option: temper tantrums where he screams, âNo, you shut up!â Follow John Nolte on Twitter @NolteNC. Follow his Facebook Page here.

articles.title: EU Incites Remainers to Act by Saying Brexit Delay Can Only Be for Second Referendum or Election
articles.subtitle: The European Union is giving the appearance of inciting Remain MPs to act against the British government by suggesting it will only allow the Brexit extension they desire if it is used to re-run the 2016 referendum or hold another general election.
articles.author: Jack Montgomery
articles.content: President of the European Parliament David Sassoli, whose left-establishment Democratic Party (PD) lost almost half of its previous support in the recent EU elections, revealed that he had said as much in controversial direct talks with anti-Brexit Speaker of the House of Commons John Bercow. Sassoli was backed byÂ AmÃ©lie de Montchalin, Europe minister under French president Emmanuel Macron, who said that âIf there are new elections or a new referendum, if there is a political shift leading us to believe we could have a different dialogue from the one we have today, then an extension can be discussedâ â strongly suggesting that the EU is no longer seeking a mutually agreeable deal with Boris Johnsonâs government, but merely waiting for him to be ousted or politically neutered.  Remain MPs reportedly are considering forcing through a second referendum at an emergency sitting next Saturday â the first weekend session in the house since the Argentine invasion of the Falklands almost four decades ago â by hijacking an almost certainly doomed Government bill seeking authorisation for a No Deal Brexit. âA lot of people are looking for ways to try to get the option of a second referendum onto the table, but we want to make sure we avoid the danger of it not being carried,â one MP source told The Independent news website, which is itself campaigning for a second referendum. The legislation may be framed as a âconfirmatory voteâ on any form of British exit from the European Union, with the option to Remain on the table (but the option of a clean no-deal break possibly excluded).  Senior EU loyalists in Parliament such as former Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond â expelled from the Tory Party for backing the âSurrender Actâ intended to force the Prime Minister into begging for another Brexit delay â do not favour an election. âI donât think an election solves our problem here,â Hammond told the BBC, leaving it open to interpretation whether the âourâ in question referred to the United Kingdom in the abstract or the anti-Brexit parliamentary faction to which he belongs. Elsewhere, he advocated remaining subject to the blocâs Customs Union, dismissing the opportunities which could arise from an independent trade policy and pursuing new deals with countries such as the United States, Australia, and New Zealand.  Perhaps unsurprisingly, leading anti-Brexit campaigner and former prime minister Tony Blair is also opposed to finding out whether or not the Leave-voting British people support Remainer MPsâ manifesto-breaking actions in a fresh election. âI think the reason for not having a general election is that if you want to resolve Brexit and thereâs a deadlock in Parliament, and Parliament canât agree over Brexit and therefore you have to go back to the people to break the deadlock, then a general election in my view is the wrong way to decide that,â said the unpopular Iraq War architect, somewhat nonsensically. Blair, who has held meetings with the EUâs team and billionaire plutocrat George Soros, who has been financing the anti-Brexit movement, throughout the Brexit negotiations, suggested that the correct course would be to make the British people vote on Brexit again, giving Remain a second chance to win â even though it is not the decision to leave the EU which is in doubt, but the way Parliament is (not) implementing it. In any case, senior Remain MPs such as Liberal Democrat leader Jo Swinson have said they would continue to defy the will of the people on Brexit even if they voted for it a second time.

articles.title: Hillary Clinton: It Is Challenging to âKeep up with the High Crimes and Misdemeanorsâ of Trump
articles.subtitle: Hillary Clinton said on Thursday it is becoming a challenge to âkeep up with the high crimes and misdemeanorsâ of President Trump.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The failed presidential candidate, who has become increasingly vocal and visible in recent weeks, publicly lamented on Twitter it is proving to be a, âchallenge to keep up with the high crimes and misdemeanorsâ supposedly committed by the president:  Clinton, who lost to Trump handily in 2016, did not specify what she considers those âhigh crimes and misdemeanorsâ to be. The comment comes a day after she declared impeachment the âonly appropriate remedyâ to address the presidentâs âunconstitutional abuse of power, his contempt of Congress, and his obstruction of justice.â Clinton told a Washington, DC, crowd during a stop on her Gutsy Women tour that âforeign governments think they can tilt the playing fieldâ as they did against her and claimed that Republicans are generally OK with it:  If foreign governments think they can tilt the playing field as they did against me, which was a deliberate, well planned out effort laid out in an indictments against Russian military actors and their alliesâ Well, you know, Republicans seem to think that, âOk, so far Russiaâs playing on the red team. You know. So we like it. Weâre not going to stand up against it.â Well, whoâs to say that next week theyâre going to be playing on the blue team? Itâs crazy my friends. She added that impeaching Trump is the âappropriate remedyâ to the blatant âassault on our democracy.â âI am all in favor of what the House is doing and gathering the evidence and making the case because this president has to be held to account because of his unconstitutional abuse of power, his contempt of Congress, and his obstruction of justice,â Clinton said. Her increased appearances and remarks have been driving speculation that former Democrat nominee is considering another presidential bid. Trump on Tuesday suggested that âCrooked Hillary Clinton should enter the race to try and steal it away from Uber Left Elizabeth Warrenâ on the condition of explaining her âhigh crimes and misdemeanors including how & why she deleted 33,000 Emails AFTER getting âCâ Subpoena!â Clinton replied, âDonât tempt me. Do your job,â further fueling the rumors:  The former secretary of state told PBS NewsHour this week that Trump is âobsessedâ with her and floated a ârematchâ âMaybe there does need to be a rematch. I mean, obviously, I can beat him again,â she said. âBut, just seriously, I donât understand, I donât think anybody understands what motivates him, other than personal grievance, other than seeking adulation.â

articles.title: Farage Expresses Hope Tories Will Deliver Clean Brexit, But Boris Rules Out No Deal Election Platform
articles.subtitle: After Nigel Farage expressed renewed optimism in the direction of Brexit and the governing Tory Party, Prime Minister Boris Johnson extinguished hopes of a clean break by ruling out a no-deal election platform.
articles.author: Oliver JJ Lane
articles.content: Veteran pro-sovereignty campaigner and Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage hadÂ said he was âfeeling more optimistic about Brexit than I have for a long timeâ after Boris Johnsonâs efforts to negotiate a watered-down version of Theresa Mayâs soft withdrawal treaty appeared to peter out, leaving a full, genuine break with the European Union as the only way forward. Brexiteers like Nigel Farage had long maintained an exit on the May withdrawal treatyâs terms would be tantamount to a surrender to the EU, and much less desirableÂ than a no-deal break ending the supremacy of the EUâs laws, courts, rules, and regulations.  Writing in response to a Downing Street briefing released earlier this week which portrayed a full, no-deal Brexit as a certainty overnight, Farage said he âwelcome[d] the Prime Minister standing up to German bullying and showing genuine determination to get Brexit done. But I donât trust his party, at all, on this issue.â Fresh briefings from Downing Street published as Mr Farageâs musings went live seem to appear to suggest he was right to offer that closing disclaimer, as the Prime Minister has moved to mollify Remain-voting Tory MPs by promising he would not explicitly endorse a no-deal Brexit. The Times reported Thursday that Boris Johnson himself had moved to rule out fighting a general election on the principle of a full, no-deal Brexit if a deal couldnât be reached, the paper quoting his remarks that he âpassionatelyâ wanted to strike a deal and had âno intentionâ of making a commitment otherwise. The remarks may indicate that the Prime Minister is moving towards the position once held by Theresa May, of striking a deal at almost any cost.

articles.title: âPatronising Snob!â: Farage Blasts MEP Who Said Leavers âDidnât Know What They Voted Forâ
articles.subtitle: Nigel Farage has branded a Liberal Democrat MEP a âpatronising, stuck-up snobâ after she said Leavers âdidnât know what they were voting onâ in the 2016 referendum.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: Liberal Democrat MEP Judith Bunting had said during a session of the European Parliament on Wednesday that while the British people voted to leave the EU, âthey didnât know what they were voting on and they were misledâ. In response, Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage said: âYouÂ patronising, stuck-up snob! How dare youÂ tell people they didnât know what they were voting for? They knew exactly what they were voting for. âThey were voting against 50Â years of people like you lying to them. They did it. You promised youâd enact it, and you â the Lib Dems and others â have betrayed the greatest democratic exercise in the history of our nation.â Lib Dem MEP: "Yes the UK voted to leave, but they didn't know what they were voting on and they were misledâ¦"@Nigel_Farage: "You patronising stuck up snob, how dare you tell people they didn't know what they were voting for," pic.twitter.com/f28dEvAeaT â BrexitCentral (@BrexitCentral) October 9, 2019  In attempts to de-legitimise the referendum, left-progressive news outlets and campaigners have claimed the vote was the result ofÂ racismÂ orÂ ignorance. Most recently, Remainers also argue the country needs a second referendum in case Britons have changed their minds. One common statement is that Britons did not vote to leave the Single Market â despite Nick Clegg, Boris Johnson, Michael Gove, and David Cameron having said many times during the 2016 campaign that that would be the case. Mr Cameron, who backed Remain, had said voting to leave the EU meant voting to leave the Single Market at least 28 times. When BBC journalist Andrew Neil confronted Mr Clegg on the fact, he could not refute it. Instead, the former Liberal Democrat leader shifted to the accusation of voter ignorance, saying: âPeople donât watch the interviews between you and me. They donât watch Andrew Marr on Sunday all the time.â Eurocrat Verhofstadt Calls Johnson and Brexiteers âTraitorsâ https://t.co/R8xEpo1acR â Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) October 10, 2019  Mr Farageâs exchange with Ms Bunting came after the European Parliamentâs Brexit coordinator Guy Verhofstadt called Prime Minister Boris Johnson a âtraitorâ for trying to take the UK out of the EU in a clean break. The MEP for South East England also told European politicians: âWe donât want your treaty in any form, even with Mr Johnsonâs proposed amendments. The referendum was very clear: we voted to leave the institutions of the European Union and to be free. âWeâve had enough of being talked down to by you [Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier], insulted by Messrs [Donald] Tusk and indeed [Jean-Claude] Juncker. We will never accept a German chancellor attempting to annex a part of our nation. We simply wonât have it. âThe good news is, your wretched treaty is off the table, support for a clean-break Brexit is growing, and it will be the winning ticket at the next general election.â

articles.title: Minneapolis Cop Running Against Ilhan Omar: Sheâs âan Absentee Landlordâ
articles.subtitle: A Minneapolis police officer and congressional candidate called freshman Rep. Ilhan Omar (MN) âan absentee landlordâ in her state because residents are unhappy with her.
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: Chris Kelley told Fox & Friends: First on Thursday that Minnesotans, including those in the Somali community, have not been happy with the job she has been doing representing her state since her election in 2018. âSheâs traveling the world. Sheâs fighting the president on Twitter. Sheâs not doing anything in the district. And, I can say firsthand, the homelessness, the opioid problems, and other issues arenât improving,â said Kelley, whoÂ announcedÂ an independent run for Omarâs seat this year. Kelley, who is also an Iraq war veteran, added that although Democrats say Omar won in a landslide, only 37 percent of the population turned out to vote. âYouâre going to have a lot of people coming out, and I think we have an excellent chance of coming out on top,â he told Fox & Friends: First. Omarâs candidacy has been put front and center as President Donald Trump prepares to hold a 2020 campaign at Minneapolisâs Target Fieldâ which is located within Omarâs district. Far-left protesters with Antifa have already announced a counter-rally called America is Canceled, to protest âthe nightmare that is Trump.â Minnesota Public Radio reported that thousands of counter-protesters are expected to show up. âIt is frustrating,â Kelley said of the counter-rally. âWe should welcome any sitting president coming here. Weâve welcomed other presidents with open arms and now because thereâs a disagreement or we have a president across a different aisle, thereâs an issue here. So, I believe we should disagree with dignity.â

articles.title: Oberlin College Will Appeal $25 Million Defamation Verdict
articles.subtitle: Oberlin College announced this week that it is filing an appeal on the Gibsonâs Bakery defamation case, which resulted in a $25 million jury verdict against the school.
articles.author: Tom Ciccotta
articles.content: According to a press release, Oberlin College has assembled a team of high-profile attorneys to challenge the outcome of its high profile defamation case. In the case, an Ohio jury ruled that Oberlin College should pay $25 million over the collegeâs role in a smear campaign against local business Gibsonâs Bakery. Breitbart News has reported extensively on Gibsonâs Bakeryâs legal battle with Oberlin College. Gibsonâs Bakery sued the college after administrators engaged in a smear campaign against the bakery, calling it âracistâ over an incident at the bakery that involved two black Oberlin students. The problem? Both students admitted in a court of law that race did not play a role in the shopkeeperâs response to their shoplifting attempt. Oberlin argues that the verdict poses a threat to the First Amendment. Oberlin hired First Amendment attorneysÂ Lee Levine and Seth Berlin, an adjunct professor at Georgetown University, to defend them in the upcoming appeal. âThe verdict and judgment in this case set a precedent that endangers free speech on campuses and for all Americans,â Levine said in a comment used in the press release. âThe jury was allowed to award substantial damages for speech that is protected by the Constitution. The case should absolutely be reviewed by an appellate court.â Benjamin SassÃ©, an appellate attorney who will also work with Oberlinâs legal team, argues that Ohioâs free speech protections should have kept the case out of court from the beginning. âThis case never should have gone to the jury in light of the heightened speech protections in the Ohio Constitution, and the trial court made several procedural errors during trial that led to this verdict.Â  Among other things, those errors prevented jurors from hearing critical information about the original incident,â SassÃ© said in a short comment. Gibson Bakeryâs attorney Lee Plakas has a different perspective on the case. Plakas argued this week that Oberlin is âhiding behindâ the First Amendment as a means of defending their abuse of Gibsonâs Bakery. âThe juryâs verdict sent a clear message that institutions like Oberlin College should not be permitted to bully others while hiding behind the claimed shield of free speech,â Plakas told a local reporter. âThere are no exemptions from the law of defamation â a fact we trust will be confirmed during the appeal process.â Stay tuned to Breitbart News for more updates on this story.

articles.title: Alec Baldwin: Trump âA Disease Killing This County and Must Be Eradicatedâ
articles.subtitle: Actor and SaturdayÂ Night LiveÂ Donald Trump impersonator Alec Baldwin encouraged the presidentâs supporters to âget rid of him,â presumably in next yearâs election, so âgood thingsâ can follow.
articles.author: Jerome Hudson
articles.content: If u voted for Trump, put ur faith in him bc u thought he was a decisive, plain-speaking, self-made business âleaderâ, now u, perhaps, realize none of that is true,â Alec Baldwin said on Wednesday. âHe is a disease that is killing this county and must be eradicated.Â Get rid of him.Â And good things will follow.â  Baldwin is good for one of these unhinged social media screeds, devoid of specifics, about once every other week or so. It was just a few weeks ago that the Boss BabyÂ star was arguing thatÂ Trumpâs declining mental state and his incompetence has been âdevastatingâ for America. âTrumpâs been in office for a while now. Incompetent is one thing. Nuts is another. Both in combination are devastating,â Baldwin said. âBut he hasnât killed America yet. Weâre like a rhino. A big, leathery rhino. He canât kill us. And he knows that and heâs scared.â Jerome Hudson isÂ Breitbart News Entertainment Editor andÂ author of the bestselling book 50 Things They Donât Want You to Know.Â Order your copy today. Follow Jerome HudsonÂ on TwitterÂ @jeromeehudson.

articles.title: Bill Hagerty Raises $1.9 Million in Three Weeks for TN Senate Race
articles.subtitle: Former U.S. Ambassador to Japan and Senate Republican candidate Bill Hagerty announced Thursday that he has raised $1.9 million in his first three weeks since entering the race for U.S. Senate.
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: Hagerty has raised nearly $2 million since he first launched his campaign for Senate on September 9, which amounts to just 22 days in his third-quarter fundraising. âChrissy and I are deeply humbled by the support our campaign has earned so far,âÂ said Hagerty in a statement Thursday.Â âIâm ready to fight for your family in the U.S. Senate, and this support is essential as we work to share my conservative vision for our state and our country. We will continue to talk with Tennesseans aboutÂ how I can best serve them in the Senate and fight to pass President Trumpâs agenda.â Hagerty has emerged as an early favorite to replace the retiring Sen. Lamar Alexander (R-TN) when President Trump endorsed him in July.  Hagerty wrote in an exclusive op-ed for Breitbart News in September that he will fight for President Trumpâs America First agenda and against Democratsâ open border policies. He charged: But no single issue more clearly highlights their extremism than the leftâs plans to radically transform our immigration system. Last year, they were calling to abolish ICE. This year they are calling for open borders. These liberal Democrats are seeking to decriminalize illegal immigration. If that isnât enough, they are incentivizing illegal immigration by offering illegal aliens everything from free college to free health care â putting illegal aliens in line ahead of your family and our veterans. And âThe Squadâ has piled on saying that taxpayers should fund abortions for illegal aliens too. As I seek to represent Tennesseans in the United States Senate, one of my top priorities will be standing strong with President Trump against the Democrats and their liberal socialist agenda. I will fight to preserve freedom and opportunity for my children and yours, because the threat these radical liberals â and socialists â pose to the American way of life we know and love is real. âWe must do everything we can to fight back, and that begins with sending President Donald J. Trump back to the White House for four more years,â he concluded. Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: FS1âs Whitlock: NBA, Nike âBeholdenâ to Communist Chinese Market
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Fox Sports 1 âSpeak For Yourselfâ co-host Jason Whitlock on Thursday ripped the NBA and Nike for bowing to ChinaÂ after the Houston Rockets general manager expressed support for the pro-democracy movement in Hong Kong and, as a result, China suspended ties with the league. Whitlock said on Fox News Channelâs âAmericaâs Newsroomâ that NBA Commissioner Adam Silver and Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James, one of the leagueâs most outspoken players on politics, have essentially been told to âshut up and dribbleâ â a reference to Fox News Channelâs Laura Ingraham telling James to stay out of politics â to help salvage the leagueâs relationship with China. âThis provides them a level of protection,â Whitlock explained. âThey wonât say anything stupid or say anything that further irritates the relationship with China.â The Fox Sports 1 personality went on to say the NBA and Nike are both âbeholdenâ to China and its market and have to âplayâ by their communist rules. âI think a lot of the things that are being said here in America, by these athletes, sponsored by Nike, is really at the behest of China,â Whitlock stated. âLook, China and communist regimes have a long history of portraying the West, America, the United States of America, as racist. And they do it to cover up their own racism and the brutality of communism. These athletes â¦ I donât think they fully understand how theyâre being manipulated by China and their addiction to that money over there. Theyâre doing the bidding of the communist regime by constantly attacking and portraying America as unrecoverably racist.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Netanyahu Condemns Turkish Invasion of Syria, Offers Humanitarian Aid to Kurds
articles.subtitle: The Times of Israel reports: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday denounced Turkeyâs invasion of Kurdish-controlled areas of northeastern Syria and said Israel was prepared to offer humanitarian aid to the Kurds in Syria facing an onslaught from Ankara.
articles.author: Breitbart Jerusalem
articles.content: The comments were the first from Netanyahu on the situation in Syria after remaining silent for several days following US President Donald Trumpâs decision to withdraw American troops from the country and allow the Turkish offensive to move ahead. Several other Israeli officials have denounced the Turkish operation and urged support for the Kurds. âIsrael strongly condemns the Turkish invasion of the Kurdish areas in Syria and warns against the ethnic cleansing of the Kurds by Turkey and its proxies,â Netanyahu said in a statement released by his office. âIsrael is prepared to extend humanitarian assistance to the gallant Kurdish people.â Read the full story.

articles.title: Susan Rice: Trump Has Put a âFor Saleâ Sign on the Oval Office
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Thursdayâs broadcast ofÂ MSNBCâs âAndrea Mitchell Reports,â former Obama national security adviser Susan Rice criticized President Donald Trump for asking China to investigate the Bidens last week from the South Lawn of the White House Rice said, âHeâs put a for-sale sign on the Oval Office, Andrea. Whether youâre China, our most formidable adversary, or Ukraine, a partner, what the president has said is, you manufacture, make up some fake dirt on my opponent, and Iâll give you what you want. Itâs always a quid pro quo with him. In the case of Ukraine, he extorted up to $400 million in military assistance and a White House visit and withheld both until he thought he could get satisfaction from the Ukrainians in terms of making up dirt on Biden.â She added, âTo call on China from the South Lawn of the White House to interfere in our elections and to create dirt on Biden that doesnât exist, in the next sentence, after he said, you know, we can punish them and do all these things with respect to trade? The clear implication, in Beijing, theyâre no dummies, what Iâm sure they heard is if they give Trump what he wants on Biden, then they might get what they want on trade and national security. Can you imagine? After all, Americans have suffered through Donald Trumpâs trade war. All our farmers have suffered. All of our manufacturers have suffered. All that we as taxpayers have suffered because weâre the ones paying these tariffs, and he says to the Chinese in effect, letâs make a deal.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Kristen Bell, Reese Witherspoon vs. Mark Ruffalo, Susan Sarandon over Ellen DeGeneresâ Call for Kindness
articles.subtitle: Hollywood celebrities are clashing over Ellen DeGeneresâ plea for bipartisan kindness â with actressesÂ Reese Witherspoon and Kristen Bell praising the talk show host, while stars Mark Ruffalo and Susan Sarandon slammed her friendship with former President George W. Bush.
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: Ellen DeGeneres cameÂ under fire from left-wing journalists after she was photographed socializing with President Bush at a Dallas Cowboys game on Sunday. The talk-show host refused to apologize, saying there is nothing wrong with being friends with someone who has differing political views. âIâm friends with a lot of people who donât share the same beliefs that I have,â DeGeneres explained in a video posted this week. âWeâre all different and I think that weâve forgotten that thatâs okay that weâre all differentâ¦ but just because I donât agree with someoneÂ on everything doesnât mean that Iâm not going to be friends with them.â âWhen I say, âBe kind to one another,â I donât mean only the people that think the same way that you do,â she continued. âI mean be kind to everyone. Doesnât matter.â The post elicited divergent reactions among DeGeneresâ fellow Hollywood celebrities. Veronica Mars star Kristen Bell posted a glowing tribute to DeGeneres on Instagram but came under almost immediate social media fire for her âprivilege.â   Shes my ððððððððð @theellenshow A post shared by  kristen bell (@kristenanniebell) on Oct 8, 2019 at 9:52pm PDT One commenter noted, âThis takes an insane amount of privilege. Veronica Mars would never.â Another commenter said, âYour queen is getting cozy with a war criminal. I expected better.â Reese Witherspoon reportedly tweeted in support of DeGeneres but deleted the tweet following public backlash. âThank you for this important reminder, Ellen!â the Oscar-winning Walk the Line actress wrote, before the tweet vanished from her account. âPrivilege must be comfortable,â wrote one commenter in response to Witherspoonâs tweet. Other celebrities have rebuked DeGeneres for her call for civility. Avengers: Endgame star Mark Ruffalo tweeted his distaste for President Bush and DeGeneres. âSorry, until George W. Bush is brought to justice for the crimes of the Iraq War, (including American-lead torture, Iraqi deaths & displacement, and the deep scarsâemotional & otherwiseâinflicted on our military that served his folly), we canât even begin to talk about kindness,â the actor tweeted. Sorry, until George W. Bush is brought to justice for the crimes of the Iraq War, (including American-lead torture, Iraqi deaths & displacement, and the deep scarsâemotional & otherwiseâinflicted on our military that served his folly), we canât even begin to talk about kindness. https://t.co/dpMwfck6su â Mark Ruffalo (@MarkRuffalo) October 9, 2019  Susan Sarandon tweeted an article from Out Magazine, which criticized the openly gay DeGeneres for hanging out with âa man repeatedly accused of being a war criminal.â The gay-issues magazine also said the talk show hostâs friendship with President Bush âfeels disappointing, irresponsible, and dangerous.â âBut missing the point entirely, DeGeneres framed the issue as simply a matter of her hanging out with someone with different opinions, not a man repeatedly accused of being a war criminal.â https://t.co/OCyYEfNRQl â Susan Sarandon (@SusanSarandon) October 8, 2019  The Oscar-winning Dead Man Walking actress also retweeted a post from the Intercept, which said that President Bush âshould be treated as a pariah not because he is a Republican or a conservative, but because he caused the deaths of thousands of innocent people and tortured hundreds of others.â George W. Bush should be treated as a pariah not because he is a Republican or a conservative, but because he caused the deaths of thousands of innocent people and tortured hundreds of others, writes @mehdirhasan. https://t.co/mga7OJghIQ â The Intercept (@theintercept) October 10, 2019  Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Cornell Law Prof Encourages Congress to Arrest Trump Allies in NYT Op-Ed
articles.subtitle: Cornell Law School professorÂ Josh ChafetzÂ wrote in a ThursdayÂ New York Times op-ed that House Democrats should consider arresting associates of President Donald Trump and hisÂ administration officials to move forward with an impeachment inquiry.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: On Tuesday, White House Counsel Pat Cipollone sent a scathing letter to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) stating it refuses to cooperate with Democratsâ impeachment probe, blasting it as âillegitimateâ and âunconstitutionalâ and an attempt toÂ âoverturn the resultsâ of the 2016 presidential election. According toÂ Chafetz, if Trump officials and members of the presidentâs inner circle refuse to comply with the inquiry, House Democrats should consider deploying itsÂ sergeant-at-arms to take them into custody and jail them in âmakeshiftâ cells on Capitol Hill: The House should instead put back on the table the option of using its sergeant-at-arms to arrest contemnors â as the person in violation of the order is called â especially when an individual, like Rudy Giuliani, is not an executive branch official. Neither house of Congress hasÂ arrested anyoneÂ since 1935, but it was not uncommon before that point (and wasÂ blessedÂ by the Supreme Court in 1927). Indeed, on at least two occasions,Â the second in 1916, a house of Congress had its sergeant arrest an executive branch official. (In that case, the Supreme Court eventuallyÂ ruledÂ against the House, not because it did not have the power to arrest for contempt, but rather because the offense â writing a nasty public letter to a House subcommittee â could not properly be understood as contempt of Congress.) Facilities in the Capitol or one of the House office buildings can be made into a makeshift holding cell if necessary. Of course, arrestees will ask the courts to set them free, but the case should be relatively open-and-shut against them: They will have committed a contempt in refusing to turn over subpoenaed materials, and the House has the power to hold contemnors. Moreover, time would work in the Houseâs favor here: The unpleasantness of being in custody while the issue was being litigated might make some contemnors decide to cooperate. Chafetzâs op-ed comes afterÂ far-left âSquadâ member Rep. Rashida Tlaib (D-MI) claimed House Democrat colleagues are exploring ways to arrest White House officials who refuse to comply with subpoenas as part of their inquiry probe. Addressing constituents at a town hall in her hometown of Detriot, Tlaib said Democrats are mulling over how to arrest Cabinet secretaries and other Trump administration officials. âThis is the first time weâve ever had a situation like this,â Tlaib said. âSo theyâre trying to figure out, no joke, is it the D.C. police that goes and gets them? We donât know. Where do we hold them?â House Democrats are inÂ âuncharted territoryâ and âtrying to tread carefully,â the freshman congresswoman added. âI will tell them they can hold all those people right here in Detroit,â she quipped. âWeâll take care of them and make sure they show up to the committee hearings.â

articles.title: Two Florida Businessmen Helping Investigate Ukraine-Biden Charged with Unrelated Campaign Finance Violations
articles.subtitle: Two Florida businessmen, Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman, who were reportedly helping Rudy Giuliani with his Ukraine investigation were arrested late Wednesday on unrelated charges they violated campaign finance laws when donating to Republicans, including a pro-Trump super PAC, according to reports.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: The Campaign Legal Center, a transparency advocacy group, filed a complaint against the two men with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) in July 2018, accusing them of violating campaign finance laws by using an LLC to hide the source of their donations, according to the Wall Street Journal. In May 2018, they gave $325,000 to the primary pro-Trump super PAC, America First Action, through Global Energy Partners LLC, according to the WSJ. A spokeswoman for American First Action told the WSJ they had put the donation in a segregated bank account filing the groupâs complaint and said it âhas not been used for any purpose and the funds will remain in this segregated account until these matters are resolved.â The men have donated just over $500,000 in the past three years, including to Sen. Rick Scott (R-FL), the National Republican Congressional Committee, and House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA), according to the WSJ. They are expected to appear in federal court in Virginia on Thursday. Both are being represented by John Dowd, the former head of Trumpâs White House legal team. The two men are reportedly both clients of Trumpâs lawyer Rudy Giuliani and had separately assisted him in efforts to investigate former Vice President Joe Biden, according to the WSJ. The two men are reportedly born in former Soviet republics, but which ones have not been specified. The WSJ report cites information from a Soros-funded group, the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP), alleging that the men had dinner with the president in May 2018 and later that month met with Donald Trump Jr. The two men reportedly introduced Giuliani to several current and former senior Ukrainian prosecutors to discuss Bidenâs case beginning late 2018, and House Democrats have sought documents and depositions from them since last month. The WSJ also reported that Parnas and Fruman allegedly worked to oust the ambassador to Ukraine, Marie Yovanovitch, who was removed from her post earlier this year. The paper also reported that both men told the Soros-funded group OCCRP that they told Rep. Pete Sessions (R-TX) that Yovanovitch was bad-mouthing Trump, and Sessions reportedly asked Secretary of State Mike Pompeo for her removal. Sessions did not confirm that to the WSJ. On Thursday, House Democrats subpoenaed the men to appear before Congress in their impeachment inquiry against Trump.  Follow Breitbart Newsâs @Kristina_Wong.

articles.title: Joe Biden Accuses Trump of Taking Orders from China, then Fundraises in Hollywood
articles.subtitle: Hollywood elites are opening up their wallets for Democratic presidential candidates, including Joe Biden, ahead of a televisedÂ CNN town hall in Los Angeles focusing on LGBTQ issues.
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: Deadline reported thatÂ former Vice President Biden will attend two Hollywood fundraisers on Thursday â one in the afternoon hosted by former HBO executiveÂ Michael Lombardo,Â and one in the evening at the home of Paramount Pictures chairman and CEO Jim Gianopulos. CNNâs town hall, titled Equality in America,Â is set to air Thursday evening, fromÂ 7:30 p.m. to 12 a.m. ET, and will feature nine Democratic presidential candidates. The event is co-organized by theÂ Human Rights Campaign Foundation, a non-profit focused on LGBTQ issues. The town hall comes amidst increased U.S.-China tensions â a subject that hits close to home in the entertainment industry, Â which depends heavily on Chinese consumers to buy movie tickets and visit theme parks. Hollywood executives have remained conspicuously quiet about U.S.-China relations in the wake of democracy protests in Hong Kong that have put global businesses including the NBA to Apple in a difficult spot. President Donald Trump has publicly hammered Biden over his close ties with China, accusing the former Vice President and his son, Hunter,Â Â of being âpaid offâ by foreign interests. Moderators of Thursdayâs town hall include CNNâs Dana Bash, Anderson Cooper, Chris Cuomo, Don Lemon and Nia-Malika Henderson. Sen. Harris (D-CA) reportedly attended a reception at The Abbey in West Hollywood on Wednesday, whileÂ Buttigieg is set to attend a fundraiser at the Belasco Theater in downtown L.A. Deadline reported earlier this week that ButtigiegÂ attended a separate L.A. fundraiser on Tuesday at the home of former CAA agent Michael Kives, who is now head of the investment advisory firm K5 Global. Celebrities who were reportedly in attendance include Leonardo DiCaprio, Glenn Close, Ashton Kutcher and Paris Hilton. Hollywood is a reliable fundraising pitstop for Democratic candidates. Hillary Clinton made numerous L.A. visits in her failed 2016 bid for the White House, including events with mega donor and billionaire Haim Saban, the founder of Saban Entertainment. CNNâs town hall is set to take place at the Novo, at theÂ L.A. Live complex in downtown L.A. Other Democratic presidential hopefuls scheduled to appear include Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), Beto OâRourke, Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), former Housing and Urban Development Secretary JuliÃ¡n Castro,Â Tom Steyer andÂ Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ). Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: DNC Chair Tom Perez: Trump âIs Truly Becoming Unhingedâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Thursdayâs broadcast ofÂ MSNBCâs âAndrea Mitchell Reports,â Democratic National Committee chairman Tom Perez argued that President Donald Trump was âtruly becoming unhinged.â Perez said, âEvery one of the Democrats who are running for president has a ton of energy and is running a spirited campaign. I met with Bernie Sanders on the campaign last week. His energy is boundless. All the candidates, we have an embarrassment of riches, I think, in the Democratic field. And I think that is going to serve us well. And what all the candidates and what the events of these recent weeks especially crystallize for us is that itâs not about any one candidate. It is truly about our democracy on the ballot.â He continued, âWeâre at a moral fork in the road here. We have a chronic democracy recession right now with this president. And everybody running for president understands. They want to win, of course, you want to win when you run. But they understand that we must come together and we will come together as Democrats around whoever the nominee is because this is about health care. This is about womenâs reproductive health. This is about good jobs. This is about democracy as we know it. The American people are starting to realize it because this president is truly becoming unhinged. Itâs affecting our national security. He constantly puts himself over the public interest.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: GOP Rep. Meadows Supports Schiffâs Removal from Leading Impeachment Inquiry â âNot a Neutral Arbiterâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Thursday on Fox News Channelâs âAmericaâs Newsroom,â Rep. Mark Meadows (R-NC), the chairman of the House Freedom Caucus, voiced his support forÂ  House Intelligence Committee chairman Rep. Adam Schiffâs (D-CA) removal from leading the President Donald Trump impeachment inquiry Meadows said Schiff is not a âneutral arbiter,â so he should not be leading investigation. âListen, Chairman Schiff is not a neutral arbiter,â Meadows advised. âWe saw that when he made up the actual conversation â he did what he called a parody, but most of America didnât know it. He made that up.â âThis is all about politics. This is all about Adam Schiff trying to make sure that President Donald Trump doesnât get reelected,â he added, saying he knows House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) will not remove Schiff because she is âpartisan in that.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Tom Cotton: Intel IG Obstructing Congress on Backdated âWhistleblowerâ Form Changes
articles.subtitle: Sen. Tom Cotton (R-AR)Â sentÂ a scathing letter Wednesday to the Intelligence Communityâs Inspector General, calling Michael Atkinsonâs recent testimony before Congress âinsolent and obstructiveâ regarding his alleged backdating of federal âwhistleblowerâ guidelines.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: Cotton accused Atkinson of stonewalling the Republican-controlled Senate Intelligence Committee while giving more details to the House Intelligence Committee â chaired by Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA), who has been a central player in the âwhistleblowerâ complaint and his partyâs impeachment inquiry against President Donald Trump. The Federalistâs Sean Davis explainsÂ the ongoing scandal over the complaint â including claims that Atkinsonâs office eliminated the requirement for âwhistleblowersâ to have a first-hand account of any wrongdoing and âbackdated,â orÂ falsely documented, the change occurring earlier than it actually did: Michael Atkinson, the intelligence community inspector general, told HPSCI lawmakers during a committee oversight hearing on Friday that the whistleblower forms and rules changes were made in September, even though the new forms and guidance, which were not uploaded to the ICIGâs website until September 24, state that they were changed in August. Despite having a full week to come up with explanations for his officeâs decisions to secretly change its forms to eliminate the requirement for first-hand evidence and to backdate those changes to August, Atkinson refused to provide any explanation to lawmakers baffled by his behavior. When pressed on the curious changes and attempts to obscure the timeline of his revisions, Atkinson refused to explain why the forms were backdated to August even though they were not made until September. The ICIG previously stated that it changed its forms and guidance âin response to recent press inquiries regardingâ the anti-Trump complaint, of which Congress was not even notified until the second week of September. The new forms, which were not uploaded to the ICIG website until September 24, nonetheless stated that the revisions were made back in August. Cotton, who sits on the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, all but accused Atkinson of obstructing justice by dodging questions on the issue. âYour disappointing testimony to the Senate Intelligence Committee on September 26 was evasive to the point of being insolent and obstructive,â he wrote. âDespite repeated questions, you refused to explain what you meant in your written report by âindicia of an arguable political bias on the part of the Complainant in favor of a rival political candidate,ââ Cotton continued. âThis information is, of course, unclassified and we were meeting in a closed setting. Yet you moralized about how you were duty bound not to share even a hint of this political bias with us.â âBut now I see media reports that you revealed to the House Intelligence Committee not only that the complainant is a registered Democrat, but also that he has a professional relationship with a Democratic presidential candidate,â Cotton wrote. âIâm dissatisfied, to put it mildly, with your refusal to answer my questions, while more fully briefing the three-ring circus that the House Intelligence Committee has become.â This report comes from the Washington Examinerâs Byron York, who was told Atkinson testified to the House Intel Committee that the âwhistleblowerâ had âsome type of professional relationshipâ with a Democratic presidential candidate. Before this story broke, CNNâs Jake Tapper tried to dampen the âpartisanâ label that has stuck to this individual â reportedly a CIA official â by saying it was based only on his or her registration as a Democratic voter.  Cotton closed out his letter to Atkinson by posing a series of questions: âDid you or anyone subject to your control or influence share with CNN that the âarguable political biasâ was merely that the complainant is a registered Democrat?â he asked. Cotton also asked Atkinson to disclose the Democratic presidential candidate with whom the complainant has a professional relationship andÂ asked him to respond to the letter by 5 p.m. on Friday, October 11. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter

articles.title: Watch â ICE Asst. Director: Iâve Held âToo Manyâ Hands of Those Affected by Illegal Alien Crimes
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Zenny Phuong
articles.content: âIâve had to hold the hands of too many mothers who have lost a child to a DUI or somebody else whoâs been raped by an illegal alien or someone with a nexus to immigration. It is a problem, a problem we cannot ignore as a country.â said ICE Assistant Director Barbara Gonzalez from the Victims of Immigration Crime Engagement Office, at a White House press briefing Thursday morning. Gonzalez went on to stress the importance of prioritizing public safety over political rhetoric, which has created a lack of cooperation, she says, between ICE agents and local law enforcement. Watch the entire briefing below:

articles.title: Watch â Texas Sheriff: ICE Agents Being Attacked Like Vietnam Vets
articles.subtitle: null

articles.content: Speaking at the White House on Thursday, Sheriff Bill E. Waybourn of Tarrant County, Texas, compared ICE agents to Vietnam War veterans in the way they have been condemned for following directives. Watch the entire briefing below:

articles.title: It Looks Like China Tariffs Raised the Price of Something
articles.subtitle: We may have finally found a consumer good whose prices were driven higher by China tariffs: bicycles.
articles.author: John Carney
articles.content: For the most part, U.S. consumers are not paying for the Trump administrationâs tariffs with higher prices on goods. The Consumer Price Index was flat in September, the Department of Labor said Thursday. Compared with a year ago, prices rose just 1.7 percent, matching August and below expectations for 1.8 percent gain. After taking out volatile food and energy prices, inflation ran at 0.1 percent for the month and 2.4 percent for the year, a deceleration from Augustâs 0.3 percent monthly gain. As Breitbart has been reporting for over a year now, the prices of most items subject to the steel, aluminum, and China tariffs show no significant tariff pressure. But in May, the China tariff on bicycles rose from 10 percent to 25 percent. That is on top of the pre-existing bicycle tariff that has been in place since imposed by President John F. Kennedy, recently around 11 percent (down from Kennedyâs 25 percent). The price of bicycles and sports vehicles jumped 3 percent higher in Septemberâperhaps indicating a lag effectâand it is now 5.8 percent higher than a year ago. It is not totally clear that this has been caused by tariffs or which tariffs caused the price hike. Steel and aluminum tariffs may have contributed. The direct tariff on Chinese made bikes, which make up around half the imported bicycles in the U.S., is the most likely candidate. Despite the lack of a widespread tariff effect, special interest groups and media outlets continue to insist that prices are rising. Just a few days before the September CPI data was released, Foreign Affairs magazine claimedÂ that âthe tariffs have hit U.S. consumers harder than their Chinese counterparts.â The Federal Reserveâs monetary policy committee says it targets inflation at the rate of 2 percent. But the index the Fed uses, called the personal consumption expenditure index, runs about a half a point or so below the better-known consumer price index. Which means that inflation is likely running below the Fedâs target. In other words, even with the tariffs the Trump administration has imposed, consumer prices are rising by less than the Fed thinks is consistent with price stability. It is theoretically possible prices would be rising at an even slower rate than they are if the tariffs were not in place. But that would only mean the Fed would have to work harder to push them back toward the target. The data defy the dire predictions of experts who forecast consumers would foot the bill for tariffs. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross, however, said all of these predictions of higher prices were wrong. To the contrary, Ross argued tariffs would have little to no effect on U.S. consumers. He held up cans of Campbellâs soup and Budweiser beer to illustrate his point that the metals input into most consumer prices was very low and prices were unlikely to rise. When prices did not rise as predicted, the critics did not back off their claims. Many just moved the time frame, arguing that the forecast price increases were just taking time to move through the economy. But with each passing month, that an increasingly absurd position. Car and truck prices are perhaps the most important consumer item that tariff opponents claimed would be pushed up by the metals tariffs. But these have hardly moved. Compared with a year ago, car prices are up just 0.1 percent. The price of new trucks is 0.1 percent higher than a year ago. Prices for both fell in September. Take the prices of soup and beer, Secretary Rossâs examples.Â  The price of soup jumped 1.6 percent in September, although there was no change in the relevant tariffs. For the year it is up 1.8 percent. The price of beer consumed at home fell 0.6 percent for the month and is up just 1.6 percent from a year ago. Of course, not all soup is canned. Beer is also sold in bottles. The government doesnât track canned beer and canned soup separately. So it is possible that canned variations have seen more price inflation, offset by price declines in bottled beer and soup in cardboard containers. But thatâs largely irrelevant from the consumer perspective since shoppers can easily just switch to the cheaper category. Thereâs very little upward pricing pressure on beer consumed in bars and restaurants, which is notable because the price of beer kegs reportedly rose due to the aluminum tariffs. Beer consumed outside of the home is up just 0.3 percent compared with a year ago. Prices of canned fruits and vegetables, another category of consumer goods that was widely predicted to see prices rise because of increased aluminum costs, do not show signs of tariff-led inflation. The price of canned vegetables is up 3.3 percent from a year ago but the price of canned fruit is up just 0.3 percent. Canned veggies jumped a lot in September, for a 1.5 percent gain, likely because of sharp gains in the price of the vegetables themselves earlier in the year. In July, for example, the price of lettuce jumped 9.5 percent and tomatoes jumped 1.3 percent in August. The prices of both fell in September, which should bring the price of canned vegetables back down. Many of the categories of consumer goods that are largely manufactured abroad also saw steep declines, defying predictions that the China tariffs implemented last year would weigh on consumers. Tools and hardware were often cited by those promoting the âtariffs are taxes on consumersâ narrative. But prices on these are up just 1.9 percent compared with a year ago. Outside of Breitbart News there has been very little reporting on the crash in the price of televisions. In September, television prices fell by another 0.7 percent. This is the fourteenth consecutive monthly decline for televisions, which means weâre now compounding last yearâs declines with this yearâs. Compared with a year ago, television prices are off 19.4 percent. Thatâs pretty stunning because last September, prices were down 13.5 percent from the prior year. This steep decline may reflect foreign manufacturers competing with each other for market share by dumping televisions on the U.S. market. (There are no real domestic manufacturers for anti-dumping regulations to protect so it is unlikely the Commerce Department will take any action here. But that could be a policy error: if anyone were tempted to manufacture televisions in the U.S., theyâd certainly be discouraged from doing so watching the price collapse so rapidly.) The price of computers, digital homes assistants, and phones were predicted to see upward pressure from tariffs on China. While these are not yet subject to direct tariffs yet, some of their components are. But computers and related hardware prices are down 3.3 percent compared with last year, dropping 0.9 percent in September alone. Phone prices fell again, for at least the thirteenth consecutive month and are now down 13.9 percent compared with a year ago. Weâre now compounding annual price declines in phones so it is worth noting that in September of last year phone prices were down 6.5 percent compared with the year prior. (Note that mobile phones were excluded from the first two rounds of China tariffs but will be included in the round expected to be applied in December.) Weâre now over a year into the anti-dumping tariffs imposed in January of last year on washing machines. These were intended to drive up the price from artificially depressed levels and accomplished that goal last year. Those washing machine price gains, however, have faded. Laundry equipment prices fell 4.2 percent in August and fell another half a percentage point in September. They are now down 6.6 percent compared with a year ago, when prices were reflecting that initial boost. This shows the market adjusting to the initial tariff shock by expanding domestic production or lowering prices on foreign production. The tariffs on Chinese-made goods also do not seem to have had much of an effect on consumer prices. Appliance prices are up 1 percent compared with a year ago. The narrower âmajor applianceâ category, which was pushed up by the sharp rise in washing machines, saw prices rise by 0.9 percent in September, halting the previous four consecutive monthly declines. Compared with a year ago, prices are now down 0.1 percent. The prices of furniture and bedding, one of the largest categories of China-made imports, and are up 2.3 percent annually. Toys, another big China import category, are down 6 percent compared with a year ago. Keep that in mind when you see the inevitable stories that claim tariffs are ruining holiday shopping. Sports equipment prices are down 2.2 percent. Clothing prices are down 0.3 percent compared with a year ago. Auto parts and equipment prices are up just 1.4 percent compared with a year ago.  British actress Julie Samuel on her 60 years old tricycle, 30th November 1970. (Photo by Reg Burkett/Daily Express/Hulton Archive/Getty Images) Once again, the consumer price data has largely demolished the notion that tariffs are squeezing consumers. Phones, computers, and especially televisions have plummeted in price. Cars and trucks show no tariff pressure at all. Baseball mitts and other sports equipment are cheaper. Appliance prices are now below their year-ago levels. Toys are much cheaper. Major appliances have even fallen in price. Tariffs had driven the price of washing machines higher, as intended. But those prices have come down. Bicycle prices alone appear to be indicating any significant tariff pressure. That does not mean that prices will remain low or tariffs will never push prices up. But it demonstrates that even after over a year of tariffs, prices on consumers are not rising. The low prices may indicate that the burdens of tariffs are falling on foreign producers and on intermediate goods producers. This can happen when export prices fall in reaction to tariffs, either because manufacturers seek to maintain market share by discounting their goods or because foreign currencies decline against the dollar. The data is increasingly embarrassing for the Federal Reserve economists who claimed in two flawed studies that consumers were paying higher prices for goods subject to tariffs on steel, aluminum, or Chinese imports.

articles.title: Joe Biden Takes a Shot at Elizabeth Warren: âWeâre Not Electing a Plannerâ
articles.subtitle: Joe Biden (D) took a direct shot at his closest Democrat primary challenger, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), on Wednesday, arguing that the country is ânot electing a planner.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: While the top-tier candidates in the Democrat primary field have largely refrained from taking deep digs at one another, Biden signaled that he may switch strategies. âWeâre not electing a planner,â Biden said in New Hampshire on Wednesday, in an apparent reference to Warren. âIâve been there. I know what it takes to get it done.â Warren has made âI have a plan for thatâ a catchphrase of her campaign, claiming to have solutions for virtually every major problem the country faces and outlining those broad plans in a series of Medium posts over the course of her campaign. Most of Warrenâs plans contain a common thread, incorporating aspects from additional proposals within her political arsenal. Warren has unveiled a $3 trillion climate change proposal inspired by former presidential candidate and Washington Gov. Jay Inslee (D), a plan focused entirely on âhonoring and empowering tribal nations and Indigenous peoples,â and a proposal to âend corruption in Washington.â In August, Warren released her comprehensive criminal justice reform plan, which emphasized protections for âspecial populationsâ â such as LGBT individuals â and called for the elimination of private prisons. In September, Warren added to her ultra-progressive agenda, promising to raise Social Security benefits by $200 per month. She said she would pay for it by taxing the âwealthyâ â specifically, by increasing the Social Security contribution requirement to 14.8 percent for individuals making $250,000 per year, and splitting the 14.8 percent âequally between employees and employers at 7.4 percent each.â Most recently, Warren released a plan to address âenvironmental injusticeâ and âenvironmental racismâ across the country. Bidenâs jab comes after weeks of a slow, steady surge in Warrenâs favor, besting Biden in a variety of recent polls and overtaking him in the RealClearPolitics average for the first time this week. A poll from The Economist/YouGov showed Warren topping the field with 29 percent to Bidenâs 25 percent â a lead which remains outside of the +/- 2.9 percent margin of error:  The two candidates will face off next week alongside ten other contenders at Otterbein University in Westerville, Ohio.

articles.title: Mitt Romney Rules Out 2020 Run, Says Trump Re-Election Likely
articles.subtitle: Sen. Mitt Romney (R-UT) confirmed Thursday that he will not mount a primary challenge to President Donald Trump, stating that the president will be the Republican presidential nominee and likely win re-election in 2020.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: "There is no circumstance I can conceive of, where I would run for national office." â Romney. He says Trump will almost certainly be the GOP nominee & is most likely to be re-elected. pic.twitter.com/MagM6rJUQt â KUTV 2News (@KUTV2News) October 10, 2019  Romney, a frequent critic of President Trump, made the remarks while hosting aÂ roundtable discussion on anti-vaping policy at Intermountain Primary Childrenâs Hospital inÂ Salt Lake City, Utah. Three Republican challengers have launched longshot primary bids against President Donald Trump â former Massachusetts Gov. Bill Weld, former Rep. Mark Sanford (R-SC), andÂ former Rep. Joe Walsh (R-IL) â However, several GOP state parties have already canceled their primary contests.
