In September, the Utah Republican signaled he is unlikely to endorse President Trumpâs 2020 bid. âIâm not planning on endorsing in the presidential race,â Romney, the former 2012 GOP nominee for the White House,Â toldÂ CNN. âAt this stage, Iâm not planning on endorsing in the primary or in the general.â Asked whether he has made up his mind whether to support the House Democrats impeachment inquiry against the president, Romney replied, âNo.â âI would have to look at the evidence as itâs presented,â he said. âIâll keep an open mind until and unless there is some kind of decision reached by the House,â he added. âItâs a purposeful effort on my part to stay unbiased and to see the evidence as itâs brought forward.â Sen. Mitt Romney says he's not going to weigh in now on a potential Trump impeachment trial: "I would have to look at the evidence as it's presented" https://t.co/H9n7JKbYS7 pic.twitter.com/AQehslYLBT â CBS News (@CBSNews) October 10, 2019  Romney earned the scorn of President Trump earlier this month forÂ labelingÂ the presidentâs suggestion for China and Ukraine to probe allegations of corruption against former Vice President Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden, as âwrong and appalling.â President Trump responded to Romney by calling him a âpompous assâ and a political liability for the Republican Party. âMitt Romney never knew how to win. He is a pompous âassâ who has been fighting me from the beginning, except when he begged me for my endorsement for his Senate run (I gave it to him), and when he begged me to be Secretary of State (I didnât give it to him). He is so bad for Râs!â the president wrote on Twitter Saturday. Mitt Romney never knew how to win. He is a pompous âassâ who has been fighting me from the beginning, except when he begged me for my endorsement for his Senate run (I gave it to him), and when he begged me to be Secretary of State (I didnât give it to him). He is so bad for Râs! â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 5, 2019  In a subsequent tweet, the president called for the lawmaker to be impeached from Congress: âIâm hearing that the Great People of Utah are considering their vote for their Pompous Senator, Mitt Romney, to be a big mistake. I agree! He is a fool who is playing right into the hands of the Do Nothing Democrats! #IMPEACHMITTROMNEY.â Iâm hearing that the Great People of Utah are considering their vote for their Pompous Senator, Mitt Romney, to be a big mistake. I agree! He is a fool who is playing right into the hands of the Do Nothing Democrats! #IMPEACHMITTROMNEY â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 5, 2019  Senators are not only unimpeachable, but Utah does not have stateÂ laws to recall a senator. A Utah Political TrendsÂ surveyÂ conducted in July found Romney had the highest disapproval rating among the stateâs congressional delegation.

articles.title: The Nuclear Option â D.C. Swamp Update: Establishment Insists USA Fight in Syria Civil War
articles.subtitle: Why is it always foreigners who manage to unite all the politicians from both parties inÂ Washington?
articles.author: Charles Hurt
articles.content: Illegal aliens â I mean âDreamers.â Haitian boat people. Olde Europeans. Sudanese. And now the Kurds. It is never support for regular Americans that brings politicians from both parties together. Even military veterans seem to offend half the politicians inÂ Washington. Democrats in Congress would give illegal aliens free health care before they would give it to our wounded veterans. And donât get me wrong. Iâve got nothing against the Kurds. They seem like great people. Brave, hardworking â a considerable step up from your average American college student today. And they seem to be truly trying to shake off the yoke of tyranny, which at least half of Americans support. But why do politicians drop everything they should be working on and come together to do something only for the âDreamers,â who, again, are illegal aliens? Or for the Kurds? Politico website, in an attempt at wry humor, posted a story Monday: âTrump unites the GOP â against him.â Get it? So witty. The story is about how President Trump wants to keep his campaign promise to disentangle us from all these foreign wars, including the civil war in Syria. Nothing â and I mean NOTHING â unites politicians inÂ WashingtonÂ like some rogue renegade who gets elected and then vows to keep the promises that got him elected. It is why Mr. Trump is so deeply despised inside the swamp. The âwhistleblowersâ in the deepest bowels of the swamp breed like mosquitoes carrying virulent diseases. âThe presidentâs decision to change course in Syria has united Republicans against him, and it threatens a new round of Congress-versus-the-administration griping with consequences on the global stage,â Politico displayed on its little website. The electronic story went on to quote Democrats and Republicans drafting bipartisan legislation together â a feat they have not done for regular Americans in years. Probably more than a decade. They cannot even get together and approve the USMCA trade agreement that everyone inÂ WashingtonÂ agrees upon and for which thousands of family farmers across the United States are desperate. The holdup is that Mr. Trump might (rightly) get credit for it. One bill in support of the Kurds has so much support in Congress, politicians claim, that it will be âveto-proof.â Wow. Can you imagine Congress cobbling together that much support for anything to help regular Americans? Another Republican declared: âWe must always have the backs of our allies.â Where is this unity when it comes to â I donât know â our own soldiers? Another Republican wagged his finger: âIf the President sticks with this retreat, he needs to know that this bad decision will likely result in the slaughter of allies who fought with us, including women and children.â I am sorry, but they did not fight alongside us. We fought alongside them. This is not our war. Itâs theirs. That is why it is called a âcivil war.â And it is Syriaâs civil war. Not ours. â¦Â Contact Charles Hurt atÂ churt@washingtontimes.comÂ or on Twitter @charleshurt.

articles.title: Watch â ICE Director to Sanctuary Cities: Your Elected Leaders Are Making You âLess Safeâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Zenny Phuong
articles.content: If youâre living in a sanctuary city, your elected officials are not prioritizing your safety, says ICE Acting Director Matthew Albence on Thursday. Albence was taking questions at a White House press briefing where he stressed the importance of public safety over politics in approaching the border crisis. Watch the entire briefing below:

articles.title: Democrat Congressman: Voters âHateâ and âDonât Trustâ the Democrats
articles.subtitle: Rep. Max Rose (D-NY) said people âhate the Democratsâ for beating around the bush when it comes to the policies and positions they support.
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content: Rose himself recently flip-flopped on opposing the House Democratsâ impeachment inquiry after coming out against the investigation. The New York Democrat lawmaker spoke about his party in an interview published Tuesday by Vanity Fair magazine. Vanity Fair described the congressman, a former U.S. military veteran who served in Afghanistan, as a straight shooter who âlacks all pretense.â âRose is sick of politicians who jump on bandwagons such as the Green New Deal or Medicare for All, only to prevaricate when push comes to shove,â Vanity Fair reported. âYou canât sign on to that [Green New Deal and Medicare for All] and then say that you are against parts of it,â Rose told the magazine. âTry to present that to folks that are here or anyone that we met today. You know? They will see right through you. That is why people hate the Democrats.â Rose indicated to the magazine that both parties have failed to keep their promises to their constituents. However, the self-described âpopulistâ added that voters âdonât trust Democrats as far as they can throw them.â âInstead of trying to understand their constituents, Rose argues, too many Democrats end up patronizing them. They pander during elections, then abandon voters when they get to Washington,â Vanity Fair pointed out. Last year, Rose became the second Democrat in decades to win the seat in New Yorkâs pro-Trump 11th district. The New York Democrat now represents a district that President Trump won by ten percentage points in 2016. He won the election by painting him as an outsider. âI have zero allegiance to the Democratic Party, zero,â the freshman lawmaker told Vanity Fair. On Monday, protesters flooded the New York Democratâs office over his newfound support of the impeachment inquiry, dismissed by the White House as a âpartisan and unconstitutionalâ investigation. âIt shouldnât be something that anyone wants to do,â Rose told Vanity Fair, referring to his support of the investigation. Democrat leaders in the House are carrying out an impeachment inquiry devoid of the recognized standards governing similar efforts in the past, namely those involving Presidents Richard Nixon and Bill Clinton. Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) has refused to hold a full House vote on authorizing an impeachment inquiry. During the Nixon and Clinton administrations, lawmakers did hold a vote. Trumpâs supporters in Congress argue that such a vote is necessary to legitimize the investigation per the recognized standards of previous impeachment efforts. Not all of the 235 members of the House Democratic Caucus support the impeachment inquiry. Democrat lawmakers who represent Republican-leaning or Trump-friendly districts have come out against the investigation. According to a tally by the New York Times, ten Democrat House lawmakers oppose the impeachment inquiry. Internal pollingÂ suggestsÂ a storm is brewing for vulnerable Democrats in key congressional districts. Polling by the National Republican Congressional Committee (NRCC) shows most voters do not consider Trumpâs phone call with his Ukrainian counterpart an impeachable offense.

articles.title: ICE Director: Single California Judge Cripples Enforcement in 43 States
articles.subtitle: A California judge is crippling the nationâs immigration enforcement system, amid the myriad examples of murders and crimes committed by illegal migrants, ICE director Matt Albence said at a White House press conference.
articles.author: Neil Munro
articles.content: Immigration enforcement is âbeing singled out and marginalized in ways that no other federal law enforcement organization has to tolerate,â he said. âTying our hands from the bench does not make our country any safer.â âWe will continue to put our lives on the line to protect the American public, despite the best efforts of those who like to see no enforcement or open borders,â he said. The judgeâs action was prompted by an ACLU lawsuit, which argued that some U.S. citizens were being misidentified as migrants by police databases. The judge announced September 27 he would end ICEâs authority to detain individuals â including illegals who are arrested and held in state or county jails â when arrests are based solely on evidence in databases. Once arrested, migrants are not deported until a judge orders their deportation. The California judge is AndrÃ© Birotte Jr. He is the son of Haitian immigrants and was nominated by President Barack Obama. His ruling applies just to actions in Southern California, but that is where ICE has one of its major data centers, theÂ Pacific Enforcement Response Center, in Laguna Niguel, California. Pro-migration groups rejoiced at their success: The PERC issues detainers 24-hours a day within California and after-hours to 41 other states. The ruling means that ICE may not issue any detainer request from the PERC to any state that does not expressly authorize local law enforcement to make immigration arrests in state law, and it may not issue a detainer without something more than database information to support a probable cause determination.  Albence described the problem: This decision issued by a single judge in Los Angeles will impact at least 43 states, threatening communities far beyond the one in which this judge [sits]. I wish I could say this is an isolated occurrence, it is but the latest example of judicial overreach targeting immigration enforcement and the application of laws already passed by Congress, often decades ago. The Department of Justice may ask the Supreme Court to suspend the judgeâs decision. Albence slammed the progressivesâ massive resistance to immigration laws: This decision will threaten public safety, as it will lead to the release of criminal aliens back onto the street â criminals that we wonât find before they hurt. Or worse, more innocent victims that could have been spared their pain and suffering. If only ICE had been allowed to do its job â¦ Time and again, DHS has been prevented from exercising the authority granted to it by Congress, because of the decisions of unelected judges who substitute their judgment for that of our legislators, or the government officials and trusted with enforcing our laws. âA recent case, in a litany of tragic, tragic examples, clearly illustrates this danger,â Albence said: Carlos Daniel Carillo-LopezÂ entered this country illegally as an unaccompanied alien child in 2015 [from Guatemala].Â He was arrested no less than four times in the past seven months in the state of Washington for charges including criminal trespass, theft, malicious mischief, and failure to appear. Each time ICE lodged a detainer [request to local jails]. Each time the detaining entities â [which are] proud sanctuary jurisdictions â release him without notifying ICE [in time for ICE to arrest the illegal].Tragically, on September 30th, 2019, he was arrested for homicide. His victim [was] another young man.  Albence said: ICE made approximately 140,000 arrests this year [and] about 75 percent of those arrests came from working with the jails and prisons. The other 25 percent are made by ICE at-large teams. It is critically important work. But it takes a lot more time and resources to make those arrests and a much greater risk to our officers, the public, and the subjects themselves. And we could have apprehended those criminal aliens from the safe confines of a jail upon their release. Pro-migration groups jeered at Albenceâs plea for enforcement of the law. NDLON, a group which represents illegal migrants, declared: The eerie retrogradeÂ racism on display from the White House podium this morning makes a case for â rather than against â sanctuary citiesâ¦Â  The Trump Administration is a threat to local public safety.Â  This is a fact.Â Â And no amount of Mexican-bashing, Central American-bashing, or Muslim-bashing will change the truth that recently arrived immigrants â documented and undocumented â are now taking the historical baton and defending bedrock constitutional values for everyone. âThe oath of office taken by the men and women of ICE means something to us, which is why we will adapt like we always do, why we will persevere like we always do,â Albence said. He added: We will continue to put our lives on the line to protect the American public despite the best efforts of those who like to see no enforcement or open borders. But make no mistake, rulings from any individual federal court, sitting in a single judicial district purporting to cripple ice authorities on a nationwide basis puts people at risk, innocent victims whose lives will be forever changed for the worse, all across our great country. And we could have stopped it.

articles.title: Joni Ernst: Iowans Tired of Pelosiâs Impeachment âGamesâ
articles.subtitle: Sen. Joni Ernst (R-IA) slammed House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) Thursday, saying that Iowans are tired of her âplayingâ impeachment âgames.â
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: Sen. Ernst criticized House Speaker Pelosi for suggesting she was unwilling to answer a CNN reporter who questioned if it is acceptable for President Donald Trump to pressure foreign countries to interfere in an American election. During the interview, Sen. Ernst said, âWe have a picture thatâs painted by media,â and the Senate Intelligence Committee and other committees âwill sort it out without media interdiction.â Citing Sen. Ernstâs interview with CNN, Pelosi said that âRepublicans are refusing to answer the simplest question.â âAmerican elections should be decided by Americans, not by âfavorsâ from foreign governments,â Pelosi said, referring to President Trumpâs call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky: Actually, American elections should be decided by ELECTIONS. Not politicians. I know youâre still upset about the results from 2016, but people here in Iowa would sure appreciate it if you spent less time playing political games and actually brought #USMCAnow up for a vote. https://t.co/YM07a1MXbl â Joni Ernst (@joniernst) October 10, 2019  Sen. Ernst responded, saying Iowans want Pelosi to stop âplayingâ impeachment âpolitical gamesâ and pass useful legislation, such as the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA). âActually, American elections should be decided by ELECTIONS. Not politicians,â Ernst said. âI know youâre still upset about the results from 2016, but people here in Iowa would sure appreciate it if you spent less time playing political games and actually brought #USMCAnow up for a vote.â Sen. Ernst also said last week that Iowans want Congress to focus on improving the American economy, rather than their âimpeachment circusâ: Folks in Iowa want Congress to focus on moving our country forward, not this impeachment circus. pic.twitter.com/Oua82APRyE â Joni Ernst (@joniernst) October 1, 2019  Pelosiâs impeachment inquiry based on hearsay, secrecy and no regard for due process is a partisan sham to overturn the 2016 election. Instead, Democrats should pass USMCA. @realDonaldTrump is right to refuse to participate in this unfair, unprecedented, and illegitimate process. â Senator Mike Braun (@SenatorBraun) October 9, 2019  Sen. Mike Braun (R-IN) said that Pelosiâs impeachment inquiry has amounted to a âpartisan shamâ and that Democrats should focus on passing the USMCA. âPelosiâs impeachment inquiry based on hearsay, secrecy and no regard for due process is a partisan sham to overturn the 2016 election. Instead, Democrats should pass USMCA. @realDonaldTrumpÂ is right to refuse to participate in this unfair, unprecedented, and illegitimate process,â Braun wrote Wednesday. Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: Pro-Trump Protesters Swarm Democrat Lucy McBathâs Office over Support for Impeachment
articles.subtitle: Over 100 pro-Trump protesters swarmed Rep. Lucy McBathâs (D-GA) office inÂ Sandy Springs, Georgia, over her support of pursuing an impeachment inquiry against President Trump.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: McBath, who serves on the House Judiciary Committee, voted in favor of the impeachment inquiry last month. Protesters gathered outside of her office on Wednesday to demonstrate support for the president, chanting âfour more yearsâ and holding up Trump 2020 signs. One sign spotted at the protest read, âImpeach Pelosi.â âSheâs had an agenda from day one to bring [Trump] down,â resident Jill Wright said of McBath,Â according to AJC. âThe Democrats need to work for their constituents and not have an agenda,â she continued. âThey are disrespecting our president and they are also setting a poor example for our children.â McBath is in a vulnerable district, barely edging out former Rep. Karen Handel (R-GA) in 2018. McBath won by one percent, orÂ 3,264 votes. Georgiaâs Sixth Congressional DistrictÂ tilted in Hillary Clintonâs favor in the 2016 election by 1.5 percent, although Trump ultimately won the state. However, as internal polling suggests, Democrats in key congressional districts face an uphill battle, as the majority of constituents do not consider Trumpâs phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky an impeachable offense, and that conversation largely serves as the basis for the partisan-fueled impeachment inquiry. âPro-Trump patriots showed up to @RepLucyMcBathâs office in #GA06 this week to protest her support of Pelosiâs impeachment witch-hunt,â Donald Trump Jr. wrote. âSorry #LiberalLucy, you canât vote for Pelosi for Speaker, support her impeachment witch-hunt and still call yourself a âmoderate,'â he added. â#VoteHerOutâ:  McBath responded to the protests on Twitter, accusing the president and his eldest son of âattackingâ her. âPresident Trump and his son are attacking me because I voted for the impeachment inquiry,â she wrote on Twitter. âYesterday, they bussed folks to my office in #GA06 to protest.â âI refuse to be intimidated, I will do what is right,â she added, asking for donations:  McBath is hardly the first Democrat lawmaker to face opposition over her support of an impeachment inquiry. Protesters confronted Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) at the Reno airport this month and demanded her to âstop the impeachmentâ of Trump:  Similarly, Trump supporters greeted House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) during her visit in South Carolina last week, holding signs reading, âImpeach Pelosi,â and waving Trump flags:  On Monday, protesters swarmed Rep. Max Roseâs (D-NY) office over his support of the impeachment effort, chanting, âHey, hey! Ho, ho! Max Rose has got to go!â:

articles.title: House Democrats Subpoena Rick Perry for Ukraine Documents
articles.subtitle: House Democrats on Thursday subpoenaed Department of Energy SecretaryÂ Rick Perry for Ukraine documents as part of their impeachment investigation against President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: âRecently, public reports have raised questions about any role you may have played in conveying or reinforcing the Presidentâs stark message to the Ukrainian President,â the letter reads from the chairmen of the House Intelligence, Oversight, and Foreign Affairs committees.  The lawmakers requested that Perry turn over the documents by October 18th. The development comes afterÂ Perryâs spokesperson confirmed the Energy Secretary encouraged President Trump to discuss energy and economic issues with the leader of Ukraine during their July 25th telephone call, which was mischaracterized by a partisan CIA officer in a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint. The officerâs complaint has since sparked House Democrats to launch an impeachment inquiry. âSecretary Perry absolutely supported and encouraged the president to speak to the new president of Ukraine to discuss matters related to their energy security and economic development,â Shaylyn Hynes, a Perry spokesperson, said in a statement. President Trump on Friday evening told House Republicans that it was Perry who had teed up the July call with Ukraine, according to a person familiar with Trumpâs new comments who was granted anonymity to discuss the private conference call. But President Trump did not suggest that Perry had anything to do with the pressure on Ukraine to investigate the Bidens, or a U.S. holdup in military aid to the country, the person said. The presidentâs remarks on the late Friday call was first reported by Axios. Perry, the former governor of Texas and up to now a lower-profile but active member of Trumpâs Cabinet, has made repeated trips to Ukraine and met often with Ukranian officials, including Zelenskiy. Perry and his agency say his involvement with Ukraine was part of U.S. policy, predating the Trump administration, to increase U.S. natural gas, coal and other supplies to Eastern Europe to lessen Russiaâs control of the regionâs energy market. âHe continues to believe that there is significant need for improved regional energy security,â Hynes said. Perry was heading to Lithuania again Sunday night, and would meet with nearly two dozen European energy officials, including those from Ukraine, she said. Both President Trump and Zelensky have denied any pressure was applied to probe Biden, whose alleged corruption in Ukraine and China has garnered negative attention for the former vice president amid sinking 2020 poll numbers and a rising candidacy of rival Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA). âThere was no blackmail,â ZelenskyÂ toldÂ reporters when asked Thursday about his call with President Trump. âWe are not servants. We are an independent country.â âI donât want to be pulled into this because I understand that my words could impact the elections of the American people,â he added. The Associated Press contributed to this report.

articles.title: New Jersey Teacher Reassigned for Kneeling During Pledge of Allegiance
articles.subtitle: A New Jersey middle school teacher has been reassigned to perform duties outside the classroom during morning announcements because she kneeled during the Pledge of Allegiance.
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: The school boardâs decision to reassign the teacher came after an October 2 Vineland Board of Education meeting when two community members complained that the teacherâs decision to kneel during the pledge forced a political agenda on impressionable students. One ex-military parent said it was offensive to see a political agenda being set in the classroom after he served 20 years in the military saving lives. âThat type of behavior offends me,â said Randy London, a U.S Coast Guard veteran who spoke during the school board meeting, according to the Vineland Daily Journal. âIâm not saying anyone needs to agree with everything, but if that is the districtâs policy, there should be no teacher â¦ taking a knee during the Pledge of Allegiance.â Ron Maccri, a Vineland resident, also complained that she was using tax dollars to take the role of a parent, calling her kneeling during the pledge âreprehensible.â Maccri added that the school was named afterÂ Sgt. Dominick Pilla, a U.S. Army ranger killed in Somalia on October 3, 1993. âTeachers are paid to educate our students, theyâre not paid to indoctrinate our students, he continued. âWhat this woman is doing would be bad in any school, but because itâs in the (Sgt.) Dominick Pilla School â who gave his life for our militaryÂ â itâs reprehensible.â The principal decided after the school board meeting to reassign the teacher to administrative duties during the morningâs homeroom period to avoid further conflict, the Philly Voice reported.

articles.title: Trump Campaign Rally in Minnesota the Opening Salvo of âFull-On Major Effortâ to Win State in 2020
articles.subtitle: The Trump campaign rally in Minneapolis on Thursday marks the beginning of the presidential re-election campaignâs intense efforts to win the state of Minnesota in 2020.
articles.author: Michael Patrick Leahy
articles.content:
âIt is a full-on major effort state campaign,â Trump campaign spokesperson Tim Murtaugh told the New York Times in a story published early Thursday morning. âAnd we will have the resources behind it to make it count,â Murtaugh added. President Trump narrowly lost the stateâs ten electoral college votes by about 44,000 votes in 2016, the best Republican showing in Minnesota since President Richard Nixon won the state in the 1972 presidential election. The Times reportedÂ in its Thursday story: Brad Parscale, the presidentâs campaign manager, is planning to pour tens of millions of dollars into the campaignâs Minnesota operation, compared with the $30,000 the Trump campaign spent on the state last cycle.Â The campaign already has 20 paid staff members in the state, and expects to expand to 100. And the campaign and the Republican National Committee are outspending Democrats by about four to one on digital advertising, according to campaign officials and local Democratic Party officials. Democrats are taking note of the Republican efforts and have voiced concerns that Minnesota may actually be in play in 2020. âOver the last 25 years, Iâve never seen an investment as robust and deep this early by a Republican presidential candidate,â Ken Martin, chairman of the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor (DFL) PartyÂ told the Times. On Monday, Martin and the DFL attempted to raise money off Trumpâs visit to Minnesota in a tweet that said: THREAD: Trump is coming to Minnesota this week to break our blue wall and flip our state red in 2020. That canât happen. Weâre launching a #MoneyBlizzard to make sure we have the resources to fight back against his hateful campaign. RT & Donate: https://t.co/as41eNTLc0

â Minnesota DFL Party (@MinnesotaDFL) October 7, 2019 An earlier effort by the Democrat Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey to force the Trump campaign to pay $530,000 in order to hold Thursdayâs rally at the Target Center failed on Tuesday, as Breitbart News reported: The Trump campaign claimed victory late Tuesday in its battle with Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey, a first term Democrat elected in 2017 who wanted the campaign to pay more than $500,000 in security expenses for Thursdayâs rally at the Target Center. âThe arena in Minneapolis has been fully approved. The Target Center has backed off cancelling the contract, which means President Trumpâs Keep America Great rally will go on as scheduled,â Trump 2020 campaign manager Brad Parscale said in a statement issued on Tuesday afternoon. âConsistent with our original agreement with the venue, the Trump campaign has not agreed to pay any additional funds. We look forward to seeing everyone Thursday night,â Parscale concluded. The presidential election is not the only area where Minnesota is expected to be a battleground in 2020. Five of the stateâs eight congressional districts are âswing seatsâ that could be switched from one party to another. Three of those seats are currently held by Democrats, two by Republicans. Should Republicans pick up all three seats, they would only need to flip 16 more in other states around the country to take back the majority in the House of Representatives. Both supporters and opponents of President Trump are expected to show up in force outside the Target Center prior to Thursday eveningâs rally.

articles.title: McMaster: âAbsolutely Notâ Appropriate for Trump to Solicit Foreign Interference
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: At a Foundation for Defense of Democracies event on Thursday, former Trump White House national security adviser H.R. McMaster said it is âabsolutely notâ appropriate for President Donald Trump to âsolicitâ election interference from a foreign government. He pointed out that it is up to the Congress to decide if the president did so. A reporter asked, âIs it appropriate for the president of the United States to solicit foreign interference in our political process?â McMaster said, âOf course not. No, itâs absolutely not. And of course, what has to happen here is seeing our democracy play out, our separation of powers play out. And for the American people, through their representatives in Congress, to make a judgment of whether that happened.â He added, âTo answer your question directly, of course, it is not appropriate.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Trump to Award the Medal of Honor to Green Beret Master Sgt. Matthew Williams
articles.subtitle: U.S. Army Special Operations Command announced Thursday that President Donald Trump will award Army Green Beret Master Sgt. Matthew O. Williams with the Medal of Honor for conspicuous gallantry on October 30.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: Williams will receive the medal for his actions in Afghanistan on April 6, 2008, as a weapons sergeant with Special Forces Operational Detachment Alpha 3336, Special Operations Task Force-33, assault element. His actions helped save the lives of four critically wounded soldiers and prevented the lead element of the assault force from being overrun by the enemy, according to a White House statement. Facing rocket-propelled grenade, sniper, and machine gun fire, then-Sgt. Williams led an Afghan Commando element across a fast-moving, ice cold, and waist-deep river to fight its way up a terraced mountain to the besieged lead element of the assault force. He thenÂ set up a base of fire that the enemy was not able to overcome. When his team sergeant was wounded by sniper fire, Williams exposed himself to enemy fire to come to his aid and to move him down the mountainside to the casualty collection point, and then braved small arms fire and climbed back up the cliff to evacuate other injured soldiers and repair the teamâs satellite radio. He again exposed himself to enemy fire as he helped move several casualties down the near vertical mountainside and as he carried and loaded casualties on to evacuation helicopters. âSergeant Williamsâ actions are in keeping with the finest traditions of military service and reflect great credit upon himself. Combined Joint Special Operations Task-Force-Afghanistan, Operation Command Central, and the United States Army,â USASOC spokesman Lt. Col. Loren Bymer said in a statement. Williams is a native ofÂ Boerne, Texas, and graduated from Angelo State University with a Bachelorâs Degree in Criminal Justice. He enlisted into the Army under the 18X Special Forces enlistment program in September 2005 and became a Green Beret in 2007, serving with Charlie Company, 3rd Battalion, 3rd Special Forces Group (Airborne). In 2008, he deployed to Afghanistan with Special Forces Operational Detachment Alpha 3336, Special Operations Task Force-33. Williams has deployedÂ multiple times in support of Operation Enduring Freedom and Operation Juniper Shield, serving in numerous positions, including weapons sergeant, Charlie Company, 3rd Battalion, 3rd SFG (A); senior weapons sergeant, Bravo Company, 3rd Battalion, 3rd SFG (A); senior instructor/writer, Delta Company, 2nd Battalion, 1st Special Warfare Training Group; senior weapons sergeant, Bravo Company, 2nd Battalion 3rd SFG (A); and operations sergeant, Alpha Company, 2nd Battalion 3rd SFG (A). He is still serving in the United States Army and is assigned to Fort Bragg, North Carolina. When off duty, he enjoys hunting and spending time with his wife, Kate, and their son, Nolan, the White House statement said. His awards and decorations include the Silver Star, Bronze Star Medal with two Bronze Oak Leaf Clusters, Meritorious Service Medal, Army Commendation Medal with two Bronze Oak Leaf Clusters, Army Achievement Medal, Army Good Conduct Medal with Bronze Clasp and four Loops, National Defense Service Medal, Afghanistan Campaign Medal with three Bronze Service Stars, Global War on Terrorism Service Medal, Noncommissioned Officer Professional Development Ribbon with Numeral â4,â Army Service Ribbon, Overseas Service Ribbon with Numeral â3,â Valorous Unit Award, Combat Infantryman Badge, Parachutist Badge, and Special Forces Tab. Follow Breitbart Newsâs @Kristina_Wong.

articles.title: Dozens of Mayors Call for âGlobal Green New Dealâ
articles.subtitle: Dozens of mayors and activists involved in theÂ C40 Cities Climate Leadership Group formally called for a âGlobal Green New Dealâ on Wednesday.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The group â under the leadership of the chair, Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo, and chair-elect, Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti â announced its support for the Green New Deal on a worldwide scale, arguing that it is necessary toÂ âdrive an urgent, fundamental and irreversible transfer of global resources away from fossil fuels and into action that averts the climate emergency.â The group boasted of â94 climate leader citiesâ recognizing the âglobal climate emergency.â Per the release: The message was issued by city leaders attending the C40 World Mayors Summit in Copenhagen. Their call came in response to intergovernmental action being blocked by a minority of very powerful, science-denying governments, representing the interests of the fossil-fuel industry. Through the Global Green New Deal, cities have reaffirmed their commitment to protecting our environment, strengthening our economy, and building a more equitable future by cutting emissions from the sectors most responsible for the climate crisis â transportation, buildings, industry, and waste â to keep global heating below the 1.5Â°C goal of the Paris Agreement. The city leaders called to cut global emissions by 50 percent by 2030, an effort the United States has already led the charge on despite a lack of participation in the Paris Agreement. Carbon emissions from energy usage from the U.S. are at the lowest levels since 1992, as Breitbart Newsâs entertainment editor and author of 50 Things They Donât Want You to Know, Jermone Hudson, told Fox & Friends last month. Additionally, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) released a report last year, which indicated that greenhouse gas emissions decreased during Trumpâs first year in office. As Breitbart News reported: The EPA report revealed that total greenhouse gas emissions decreased by 2.7 percent from 2016 to 2017. âThanks to President Trumpâs regulatory reform agenda, the economy is booming, energy production is surging, and we are reducing greenhouse gas emissions from major industrial sources,â EPA Acting Administrator Andrew Wheeler said in a statement. âThese achievements flow largely from technological breakthroughs in the private sector, not the heavy hand of government. The Trump Administration has proven that federal regulations are not necessary to drive CO2 reductions,â Wheeler continued. âWhile many around the world are talking about reducing greenhouse gases, the U.S. continues to deliver, and todayâs report is further evidence of our action-oriented approach.â âAs mayors our first priority is to protect the safety of our citizens,â Hidago said.Â âIt will soon be four years since the Paris Agreement was signed in our city.â âWorld leaders met in New York just last month and once again failed to agree anything close to the level of action necessary to stop the climate crisis,â she continued, decrying their âineptitudeâ and proclaiming that it âdirectly threatens all people around the globe as time keeps running against us.â âThere is no other solution but a Global Green New Deal to be the pivotal instrument to win this race against the clock. All decision-makers must take responsibility in making it a reality,â she added. âWhen it comes to climate action, no one is doing more than cities, but no one is doing enough,â Garcetti concurred. âWe are entering a make-or-break decade for the preservation of our planet and environmental justice for every community â and I am proud to lead C40 cities at this critical moment,â he said. âTogether we will continue leading the drive to protect the world and promote a better, more equitable life for everyone living in it,â he added. Freshman âSquadâ member Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) also released a statement, praising the coalition and calling climate change âour greatest threat.â âI am inspired by this coalition and the commitments made for a global Green New Deal,â she said. âIf we work to join forces globally, we will be able to defeat our greatest threat and realize our greatest opportunity.â âFederal govs are failing to act on the climate crisis,â she followed up in a tweet. âWe canât wait for others to leadâ:

articles.title: Peter Schweizer: Washington Corrupt Practices Act Needed to Drain the Swamp
articles.subtitle: Legislation mandating disclosure of financial ties between immediate family members of elected government officials and foreign governments â provisionally titled the Washington Corrupt Practices Act â would help combat foreign-procured political influence and corruption within America, determined Peter Schweizer,Â president of the Government Accountability Institute, senior contributor at Breitbart News, and author ofÂ Secret Empires: How the American Political Class Hides Corruption and Enriches Family and Friends.
articles.author: Robert Kraychik
articles.content: Schweizer elaborated on his Wednesday-published New York Times opinion editorial in a same-day interview on SiriusXMâs Breitbart News Tonight with host Rebecca Mansour and special guest host and Washington Post columnist Henry Olsen. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnellâs (R-KY) financial relationship with the Chinese state is illustrative of the status quo of foreign business relationships between politicians and foreign governments evading disclosure requirements, explained Schweizer. The family of Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao, who is McConnellâs wife, owns a seafaring shipping business, noted Schweizer. âThey had it even before Mitch McConnell and Elaine Chao were married, but in 1993 â¦ the Chinese government basically struck a deal with the Chao family, where they said, âWe will finance the construction of your cargo ships. We will provide crews for your cargo ships, and state-owned enterprises in China will give you lots of contracts to ship our goods around Asia.'â Schweizer continued, âAnd what youâve seen as that relationship has budded, is basically that Mitch McConnell has become a lot less critical of the Chinese government, and this is essentially what the Chinese are playing at. Theyâve done it in Australia. Theyâve done it in New Zealand [and] other parts of Asia. They are quite confident that the way to deal with adversarial countries or countries that are resistant to their policies is essentially [is to] try to buy off the political class, and theyâve had some success in doing that, and theyâre doing that in the United States today.â LISTEN:  Schweizer noted how Joe Bidenâs geopolitical analysis of China changed following his youngest son, Hunter Biden, launching a private equity firm with $1.5 billion in financing from the Chinese state. âJoe Biden was basically a hawk on China for most of his Senate career in the â80s and â90s, even up until the early parts of the Obama administration,â Schweizer remarked. âJoe Biden has basically said, âWe should welcome a rising China. China is not a threat. There is benefit to China becoming stronger, because they will be more like us.'â âChina is going to eat our lunch? Câmon man,â said Biden in May, further dismissing China as a geopolitical threat, âTheyâre not a competition for us.â Olsen contrasted news media focus on alleged foreign-rooted conflicts of interest between President Donald Trump and those of Joe Biden via Hunter Bidenâs business dealings in China and Ukraine. âThe thing that gets me is that Hunter Biden is obviously a troubled individual,â Olsen stated. âThe New Yorker magazine profile of him goes into enormous detail about his troubles. For three years, weâve been hearing about every little thing about the Trump children or the Trump administration, and how awful it is that foreign dignitaries stay at the Trump Hotel in DC because they might be currying favor with the president, and how terrible it is that Chinese investors are buying condos in Jared Kushnerâs familyâs buildings, and yet here weâve got this troubled person, who Joe Biden obviously loves, who is raking in cash well beyond his expertise, and supposedly weâre not supposed to be worried about it. The double standard here is just glaring.â Olsen added, âItâs almost like you can imagine some sort of shakedown deal. You can almost imagine somebody going up to [Joe Biden] and saying, âNice son youâve got there. Shame if something were to happen to him.â Itâs very troubling. You donât even have to say that [Joe Biden] has changed his mind [on China.] The fact is Hunter Bidenâs future is now indebted to people and regimes that are potentially hostile to the United States, and definitely regimes that we want to have an interest in, and he, unfortunately, has a personal stake [in this] because of his sonâs involvement. Thatâs news, and itâs as much news as when the president of Ukraine says, âOh, I stayed in the Trump Tower when I was in New York.â In fact, Iâd say itâs even more so.â Asked by Mansour for solutions to combating foreign procurement of political influence through business relationships with politiciansâ family members, Schweizer proposed legislation modeled after the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. âHereâs the paradox,â replied Schweizer, âA few years ago â¦ one of [J.P. Morganâs] subsidiaries was fined hundreds of millions of dollars by the federal government of the United States because what their subsidiary did was hire the children of Communist Party officials in China with the explicit hope of getting favorable treatment from the Chinese government. So they paid a large fine for that, and that violated the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, which means you are not allowed to provide a favor or a benefit to a foreign government officials in exchange for favorable treatment.â Schweizer continued, âHereâs the problem. Itâs called the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act for a reason. It does not apply in the United States. If J.P. Morgan did what they did in China and got fined for â if they did the same thing in the United States â it would be completely legal and acceptable. And to me, that should be unacceptable.Â The notion that American corporations are not allowed to buy foreign politicians â but foreign corporations can buy American politicians â I donât think is where we want to be as a country. Iâm proposing [a] legislative solution that creates similar barriers to hiring the family members of politicians in the United States.â Without identifying specific persons, Schweizer revealed that he had discussed the aforementioned legislative proposal with some senators. âI recognize itâs not going to be easy to get passed,â said Schweizer of the Washington Corrupt Practices Act. âYouâve people on both sides of the aisle that want to cash in, but I think this is key, or weâre going to continue to see in this country a descent into more corruption, into kind of a third-world swamp where the political class is getting rich and their interests are not aligned with the populace; their interests are aligned with foreign oligarchs or companies that are paying them.â âAt a very minimum â¦ there ought to be a disclosure,â Schweizer continued. âIf Joe Biden or Mitch McConnell are running for office, theyâre required to disclose a $200 donation from anybody. Itâs required by federal law, and the reason is we want to know whoâs putting money in their campaign coffers if that person is getting favorable treatment or influence. And theyâre also required to disclose if they have $1000 in stock in General Electric, because we want to make sure their decisions are not being marred by their own financial interests. So they have to disclose those things.Â But their adult child, like Hunter Biden, joins a Chinese firm â a billion-dollar firm funded by the Chinese government â thereâs no disclosure requirement.â Existing disclosure requirements related to campaign contributions and investment are insufficient to reveal potential conflicts of interest between politicians and foreign states, noted Schweizer. âI would argue that if you are a foreign entity, the best way to get influence over an American politician is not by making a $200 campaign contribution, itâs not by hoping they own $1000 of your stock, itâs by striking a lucrative deal with one of their kids, and yet thereâs no disclosure requirement.Â At a minimum, we should require American politicians [and] elected officials in senior government positions [to disclose] if their immediate family members have deals with foreign governments. They should be required to disclose that and let citizens know that.â The Washington Corrupt Practices Act may yield bipartisan support, speculated Schweizer. âThis has the prospect of a kind of populist left-right legislative approach,â Schweizer estimated. âImagine if you could have a Ted Cruz, [a] conservative Republican, and an [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez], who is really a left-wing socialist in Congress, both of them [support this]. This is the sort of issue I think resonates with them and their view of Washington. Theyâre suspicious of the establishment. They see this as corrupt and Iâm hoping that we can find common cause.â Schweizer added, âThatâs what happened with the STOCK Act. You had conservative Republicans in the Freedom Caucus [and] left-wing Democrats in New York who all said, âItâs outrageous. They shouldnât be trading stock in this way. We need to place some restrictions on it.â I think this has the same marker. The biggest challenge youâre going to have is with leadership. Nancy Pelosi and Mitch McConnell, theyâve been there for a long time. They like to set aside these kinds of perks for themselves. They donât like to place restrictions on fellow members of Congress. I think you have reform-minded people in both parties, and I just think they need to have the courage to step up and say, âYou know what? We need to have a legislative solution to this,â and I think itâs going to be very hard for the leadership to resist a move, because these are not issues where youâre going to find even five percent of the American people who think this is a good idea. Most Democrats and most Republicans think this is terrible and needs to stop.â Olsen concluded, âSounds to me like the one thing Elizabeth Warren, Bernie Sanders, and President Trump could all agree on.â Breitbart News Tonight airs Monday through Friday on SiriusXMâs Patriot channel 125 from 9:00 p.m. to midnight Eastern (6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. Pacific). Follow Robert Kraychik on Twitter @rkraychik.

articles.title: Adam Schiff Staff Refuses to Meet Senior Citizens, Citing âSecurityâ
articles.subtitle: Staff for Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) refused to meet with a group of ten senior citizens opposed to the impeachment of President Donald Trump at his district office in Burbank on Thursday, citing a ânew policyâ on âsecurity.â
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: The group, which included several constituents of Schiffâs 28th congressional district, Trump supporters, and Tea Party activists, had informed Schiffâs staff ahead of time that they would be coming. They carried home-made signs that read, âDonât Impeach!â, âPink Slip for Adam Schiff!â, and âSchiff, is a Shifty Character and a Liar!â They also carried a document listing 200 of Trumpâs accomplishments, as part of their opposition to impeachment. The protest was live-streamed on Breitbart Newsâ Facebook page, reaching over 200,000 viewers in two hours. After holding a demonstration on the sidewalk in front of the office building housing Schiffâs office, the group went inside and attempted to meet with Schiffâs staff. Finding the door locked, they rang the doorbell. They were told that they could leave comments for the congressman on cards in the hallway, but that a ânew policyâ prevented staff from venturing out into the hallway, or inviting the demonstrators inside Schiffâs office, for âsecurityâ reasons. Adam Schiff protest (Joel Pollak / Breitbart News) Schiff, who chairs the House Intelligence Committee, is leading the âimpeachment inquiryâ into the president, though that inquiry has yet to be authorized by a vote of the House of Representatives, as per House precedent. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Biden Campaign Furious NYT Reported on Biden Corruption Like Breitbart Did
articles.subtitle: Joe Bidenâs campaign is furious The New York TimesÂ is covering how the former vice presidentâs political interests converged with his sonâs business dealings â a topic Breitbart News has explored extensively.
articles.author: Haris Alic
articles.content: Kate Bedingfield, the former vice presidentâs deputy campaign manger, sent a letter to the Times on Wednesday, lambasting the paper for publishing an op-ed by Peter Schweizer, a senior contributor at Breitbart News, detailing several such instances. In particular, Schweizer, who helms the Government Accountability Institute, noted that the former vice presidentâs youngest son, Hunter, profited off deals with Ukraine and China that were inaccessible to the average American businessman. Instead of refuting Schweizerâs argument, Bedingfieldâs letter attacked the TimesÂ for having published the opinion piece in the first place. The deputy campaign manger even went to the extent of accusing the paper of not having âinternalized the sobering lessons of 2016â by giving âtop billingâ to a âright-wing polemicist.â âBut todayâs decision is hardly the first example,â Bedingfield wrote, before proceeding to claim theÂ TimesÂ had an âoutsized hand in the spread of a baseless conspiracy theoryâ concerning the Biden family.Â âWhat was especially troubling about the Timesâs active participation in this smear campaign is that prior to its reportingâ¦ this conspiracy had been relegated to the likes ofÂ Breitbart,Â Russian propaganda, and another conspiracy theorist, regularÂ HannityÂ guestÂ John Solomon.â The campaignâs line of attack, although unsurprising given their frequent broadsides against the media, comes as Hunter Bidenâs dealings have spilled into the open amid the impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump. At the center of the inquiry is a conversation the president had with the Ukrainian government suggesting they probe how the younger Biden secured an appointment to the board of directors of Burisma Holdings. The younger Biden was appointed to the oil and gas giantâs board, a position which paid as much asÂ $83,000 per month, in 2014, around the same time his father was made the Obama administrationâs point man on Ukraine. Breitbart News has followed that story, along with Hunter Bidenâs ties to a private equity firm bankrolled by the Chinese government, since Schweizer published his bestselling book â Secret Empires: How the American Political Class Hides Corruption and Enriches Family and Friends.

articles.title: Bidenâs âBroad Campaignâ to Silence Coverage of Ukraine Corruption Scandal
articles.subtitle: Democrat White House hopeful Joe Bidenâs campaign attempted this week to push the New York Times (NYT), Twitter, and Facebook into extinguishing stories and presidential campaign ads about the Ukraine corruption scandal linked to the former vice president, to no avail.
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content: On Wednesday, CNN revealed the Biden campaign âdid not rule outâ reaching out to Google and YouTube as well. The Biden campaign sent letters to Facebook and Twitter, demanding that they ban an ad by U.S. President Donald Trumpâs re-election campaign. Trumpâs re-election campaign ad accuses the former vice president and his son, Hunter Biden, of corrupt activities in Ukraine. Unlike CNN, the Times, Facebook, and Twitter have resited Bidenâs effort to silence Trumpâs assertion that Biden engaged in improper dealings with Ukraine while serving as vice president. On Wednesday, Biden campaign staffers sent also sent a letter to the NYTÂ complaining about its coverage of the former vice presidentâs alleged pattern of corruption in Ukraine, including the newspaperâs publication of an editorial by author and Breitbart senior contributorÂ Peter Schweizer. A spokesperson for NYT maintained that its coverage has been âfair and accurate.â The newspaper will âcontinue to cover Joe Biden with the same tough and fair standards we apply to every candidate in the race,â it added. âWeâre happy to sit down with Biden advisers anytime to discuss news coverage,â the spokesperson declared. The refusalÂ by NYT, Twitter, and Facebook to put the lid on information about Bidenâs link to corruption in Ukraine has angered the Biden campaign, prompting it to lash out. Facebook rejected a request from Bidenâs 2020 campaign to remove a video ad by Trumpâs re-election campaign that highlights allegations of corruption against Biden and his son, Hunter. In a statement, the social media platform said its decision is âgrounded in Facebookâs fundamental belief in free expression, respect for the democratic process, and belief that in mature democracies with a free press, political speech is already arguably the most scrutinized speech there is.â Irked by Facebookâs response, Biden campaign spokesperson TJ Ducklo called the reply âunacceptableâ and said that the dissemination of âobjectively false information to influence public opinion poisons the public discourse and chips away at our democracy.â Ducklo did not explicitly comment on the substance of the adâs accusations. The video asserts that Biden threatened to withhold $1 billion in aid to Ukraine unless the eastern European country fired a prosecutor reportedly investigating an energy company. Hunter Biden served on the Ukrainian companyâs board at the time. Biden bragged on video about bullying Ukraine into firing the prosecutor. Titled âBiden Corruption,â the 30-second video clip is running on various cable networks and online.  On Wednesday, CNN obtained a letter from the Biden presidential campaign asking Twitter to reject what appears to be the same Trump re-election campaign ad. The letter âacknowledges that the social media company has said the ad complies with its policies,â the news network noted. Nevertheless, the Biden campaign reportedly requested that Twitter âpromptly reassessâ that position. CNN reported: Specifically, the letter calls on Twitter to make a distinction between the personal account of a politician and paid advertising content â¦ Twitter has not responded to CNNâs request for comment. The move from Bidenâs team appears to be part of a broad campaign to respond to Trumpâs attacks on social media. Last Monday, CNN refused to run the âBiden Corruptionâ ad,Â allegingÂ Â the video âdoes not meet our advertising standards.â âIn addition to disparaging CNN and its journalists, the ad makes assertions that have been proven demonstrably false by various news outlets, including CNN,â the network added in a statement. Tim Murtaugh, Trump 2020 campaignâs communications director, lambasted CNNâs decision, accusing the network of âspend[ing] all day protecting Joe Biden in their programming.â House Democrats have launched an impeachment inquiry against President Trump, claiming he attempted to coerce his Ukrainian counterpart into investigating the corruption allegations against Biden and his son. Trump and Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky have denied the claim. The White House is refusing to cooperate with the impeachment investigation, saying it is aÂ âpartisan and unconstitutionalâ probe.

articles.title: Dollar General Clerk Who Killed Alleged Suspect: âI Shot Him in Self-Defenseâ
articles.subtitle: The Dollar General store clerk who killed an alleged robber Wednesday night said, âI shot him in self-defense.â
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: WHIO reports the clerk called 911 after the incident, saying, âI just had somebody try to attempt and rob me over here at Dollar General on Gettysburg. Came in with a firearm, threatened to take money out the drawer, pointed a gun at me and my staff members.â Dayton police Sgt. Thomas Schloss indicated the suspect entered the store around 6:20 p.m. and confirmed that he had a firearm. The clerk said, âHe pointed a gun at me, I had a firearm on me, I pulled my firearm and I shot him in self-defense.â WDTN reports that the suspect tried to flee after being shot, âbut collapsed just outside the front doors of the store, where he was pronounced dead.â The suspect was identified as 23-year-oldÂ Roosevelt Rappley. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Trump Says China Trade Talks Are Going Really Well
articles.subtitle: Donald Trump said Thursdayâs trade talks with China went âreally well.â
articles.author: John Carney
articles.content: Speaking to reporters on the lawn of the White House before departing for a political rally tonight, Trump said the first day of negotiations were going very well and confirmed that he would be meeting with the top Chinese negotiators at the White House on Friday. âWeâre going to meet with them tomorrow here,â Trump said. âAnd itâs going very, very well.â The first day of high-level trade talks with China extended into late Thursday afternoon, a sign that talks are making progress and the two sides are proceeding amicably. The last round of high-level talks in Shanghai was broken off early when Chinese and American officials quickly realized that neither side was willing to move far from the positions that had stalled talks back in the spring. President Trump responded by announcing a new round of tariff hikes and China promised retaliation. On Thursday morning, it seemed talks might again be on the verge of a breakdown before they had even begun. The South China Morning Post reported deputy-level trade talks this week had made no progress and that Chinese Vice Premier Liu He would leave after the first day of what were scheduled to be two days of talks. President Donald Trump, however, appears to have rescued the talks by announcing that he would host Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at the White House on Friday.  This afternoon lunch was delivered to the negotiators and the talks extended into the early evening.  There have been a number of reports in the media suggesting that the Trump administration may be open to a partial deal, perhaps around the idea of a currency pact. That could involve China agreeing to not allow its currency to fall below a specified range in exchange for the U.S. lifting the âcurrency manipulatorâ label and possibly easing back on existing tariffs or not implementing hikes scheduled for later this year.

articles.title: EXCLUSIVE: Rep. Jim Banks Seeks Retraction and Correction from NPR for Fake News
articles.subtitle: Rep. Jim Banks (R-IN) has sent a letter to National Public Radio (NPR) asking for a retraction and correction for its âdisingenuousâ article claiming that the lawmaker had provided false information in an interview with the taxpayer-funded media outlet about the Democratsâ efforts to impeach President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: In an October 2 interview with All Things Considered host Michel Martin, Banks called out Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA), chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, for leading what Banks described as a âpolitical impeachment.â At the end of the interview article NPR posted on its website, Martin added commentary criticizing Banksâ remarks. âWe feel we must note that Congressman Banks did not accurately describe The New York Times reporting about Congressman Schiff and the whistleblowerâs complaint,â Martin said. âThe Times quoted a spokesman for Congressman Schiff who said Schiff never saw any part of the complaint or knew precisely what the whistleblower would deliver.â And as Breitbart News reported, the Washington Post called out Schiff for his dishonesty: The Washington Postâs âFact Checkerâ column hit House Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff (D-CA) with four PinocchiosÂ Friday for falsely claiming that his panel had ânot spoken directlyâ with the partisan CIA officer behind a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint about President Donald Trump. Then NPR sent out its public editor, Elizabeth Jensen, to not only accuse Banks of inaccurate remarks, but promote the idea that the news outlet should use only pre-taped interviews instead of live ones so that it could edit them before they were aired. Banks addressed his letter seeking a retraction and correction to Edith Chapin, vice president and executive editor of NPR, and ccâd all Republicans in the House and the Senate: In fact, it is Mrs. Jensenâs article that spreads misinformation. The premise of the article, that I mischaracterized Adam Schiffâs relationship with the whistleblower, is false. I request that NPR publish an article correcting her âcorrection.â After a rambling introduction that takes well over half of the article and repeatedly alludes to âerrorsâ and âmisinformationâ in the October 2 interview, Mrs. Jensen finally presents her account of my supposed lie. Apparently, I am guilty of âincorrectly asserting that Schiff had âliedâ about his role in the whistleblower complaint.â Mrs. Jensen then adds â(Iâm not going to repeat the entire incorrect statement.)â, as if my claims were so vulgar and salacious as to be unworthy of reprint. If she had included my full remarks, well-informed readers would see that everything I said about Adam Schiff is true. And demonstrably so. I stated the following three facts, which are taken directly from the interview transcript, and which Mrs. Jensen claims are false: âAdam Schiff knew about the whistleblower. The whistleblower came to Chairman Schiff and to the intelligence committee even though he lied about it and said that heâd never spoken directly to the whistleblower. We now know that he was part of orchestrating the whistleblower account to begin with.â Banks points out in the letter that on the same day of the NPR interview, the New York Times ran a story âdetailing how the whistleblower spoke with a House Intelligence Committee aide about the Trump-Zelensky phone call before the whistleblower filed an official complaint.â He also said Schiff made the same false claim in an interview on MSNBC. âDuring a September 17, interview on âMorning Joeâ Adam Schiff stated, âWe have not directly spoken with the whistleblower.â This, as the New York Times report proved, is untrue,â Banks wrote. âSo, Chairman Schiff, like Mrs. Jensen, did, in fact, âlie about it,ââ Banks wrote. Banks then nailed down the final true statement he made in the interview: Regarding my final claim, the New York Times story reports that Chairman Schiffâs aide counseled the whistleblower to find legal representation and then file a formal complaint with an inspector general. In accordance with the stafferâs advice, the whistle-blower hired attorneys Andrew Bakaj and Mark Zaid, and submitted a complaint to Inspector General Michael Atkinson. Additionally, on September 10, 2019 Chairman Schiff sent a public letter to acting Director of National Intelligence, Joseph Maguire, calling for him to turn over a then little-known whistleblower complaint to the House Intelligence Committee. According to the New York Times report, Maguireâs staff was âpuzzledâ by the aggressive, public campaign, as such negotiations are typically conducted privately.Â  The Chairmanâs unusual decision was clearly motivated by his firsthand knowledge of the whistleblowersâ grievance. So, Chairman Schiff did play a clear role in âorchestrating the whistleblower account.â Banks also called out NPR for claiming it interviews more Democrats than Republicans because members of the GOP wonât agree to be interviewed. âBut she never asks why they might hesitate to appear on NPR. The lack of self-awareness is astounding,â Banks wrote. âRepublicans have come to expect the biased, deceptive, and self-serving behavior embodied by Mrs. Jensenâs article. Its publication simply served to remind conservatives that NPR will not treat us fairly.â âWithin NPRâs newsroom, it seems Mrs. Jensenâs stance towards my interview is a typical one,â Banks wrote. âWhen a listener tweeted âJim Banks spouting clear lies on NPR and he got no pushback. Why?â âAll things Consideredâ host Mary Louise Kelly replied, âDonât believe Iâve ever interviewed Jim Banks but when I do, Iâll look forward to pressing him for evidence.ââ âShe will not be interviewing me anytime soon, but luckily Mrs. Kelly can find the âevidenceâ she seeks by reading this letter, or the original New York Times report,â he wrote. Banks concludes his letter by reminding NPR that as a taxpayer-funded media outlet it has âa special responsibility to remain evenhandedâ even while acknowledging that all of public broadcasting has a long history of political bias to the left. âBut, if you retract and issue a correction to Mrs. Jensenâs disingenuous article, NPR will have taken a step towards basic standards of journalistic integrity,â Banks wrote. âAnd if you sincerely do wish to book Republican lawmakers, they may be more likely to accept your request.â Follow Penny Starr on Twitter.

articles.title: WatchâTexas Sheriff: Illegal Alien âDrunks Will Run over Your Childrenâ if Released by Sanctuary Cities
articles.subtitle: Texas Sheriff Bill Waybourn warned law enforcement agencies against shielding illegal aliens from deportation with sanctuary policies, saying those who have been arrested for drunk driving will ârun over your childrenâ if released from custody.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: During a press conference at the White House, Tarrant County, Texas Sheriff Bill Waybourn said local jurisdictions must not be forced to release criminal illegal aliens from custody by federal judges. Waybourn said: If these people want to change things, Capital Hill is down the street, and thatâs where theyâre changed at. Theyâre not the policymakers. And people often get confused with that. But grilling down just a little bit in Tarrant County, Texas, itâs the 15th largest county in the nation, is this morning we had 4,200 inmates out of that 7 percent were illegal aliens. And they were being held for such offenses as murder, sexual assault of children â there was about 70 of them â and so, and there were robbers in there and kidnappers and people who committed arson and people who were DWI. [Emphasis added] And out of that, you know, you think about that if we returned them with this radical ruling out of California where you have a federal judge making law for the nation, or attempting to, it will put our communities in jeopardy. Of those people that we have in custody, we know for a fact that 72 percent of them are repeat offenders. So if we have to turn them loose or they get released theyâre coming back to your neighborhood in my neighborhood. These drunks will run over your children, and they will run over my children. And if that happens, I know that you will want, and certainly, I would want for you, the full force of the law and immigration is part of that full force. These people have come into the country illegally. [Emphasis added] Waybourn said illegal alien children are often the victims of illegal alien sex offenders in Tarrant County, noting that his sheriffâs office works with the victims to prosecute the perpetrator. âAnd the people that we have in jail, are here illegally in the first place,â Waybourn said. âThen they commit an offense against one of our citizens. And often, some people from their own community. For instance, aggravated sexual assault on children are not children who are legally here, they are their children that are here illegally. Unfortunately, those people are crying out, and weâre taking care of them and treating them as victims.â Every year, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents arrest tens of thousands of illegal aliens who have been convicted of drunk driving, often killing Americans in the process, and illegal alien sex offenders. In 2018, alone, ICE agents arrestedÂ 54,630 illegal aliens convicted of drunk driving. Another nearly 5,000 illegal alien sex offenders were arrested, along with 1,641 illegal aliens who had been convicted of murder. Watch the full ICE press conference here: John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Saved in America Founder: Open Border Helps Cartel Sex-Traffickers Abduct Our Children
articles.subtitle: An unsecured U.S.-Mexico border endangers American children by assistingÂ Mexican drug cartels engaged in child sex-trafficking, explained Joseph Travers, founder ofÂ Saved in America, in a Thursday interview on SiriusXMâsÂ Breitbart News DailyÂ with host Alex Marlow.
articles.author: Robert Kraychik
articles.content: Saved in America is a volunteer organization composed of retired military personnel and law enforcement who help authorities find and rescue missing children. Unsecured regions of the southern border have become major child sex-trafficking routes, Travers explained. âThe second-largest child sex-trafficking corridor sector is San Diego County because the largest trafficking sector is San Diego County. Texas is number one,â he said. âSo youâre with me that a secure border is actually a humanitarian thing because it does keep kids safer?â Marlow asked. âAbsolutely. One hundred percent,â Travers responded. LISTEN:  Human trafficking â including child sex-trafficking â is a criminal enterprise dominated by transnational drug cartels, Travers said. He recalled his organizationâs role in assisting the recovery of a 14-year-old American girl in Mexico who had been abducted by a Mexican gang member and smuggled across the southern border. âA 29-year-old gang member affiliated with the Mexican mafia got ahold of [the 14-year-old American girl] and her social networking through one of her friends and saw that the young girl was posting [about] her problems,â Travers said. â[He] befriended her, unbeknownst to [her] mom, and this person lured her.Â  [He] told her, âYou need to come with me. Iâll take care of you,â and [made] all these promises â¦ and [spoke of] how much affection he had for her.Â So one day the mom went to go take the 14-year-old to school, the window was open, and she was gone. He had plied her up with drugs and taken her down to Mexico, and we had to find her in Mexico and coordinate her rescue, and now heâs in jail.â Travers linked his professional background as a Los Angeles police officer to his decision to found Saved in America. âMy background is obviously police investigation and private investigation,â Travers said.Â  âThe motivation for us to do this is, as the founder, I was listening to [the story of a] young girl named Brittanee Drexel from upstate New York that went missing, and I was wondering, âWhat happened?â and I knew from working narcotics in Los Angeles that there formed what weâll call an evil triad of street gang members, prison gang members, and the cartel that took over the narcotics-trafficking trade in this country.â Around 2009, âthis same triad decided to take over child sex-trafficking,â Travers explained. âRight after that, I read an article about United States Navy SEALs overseas rescuing children. So I got a hold of these guys and I said, âHey, why donât you come out here and weâll put cops together with special operators, and for free, weâll go help find these children?'â âThe way kids are taken in this country, itâs not like the movie Taken,â Traver said. âThese gang members and gang member recruiters lure young girls through social media networking away from their homes and ply them up with drugs, up to and including heroin. And thatâs how they traffic our children.â âItâs coercion,â he said. âTheyâre coerced.â He cited a study conducted in San Diego County which showed that âthereâs at least one gang member recruiter or trafficker in every middle school and high schoolâ in the county. Child predators often use social media to target vulnerable young girls from troubled backgrounds, Travers explained. âThey look for a young girl who might be going through some type of trauma, like [parental] divorce, a death in the family, a break-up with a friend or something. Then â¦ they befriend the child [via] social networking and social networking applications to have conversations with the child that the parent has no idea [are occurring], and then one day the parent goes to get the child to take them to school, and the childâs gone. Theyâre missing.â Forensic analysis of missing childrenâs internet behavior is critical in determining the nature of their disappearances, Travers said. âIt appears to the normal police officer is that itâs a runaway, but in fact, the answer lies in the social networking of the child, that she was seduced outside of the family and thatâs how they traffic them.â Travers highlighted the volume of missing children â including those being trafficked â across America. âThis is a problem across the country,â determined Travers. âAccording to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children, there [are] about 300,000 missing children in our country at any one time. Now, if you take another statistic that 30 to 40 percent of these 300,000 children are being trafficked â weâre talking 100,000 children in our country [who] are being sex-trafficked, who are being enslaved by organized crime.â Saved in America accepts donations. Breitbart News Daily broadcasts live on SiriusXM Patriot 125 weekdays from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. Eastern. Follow Robert Kraychik on Twitter.

articles.title: Sanders: Iâll Pass âVery Broadâ Legislation Prohibiting Discrimination on the Basis of Sexual Orientation
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: During an interview with CNN on Thursday, 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Senator Bernie Sanders (I-VT) stated that âwe cannot now use the argument that it is my religious belief that if youâre gay, I will not sell you a cake,â and vowed that if elected, he would pass âvery broad and sweeping legislationâ barring âdiscrimination against anybody because of their sexual orientation.â Sanders said, âI am very worried about the right wing in this country now using the argument of freedom of religion to force discrimination.
