We all believe in freedom of religion. Weâre all proud Americans, everybody has the right to practice their own religion. But we cannot now use the argument that it is my religious belief that if youâre gay, I will not sell you a cake, or I will â if you are black, it is my religious belief you canât come into my store, if youâre Jewish, or whatever. Weâve gone way, way beyond that. And it worries me very much that there is a strong movement trying to bring â under the guise of freedom of religion, racism, and sexism, and homophobia back into this â.â He later added, âWe would pass federal legislation that makes it clear, absolutely clear that it is illegal to prohibit â to have discrimination against anybody because of their sexual orientation. Thatâs clear, and it would be very broad and sweeping legislation, at work and any other capacity of life.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: Sesame Street Tackles Opioid Crisis with Character Whose Mother Struggles with Addiction
articles.subtitle: The enduring childrenâs show Sesame Street is tackling the opioid crisis with a character whose mother is struggling with an addiction.
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: Sesame Workshop, which is behind the show, said the new initiative features Karli, a six-and-a-half year-old Sesame Street Muppet âwhose mom is dealing with addiction.â The organization didnât specify the nature of the characterâs health problems, saying only that the issue will be explored through an ongoing series of videos and other content.  âFavorite Sesame StreetÂ characters like Elmo and Abby Cadabby learn what Karli is going through and help their friend to cope,â Sesame Workshop said in its announcement on Wednesday.  Sesame Street first introduced Karli in May as the face of the Sesame Street in Communities foster care initiative. The new addiction storyline explains that Karliâs was placed in foster care because her mother had to go away for treatment, though now sheâs in recovery. The show saidÂ there are 5.7 million children under the age of 11 â one in eight children â who live in households with a parent who has a substance abuse disorder. It said one in three of these children will enter foster care due to parental addiction, a number that risen by more than 50% in the past decade. Opioid used can take many forms, including addiction toÂ Chinese-supplied fentanyl, Mexican heroin and U.S-made prescription opioid drugs. Nearly 1 million prime-age Americans were dragged out of the 2015 labor force due to addiction to these substances, according to a report last year from theÂ American Action Forum, a business-first advocacy group. After decades on PBS, Sesame Street moved to HBO in 2015, with repeats still available on PBS. Last week, it was announced that beginning with its 51st season, the show will debut on HBO Max, the new Warner Media streaming service that is set to launch in 2020. Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Fashion Notes: Melania Trump Is Cozy Chic in Cashmere Dress by The Row
articles.subtitle: First Lady Melania Trump was cozy and chic for a gathering at the White House for her âBe Bestâ campaign where she warned of the dangers of e-cigarettes and vaping.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: Mrs. Trump spoke to American teenagers and high school students at the White House on Wednesday, wearing a cashmere knit dress by The Row â the American fashion brand of Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen, known for its minimalism and oversized knitwear. The Row dress was paired with pale pink snakeskin pointed toe stilettos by Manolo Blahnik, Mrs. Trumpâs most beloved shoe designer. âThank you to the @truthinitiative teens for joining me today & sharing your experiences w/vaping. It exposed just how invasive these dangerous products have become in our schools & communities. Iâm listening & will continue tackling this important issue. #BeBest,â Melania Trump wrote on Instagram. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Illegal Alien Accused of Rape Released by Oklahoma Sanctuary County
articles.subtitle: An illegal alien accused of raping a woman in Oklahoma County, Oklahoma, was released back into the general public by local law enforcement, according to the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agency.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: Antonio Ulises Perez, a 38-year-old illegal alien from El Salvador, was first arrested by theÂ Oklahoma County Sheriffâs Office on September 30 and charged with first-degree rape. While Perez was in local custody, ICE agents interviewed him on October 8 and requested that police hold him until he could be turned over to federal immigration officials. Instead, according to ICE, the Oklahoma County Sheriffâs Office released Perez from custody on October 9 and he immediately returned to the home of the woman he is accused of raping. âIt is unconscionable that someone who is sworn to uphold the law would find it acceptable to release an alleged rapist who is illegally present in the U.S. back into the community when there are other options available under federal immigration law,â ICE official Marc Moore said in a statement. âWithin a few hours of being released, this illegal alien was back at the home of the rape victim where he was free to re-victimize her and harm other members of the community,â Moore said. The same day Perez was released from local custody, ICE agents tracked him down in Oklahoma City and arrested him. He is currently in federal custody pending his immigration court proceeding. ICE officials said that as of late, the Oklahoma County Sheriffâs Office has decided to stop honoring ICE detainers, which request that criminal illegal aliens are held in local custody until federal officials can transfer them into their custody. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.author: Tony Lee
articles.content:
Stay tuned to Breitbart News for live updates. All times eastern. â 10:30 PM: Trump predicts the best is yet to come for Minnesota as he concludes another raucous rally. Heâll head to Louisiana tomorrow evening for another. 10:25 PM: Trump: âThe Iron Range is back in business.â He spoke about mineral restoration in the Superior National Forest. 10:21 PM: Trump calls on Pelosi to pass legislation instead of being preoccupied with ânonsense.â Trump says Chinaâs supply chain that was once âunbreakableâ is not âbreaking wide openâ since he got into office. 10:05 PM: After ripping Democrats on border security, Trump says Democrats who have long wanted the wall donât want the wall just because he wants the wall. He says he should have said he didnât want the wall to get funding for it. Trump now talking about ending âendless wars.â He talks about how the toughest thing he has to do is write unique letters to the families of the fallen and he says âitâs time to bring them home.â Trump says the Kurds and Turks have been fighting for centuries and Obama âartificiallyâ got America in the conflict. He says going into the âquicksandâ of the Middle East was the greatest mistake the country has ever made. 9:56 PM: Trump rips Minnesotaâs leaders for bringing refugees from Somalia without regard to what local communities were feeling and considering how it would impact schools, etc. 9:54 PM: Trump invites the cops who support him on stage and salutes them! 9:45 PM: Trump reminiscing about 2016. "How do you have such a person representing you in Minnesota? I'm very angry at you people right now," Trump said of Omar. "She is a disgrace to our country and she is one of the big reasons that I am going to win and the Republican party is going to win Minnesota." â Courtney Subramanian (@cmsub) October 11, 2019  9:25 PM: Crowd chants âDonald! Donald!â after Trump says he wishes some of his friends would call him âDonaldâ instead of âMr. President.â Trump again makes a joke about â16 more years.â Trump says he gives away his salary ($450,000) but if some random guy from the Middle East stays at his hotel, the media say âemoluments!â âItâs the craziest thing Iâve ever seen,â Trump says, adding that it has cost him a billion dollars being president. 9:19 PM: Trump says it would be so much easier to âbow and bendâ to the Washington swamp. He adds Biden allowed China to rip us off and Obama let Biden allow China to ârob us blind.â 9:08 PM: Trump mocks Pelosi, says keeps going because of the media even though she knows the Ukraine text doesnât warrant impeachment.  Trump says Democrats do not think illegally crossing the border is a crime but a âbeautiful callâ with a foreign leader is a crime. He says Democrats are âon a crusade to destroy our democracy.â âWe will never let it happen, we will defeat them,â Trump says before mocking the âcrazyâ Democrats. 9:05 PM: Trump now ripping âCrooked Adam Schiffâ for âmaking up a fake conversation that never happened.â âIt was a total fraud,â Trump says. âThese people are sick. Iâm telling you, theyâre sick.â 9:01 PM: Trump says he is âenergizedâ because âwe are draining the swamp.â And Trump says the impeachment process will a âbacklashâ at the ballot box, âthe likes of which they have never, ever seenâ before in the countryâs history. He predicts a historic turnout in November 2020. He says his phone call with the president of Ukraine was âperfectâ and he had to release the text of the call because the Democrats put out a âphony narrative.â 8:58 PM: Trump now makes fun of Lisa Page and Peter Strozk. He rips the phony suppression polls that are no better than phony writers. Trump says he could do the greatest thing in history and the media will make it look bad. He says if he does something âneutral,â the media will call for the electric chair.  8:53 PM: Trump says the pursuit of a âpro-American agendaâ has âenraged the failed ruling classâ of Washington, DC. He says it is not easy to get âthese corrupt politiciansâ who got rich âbleeding America dryâ out. He says that is why, from day one, the âwretched Washington swamp has been trying to nullifyâ the democratic results of the 2016 election. Trump says they want to erase your vote, your voice, and your future. He says they will fail because in America, âthe people rule again.â Trump says just 19 minutes after he took the oath of office, the Washington Post published a story about how the âcampaign to impeach President Trumpâ has begun. Trump says they werenât playing games. Trump is right. Here's the Washington Post story from January 20, 2017, published at 12:19pm, 19 minutes after @RealDonaldTrump was sworn in. #TrumpMinneapolis https://t.co/GrBMP3r6mv â Andrew Clarkð (@AndrewHClark) October 11, 2019  8:51 PM: Trump says America has the number one economy anywhere in the world âand itâs not even close.â He says he is trying to make a deal with China. Trump says America has picked up trillions of dollars in value while China has lost trillions of dollars in value. Trump says had Clinton won the election, China would be the top economy in the world. He says right now âthey are not even close.â 8:50 PM: Trump: âWe are going to win this state in a very short period of time.â Trump says âthis feels like the day before the election.â Trump says nearly 100,000 people wanted to come to the rally. 8:45 PM: Trump takes the stage as the Main Event is about the start. Crowd chants âUSA!â Overflow crowd outside as well:  8:30 PM: Vice President Mike Pence taking the stage to introduce Trump. Pence says Minnesota and America need four more years of Trump in the White House. He speaks about three years of actions, results, and âpromises made, promises keptâ and lists off the administrationâs accomplishments re: the economy, energy. He also says cops know that âTrumpâs for cops.â Pence says itâs going to take âat least four more years to drain the swampâ and rips the âdo-nothing Democrats in Washington, DC.â He says the Democrats have been taken over by âradical leftistsâ who want high taxes, open borders, late-term abortions, and socialist policies that will crush the economy. He says Democrats have spent the last three years, along with the media, trying to overturn the results of the 2016 election. articles.title: Watch Live: President Donald Trump Holds Campaign Rally in Minneapolis
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump is holding a campaign rally at 8 p.m. EST Thursday in Minneapolis, Minnesota.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: Trump is hoping to win Minnesota in his 2020 re-election bid â a state that he lost to Hillary Clinton by only 44,000 votes. Trump could weigh in on the Democratâs impeachment inquiry given this is the first rally the president has held since Nancy Pelosi announced the move. While Pelosi said the inquiry is proceeding, the House has yet to vote on a formal impeachment resolution â the first step ahead of drafting Articles of Impeachment, which would trigger a trial in the Senate. Livestream courtesy of Right Side Broadcasting Network. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter

articles.title: Cory Booker: SCOTUS Trying to Roll Back Civil Rights, Voting Rights, LGBTQ Rights
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Thursdayâs broadcast of CNNâs town hall on LGBTQ issues 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ) said the Supreme Court of the United States is attempting to roll back civil rights. Booker said, âI will not wait for the Supreme Court because with the right-wing justices that this president has appointed, theyâre not just looking to roll back LGBTQ rights, but we see it already,Â  a rollback of civil rights. A rollback of voting rights. A rollback weâre seeing across this country because of federal judges on a womanâs right to control their own body, and so we have got to make sure we enshrine everything from Roe v. Wade to the Voting Rights Act.â He added, âWe need to do legislation in Congress once and for all, and the Equality Act is essential. It is essential that nowhere in America, right now, the majority of states in America, you can post your pictures of your wedding on your Facebook page, but the next day you can be fired just because you are gay. That goes against every one of our core values in this nation, and we are not free when we swear an oath, all of us, swear an oath that weâll be a nation for liberty and justice for all. those are aspirational words right now until every LGBTQ American has equal rights, and I will get the Equality Act passed and into law in our country.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: âWhistleblowerâ Lawyer Confirms: Client Had âContact with Presidential Candidatesâ
articles.subtitle: The lawyers representing the âwhistleblowerâ at the center of the impeachment inquiry conceded Wednesday they âhad come into contact with presidential candidates from both parties.â
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content: Attorneys Mark Zaid and Andrew Bakaj, however, insisted in a statement that the whistleblowerâs relationship with the politicians was limited to their role as âelected officials,â not as candidates. The statement came after the Washington Examiner reported that the âwhistleblowerâ worked âor had some type of professional relationshipâ with a 2020 Democrat candidate. Citing anonymous sources, the Examiner noted that Michael Atkinson, the intelligence community inspector general (ICIG), made the revelation about the âwhistleblowerâsâ relationship with the candidate in testimony before congressional investigators. Zaid and Bakaj asserted that the whistleblower âhas never worked for or advised a political candidate, campaign, or party.âÂ The lawyers, however, left open the possibility that the leaker did advise a current 2020 Democratic presidential candidate before his or her run for office. Two âwhistleblowersâ have accused President Donald Trump of improperly leveraging U.S. aid to Ukraine in return for it investigating Joe Biden and his son, Hunter. The âwhistleblowersâ claim Trump made a quid pro quo offer during a July 25 call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. Both Trump andÂ Zelensky, however, have denied the âwhistleblowerâ characterization of their conversation. Zaid and Bakaj wrote in a statement issued Wednesday: In light of the ongoing efforts to mischaracterize whistleblower # 1âs alleged âbiasâ in order to detract from the substance of the complaint, we will attempt to clarify some facts. First, our client has never worked for or advised a political candidate, campaign, or party. Second, our client has spent their entire government career in apolitical, civil servant positions in the Executive Branch. Third, in these positions, our client has come into contact with presidential candidates from both parties in their roles as elected officials â not as candidates. Fourth, the whistleblower voluntarily provided relevant career information to the ICIG in order to facilitate an assessment of the credibility of the complaint. The lawyers went on to deem the original âwhistleblowerâsâ complaint âurgent and credible.â News reports have identified the original âwhistleblowerâ as a âregistered Democrat.â The New York Times (NYT) revealedÂ the âwhistleblowerâ shared his complaint with a Democrat-led House panel before reaching out to the IC inspector general, a move thatÂ suggestsÂ he violated the law. âThe whistleblower is not the story. To date, virtually every substantive allegation has been confirmed by other sources,â the whistleblowerâs lawyers said in the statement. âFor that reason the identity of the whistleblower is irrelevant.â House Democrats are reportedly considering having the original whistleblower testify remotely with the face and voice obscured to keep the identity hidden from Republican lawmakers and staffers. So far, House Democrats have carried out the impeachment investigation behind closed doors. The lawyers representing the âwhistleblowersâ have maintained relationships with Democrats and expressed ardently anti-Trump sentiment. Their law firm â Compass Rose Legal Group â was so desperate to find Trump administration informants that they previously offered discounted pricing to those who come forward. Zaid co-founded Whistleblower Aid, a small nonprofit that blasted advertisements around the nationâs capital actively seeking leakers during the Trump administration. One of the lawyers representing the âwhistleblowersâ â Charles McCulloughÂ â is a former staffer for Democrat Sens. Chuck Schumer and Hillary Clinton. He also served as the intelligence community IG at the height of the Clinton email scandal. McCullough âreported directlyâ to James Clapper when the CNN analyst served as the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) under the previous administration, the attorneyâs professional biography revealed.

articles.title: Report: Whistleblower Worked with Joe Biden at Obama White House
articles.subtitle: Democrat presidential hopeful and former Vice President Joe Biden had a âprofessionalâ tie to the CIA Whistleblower, according to a report from the Washington Examiner, which includes statements from intelligence officers and former White House officials.
articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.content: After two separate reports from the New York Times, the Washington ExaminerÂ has established the whistleblower âis a career CIA analyst who was detailed to the National Security Council at the White House and has since left.â A now-retired CIA officer told the Washington Examiner, âFrom everything we know about the whistleblower and his work in the executive branch then, there is absolutely no doubt he would have been working with Biden when he was vice president.â The Washington Examiner noted: As an experienced CIA official on the NSC with the deep knowledge of Ukraine that he demonstrated in his complaint, it is probable that the whistleblower briefed Biden and likely that he accompanied him on Air Force Two during at least one of the six visits the 2020 candidate made to the country. A former Trump administration official also spoke with theÂ Washington Examiner and claimed Bidenâs work on foreign affairs put him in the whistleblowerâs circle either at the CIA or at the White House. âThis person, after working with Biden, may feel defensive towards him because he feels [Biden] is being falsely attacked. Maybe he is even talking to Bidenâs staff,â the former Trump administration official stated. âMaybe it is innocent, maybe not.â âThe Whistleblowerâs facts have been so incorrect about my âno pressureâ conversation with the Ukrainian President, and now the conflict of interest and involvement with a Democrat Candidate, that he or she should be exposed and questioned properly,â President Donald Trump wrote Wednesday on Twitter.  In a statement to members of Congress, Michael Atkinson, the Intelligence Communityâs inspector general, said the whistleblower had a âprofessionalâ tie to a 2020 Democrat presidential hopeful. Atkinson also said the whistleblowerâs complaint shows âsome indicia of an arguable political bias â¦ in favor of a rival political candidate.â Follow Kyle on Twitter @RealKyleMorris and Facebook.

articles.title: Study: Health Care for Illegal Aliens Would Cost America $23 Billion a Year
articles.subtitle: A plan from 2020 Democrats to provide free, American taxpayer-funded health care to all illegal aliens living in the United States would cost up to $23 billion a year, a new study finds.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: In June, the majority of 2020 Democrats running for president â including Joe Biden, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), and Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) â endorsed a plan that would force American taxpayers to provide free health care to all 11 to 22 million illegal aliens in the U.S. and anyone else who crosses the southern border. The latest study by Center for Immigration Studies (CIS) researchers reveals that providing health care to all illegal aliens would cost American taxpayers up to $23 billion a year should every illegal alien enroll. This total includes at least 2.5 million low-income illegal aliens and their children who would cost almost $13 billion a year, alone, to be given health care. (Center for Immigration Studies) Even if only about five million illegal aliens enroll in federal subsidies for health care, American taxpayers would be forced to foot a $10.4 billion bill every year, CIS researchers conclude. Overall, providing taxpayer-funded health care to each illegal alien costs Americans about $4,600 a year. With a scenario in which higher-income illegal aliens are enrolled in Obamacare and poorer illegal aliens take Medicaid, that plan would still cost Americans nearly $20 billion a year assuming every illegal alien enrolls. Based on current enrollment trends, a lower enrollment rate among illegal aliens would nonetheless cost Americans $10.7 billion a year. Previously, Breitbart News estimated, based on CIS analysis, that providing illegal aliens with taxpayer-funded health care would cost Americans about $66 billion every year and $660 billion every decade. This assumed that every illegal alien enrolled and each cost $3,000 to insure. While 2020 Democrats have made giving health care to illegal aliens â paid for by U.S. taxpayers â a priority, experts have said that such a policy would drive âstrong incentives for people with serious health problems to enter the country or remain longer than their visas allow in order to get government-funded care.â The latest Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll finds that the 2020 Democratsâ health care for illegal aliens plan is the most unpopular policy position thus far in the race for president with opposition from 62 percent of all likely voters. Today, Americans are forced to subsidize aboutÂ $18.5 billionÂ of yearly medical costs for illegal aliens living in the U.S., according to estimates by Chris Conover, formerly of the Center for Health Policy and Inequalities Research at Duke University. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Biden: Sex Reassignment Surgery âCovered,â âViewed as Necessaryâ in Military, Affordable Care Act
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Thursdayâs broadcast of CNNâs town hall on LGBTQ issues 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful former Vice President Joe Biden said if he wins, sex reassignment surgery would be paid for transgender military members. When asked about transgender military service, Biden said, âIf I were president, you would not have to choose. Not a joke. You would not have to choose. The fact of the matter is that weâre in a position where transgender men and women are in a position where they should be able to do anything anybody else in the world can do. There should be no difference. I mean it sincerely. You know, you know, my friend Sarah McBride. Sarah worked for my son as attorney general of the state of Delaware. When Sarah decided it with us time for her to come forward, and she came out. My son, being raised in the same family I was with my dad and the rest, my son, immediately moved to make sure the barriers for transgendered people in Delaware were eliminated because thatâs who we are.â âThere is not a single solitary thing,â he continued. âAnd we should be doing everything from making sure they donât deal with Title IX and cut planned parenthood back and canât have access. There are so many things we did in our administration that increased the prospect of you being able to get every single solitary service you could get, including under the ACA covered by insurance, making sure you have to be, and making sure any surgery that was required would be viewed as necessary. And so the whole thing has to change. I mean, it really does. And by the way, thank you for your tour. My son served a year in Iraq. You served two combat tours, and by the way, guess what? You know weâre going to win this fight? Weâre going to win this fight.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Watch â Trans Activists Disrupt CNN LGBTQ Town Hall
articles.subtitle: âTrans people are dying!â yelled transgender activists who interrupted an audience member asking Democrat presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg a question, during the CNN LGBTQ town hall in Los Angeles, on Thursday.
articles.author: Matt Perdie
articles.content: âItâs okayâ¦ itâs okayâ¦ yo, guys chill out! Guys, relax! Relax!â said host Anderson Cooper, who then expressed sympathies with them:Â âLet me just point out there is a long and proud tradition and history in the gay and lesbian and transgender community of protest and we applaud them for their protest.â âThey are absolutely right to be angry and upset at the lack of attention, particularly in the media, on the lives of transgender[s].â Amanda House contributed to this article.

articles.title: Report: Lindsey Graham Undercut Own Support for Kurds During Prank Call
articles.subtitle: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC), who has criticized President Donald Trumpâs decision to pull U.S. troops out of northern Syrian because of its impact on the Kurds, reportedly privately undercut his own support for the ethnic group during what he believed was a phone call with the Turkish defense minister.
articles.author: Haris Alic
articles.content: As Politico reported on Thursday, Graham was the victim of a prank phone call by two notorious Russian rogues in August. The pranksters, who go by Lexus and Vovan, have tricked a number of high-profile western leaders into taking their calls by pretending to be foreign dignitaries. In Grahamâs case, the duo succeeded in getting the senator on the phone by impersonating Turkish Defense Minister Hulusi Akar. Graham, who sits on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, spent a sizable portion of the call attempting to dissuade Turkey from using the new S-400 anti-aircraft weapons system it purchased from Russia at the objections of the U.S. and NATO. Towards the end of the call, however, the senator also broached the subject of Turkeyâs longstanding âproblemâ with Kurds in northern Syria, even stating the ethnic group was a âthreatâ âYour YPG Kurdish problem is a big problem,â Graham told the pranksters. He was referring to the Kurdish Peopleâs Protection Units, a group that began fighting ISIS as part of the Syrian Democratic Forces in 2015âwith support from the U.S.âbut is considered a terrorist group by Turkey because of its push to establish an autonomous state for the Kurds on the Turkish-Syrian border. âI told President Trump that Obama made a huge mistake in relying on the YPG Kurds,â Graham continued. âEverything I worried about has come true, and now we have to make sure Turkey is protected from this threat in Syria. Iâm sympathetic to the YPG problem, and so is the president, quite frankly.â The comments, as Politico noted, undermine the tough posture Graham has taken in recent days against Trumpâs decision to withdraw U.S. troops from northern Syria and redeploy them elsewhere in the country.Â Graham has argued against such a maneuverer, which involves the redeployment of less than 25 U.S. troops and amounts to an abandonment of the Kurdish forces that have fought against ISIS since at least 2013. In particular, Graham and other backers believe such a redeployment will incentivize Turkey, who has also fought ISIS and Bashar al-Assadâs forces in Syria, to move against the Kurds. To prevent such an action, Graham has threatened to lead Congress in imposing sanctions against Turkey if they were to attack the Kurds. âWhile the Administration refuses to act against Turkey, I expect strong bipartisan support,â Graham said on Wednesday when outlining his plan for sanctions. âMost Members of Congress believe it would be wrong to abandon the Kurds who have been strong allies against ISIS.â

articles.title: Pete Buttigieg: The Right Is Making âGod Smallerâ with Religious Liberty Claims
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: During the broadcast of CNNâs town hall on LGBTQ issues on Thursday, 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful South Bend, IN Mayor Pete Buttigieg argued that by refusing services to gay people as an expression of religious freedom made âGod smaller.â A town hall participant asked, âAs you know in 27 states including my state of Florida, LGBTQ people can be denied service in restaurants and other public spaces based on who they love or who theyâre perceived to love. Restaurant owners can deny service based on so-called religious liberty. As a Christian, can you point to teachings in faith that state things like thouÂ  shall not serve the gays meatloaf in diners or other religious verse that which provides instruction to the faithful to denyÂ services or housing or other services to LGBTQ people â Buttigieg said, âWhat a great question. And without telling others how to worship, the Christian tradition that I belong to instructs me to identify with the marginalized and the greatest thing that any of us has to offer is love.â He continued, âReligious liberty is an important principle in this country and we honor that. Itâs the case that any freedom that we honor in this country has limits when it comes to harming other people. We say that the right to free speech does not include the right to yell fire in a crowded theater. A famous justice said my right to swing my fists ends where somebody elseâs nose begins, and the right to religious freedom ends where religion is being used as an excuse to harm other people.â He added, âWhen religion is used in that way, to me, it makes God smaller. It to me is an insult not only to us as LGBTQ people, but I think itâs an insult to faith to believe that it could be used to hurt people in that way.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Watch: Eric Trump Sparks âLock Him Upâ Chant About Hunter Biden
articles.subtitle: Eric Trump on Thursday evening ripped into Hunter Biden ahead of President Donald Trumpâs re-election rally speech inÂ Minneapolis, prompting attendees to break out into chants of âLock him upâÂ â a play on theÂ âLock her upâ sloganÂ synonymous with failed presidential candidate Hillary Clinton.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: âHow do you think Joe Biden â how do you think his son is feeling right now after embezzling a lot of money, taking a lot of money, the crookedness? Heâs not looking too good either,â Trump said, prompting jeers from the crowd.  One man can then be heard shouting âlock him up,âÂ â seemingly a reference to Hunter Biden, who has faced increased scrutiny over allegations of corruption in China and Ukraine. âMaybe âLock her up,â goes to âLock him up,â Trump responded to the chant, sparking cheers from attendees. âI like âLock her upâ a little bit more,â Trump added, before thanking the audience member for repurposing the famous anti-Clinton slogan. The crowd then broke out in loud chants of âLock him up,â to which Trump responded:Â âWe donât need to lock him up. Weâre just going to beat the hell out of him. Weâre going to win.â  As Breitbart News reported, Hunter Bidenâs investment company scored aÂ $1.5 billion investment dealÂ with the Bank of China after traveling with his father on Air Force Two to the country in 2013. In regard to Ukraine, Hunter Biden was paidÂ $83,000 monthly as a board member of the gas giantÂ Burisma Holdings, despite having no expertise in the energy section. The former vice presidentÂ forced out former Ukrainian prosecutor Viktor Shokin as he was investigating Burisma Holdings and evenÂ boastedÂ to the Council of Foreign Relations last year that he had threatened to withhold $1 billion in U.S. aid unless the prosecutor was fired.

articles.title: ExclusiveâDonald Trump Jr: Impeachment Hysteria Is Really About Taking Away the Future Americans Chose
articles.subtitle: The impeachment circus is about one thing and one thing only: distracting Americans while their government and the future they chose is stolen from them.
articles.author: Donald Trump Jr.
articles.content: By exploiting a leakerâs hearsay to turn an innocuous phone call my father made to his Ukrainian counterpart into grist for the impeachment mill, the Democrats and their allies made their objective transparent: They want the 2020 presidential election to be strictly about this phony controversy. They certainly donât want to contest this administrationâs record in next yearâs election, and they definitely donât want to test my fatherâs popularity with the American people. Theyâd much prefer to leave the outcome of the 2020 election in the hands of the Beltway establishment and the elite-approved media. This Ukraine âscandalâ is merely a vehicle to allow them to do the latter and avoid the former. Let me be clear: There was nothing illegal, improper, or even remotely impeachable about my fatherâs phone call with President Zelensky. Hunter Biden, on the other hand, took a $600,000-a-year job with a notoriously corrupt foreign company despite being woefully unqualified. This was almost certainly due entirely to his fatherâs perceived influence as the Vice President of the United States at the time â the same influence the elder Biden used, by his own admission, to pressure Ukraine into firing the prosecutor investigating his sonâs firm. That needs to be investigated, as does the equally suspicious circumstances surrounding Hunterâs trip to China with his father while Hunter was in the midst of negotiations for $1.5 billion in Chinese cash. Fortunately, Senator Lindsey Graham has pledged to invite Rudy Giuliani to testify before the Senate Judiciary Committee, so weâll soon know a lot more about those shady dealings. Whatever role Ukrainian nationals and firms operating in Ukraine may have played in laying the groundwork for what became the Russiagate hoax also must be investigated. My father has said this, publicly. Attorney General Bill Barr has said this, publicly. His subordinates at the Justice Department have said this, publicly. Why on Earth would anyone be surprised that my father would ask foreign leaders with the ability to assist those investigations to do so? Considering that the same Democrats who are now clamoring for impeachment themselves asked the Ukrainians to assist in investigating my father, how can any of them claim with a straight face that my father acted improperly, let alone call for his impeachment? As Sen. Grahamâs hearings will no doubt reveal, corruption has been endemic in Ukraine for many years. It would have been downright irresponsible for the President of the United States to ignore that issue before handing over hundreds of millions of taxpayer dollars. In short, none of them actually believe this nonsense. The Democrats are simply hoping to tarnish my fatherâs political standing before the voters have to start evaluating the choice between Donald Trump and whichever far-left radical the Democrats nominate to run against him. Indeed, the leftâs hysterical reactions to Ukrainegate are just recitations of the same attacks theyâve been making since before my father was even elected. Deranged lawyer George Conway just wrote a rambling, 11,000+ word opinion article pretending to be a psychologist judging my father as mentally unfit for office. J.W. Verret, who briefly served on my fatherâs transition team, is convinced that Ukrainegate is worse than Watergate â âa lot worse,â in fact. Liberal journalist Paul Brandus goes even further. Not only is my father âmuch worse than Richard Nixon,â Brandus contends that heâs actually a traitor to America! Doesnât this sound familiar? It should. Worse than Watergate? Anyone making that claim this week is obviously slow on the draw. Watergate one-hit wonder Carl Bernstein wasÂ using the âworse than Watergateâ line back in November 2017. One of the men who wound up in prison as a result of Bernsteinâs reporting, John Dean, was convinced that my father had breached the âworse than Watergateâ wall in May 2017, just four months after taking the oath of office. George Conway thinks my father is unfit for his office? The same USA Today editorial board that published Brandusâs âtreasonâ claim broke decades of policy to say the exact same thingÂ â¦ in September 2016, before my father was even elected. Speaking of treason, NBC News was accusing my father of treason in July 2016 â before he was even the Republican nominee â over a joke. It only took another year for the Democrats to accuse me of the same thing without a shred of truth. Yet, they expect you to believe their latest hysterics about a phone call with Ukraine. Itâs a joke, and not a very funny one, at that. Even the people making the claims reveal so much with their own behavior. J.W. Verret â a professor whom the media is presenting as a former Trump supporter won over by the evidence of wrongdoing in Ukrainegate â was calling for impeachment months ago, when this Ukraine âwhistleblowerâ scheme wasnât even a twinkle in Adam Schiffâs eye. Schiff, the Jussie Smollet of American politics, is trying to make this about Ukraine. As I hope you can see, it just doesnât wash. This impeachment farce is solely about preventing a repeat of the greatest political embarrassment in the modern history of the Democratic Party: my fatherâs victory in 2016. The prospect that the Democrats will be able to unseat my father in a fair election are fading fast. Hunter Bidenâs scandals, along with a series of embarrassing gaffes and apparent âsenior momentsâ on the debate stage have crippled the Democratsâ putative front-runner, Joe Biden. The corresponding ascendance of Senator Elizabeth Warren makes it increasingly likely that the Democrats will nominate a candidate from the Partyâs far-left wing, which is woefully out of step with the American mainstream. Democrats evidently feel that the 2020 presidential election cannot be left to chance. They donât want to give the American people the option of making the same âmistakeâ twice. Nothing else adequately explains this impeachment push. Michael Anton famously wrote at the time that 2016 was the âFlight 93â election â the final chance for Americans to regain control over the airplane of state before it fell forever into the hands of Hillary Clinton and her vast network of swamp creatures, who would create conditions under which the people would never be able to choose their own destiny again. Three years ago, Americans rose to the occasion. They chose the future they wanted, and, since January 2017, my father has worked tirelessly to deliver it to them. The would-be impeachers on Capitol Hill are desperately trying, as they have throughout, to take that choice back and ensure that the American people are never given such an opportunity for autonomy again. They are trying to use the Ukraine hoax to override the will of the people, and they arenât even being subtle about it. Donald Trump, Jr. is the Executive Vice President at The Trump Organization.

articles.title: Mainstream Economists Recognize U.S. Jobs Boom from Lasting China Tariffs
articles.subtitle: A recent study that found permanent tariffs on Chinese imports would create more than a million American jobs has won a prestigious national award.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: The Coalition for a Prosperous Americaâs (CPA)Â Chief Economist Jeff Ferry and Senior Economist Steven Byers were given theÂ Edmund A. Mennis Award from theÂ National Association for Business Economics (NABE) for their study finding that permanent tariffs on China would drive an employment boom for American workers. âThe effects of freer trade on the US economy are complex, and often negative for long-term economic growth and income equality,â Ferry said in a statement. âIn this study, we attempted to show that activist trade intervention like tariffs, if implemented correctly, can produce positive results for the US economy.â As Breitbart News reported, the study concluded that a permanent 25 percent tariff on Chinese imports would create about 1.05 million American jobs by 2024 and boost the nationâs GDP by $167 billion.  CPA Chairman Dan DiMicco said the award is further validation from mainstream economists that permanent tariffs on Chinese imports are key to driving U.S. job growth. âThis is a very gratifying honor,â DiMicco said in a statement. âIt validates CPAâs longstanding critique of free trade. Mainstream economists are finally recognizing that faulty China trade has hurt Americaâs workers and domestic manufacturers.â âAs Ferry and Byers have demonstrated, returning production to the United States can provide much needed growth and job creation for the overall economy,â DiMicco said. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: WatchâTrump: Joe Biden âWas Only a Good Vice President Because He Understood How to Kiss Obamaâs Assâ
articles.subtitle: President Trump said Democrat Joe Biden was âonly a good Vice President because he understood how to kissâ former President Obamaâs âassâ in Minneapolis, Minnesota on Thursday.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: During his rally in Minneapolis, Trump called out Biden for his alleged corruption schemes in Ukraine and China, where his son Hunter Biden was paid up toÂ $83,000 a month to sit on a Ukrainian energy companyâs board while his father was Vice President. Trump said: Two months after President Obama put Joe in charge of Ukraine policy â¦ and the press will not write it. They say, âIn totally unsubstantiated chargesâ every time they talk about him, âPresident Trump has said that his son walked away with a fortune, now you know thatâs a totally unsubstantiated charge.â Really? Itâs not unsubstantiated, itâs a fact.â âJoeâs son Hunter got thrown out of the Navy and then he became a genius on Wall Street in about two days,â Trump said. âBy the way, whatever happened to Hunter? Where the hell is he â¦Â Whereâs Hunter?â Speaking directly to Hunter Biden, Trump said Biden was only a good Vice President because he sucked up to Obama. âAnd your father was never considered smart, he was never considered a good Senator, he was only a good Vice President because he understood how to kiss Barack Obamaâs ass,â Trump said to a roaring crowd. Trump noted Hunter Bidenâs deal with the Bank of China that provided him with a $1.5 billion check for his own private business dealings. âAnd then they go to China â¦ and Hunter, whoâs not too smart â¦ he goes in, he has a meeting and walks out with $1.5 billion, billion with a B, $1.5 billion,â Trump said. âNow think of it, whereâs Hunter?â âHunter, you know nothing about energy, you know nothing about China, you know nothing about anything really. Hunter, youâre a loser,â Trump said. âWhy did you get $1.5 billion, Hunter?â As Breitbart Newsâs Haris AlicÂ has reported, questions about why Hunter Biden was appointed to serve on the board of Ukrainian oil companyÂ Burisma in April 2014 have plagued the former vice presidentâs 2020 Democrat presidential primary bid. Breitbart Newsâs Senior Contributor Peter Schweizer has detailed in hisÂ book,Â Secret Empires: How the American Political Class Hides Corruption and Enriches Family and Friends, how Hunter Biden had no experience with the oil and gas industry or the nation of Ukraine before joining Burisma while his father was vice president. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Report: William Barr, Rupert Murdoch Meet Privately as Trump Sours on Fox News
articles.subtitle: Attorney General William Barr and media mogul Rupert Murdoch met privately in New York City on Wednesday evening as President Donald Trump ratchets up his attacks on the Fox News Channel, according to the New York Times.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: The details of their discussion are unknown, as press representatives for the Trump official and chairman of theÂ Fox Corporation refused to comment to the Times. The report comes hours after President Trump ripped into Fox News, owned by Murdoch, for conducting a poll that found a recond 51 percent of voters support his impeachment and removal from office. The president also took aim at several of the networkâs anti-Trump personalities, including legalÂ analystÂ Andrew Napolitano and daytime anchorÂ Shepard Smith. The president wrote on Twitter: From the day I announced I was running for President, I have NEVER had a good @FoxNews Poll. Whoever their Pollster is, they suck. But @FoxNews is also much different than it used to be in the good old days. With people like Andrew Napolitano, who wanted to be a Supreme Court Justice & I turned him down (heâs been terrible ever since), Shep Smith, @donnabrazile (who gave Crooked Hillary the debate questions & got fired from @CNN), & others, @FoxNews doesnât deliver for US anymore. It is so different than it used to be. âOh well, Iâm President!â he added.  The poll comes as House Democrats move swiftly with an impeachment inquiry against President Trump that was launched in the wake of a partisan CIA officerâs so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint claiming the president pressured the leader of Ukraine to look into allegations of corruption againstÂ former vice president and 2020 candidate Joe Biden and his son, Hunter. President Trump and Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky vehemently deny any pressure was applied to look into the Biden family. To underscore no wrongdoing occurred, the White House released a transcript of the July 25th telephone call. President Trumpâs Thursday tweets are not the first time heâs criticized Fox News in recent months. In August, the president blasted the network for letting âmillionsâ of Americans down by allowing Democrat panelists and guests to push their talking points unchallenged. âWe have to start looking for a new News Outlet. Fox isnât working for us anymore!â he tweeted. âJust watched Fox News heavily promoting the Democrats through their DNC Communications Director, spewing out whatever she wanted with zero pushback by anchor, Sandra Smith,â heÂ added.

articles.title: Fact Check: No, the Indictments of 2 Rudy Giuliani Aides Did Not Stem from the Ukraine Call
articles.subtitle: CLAIM: The indictmentÂ Thursday of two businessmen with ties to Rudy Giuliani was related to President Donald Trumpâs July 25 phone call with the President of Ukraine, which is now the subject of an âimpeachment inquiry.â
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content:
On Thursday, federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York unsealed an indictment against four U.S. citizens, three of whom were born abroad. Two of them, Ukrainian-American Lev Parnas and Belarussian-American Igor Fruman, are political neophytes who are accused of passing campaign contributions from a foreign donor to pro-Trump organizations through a fictitious company. They also made other fraudulent individual contributions to politicians they hoped to influence âso as to advance their own personal financial interests and the political interests of Ukrainian government officials, including at least one Ukrainian government official,â the indictment reads. It is believed that these two businessmen were involved in Giulianiâs efforts to investigate the conflict of interest by former Vice President Joe Biden, whose son Hunter was a paid board member of a Ukrainian oil and gas company.

But the indictment does not mention the Giuliani investigation at all. Nor does it mention the Ukraine call itself. The only thing the indictment and the phone call share in common is a mention of the effort to replace the former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine. Paras and Fruman allegedly hoped donations to a âCongressman-1â â later identified in media reports as former Rep. Pete Sessions (R-TX) â would influence him to ask the administration to replace the ambassador. In a statement, Sessions said he approached the State Department, but not because the businessmen asked him to: rather, he said, he was informed by other colleagues that the ambassador was trashing the president. In the White House transcript (or âreadoutâ) of the Ukraine call, the president refers to the ambassador having been removed already, adding that she was âbad news,â as were the âpeople she was dealing with in the Ukraine.â So whatever Parnas and Fruman were doing about the ambassador happened long before the Ukraine call. Likewise, their campaign contributions happened before the call: a watchdog group filed a complaint with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) about Parnas, Fruman, and two unnamed âJohn Doeâ co-conspirators in July 2018, a full year before the phone call between Trump and the new president of Ukraine, who would not be elected for another year. Yet here is how the Associated Press explained the indictments Thursday: âThe indictment contained the first criminal charges stemming from a July 25 phone call in which Trump asked Ukraineâs leader to dig up dirt on Democratic foe Joe Biden and his son.â First of all, Trump did not ask Ukraineâs leader to âdig up dirt.â At the end of a long list of other requests, Trump asked him to work with the U.S. Attorney General and Giuliani to âlook intoâ the circumstances in which Biden had the prosecutor fired while he was apparently investigating his sonâs company.

Second, the charges do not âstemâ from the July 25 phone call. They appear to be independent. One final note: the Southern District of New York has done this before, indicting former Trump lawyer Michael Cohen during the Russian âcollusionâ investigation. The media jumped to the wrong conclusions then. They are doing so again today. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Donald Trump: âIlhan Omar Is an American-Hating Socialistâ
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump ripped into Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-MN) during a âKeep America Greatâ rally in Minneapolis Thursday night, calling her âan America-hating socialist.â
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: Trump asked the crowd âhow the hellâ Omar got elected before calling her âan America-hating socialistâ who âpleaded for compassion for ISIS recruits right here in Minnesota.â âShe minimized the September 11th attack on our homeland where far more than 3,000 people died, saying, âSome people did something, big deal,'â he added. Trump also said that House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) have given far too much control of the Democrat Party to the radical left âincluding Minnesotaâs own Omar,â to which the crowd booed loudly. Trump also ripped into Omarâs history of âantisemitic screeds,â including statements where she said the U.S. support for Israel is âall about the Benjamins'â and said that âpro-Israel lawmakers have an allegiance to a foreign country. âShe is a disgrace to our country,â Trump said, adding that lawmakers like her are the reason he will win in 13 months.

articles.title: Beto OâRourke: Religious Institutions Will Lose Tax Exemption If They Oppose Same-Sex Marriage
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: During the broadcast of CNNâs town hall on LGBTQ issues on Thursday, 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful former Rep.Â Beto OâRourke (D-TX) said religious institutions that do not agree with same-sex marriage would lose their tax-exempt status under his presidency. Don Lemon asked, âThis is from your LGBTQ plan. This is what you write. Freedom of religion is a fundamental right, but it should not be used to discriminate. Do you think religious institutions like colleges, churches, charities, should they lose their tax-exempt status if they oppose same-sex marriage? OâRourke said, âYes. There can be no reward, no benefit, no tax break for anyone or any institution, any organization in America that denies the full human rights, and the full civil rights of every single one of us. And so as president, weâre going to make that a priority, and we are going to stop those who are infringing upon human rights.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: GOP Sen. Kevin Cramer: Illegitimate Impeachment Probe Will âRip this Country Apartâ
articles.subtitle: Appearing Thursday onÂ KVLY-TVâsÂ Point of View with Chris Berg, Sen. Kevin Cramer (R-ND) criticized the House Democratsâ impeachment probe against President Donald Trump as illegitimate and warned it will ârip this country apart.â
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: A partial transcript is as follows: CHRIS BERG: From the Fox News poll, in July 2019, 42 percent of the people who they polled said President Trump should be impeached. Now itâs at 51 percent saying that President Trump should be impeached and removed from office. What say you? SEN. KEVIN CRAMER: I say letâs see where the facts lead, but this is not a legitimate impeachment inquiry. This is unprecedented and not just a political process, it is a partisan political process thatâs completely void of any due process. And in our system, you are entitled to due process. This is a circumstance where the accuser gets to remain anonymous and the accused gets to remain defenseless. Itâs unfair to the president, itâs unfair to the presidency. Itâs an overeach by the Democratic Party in the House of Representatives and they ought to be ashamed of themselves. They want a fast prosecution before it unravels â just like the Mueller investigation. That went so poorly for them, they were so embarrassed by it that this time around that they decided to just try a man by declaring him guilty before they even have the trail, before they even allow due process, before they allow witnesses, before they allow cross-examination or subpoenas by the accused or the accusedâs allies. Itâs a grossly unfair process. This is going to rip this country apart and I believe itâs designed to do exactly that. Itâs designed to undermine the credibility of our country when weâre on the international stage doing big trade deals, involved in geopolitical issues around the world, and the Democrats would rather see America fail than Donald Trump succeed. They should be ashamed of themselves.

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Applauds Transgender 9-Year-Old, Suggests Child Help Choose Education Secretary
articles.subtitle: Democrat presidential hopeful Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) applauded a nine-year-old child who claims to be transgender during Thursday nightâs CNN Equality Town Hall, and she suggested that the child assist her with choosing her education secretary, should she be elected.
articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.content: âMy name is Jacob, and I am a nine-year-old transgender American,â Jacob Lemay said to applause from Elizabeth Warren and the audience. âWhat will you do in your first week as president to make sure kids like me feel safer in schools, and what do you think schools need to do better to make sure that I donât have to worry about anything but my homework?â âLet me start by saying I want to have a secretary of education who both believes in public education and believes in the value of every one of our kids and is willing to enforce our civil rights laws,â Warren said. âWeâve had some secretaries of education whoâve been better, and weâve had one thatâs been a whole lot worse,â she added. âHer name is Betsy DeVos. So, when Iâm president, sheâll be gone.â Before closing, Warren indicated that she would like to have Jacob vet who she chooses as the secretary of education in her administration. âI want to make sure that the person I think is the right secretary of education meets you and hears your story, and then I want you to tell me if you think thatâs the right person and then weâll make the deal,â Warren said. Jacob smiled and gave Warren a thumbs up as he took his seat. Follow Kyle on Twitter @RealKyleMorris and Facebook.

articles.title: Klobuchar: My Justices Will âUnderstandâ Constitution âFounded on a Separation of Church and Stateâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: During a CNN town hall on Thursday, 2020 presidential candidate Senator Amy Klobuchar (D-MN) stated that the Constitution has âbeen founded on a separation of church and state.â And âthe law rules when it comes to discrimination and all kinds of other things.â She further vowed that if she is elected, âI will appoint Supreme Court justices that understand that.â Klobuchar said, âFirst of all, our Constitution, as you know, has been founded on a separation of church and state. And we can have different faiths in this country, but the law rules, and the law rules when it comes to discrimination and all kinds of other things. And I can just tell you that I will appoint Supreme Court justices that understand that.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: Mitch McConnell Challenger Raises $10.7 Million in Third Quarter
articles.subtitle: Amy McGrath, the top Democrat challenging Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell in the 2020 Kentucky Senate race, raised nearly $11 million in the third quarter of 2019.
articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.content: McGrath, who lost a House race in 2018 to an incumbent Republican, launched her campaign in July and raised $2.5 million within the first 24 hours of doing so. According to her campaign, McGrath received 299,000 contributions, with the average donation being $36. McGrathâs third-quarterÂ fundraising total outpaces that of several presidential candidates, such as Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), who raised $4.8 million in the third quarter, and Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ), who raised $6 million in the third quarter. In a statement, Mark Nickolas, McGrathâs campaign manager, claimed, âChange is coming.â âMitch McConnell has never faced an opponent like Amy McGrath. Not only does a new independent poll show the race tied, but more than a quarter-million grassroots donations-from all 120 Kentucky counties-have provided us a record-shattering first quarter of nearly $11 million to take down McConnell and his self-serving special interest allies. Change is coming,â said Mark Nickolas, McGrathâs campaign manager. McConnell, who has represented Kentucky in the United States Senate since 1985, has received an endorsement from President Donald Trump. In 2016, Trump won the state of Kentucky by 30 percentage points. Shortly after announcing her bid to unseat McConnell, McGrath received praise from many of Hollywoodâs far-left figures, including Bette Midler, Chelsea Handler, Patton Oswalt, and Stephen King. Follow Kyle on Twitter @RealKyleMorris and Facebook.

articles.title: Outraged Campus Protesters Help Donald Trump Jr. Promote His Book âTriggeredâ
articles.subtitle: GAINESVILLE, Florida â Donald Trump Jr. on Thursday spoke at the University of Florida (UF) as an invited guest of theÂ UF student governmentâs ACCENT Speakers Bureau alongside Trump campaign senior adviser Kimberly Guilfoyle. Their appearance drew the ire of left-wing activists, who rejected their pro-America, anti-socialism message and unwittingly helped Trump promote his upcoming book Triggered: How the Left Thrives on Hate and Wants to Silence Us.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Trump took the stage after Guilfoyle, who detailed her experience of pursuing the American dream. âI am not a victim. I have never believed that I am a victim,â she declared. She decried the leftâs pursuit of socialism, which she said is âplaguingâ the Democrat Party, and told the audience that the left âneed[s] you to be a victim.â âYou have the power and control over your own beautiful life,â Guilfoyle said, encouraging attendees to âdream,â which provoked campus protesters, who shouted, âbullshit.â Trump supporters quickly drowned the protesters out by chanting, âUSA, USA, USA!â The disgruntled protesters became increasingly vocal after Trump took the stage. He, like Guilfoyle, warned of the fallacies of socialism â a narrative that prompted anti-Trump activists to shout, âfuck you!â âCouple things Iâm going to talk about because theyâre sort of relevant to college campuses today beyond the sort of obvious suppression of conservative ideas and lack of free speech,â Trump said, âsomething that I included in the book I have coming out in a few weeks called Triggered.â âI probably donât have to explain to you why the book is called TriggeredÂ because you can hear from the audience just why that is,â he said amid shouting. âBut really, one of the things that sort of drove me to write that book is people ask me â theyâre like, âDon, youâre the son of a billionaire from New York City. You went to an Ivy League school. Youâre supposed to be a liberal,â he said as left-wing protesters stood up and shouted. âAnd you know why Iâm not?â Trump continued, unfazed by the protesters. âBecause I have a mother who escaped from some of the liberal ideas that are now being preached on college campuses,â he said, mentioning socialism again. Trump noted that virtually no one from communist or socialist countries are able to vouch for the systems and pointed to Venezuela, which further triggered activists scattered across the crowd. âHow about Venezuela? A once thriving country, beautiful, with prosperity for everything. How come thereâs no one from Venezuela talking about the wonders of socialism?â Trump asked. âTheyâre selling a fictitious creed. Itâs easy to buy into Santa Claus when you donât have the facts,â he said before pivoting to the success of his fatherâs administration. âUnder this administration, there isnât a single economic metric where we are not better off today than we were three years ago,â Trump said, citing the historically low unemployment rate for African Americans and Hispanics and the millions of individuals off of food stamps. The latter indicates that people are âself-sufficient,â which is âscaryâ to the left, which only offers dependence, Trump added. Once again, protesters broke out in a âbullshitâ chant. Protesters could also be heard chanting, âNazi scumbag,â âNoÂ KKK, no fascist USA,â and âyou put children in cages.â âLet them get it out of their system. Itâs all good,â Trump said over the shouting.Â âThatâs what weâre facing. You guys have a decision.â âThe difference between the sides are â Iâll still come here. Because as my father said in 2016, heâs going to be the president for all Americans, not just those who agree with him,â he said to cheers. Trump concluded his speech by thanking supporters for âhaving the gutsâ to attend the event and urged college students to exercise the ability to listen and âhave sensible arguments face to face â not on social media where everyoneâs a badass.â âNot behind a computer screen where everyoneâs a tough guy,â Trump said. âHaving that dialogue, respectfully, I promise you will learn a lot, and it will serve you well for the rest of your lives.â Protests occurred outside throughout the duration of the event. Activists from Planned Parenthood and March for Our Lives were in attendance, one of whom displayed a picture of Andrew Pollackâs daughter, Meadow, who was one of the 17 killed atÂ Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in 2018. âA @AMarch4OurLivesÂ activist is using a picture of my deceased daughter to protest @DonaldJTrumpJrÂ at @UF.Â My family has asked the group to leave her name out of their gun-grabbing agenda more than once. Meadow wouldnât agree with their agenda,â he wrote:  âImagine being so desperate to strip people of their rights that youâd use a familyâs daughter, who was tragically murdered along with her classmates, to advance your agenda,â Trump tweeted following the event. âThis is what the Left does to good people,â he continued. âYouâll always have our support, Mr. Pollackâ:

articles.title: Left-Wing Rioters Attack Trump Supporters Leaving Minneapolis Rally
articles.subtitle: Left-wing rioters attacked supporters of President Donald Trump leaving a rally in Minneapolis, Minnesota on Thursday evening â assaulting them in groups, setting fire to pro-Trump hats, and attacking the police.
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: Riot police stood by as members of Antifa were seen dragging steel fences away from the Target Center. They were filmed by Elijah Schaffer, a correspondent for The Blaze, a conservative news site â who was maced as he filmed.     LocalÂ MinneapolisÂ Star-Tribune reporter Liz Sawyer noted there were several hundred rioters, and that some were singling out Trump supporters and surrounding them in groups before attacking them. Some also attacked police:    The scene was reminiscent of the riot outside a convention center in San Jose in June 2016, when anti-Trump rioters attacked Trump supporters leaving the venue in full view of the media â and Mayor Sam Liccardo blamed Trump. Minneapolis Mayor Jacob FreyÂ proclaimed Thursday as âLove Trumps Hate Dayâ in the city, in solidarity with protests against Trump. Evidently, however, some of those among the âprotestersâ felt âhateâ trumped âlove.â In one instance, a bystander who was not a Trump supporter reported being attacked by the anti-Trump mob:  The Target Center had attempted to charge the Trump campaign hundreds of thousands of dollars for additional security. The rally itself â with a capacity crowd inside and tens of thousands outside â passed without serious incident, but local police seemed unprepared for the violence by anti-Trump rioters after the event was over. This story is developing. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Transgender Activist: âCNN, You Have Erased Black Trans Women for the Last Timeâ
articles.subtitle: A black transgender activist interruptedÂ a question and took the microphone on Thursday nightâs CNN Equality Town Hall, where the individual claimed CNN had âerased black trans women.â
articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.content: âI donât want to take this away from you, but let me tell you something,â the activist said while taking the microphone during an audience question. âBlack trans women are being killed in this country, and, CNN, you have erased black trans women for the last time.â âLet me tell you something, black trans women are dying,â the transgender audience member added. âOur lives matter. I am an extraordinary black trans woman and I deserve to be here. My black trans sisters that are here, I am tired. I am so tired of just sitting there.â The activist identified herself as Blossom when CNN host Don Lemon stepped in to de-escalate the situation. âThe reason that we are here is to validate people like you,â Lemon told Blossom. âThat is why we are here.â As Blossom continued to speak to the crowd, Lemon stood on stage with Democrat presidential hopefulÂ Robert Francis âBetoâ OâRourke. Lemon gave the microphone back to Blossom, who added, âBaby, your actions have to speak louder than words because guess what? Not one black trans woman has taken the mic tonight. Not one black trans man has taken the mic tonight.â As BlossomÂ gave the microphone back to Lemon, he said, âwe want to hear from you.â Blossom then spoke about âanti-blacknessâ and pleaded for the âopportunityâ to be heard. Follow Kyle on Twitter @RealKyleMorris and Facebook.

articles.title: Blue State Blues: Nancy Pelosiâs Faithless Impeachment
articles.subtitle: Democrats like the latest polls on impeaching President Donald Trump, some of which show rising support. But in the long term, it is a losing issue. Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) made it so when she launched an âimpeachment inquiryâ without waiting for the evidence.
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: By the time Pelosi convened a fateful meeting with House Democrats on Sep. 24, Trump had already announced he would release the transcript the next day. Pelosi went ahead, anyway. After years of claiming that Democrats would wait to see where the facts would lead, hoping that Special Counsel Robert Mueller would deliver the goods on Russia âcollusion,â Pelosi decided that she could not wait 24 hours for the facts to emerge. She had lost control: behind closed doors, she faced a caucus that already backed impeachment: a majority of House Democrats had majorityÂ it since August 1, a week after Muellerâs testimony produced a dud. Regardless of her reasons, the decision was a serious political mistake. The rush to impeachment showed that Pelosi was willing to put politics ahead of facts â and ahead of all the other promises she had made to voters in 2018. The fact that she marched ahead of the evidence â which contradicted the whistleblowerâs claims â gave Republicans a reason to rally behind the president. It will also put an asterisk next to the 2020 election, in the event Trump loses. Pelosi repeated her error on Tuesday. The White House sent her an eight-page letter, citing the Constitution, the law, and judicial precedent, explaining why it would not cooperate with an âimpeachment inquiryâ that the House had not yet voted to authorize. Such a vote would trigger impeachment rules and procedures designed to ensure fairness. Pelosiâs response failed to address the White House arguments, and accused Trump of trying âto hide the facts.â The idea that the target of an investigation cannot insist on a fair procedure, and will be further implicated for trying to assert his or her rights â as Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) stated explicitly last week with Pelosi by his side â is reminiscent of âjusticeâ in totalitarian dictatorships. It is, as Breitbart News noted last week, an echo of the horrors of the âStar Chamber,â which the Framers who wrote the U.S. Constitutionâs Bill of Rights were eager to prevent. Pelosi insists that the Constitution does not require the House to obey a set of rules or procedures for impeachment. She is right. But the Constitution also does not require the White House to comply with an âimpeachment inquiry.â If the matter is brought to federal court, the judiciary would likely decline to intervene, citing the political question doctrine. Pelosi will have to hold an impeachment vote without the public ever seeing the evidence â or the defense. There is another weakness in Pelosiâs approach. She is defending her âimpeachment inquiryâ based on the argument that she and her party are retraining a lawless president: âMr. President, you are not above the law,â she declared on Tuesday. But Pelosi herself is casting aside any set of rules. If the presidentâs alleged abuse of power is the problem, Pelosi and the Democrats are not providing an alternative. They are simply imposing their own arbitrary reign. It is worth exploring President Trumpâs alleged misconduct in further detail. He is accused of doing what Democrats have said for years that President Barack Obamaâs administration had aÂ duty to do: namely, to investigate possible foreign corruption by a presidential candidate. It was a matter of national security, they said, because Russia could use âkompromatâ to control the president. (Many continue to claim Trump is doing Vladimir Putinâs bidding.) The difference in the two cases is that Trump took personalÂ responsibilityÂ for asking that Ukraine investigate former Vice President Joe Biden. Obama made a habit of avoiding any personal responsibility for anything controversial in his administration: he left that to underlings, then professed outrage when their misconduct was exposed. Trump not only made the request himself, but also repeated it publicly. He believes he has a duty to do so and is right to do so. That is a matter for oversight, not impeachment. It is telling that no one can name a single law that Trump has broken. After the so-called âwhistleblowerâ raised his or her concerns, the Department of Justice (DOJ) investigated the president for allegedly violating campaign finance laws. It is illegal to accept foreign contributions, as two of Rudy Giulianiâs associates found out on Thursday. But the DOJÂ closed the caseÂ on Trump: he did not break the law. As Democrats told us for years, while their party might have benefited politically from investigating the Trump campaign, that did not matter because there was a legitimate public interest in finding out whether Russian influence extended to a GOP candidate. (Never mind that Hillary Clinton and the Democratic National Committee arguably broke campaign finance laws themselves by disguising payments to dig up dirt on Trump through foreign sources.) Trump can cite a similar public interest in finding out what the Bidens were up to in Ukraine â all the more so because Joe Biden has admitted to quashing an investigation into a company on which his son, Hunter, was a board member. Even if the Bidens did not actually do anything wrong, as the suddenly incurious media are rushing to tell us, there is no doubt that Joe Biden had a conflict of interest. The fact that he did not recuse himself was unethical. But if what Trump did was in the public interest, what about theÂ way he did it? Though there is no evidence of anyÂ quid pro quo â which would probably not be illegal anyway â the idea that Trump used a personal call to request that the new Ukrainian president examine both the 2016 election shenanigans and the Bidensâ activities strikes some observers as odd. It suggests that Trump has supposedly erased boundaries between the personal and the national. Democrats interpret that as evidence of authoritarianism â as they have done with almost everything else Trump has done. If Trump lowers taxes that benefits American businesses as a whole, Democrats and their media allies rush to calculate how much the presidentâs own business interests might save as a result. Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) has campaigned for months on the idea that President Trump is benefiting personally from such alleged âcorruption.â Democrats and journalists showed considerable less interest in figuring out why President Obama made a sudden, albeit unsuccessful, pitch for Chicago to host the 2016 Olympics when he flew to Copenhagen in his first year as president. Hosting the Olympics often costs cities more than it is worth. But several of Obamaâs Chicago friends â including, supposedly, White House adviser Valerie Jarrett â stood to benefit from an Olympic-sized windfall. Trump does not operate that way. Indeed, the appeal for his voters was that unlike the Obamas, he hadÂ already made Â a fortune before going into politics (and risked a fortune by doing so). Rather than pursuing his personal interests as if they were the national interest, Trump has made the national interest his personal interest. As he said repeatedly in Â the 2016 race: âMy whole life Iâve been greedy â¦ Now I want to be greedy for the United States.â He is delivering. His style bothers some constitutional conservatives, whose ideal would be a president who operates more at armâs length. But Trump may be incapable of functioning any other way. Recall that he made his fortune as the head of a private, family business. He has never had to please shareholders â and may not have succeeded if he needed to do so. For him, personal success and company success are the same. He has brought that approach to the presidency. That is why Trump often speaks off-the-cuff, even at ostensibly non-political or public events, about how his own performance is supposedly better than those of his predecessors.
