There is more than ordinary presidential narcissism at work (and Obama, unlike Trump, seemed unable to deliver even a prepared speech without using the first person pronoun incessantly). It is the way a family businessman thinks. It works â but it rubs some people the wrong way. Democrats have an opportunity to provide an alternative to Trump by advocating a return to a more rules-based way of running the government. Instead, they are doing the opposite. Pelosi has made it clear that she will not be bound by House precedent and will not follow the basic rules of fairness in the impeachment inquiry. Much of the inquiry thus far has been held behind doors in intelligence hearings, which allows Democrats to leak out-of-context details. What Pelosi and the Democrats seem to be saying is that the normal rules and rights â which Republicans, even in their own impeachment frenzy, afforded to President Bill Clinton â must be suspended for this particular president. They argue no president is above the law. But no president is beneath it, either. And by protecting leakers like the so-called âwhistleblower,â Democrats may even be condoning law-breaking for the âjustâ cause of ousting Trump. That approach is not only legally and morally wrong: it is also politically disastrous. Before Pelosi ordered the impeachment inquiry, Trump was largely running against the âsocialismâ proposed by most Democrat presidential candidates. (In that vein, William Galston â the liberal on theÂ Wall Street Journal op-ed page â warned Democrats this week that Warren, the new frontrunner, is too left-wing for voters in states Democrats must win in 2020.) Now, Trump is running to defend democracy. Democrats, he argues, want to undo the last election and steal the next one. They cannot be bothered to wait for the voters to deliver their own verdict, mere months from now: they want to usurp the power of the people. It is an argument for which Democrats have no answer. And if they manage to win in 2020 by using a partisan impeachment to tarnish the president, many Americans will lose faith in our democracy. There are probably Democrats who think they are doing what is right for the country â just like there were FBI agents, starting with then-Director James Comey, who understood they were bending the rules in 2016 to help Hillary Clinton and hurt Donald Trump, but believed they were protecting the country. They acted as they did because they lacked faith in our constitutional checks and balances, and the wisdom of the American electorate. Pelosi lacks that same faith â and the proof is that she refuses to authorize the impeachment inquiry with a vote. If she believed the case against Trump were strong, she would not oppose a fair process based on rules and precedent. She told fellow Democrats that she was undertaking impeachment âprayerfully.â If so, there has never been a more faithless prayer. The Democrats are opposing democracy because they do not believe in it, or the American people. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Turkey, Hezbollah Order EU to âKneelâ or âWe Open the Gates and Send 3.6 Million Refugees Your Wayâ
articles.subtitle: President Erdogan of Turkey and Hezbollah politicians in Lebanon are ordering the EU to âkneelâ or watch as their countries âopen the gatesâ for millions of illegal migrants.
articles.author: Jack Montgomery
articles.content: âHey European Union. Pull yourself together,â warned the Turkish strongman, who used a failed coup against him in 2016 as an opportunity to hurl thousands of his political opponents and detractors into prison, over moves by the EU to condemn his recent incursion into Kurdish-controlled territory in northern Syria. âI say it again. If you try to label this operation as an invasion, itâs very simple: we will open the gates and send 3.6 million refugees your way,â threatened the Islamist leader, prompting a round of applause from his audience. Erdogan boasted that his operation had already eliminated over 100 âterroristsâ and insisted his goal was to âcontribute to Syriaâs political and territorial integrityâ â although his operation is opposed by the Russian-backed Syrian government which controls most of the country. He also suggested the leadership of the Saudi regime, which has also been critical of the incursion, âlook into the mirrorâ, suggesting they had themselves caused âtens of thousandsâ of deaths in Yemen. Turkey is ostensibly a military ally of most of the European countries Erdogan is threatening, as a member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) defence alliance.  Meanwhile,Â Mohammad Raed, a Lebanese legislator representing Hezbollah, the Islamist political party-cum-terror network, has been recommending a similar diet of threats to make Europe âkneelâ to their own demands. âAll we have to do is wave the card of Syrian refugees and all the European countries will kneel before us,â said the MP, in comments reported by An-Nahar, one of Lebanonâs most widely circulated newspapers. â[The European Union] could not receive 10,000 refugees and yet they want us to take in 1.5 million,â he added â although in fact Europe has been inundated by well over a million newcomers since the onset of the migrant crisis in 2015, which continues â albeit at a slower pace â down to the present day.

articles.title: Watch: Democrats Say Yes to Every Transgender Demand
articles.subtitle: Democratic politicians agreed with almost every demand made by the audience of invited transgender and gay advocates at a Thursday town hall managed by the Human Rights Campaign and broadcast by CNN.
articles.author: Neil Munro
articles.content: Sen. Elizabeth Warren promised her nominee to the Department of Education would have to earn the approval of a nine-year-old child who claimed to be transgender. The invited child, flanked by the mother, asked, âWhat are you doing â¦ to make sure that kids like me feel safer in schools? And what do you think schools need to do better to make sure that I donât have to worry about anything but my homework?â Warren responded: So let me start by saying, I want to have a secretary of education who both believes in public education and believes in the value of every one of our kids, and is willing to enforce our civil rights laws. It turns out that when the Department of Education was set up many years ago, the secretary of education was given a whole lot of power over the public schools, and over the rules and how theyâre enforced. And weâve had some secretaries of education whoâve been better. And weâve had one thatâs been a whole lot worse. Her name is Betsy DeVos. And when Iâm President, sheâll be gone. And hereâs my plan â¦Â  Iâm going to find just the right secretary of education. But hereâs what I plan to do. I want to make sure that the person I think is the right secretary of education meets you and hears your story. And then I want you to tell me if you think thatâs the right person, and then weâll make the deal. Does that sound good? âThe Equality Act is essential,âÂ said New Jersey Sen. Cory Booker, referring to the House-passed Equality Act, which would establish the transgender ideology as law, and so outlaw and stigmatize any recognition of the complementary differences of women and men. âIf we can get five [Senate] votes, we will pass the Equality Act the next day,â said Minnesota Sen. Amy Klobuchar.Â  âWe urgently need an Equality Act,âÂ said Mayor Pete Buttigieg.Â Â âWe would pass the Equality Act right off the bat, number one,â said Joe Biden. The candidates promised to promote the status of gay and transgender people in K-12 schools, to roll back restrictions on blood donations, to appoint gay generals, and to subordinate national diplomacy to the goal of gay acceptance. âI would, in fact, curtail aid, curtail foreign assistance to countries who, in fact, engage in this kind of [anti-gay] behavior,â said Biden. The audience picked by the pr0-transgender HRC was delighted with the river of promises and praise. âThis means the world to all of us â¦ I cannot believe this is happening,â said activist Julia Goldman, an author of a podcast about gay politics. The Pentagon must treat male soldiers as if they are women once they say they are transgender, said Buttigieg.Â âThe trans military ban is an outrage â¦ That is dead wrong â¦Â I will put an end to that,â he said. Religious rights must end when âreligion is being used an excuse to harm other people,â Buttigieg said. Religious-based opposition to gay status âmakes God smaller â¦ It is an insult to faith to believe it can be used to hurt people in that way,â he said. Religious groups must agree to arrange adoptions for gay couples, said Klobuchar. âYou haveÂ got to have agencies that follow the law â¦ You have got to [endorse] adoptions for gay families,â she said.  Warren jeered at critics of single-sex marriage and transgenderism. One questioner asked her: Senator, thank you for being here. Now, letâs say youâre on the campaign trail, and a supporter approaches you and says, âSenator, Iâm old-fashioned. And my faith teaches me that marriage is between one man and one woman.â What is your response?â Well, Iâm going to assume itâs a guy who said that. Iâm going to say, just marry one woman. Assuming you can find one! A moment later, Warren declared her deep belief in charity towards other people: Itâs about what I learned in the church I grew up, in first song I ever remember singing: âThere is yellow, black and white, they are precious in His sight. Jesus loves all the children in the world.â â¦Â That was the basis of the faith that I grew up in. And it truly is about the preciousness of each and every life, it is about the worth of every human being. Former California Attorney General, Kamala Harris, boasted of her refusal to defend Californiaâs marriage law in 2008 from advocates for single-sex marriage. Tom Steyer backed body-changing drugs for teenagers who say they are transgender. âAll of that care should be available for all transgender youth,â he said. âIt has to be part of the public [healthcare] option I believe in â¦ It is an absolute right, and this is a critical part of healthcare for these young people.â Warren promised taxpayer funding for cosmetic surgery for people who want to live as members of the opposite sex: I believe that everyone is entitled to medical care and medical care that they need, and that includes people who are transgender, who â it is the time for them to have gender-affirming surgery. I just think thatâs important and the appropriate medical care. CNNâs announcers excluded any possible critics or skeptical questioners who might spotlight the political risks posed by the candidatesâ unreserved support for transgender ideology. That ideology would change womenâs status and rights, change education rules, and girlsâ sports. Amy Klobuchar provided the only moment of disagreement when she declined to endorse a call for legal prostitution.Â âI am not in favor of demineralizing all of sex work,â she said, but quickly backtracked,Â  âbut Iâd love to talk with you for a few minutes and see if we can find common ground going forward.â The only loud opposition came from several attendees who described themselves as black transgender women, including one named Blossom. A second person rebuked one CNN announcer for a mispronouncing the personâs name, saying, âitÂ is violence to âmisgenderâ or to alter the name of a transperson.â A group interrupted the event to chant about âblack transâ lives. But Beto OâRourke pushed the envelope. âDiscriminationâ against people who are homosexual or transgender cannot be tolerated, he said. âThereÂ can be no reward, no benefit, no tax break for anyone, any institutionâ¦ that denies the human rights and full civil rights of every single one of us.â He promised cheap anti-AIDS medicine: âWeâll bring down that cost â¦ We will take over that patent and make sure it is distributed to every person in America.â Mental-health professionals should not be allowed to guide adults or children who prefer to detransition from transgender status or to change homosexual feelings. âConversion therapy â¦ should be illegal,â OâRourke said. âAs president, I will seek to outlaw it everywhere in this country â¦ this is tantamount to torture â a torture we visit on children who are absolutely defenseless,â he said. Beto also promised a new policy to counter the murder of black transgender women, saying, âthey will be the guide on this issue â they will direct our policy.â Countering the murders isÂ âa matter of restoring the very fabric of America,â he said.

articles.title: Watch: Delingpole Savaged by a Tofu-Muncher at the Extinction Rebellion Protest
articles.subtitle: At the Extinction Rebellion protests in London this week, a bedwetting greenie grabbed my shoulder, pushed me and told me he hoped Iâd never have ****ing kids and that if I ever did theyâd ****ing hate me forever.
articles.author: James Delingpole
articles.content: Obviously I loved this, a) because being physically assaulted by a pasty-faced soy boy is always comedy gold. And b) because it confirmed what Iâve long suspected: thereâs really nothing peaceful or âniceâ about these posturing, deluded, âplanet-savingâ pests. Iâve put the âplanet-savingâ in inverted commas because the only place these soap-shunning losers are saving the planet is in their warped imaginations. Some of them are even honest enough to admit it. Here is one of the founding members of Extinction Rebellion (XR), telling it like it is on Medium: So Extinction Rebellion isnât about the climate. Itâs not even about âclimate justiceâ**, although that is also important. If we only talk about the climate, weâre missing the deeper problems plaguing our culture. And if we donât excise the cause of the infection, we can never hope to heal from it. This article is calling to all of those who are involved in XR who sometimes slip into saying itâs a climate movement. Itâs a call toÂ the American rebels who made a banner saying âCLIMATE extinction rebellionâ. Itâs a call to the XR Media & Messaging teams to never get sloppy with the messaging and âreduceâ it to climate issues. Itâs a call to the XR community to never say weâre a climate movement. Because weâre not. Yes, I think the pieceâs author Stuart Basden, has made it pretty clear that Extinction Rebellion is not about the climate. So what, then, is it about? Basden himself doesnât appear to have much of a clue. At one point, he writes: Weâre facing imminent societal collapse (whatever that means), both around the world and in the UK. That parenthesis speaks volumes. âImminent societal collapseâ is just another empty phrase to be brandished alongside all the other emotive catchphrases like âfuture generationsâ and âtime is running out.â But what else would you expect from a movement whose spiritual leader is a 16-year old autistic school drop out who thinks she can see âcarbonâ in the skies and who apparently gets her science facts from Ice Age 2? Elsewhere in his article, Basden has a good old rant about some of his other obsessions: In other words, Extinction Rebellion is imbued with the kind of pseudo-academic, post-modernist, neo-Marxist intersectional guff that they teach at universities these days â and which bears a great deal of responsibility for the widespread madness afflicting our age and poisoning relationships between the young and old, between races and religions, between the two [nb] sexes, between social classes and so on. What also struck me as I wandered among the Extinction Rebellion crowds, feeling the loathing oozing from the ones that recognised me (Iâm quite the hate figure in greenie circles, for some odd reason) was just how blinkered, prejudiced and ill-informed these people are. Did they but know it â and I did try to explain this to some of them â I care at least as passionately about the environment as any of them do. Indeed, Iâd just come from a meeting with Mike Shellenberger, a green activist once named a âHero of the Environmentâ by Time magazine. Shellenberger is a Democrat from the Peoplesâ Republic of California, founder and president of a think tank called Environmental Progress, and was an early campaigner for the renewables program later adopted by President Obama. Despite all this we got on like a house on fire because, though we disagree on some minor issues â he thinks âclimate changeâ is a problem; I donât â we agree on the fundamentals: the stuff being done to save the planet is actually killing it â and as nature lovers this drives both of us insane. Watch: Mike Shellenberger and James Delingpole talk Extinction Rebellion and why theyâre so wrong  We both agreed strongly that Extinction Rebellionâs war on economic growth â among all the other things it would love to ban: air travel, cars, etc â is the very last thing either the planet or future generations need. Itâs prosperity that enables us to have the money we need to care for our environment. Poverty just makes things worse. Itâs no coincidence that the worldâs worst environmental disasters of the last 100 years happened mostly either in the developing world or behind the Iron Curtain. But when you try explaining this stuff to the Extinction Rebellion crowd they just donât want to know. They are so convinced of the rightness of their cause they donât want any pesky facts to get in the way of their belief system. I suppose they think just the same about people like me. Indeed, I know they do: the ones who confronted me, such as the chap you see on camera having a go at me, assume that everything I say about the environment I say in bad faith. That is, they all think Iâm a wicked âdenierâ who only says sceptical things about climate change and the environment because I am paid lavishly to do so either by Big Oil or by the rabid right-wing media. I canât say I blame them for thinking this way: itâs all theyâve been taught in schools; all they ever hear at college and university; all they ever read in the mainstream media or see on TV. They have been brainwashed and propagandised into green groupthink. So itâs all very well mocking freaks like the guy dressed in the clown suit, and the weeping dad blubbing next to a photo of his children, and the idiots doing dances and yoga classes and saying: âEnough is enough! This time we need to get serious about these idiots blocking our streets.â We â by which I mean our culture, rather than you or me personally â have created this problem by allowing all this junk-science, greenie nonsense these loons are spouting to go largely uncriticised by anyone, anywhere. Dissenting voices to the green fake news narrative are so rarely heard â on the BBC, they are more or less banned â that itâs no wonder that kids are frightened the world is going to end in twelve years and that XR feel morally justified in causing such disruption and economic damage and human misery. Prime Minister Boris Johnson has dismissed the XR crowd as ânose-ringed crusties in hemp smelling bivouacsâ. And he has a point. But isnât this the same Boris Johnson whose government is committed to making the UK economy Net Zero of CO2 emissions by 2040 â an aim which is not only impossible without causing tremendous disruption, damage and expense to British industry and consumer freedom, but which also has no sound scientific justification whatsoever? Iâll leave the last word on this to Matt Ridley, the Oxford-educated zoologist, now a member of the House of Lords, who is one of passing few politicians to talk sense on this issue.  Interviewed by Julia Hartley-Brewer, he said: âWhat worries me is that the Establishment â in terms of journalists, politicians and scientists too â have kind of talked a whole generation into this extreme apocalyptic rhetoric which is just not supported by the factsâ. Precisely. Itâs the Establishment which created the Extinction Rebellion monster. Itâs the Establishment which continues to feed the Extinction Rebellion monster. And until the Establishment faces up to its responsibility for helping stoke up this green hysteria, the Extinction Rebellion monster will be rampaging amongst us for many years hence.

articles.title: âDo or Dieâ: Boris Wonât Win Election Unless He Delivers Brexit on Time
articles.subtitle: The Conservatives will only win a majority in the House of Commons at the next election if Boris Johnson delivers Brexit on October 31st.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: The ComRes poll, seen by The Telegraph, was presented at a fringe event at last weekâs Tory Party conference. It validated the predictions by many Brexiteers that failure to deliver Brexit by the deadline will result in a majorÂ  electoral loss for the party. âThis polling shows what every MP must know. The UK is yearning to move on. Itâs time to get Brexit done, on time, do or die,â said Steve Baker, chairman of the Conservative Partyâs Brexiteer European Reseach Group (ERG). Even a slight delay would cost the Tories an election, the survey revealed. The poll of 2,050 adults found that is the country left the European Union after yet another extension, the part would be 14 seats short of a majority if it was with a late deal, and 18 short if late and without an agreement. Only leaving on time would result in a majority for the party, either a 118-seat majority with a deal or 114-seat majority without a deal. The projections highlight the necessity for the Tories to deliver Brexit to survive as a party. However, the Labour Partyâs recent movements demonstrate that if the Tories do not deliver Brexit by the next election, there may be no Brexit at all.  Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn confirmed on Thursday that his first act as prime minister would be to âimmediately legislateâ a second referendum. Mr Corbyn has said that as the leader of a future government, he would negotiate an even softer Brexit deal and put that option against Remain on the referendum ballot paper. âWithin three months of coming to power, a Labour government will secure a sensible deal, based on the terms we have long advocated and discussed with the EU, trade unions and businesses, including a new customs union, a close single market relationship and guarantees of rights and protections. âWithin six months of being elected, we will put that deal to a public vote alongside Remain,â Mr Corbyn said. It has long been a feature of European Union âdemocracyâ that national votes and referenda that go against Brusselsâ interests are ignored and run again, this strategy having been used several times in Denmark, the Netherlands, France, and Ireland. Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage remarked on the latest announcement, saying at a rally last night: âThe Labour Party â genius â will negotiate a new deal with Brussels, put it to the electorate in a referendum, and then campaign against it. Work that one out!â Mr Farage has said that he is preparing to stand candidates in every seat in the UK for the next election to deliver Brexit if Johnson fails to do so. The Brexit Party leader has also made strong overtures to the Tories to make an election pact. A study showed his party is better placed than Johnsonâs to win seats in working-class heartlands abandoned by Labour, so an alliance would be key to delivering a strong majority for Brexit. However, Mr Johnson has turned down offers of cooperation.

articles.title: Australian Troops Bound for Mission on Syria-Israel Border
articles.subtitle: SBS News Australia reports:Â  Australian and Fijian soldiers will be deployed to a disputed region between Syria and Israel on a United Nations peace-keeping mission. The troops are awaiting final U.N. approval before travelling to the disputed territory of Golan Heights.
articles.author: Breitbart Jerusalem
articles.content: A Department of Defence spokeswoman confirmed the mission has nothing to do with the United Statesâ recent withdrawal from north-eastern Syria, on the other side of the country. âI just met some of the [Australian Defence Force] boys upstairs who are going to be deployed with the Fijians over in Syria,â Prime Minister Scott Morrison told his hand-picked rugby league team in Suva on Friday before they played their Fijian counterparts. Read more here.

articles.title: George Clooney âHorrifiedâ by Trump Withdrawing Troops from Syria
articles.subtitle: HELSINKI (AP) â George Clooney said on Thursday he was appalled U.S. President Donald Trump partly justified the decision to withdraw U.S. troops from Syria by stating Kurds âdidnât help us with Normandyâ during World War II.
articles.author: Breitbart News
articles.content: The politically active Hollywood actor, director and producer told a business seminar in Finlandâs capital that he found Trumpâs words from a day earlier âa pretty shocking statement.â Clooney accused Washington of leaving the allies of U.S. forces in Syria to deal alone with Turkeyâs military offensive. âIâm horrified at the idea we would say that after having Kurds fight our battle for us â because we donât want to send troops there â and then say, âOK, youâre on your own,ââ he said. Clooney was interviewed at the Nordic Business Forum in Helsinki in front of some 7,000-strong audience of mostly business and corporate leaders. He is known to voice opinions on global political matters and has been engaged in humanitarian causes together with his wife Amal Clooney who is a human rights lawyer. Clooney, who won the best supporting actor Academy Award for playing a former CIA agent in the 2005 Middle East political thriller âSyrianaâ said he was currently working on an eight-part series with Netflix on the Watergate scandal and President Richard Nixonâs downfall.

articles.title: Joe Biden Responds to Trump Rally Taunts: âAmerica Is So Much Stronger than Your Weaknessâ
articles.subtitle: Former Vice President and 2020 candidate Joe Biden lashed out at President Donald Trumpâs remarks during his Thursday evening re-election rally, stating âAmerica is so much stronger than your weakness.â
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: Biden fired off a tweet after appearing at the Human Rights Coalitionâs âEquality Town Hall,â which ran on CNN during the presidentâs rally inÂ Minneapolis, Minnesota. âI spent my night at the HRC forum talking about the fundamental respect every human being deserves. You spent yours showing how little respect for anyone else you have. America is so much stronger than your weakness, @realDonaldTrump,â Biden wrote.  President TrumpÂ laced into BidenÂ and his beleaguered son Hunter several times during his rally as the pair face increased scrutiny over allegations of international corruption. âJoeâs son Hunter got thrown out of the Navy and then he became a genius on Wall Street in about two days,â President Trump recounted to rally attendees.Â âWhatever happened to Hunter? Where the hell is he?â he asked. âWhereâs Hunter?â âHey fellas, I have an idea for a new T-shirt,â the president then quipped. âLetâs do another T-shirt: âWhereâs Hunter?'â At another point in the rally,Â President Trump turned his attention to the 76-year-old Biden, who he said was only a good vice president because he understood how to âkissâ former President Barack Obamaâs âass.â âTwo months after President Obama put Joe in charge of Ukraine policyâ¦ and the press will not write it. They say, âIn totally unsubstantiated charges,â every time they talk about him, âPresident Trump has said that his son walked away with a fortune, now you know thatâs a totally unsubstantiated charge.â Really? Itâs not unsubstantiated, itâs a fact,â he added. As Breitbart News extensively reported, Hunterâs investment company scored aÂ $1.5 billion investment dealÂ with the Bank of China after traveling with his father on Air Force Two to the country in 2013. Further,Â then-vice presidentÂ Biden forced out former Ukrainian prosecutor Viktor Shokin as he was investigating the gas giant Burisma Holdings, which was paying Hunter Biden $83,000 per month as a member of its board, despite having no expertise in the energy sector. Biden laterÂ boastedÂ before the Council of Foreign Relations that he had threatened to withhold $1 billion in U.S. aid unless the prosecutor was removed from his post.

articles.title: Prince Estate Swipes Trump for Playing âPurple Rainâ at Minneapolis Rally
articles.subtitle: The estate of Prince swiped at President Donald Trump on Thursday, after one of the late pop rock legendâs songs was played at TrumpâsÂ campaign rally in Minneapolis.
articles.author: Ben Kew
articles.content: At one point during the rally, which took place in his hometown of Minneapolis, Princeâs classic song âPurple Rainâ was played, leading his estate to send a legal warning to the eventâs organizers. âPresident Trump played Princeâs âPurple Rainâ tonight at a campaign event in Minneapolis despite confirming a year ago that the campaign would not use Princeâs music,â the singerâs estate wrote on Twitter. âThe Prince Estate will never give permission to President Trump to use Princeâs songs.â President Trump played Princeâs âPurple Rainâ tonight at a campaign event in Minneapolis despite confirming a year ago that the campaign would not use Princeâs music. The Prince Estate will never give permission to President Trump to use Princeâs songs. pic.twitter.com/FuMUPzSWOe â Prince (@prince) October 11, 2019  Although the exact legal case made by his estate remains unclear, the campaign agreed to refrain from playing Prince songs. âWithout admitting liability, and to avoid any future dispute, we write to confirm that the Campaign will not use Princeâs music in connection with its activities going forward,â campaign attorney Megan Newton wrote in a response to the request.  During his career, Prince (real name Prince Rogers Nelson) was never overtly political, instead choosing to focus on animal welfare and philanthropy. Following his death in 2016,Â The Washington PostÂ even described him as a âconservative Christianâ who opposed gay marriage after becoming a Jehovahâs Witness in 2001. Numerous artists have themselves demanded that Trump and his campaign affiliates refrain using their music in promotional content or at campaign events,Â includingÂ The Rolling Stones, Adele, and Queen. Follow Ben Kew onÂ Facebook, Twitter atÂ @ben_kew,Â orÂ email him at bkew@breitbart.com.

articles.title: Fact Check: Doubts About Elizabeth Warrenâs Pregnancy Story Raised by Female Socialist
articles.subtitle: CLAIM: Conservatives are using an old âsexist tropeâ by attacking Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) for her âauthenticity.â
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: Thomas Kaplan writes in theÂ New York Times that Republicans and conservatives have questioned Warrenâs claim that she was fired from a teaching job in 1971 because she was âvisibly pregnant.â In doing so, Kaplan writes, they have âemployed a tactic â questioning a female candidateâs authenticity â that is at once often a sexist trope in politics and a strategy used against Hillary Clinton in 2016.â The article appears as ânews analysis,â not opinion. Unfortunately, for Kaplan, there are three problems. The first is that doubts about Warrenâs pregnancy tale were first raised byÂ left-wing Jacobin magazine wrier Meagan Day, a member of the Democratic Socialists of America.   Second, Warren has made a habit of telling false stories. For years, she falsely claimed Native American ancestry â and fundraised off (correct) efforts by critics to debunk her story, just as she is doing now with her pregnancy story. More recently, her campaign has consistently exaggerated crowd sizes at her events, and Warren has repeatedly evaded questions â even from well-meaning liberals â about whether she would raise taxes on the middle class to pay for her âMedicare for Allâ plan. Warrenâs âauthenticityâ is in doubt because she keeps putting it in doubt. Third, questioning a candidateâs honesty is the bread-and-butter of politics. Journalists and opponents always challenge what candidates say. To claim that the normal course of politics is a âsexist tropeâ is absurd. It is also an effort â arguably, a sexist one â to shield a female candidate from scrutiny, as if she could not win on the merits. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Greta Thunberg Denied: Ethiopian PM Abiy Ahmed Wins Nobel Peace Prize
articles.subtitle: Swedish teenage climate alarmist Greta Thunberg has been passed over for the Nobel Peace Prize, which instead was awarded to Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed for ending his countryâs long-standing border conflict with neighbor Eritrea.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: As the Sun UK notes, Thunberg, 16, was the bookiesâ favorite to take home the prize â following her angry tirade in which she lambasted world governments for failing to address so-called climate change at theÂ United Nations Climate Action Summit in New York City last month. Abiy, 43, took office after widespread protests pressured the longtime ruling coalition and hurt one of the worldâs fastest growing economies. Africaâs youngest leader quickly announced dramatic reforms and âAbiymaniaâ began. In a move that caused surprise in the long-turbulent Horn of Africa region, he said Ethiopia would accept a peace agreement with Eritrea, ending one of Africaâs longest-running conflicts. The improving relations led to the lifting of United Nations sanctions on Eritrea, one of the worldâs most reclusive nations. But Ethiopiaâs reforms appear not to have inspired any in Eritrea, which has since closed border posts with its neighbor. The Associated Press contributed to this report.

articles.title: MSNBCâs Deutsch Calls on Romney to Support Trump Impeachment â âWould Be an American Heroâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Friday, MSNBC contributor Donny Deutsch called on Sen. Mitt Romney (R-UT) to push for President Donald Trumpâs impeachment amid the Ukraine phonecall controversy. Deutsch said on âMorning Joeâ that Romney âwould be an American heroâ if he came forward in support of impeaching Trump. âFirst of all, I think itâs important that the Democrats, this new Rudy story, obviously, thereâs so much to unpack there,â Deutsch stated. âBut the good news/bad news is the Democrats continue to move forward on impeachment is they still canât lose that one-sentence strategy. The more this thing airs out, if you will, and fans out, you start to in a strange way, it gets worse but it also dilutes the simple one-sentence message, âThe president [sought] a foreign power to get dirt on his opponent at the expense of our national security.â We canât still lose that one headline. And thatâs critical for the Democrats.â He continued, âAnd I want to also go back to one point you made earlier, Joe. I donât understand how somebody like a Mitt Romney does not come forward. It is such an obvious thing to say. Right now you would be an American hero, and you can say, âLook, Iâve supported the presidentâs policies and this is painful, but I work for the voters and for the Constitution.â It astounds me as a branding guy and a guy who has managed peopleâs careers that none of these people get that. Itâs not even brave. Itâs smart politically.â â[T]o me, is the one guy who is bulletproof,â Deutsch added, saying, âRepublicans would line up behind him.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Tunnel Talks: Mainstream Media Blazes with âNewsâ that EU, UK Negotiators May Negotiate
articles.subtitle: Mainstream media outlets are ablaze with the ânewsâ that the European Unionâs chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier has been given the green light for so-called âtunnelâ negotiations with their British counterparts.
articles.author: Jack Montgomery
articles.content:
With the British Parliament and government both rejecting the withdrawal treaty negotiated by Theresa May, and the European Union rejecting a rehash of the treaty with some alternative arrangements for the customs border between EU member-state the Republic of Ireland and the British province of Northern Ireland put forward by Boris Johnson, the United Kingdom is currently headed for a clean break with the bloc â or, if anti-Brexit MPs have their way, yet another Brexit delay. After the Irish prime minister (or âtaoiseachâ) Leo Varadkar suggested that a deal could still be done on-time following one-on-one talks with Prime Minister Johnson and a meeting between Barnier and Britainâs Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay, however, the word has gone out that âtunnelâ negotiations may (or may not) be on the cards â although few reporters have elaborated on what this actually means. EU wonât go into tunnel unless both sides can clearly see âlanding zoneâ ahead. EU resisted PMs enthusiasm to head into tunnel immediately after presented his proposals last week. Needs trust + a big leap forward considering how far apart both sides were on key issues this week.. â katya adler (@BBCkatyaadler) October 11, 2019  HOLD UP! It might not be a full tunnel. More of an underpass. https://t.co/p8yxTyTsAb â Matt Wells (@MatthewWells) October 11, 2019  EU diplomats confirm to @AFP that EU27 has given green light for Brexit talks to enter a negotiation 'tunnel' (ie. intense negs with a communication blackout â no briefings, no leaks).
This just days before Oct17 make-or-break EU summit. â Marc Burleigh (@marcburleigh) October 11, 2019  Marc Burleigh, Brussels correspondent for AFP, indicates that âtunnelâ negotiatons are essentially just regular negotiations without breifings or leaks, conducted in an âintenseâ way â which rather raises the question of what EU and British negotiators have been doing up until now, considering Brexit was originally supposed to take place on March 29th and its current deadline is only twenty days away. Mr Burleighâs initial claim that Barnier has been given the âgreen lightâ for such talks now seems uncertain, however, with a number of other reporters inflicting an abundance of mixed metaphors on observers by suggesting that the governments of the EU27 will not enter a âtunnelâ with the British without being able to see a âlanding zoneâ at the end of it. The European Commission hasÂ confirmed that the EU and British teamsÂ âhave agreed to intensify discussions over the coming dayâ, but according to CNN reporter Bianca Nobilo this falls short of âsecret tunnel talksâ, and is âmore of a journey into Platoâs caveâ. Whether or not there was ever really anything to report other than that the two negotiating teams are still negotiating remains unclear. Eu statement on Brexit talks ðð¼. âThe EU and UK have agreed to intensify discussions over the coming daysâ, so no secret tunnel talks just yetâ¦more of a journey into Platoâs cave  https://t.co/BjWB7vVjM9 â Bianca Nobilo (@bianca_nobilo) October 11, 2019  Maybe the real tunnel negotiations were the friends we made along the way â Stephen Canning ð (@EssexCanning) October 11, 2019

articles.title: Liberal Democrat Candidate Compares Brexit to Nazi Germany
articles.subtitle: A Liberal Democrat candidate has compared Brexit to Nazi Germany in the latest embarrassment for the pro-EU party.
articles.author: Victoria Friedman
articles.content: David Chalmers wrote on Facebook in comments reported by Guido Fawkes that leaving the EU is causingÂ âhuge rises in violent crime on our streets and domestic abuse in our homesâ. The candidate for Torridge and West Devon added: âWe have to stop this â just as we stopped the Nazis in Germany and their sympathisers in this country at the time from destroying this country in the 1930s.â Last month, another Liberal Democrat candidate resigned after saying that people in her prospective constituency were too âwhiteâ, âisolatedâ, and poor to âappreciateâ being in the EU. Kirsten Johnson, who was running in the North Devon seat, made the comments during an interview on BBC Radio 4 on September 19th. When asked about the constituentsâ enthusiasm for leaving the EU, Ms Johnson said:Â âDemographically itâs 98 per cent white. We donât have a lot of ethnic minorities living in north Devon. âPeople arenât exposed to people from other countries. They donât travel a lot. I think there is a slight disconnect with North Devon being isolated, being rural, and low income. Perhaps they donât appreciate the advantages of being in the European Union?â  Just three days before, the Liberal Democrat candidate forÂ Banff and Buchan stepped down after saying Tory Brexiteer MPs should be âhung, drawn, and quarteredâ. âJohnson, Fox, Gove, Davis, Rees-Mogg should be hung, drawn, and quartered, with each quarter being sent to the four corners of the UK to be burned at the stake,â Galen Milne had written on social media. Jacob Rees-Mogg responded in typical good humour, saying:Â âTypical Lib Dem. Mr Milne should get his facts straight. As Lord President of the Council, I am entitled to the privilege of being beheaded.â It is not just the candidates who are known for their colourful language. During Mayâs European Parliament elections, then-party leader Vince Cable launched campaign material bearing the slogan: âBollocks to Brexit.â The motto was passed down to his successor Jo Swinson, who said during her leadership acceptance speech in July:Â âWhen I say Bollocks to Brexit I mean it.â Party members approved at Septemberâs conference to back revoking Article 50 â cancelling Brexit altogether â without a referendum. However, that would only occur if the party won an absolute majority â seen as highly unlikely, given the Liberal Democrats are riding comfortably in third place in the polls.

articles.title: Survey Reveals âAlarmingâ Civic Literacy Crisis Among College Graduates
articles.subtitle: College graduates are responsible, in part, for a âknowledge crisisâ regarding basic civic literacy in the United States, according to a recent survey that revealed âalarming results.â For example, less than half of college graduates surveys knew the term lengths of U.S. Senators and Representatives.
articles.author: Alana Mastrangelo
articles.content:
AÂ recent survey has uncovered âalarming resultsâ which point to âa crisis inÂ civic understanding and the urgent need for a renewed focus on civics education at the postsecondary level,â according to theÂ American Council of Trustees and Alumni (ACTA), which commissioned the survey. Among the results, 18 percentÂ of respondents selecting Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) as the author of The New Deal â a series of programs and regulations that had actually been enacted by President Franklin D. RooseveltÂ in the 1930s. Among college graduates, 12 percentÂ selected Rep. Ocasio-Cortez. Moreover, 26 percent ofÂ respondents selected Brett Kavanaugh as the chiefÂ justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, while 14 percent selectedÂ Antonin Scalia, who passed away in 2016. Among those respondents, 15 percent of college graduates selectedÂ Brett Kavanaugh, with less than half of respondents correctly selectingÂ John Roberts. The survey, entitled, âAmericaâs Knowledge Crisis: A Survey on Civic Literacy,â also noted that 63 percent of respondents did not knowÂ the term lengths of U.S. Senators and Representatives, with less than half of college graduates selecting the correct answer. Additionally, an alarming 12 percent ofÂ respondents surveyed understood the relationship between the Emancipation Proclamation and the 13th Amendment, with only 19 percent ofÂ college graduates selecting the correct answer. âColleges have the responsibility to prepare students for a lifetime of informed citizenship,â said the president of ACTA, Michael Poliakoff. âOur annual What Will They Learn? report illustrates the steady deterioration of the core curriculum.â âWhen American history and government courses are removed, you begin to see disheartening survey responses like these, and Americaâs experiment in self-government begins to slip from our grasp.â he added. ACTA says that its annualÂ What Will They Learn? report,Â âuniquely assesses the core academic requirements at 1,123 four-year institutions that together enroll more than eight million undergraduate students,â and that it scores the institutions based on whether they require all students to take courses in seven âpriority subject areas.â According to the organization, only 22Â institutions earned an âAâÂ for core curriculum requirements, and 137 schools failed. âWhile most universities require students to take courses in composition and the natural sciences, curricular gaps are common everywhere else,â said ACTA in a statement. 82% do not require students to take a foundational course in U.S. government or history.

43% do not require students to take a college-level mathematics course.

68% do not require students to study literature.

88% do not require intermediate-level foreign language courses.

97% do not require a course in economics. âItâs not surprising that public confidence in higher education is falling,â said Poliakoff. âAmidst all the fanfare about the release of the latest college rankings this week, there is not a peep about ill-informed citizens, often underprepared for the workforce, who are graduating from our colleges and universities with mountains of student debt.â âBy focusing on resource inputs, admissions selectivity, and institutional reputation, the major rankings systems drive costs up but show little interest in what students learn â or donât learn,â he added. You can follow AlanaÂ Mastrangelo on Twitter at @ARmastrangelo and on Instagram.

articles.title: Chris Cuomo Says His Pronouns Are âShe, Her, and Hersâ
articles.subtitle: Democrat presidential hopeful Sen. Kamala Harris took the stage at CNNâs Equality Town Hall Thursday night, where she said her pronouns are âshe, her, and hers,â and CNN host Chris Cuomo agreed, saying, âMine, too.â
articles.author: Kyle Morris
articles.content: Harris walked out on stage to a round of applause from the audience and immediately announced her pronouns. âMy pronouns are âshe,â âher,â and âhers,'â Harris told the crowd. Cuomo turned to Harris and responded, ââShe,â âher,â and âhersâ? Mine, too.â âAll right,â Harris said as she smiled awkwardly. Cuomo later apologized on social media, saying he âshould not haveâ made that remark: PLEASE READ: When Sen. Harris said her pronouns were she her and her's, I said mine too. I should not have. I apologize. I am an ally of the LGBTQ community, and I am sorry because I am committed to helping us achieve equality. Thank you for watching our townhall. â Christopher C. Cuomo (@ChrisCuomo) October 11, 2019  âPLEASE READ: When Sen. Harris said her pronouns were she her and herâs, I said mine too,â Cuomo wrote in a tweet. âI should not have. I apologize. I am an ally of the LGBTQ community, and I am sorry because I am committed to helping us achieve equality. Thank you for watching our townhall.â GOP strategist Arthur Schwartz mocked Cuomo shortly after the apology: Whatever, Fredo. https://t.co/1x6LPu9Ei3 â Arthur Schwartz (@ArthurSchwartz) October 11, 2019  âWhatever, Fredo,â Schwartz stated in a tweet. Follow Kyle on Twitter @RealKyleMorris and Facebook.

articles.title: Elizabeth Warren Proposes Mixed-Sex Prisons as Part of LGBT Agenda
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) advocated for mixed-sex prisons as part of the âLGBTQ+ Rights and Equalityâ plan she released on Thursday, hours before the Human Rights Campaignâs town hall on CNN.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Warren detailed her proposal in a Medium post, painting a bleak picture of the state of LGBT rights under the Trump administration. She accused the Trump White House of weaponizing the âlanguage of religionâ and giving entities a âlicense to discriminateÂ against LGBTQ+ people.â While Warrenâs proposal contains a swath of promises of protections for LGBT individuals, the presidential hopeful specifically vowed to mix federal prisons, allowing men to move into womenâs prisons on the basis of âgender identityâ rather than biological sex. She said she would instructÂ the Bureau of Prisons to house transgender inmates according to their identified sex, much like the Obama administration did in January 2017. Warrenâs plan states: I will direct the Bureau of Prisons to end the Trump Administrationâs dangerousÂ policyÂ of imprisoning transgender people in facilities based on their sex assigned at birth and ensure that all facilities meet the needs of transgender people, including by providing medically necessary care, like transition-related surgeries, while incarcerated. Former Attorney General Jeff Sessions announced a reversal of the Obama administrationâs mixed-sex policy in 2018,Â  determining that it would resume using âbiological sex as the initial determination.â As Breitbart News reported: Critics said Obamaâs transgender policy would have created huge risks of rape because few people who say they are transgender have undergone genital cosmetic surgery, and few can pass as members of the opposite sex. For example, Obamaâs policy wouldÂ allow male criminals into womenâs prisons and pressure women-who-say-they-are-men to live in menâs prisons. Sessionsâ new policy marks another step in reasserting the normal biology-based legal distinctionsÂ between femaleÂ and male. Those distinctions were being scrubbed from the law by Obamaâs pro-transgender policies. Trump has already begun reversing Obamaâs pro-transgender policies in K-12 schools, inÂ health care,Â andÂ theÂ militaryÂ which now says it classifies soldiersâ sex by using the âbright lineÂ based on biological sex.â Warren previewed her position in the criminal justice reform plan unveiled in August, which specifically called for âspecial protectionsâ for LGBT individuals behind bars. This is hardly the first time Warren has courted the transgender community. She applauded a child who claimed to be transgender during CNNâs Equality Town Hall on Thursday evening. âI want to make sure that the person I think is the right secretary of education meets you and hears your story, and then I want you to tell me if you think thatâs the right person and then weâll make the deal,â Warren said. Warren also vowed to provide taxpayer-funded sex-reassignment surgery. She outlined that position in her comprehensive LGBT agenda, calling for âgender-affirmingâ health care. âI believe that everyone is entitled to medical care and medical care that they need, and that includes people who are transgender, who â it is the time for them to have gender-affirming surgery,â Warren said during the town hall. âI just think thatâs important and the appropriate medical care,â she added. Warren, however, has not always felt that way. She said in 2012 that she did not find sexual reassignment surgery â for a transgender inmate, specifically â a âgood use of taxpayer dollars.â âI have to say, I donât think itâs a good use of taxpayer dollars,â she said at the time, only to reverse her position years later.

articles.title: Appeals Court Rules House Should Get Trump Financial Records
articles.subtitle: WASHINGTON (AP) â A federal appeals court has ruled that President Donald Trumpâs financial records must be turned over to the House of Representatives.
articles.author: Breitbart News
articles.content: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit said Friday that lawmakers should get the documents they have subpoenaed from Mazars USA. The firm has provided accounting services to Trump. Trump could appeal to the Supreme Court. The House Committee on Oversight and Reform subpoenaed records from Mazars in April. They include documents from 2011 to 2018 that the House wants for investigation into the presidentâs reporting of his finances and potential conflicts of interest. Trump appointee Neomi Rao dissented from the three-judge panelâs ruling. The other judges are Patricia Millett, appointed by President Barack Obama and David Tatel, appointed by President Bill Clinton.

articles.title: Hillary Clinton Criticizes Facebook for Not Being Anti-Trump Enough
articles.subtitle: Facebook, which has banned numerous conservative personalities and placed others on âhate agentâ watchlists has repeatedly come under fire from Hillary Clinton â for not being anti-Trump enough.
articles.author: Allum Bokhari
articles.content: At an event at the University of Michigan, twice-failed presidential candidate Hillary Clinton said she was âvery worriedâ about âforeign interference with the election,â and attacked Facebook for allowing âa stream of outrageous stories fed to peopleâs Facebook feeds.â Despite the mountain of evidence of Silicon Valleyâs anti-conservative bias, including search results rigged to suppress conservative content, Clinton demanded more from big tech companies. âIâm also really disappointed in a lot of the tech companies and Iâll mention Facebook because theyâre the most influential,â said the former candidate. Clinton madeÂ similar comments in a speech at George Washington University last month, complaining that the Trump Campaign is âspending hundreds and hundreds of thousands of dollars on Facebook each week.â She went on to accuse the Trump campaign of using the platform to spread âfake endorsements and outright lies about Democrats.â âThey have been doing this since after the 2017 inauguration, but itâs getting at an even higher velocity now. And even though these posts violate Facebookâs stated terms of service, theyâre still up, Facebook is still paid for them, and the people who are targeted to receive them still believe them.â Clinton also complained that democracy was being threatened by âphony, false, online news storiesâ that âmigrate to the so-called mainstream media.â She attacked Facebook for suggesting that users ought to âdecide for themselvesâ whether to believe or disbelieve content on the platform. Allum Bokhari is the senior technology correspondent at Breitbart News.

articles.title: 109 House GOP Back Movement to Condemn Adam Schiff
articles.subtitle: One-hundred and nine Republicans have backed a movement to condemn House Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff (D-CA) for deliberately misrepresenting a phone call between President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, according to a list obtained by Breitbart News Friday.
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: Over half of House Republicans have moved to condemn chairman Schiff by cosponsoring House Freedom Caucus Chairman Andy Biggsâ (R-AZ) H. Res. 604, according to a list obtained by Breitbart News. H. Res. 604 would condemn Schiff for retelling a fictional phone call between Zelensky and Trump. Schiff also allegedlyÂ liedÂ about having never spoken to the Ukrainian intelligence officer âwhistleblower.â House Freedom Caucus Chairman Biggsâ legislation has quickly moved through the House GOP conference. Support for the bill spreads from conservatives to moderates and House Republican leadership. Two weeks ago, the resolution gained 18 cosponsors. Last Friday, the bill gained 61 cosponsors. On Monday, the resolution had 73 cosponsors. On Wednesday, the legislation gained support from half of the House Republican conference. Now, as of Friday morning, the legislation has the support of 109 Republicans. House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA), House Minority Whip Steve Scalise (R-LA), and House Republican Conference chairwoman Liz Cheney (R-WY) have sponsored the resolution to condemn Schiff. The 109 House Republicans who have cosponsored Biggsâ resolution to condemn Schiff are: When Breitbart News reported that the legislation gained more than half of the House Republican conference, Rep. Biggs said that âit is time to hold Mr. Schiff accountable for misleading the American people in this unauthorized impeachmentâ of President Trump.  Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: Maryland Republican Gov. Larry Hogan Backs Impeachment Probe
articles.subtitle: Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan became the third Republican governor to express support for the House Democratsâ impeachment investigation against President Donald Trump when he appeared on PBSâs Firing Line for an interview airing Friday.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: A transcript is as follows: MARGARET HOOVER: Govs. Phil Scott (R-VT) and Charlie Baker (R-MA), two of your contemporaries and fellow travelers, they have said they support the impeachment inquiry. Do you? GOV. LARRY HOGAN:Â I do think we have to have an impeachment inquiry because we need to get to the bottom of it. Iâm not saying Iâm ready to say I support the impeachment and removal of the president, but I do think we need an impeachment inquiry.Â But Iâm very concerned aboutâ¦can we have a fair and objective one? And Iâm not sure we can in this Democratic Congress. HOOVER: But you do believe, I mean, you just said you do think we need to have an impeachment inquiry. GOV. HOGAN:Â I donât see any other way to get to the facts.

articles.title: Schweizer: Biden Needs to Address Ukraine Accusations âFront and Centerâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: Breitbart News senior contributor Peter Schweizer, author of âSecret Empires: How the American Political Class Hides Corruption and Enriches Family and Friends,â on Friday stressed the importance of 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden addressing the Ukraine issue involving him and his son, Hunter. Schweizer said the former vice president needs to address his familyâs dealings in Ukraine âfront and centerâ rather than ignoring because polling indicates most people believe it needs further investigation. â[Hunter Biden] has been radio silent, and I think if you look at the way the Bidens have handled this issue, itâs been to not answer any questions, which I think just raises further suspicions,â Schweizer told Fox News Channelâs âAmericaâs Newsroom.âÂ âHunter Biden is somewhere, allegedly in California hiding out, and Joe Biden wonât answer any questions on this. He gets angry.â âI think at some point theyâre going to have to address these issues front and center because as it stands right now, polls indicate that most people believe this needs further investigation and needs to be looked at,â he added. Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: 5 Ways Trump Plans to Improve Medicare for Older Americans
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump announced an executive order last week that seeks to protect Medicare for older Americans and strengthen it by providing them with more choices â even the choice to not accept it if they would rather have a private, non-government health plan.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: Speaking to residents of the Villages in Ocala, Florida, Trump said while Democrats are seeking to expand Medicare so that âallâ Americans can be on government-run socialized medicine, he intends to protect it, keep it for seniors only, and improve it by providing more options within the Medicare Advantage program and reducing its costs. âTogether, weâre creating a healthcare system that protects vulnerable patients, makes healthcare more affordable, gives you more choice and control, and delivers the high-quality care Americans deserve,â Trump told seniors in Florida.Â âAnd thatâs what weâre doing â weâre strengthening our healthcare system to a level that nobody thought would be possible.â Though the presidentâs executive order does not change any current policy by itself, it will launch necessary regulatory proposals by federal agencies, particularly the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). Here are five ways Trumpâs executive order seeks to strengthen Medicare: Within a year, Trump would like to see the HHS secretary propose a regulation that enables Medicare âto provide beneficiaries with more diverse and affordable plan choices.â The president wants to âencourage innovative â¦ benefit structures and plan designsâ in Medicare Advantage, the program that allows millions of older Americans to access various private health insurers at lower cost due to Medicare subsidies. In his order, Trump says he wants to âreduce barriers to obtaining Medicare Medical Savings Accountsâ and to âpromote innovations in supplemental benefits and telehealth services.â  Healthcare analyst Christopher Jacobs, CEO of Juniper Research Group, explained at the Federalist that Medicare Medical Savings Accounts are âa health savings account-like mechanism that gives beneficiaries incentives to serve as smart consumers of health care.â âTo accomplish that last objective, the order references broader access to cost and quality data, âimproving [seniorsâ] ability to make decisions about their health care that work best for them,ââ Jacobs noted. Younger Americans are gradually becoming more aware of the costs of healthcare services and prescription drugs. Many are using apps that help them assess the cost of a service or drug by various providers and pharmacies. Trumpâs order reflects that the practice of deciding what is best for each individual patient does not end when an American turns 65. When more Americans of any age seek the best quality health care at the lowest price, the costs of those services will come down. The implementation of Trumpâs executive order would allow more older Americans to access to health care services through telemedicine and other technologies. Jacobs noted this feature could especially be helpful to seniors in rural areas. Very importantly, the order also seeks to take on states whose restrictions curtailÂ competition in healthcare access and, thus, lead to limited provider networks in Medicare Advantage plans.  The executive order demands further improvement of Medicare by âeliminating burdensome regulatory billing requirements, conditions of participation, and other requirements that serve as obstacles to more providers participating in the program, including physician assistants and nurse practitioners. In a press statement, the Association of American Physicians and Surgeons (AAPS) commended Trump for taking âbold steps toward increasing the ability of American seniors to choose the medical care and insurance options best for them, instead of being trapped within increasingly insolvent government-run programs.â âAAPS thanks President Trump for the options he is granting seniors, and the physicians who care for them, in Section 11 of the Executive Order aimed at curbing the further encroachment of socialized medicine inÂ the United States,â said AAPS Executive DirectorÂ Jane M. Orient, M.D. Trumpâs order wants older Americans to reap the benefits of learning about costs in healthcare services by directly providing them with rebates and allowing them to share in the savings of the updated program. The presidentâs executive order finally demands a change in the 1993 rule that requiredÂ Medicare and Social Security to be linked together. The Clinton administration wrote the rule that states seniors cannot opt out of Medicare without giving up their Social Security benefits, even though they had been forced to pay into Social Security for years. The order states: Within 180 days of the date of this order, the Secretary, in coordination with the Commissioner of Social Security, shall revise current rules or policies to preserve the Social Security retirement insurance benefits of seniors who choose not to receive benefits under Medicare Part A, and propose other administrative improvements to Medicare enrollment processes for beneficiaries. âIt is unethical, not to mention contrary to basic common sense, to insist that American seniors only receive care through Medicare,â said Orient. AAPS added: Medicareâs Hospital Trust Fund will beÂ depleted by 2026Â and over the next 10-15 years, counting the Trust Funds as assets rather than taxpayer liabilities, the Medicare programÂ is only 71% fundedÂ under trusteesâ unfavorable assumptions, and 91% under favorable assumptions. Giving seniors the ability to escape this faltering program will help ease the looming crisis as well as give Americanâs access to options that work best for them, not government bureaucrats. The Clinton-era rule was challenged by a nonprofit group seeking healthcare freedom, but, in 2011, a federal judge ruled in favor of the Obama administration and stated ârequiring a mechanism for plaintiffs and others in their situation to âdis-enrollâ would be contrary to congressional intent, which was to provide âmandatoryâ benefits under Medicare Part A and for those receiving Social Security Retirement benefits.â âPlaintiffs are trapped in a government program intended for their benefit,â U.S. District Judge Rosemary Collyer continued. âThey disagree and wish to escape. The Court can find no loophole or requirement that the Secretary provide such a pathway.â Under Trumpâs order, individuals would still be required to pay Medicare taxes, but if they chose private health insurance, they could opt out of the government-run program without forfeiting their Social Security benefits. Jacobs observed the proposal âstands as a common-sense solution to our entitlement shortfalls.â âAfter all, why should we force someone like Bill Gates or Warren Buffett to accept Medicare benefits if they are perfectly content to use other forms of health coverage?â he reasoned. Orient emphasized the need to increase patient freedom, rather than adopt âMedicare for All,â which will eliminate choice. âWidening escape hatches from an insolvent program and other looming Medicare changes, that will deteriorate patient care and limit their options, is needed now more than ever,â she said.

articles.title: Nolte: Trumpâs Job Approval Rating Holds Steady and Still Higher than Obamaâs
articles.subtitle: President Trumpâs job approval ratings has not been noticeably damaged by the Ukraine Hoax and is still higher than Barack Obamaâs.
articles.author: John Nolte
articles.content: While itâs true that Trumpâs approval rating was climbing, and climbed to 45 percent in the Real Clear Politics poll of polls prior to the media and Democrats launching their coordinated impeachment blitzkrieg, as of now it sits at 43.4 percent, not even two points lower. Whatâs more, Trump disapproval rating has barely increased, from 52 percent to 53.6 percent. And as of late, in fact, Trumpâs numbers have actually improved slightly: a half point increase in approval and a half point decrease in disapproval. Overall, what you have here, with such a small amount of movement, is Trump holding remarkably steady during yet-another full-throated media and political assault, the likes of which we have not seen since, you know, the last one. Whatâs especially fascinating is that during the Russia Collusion Hoax, Democrats and their media allies were able to drive Trumpâs numbers down into the 30s, to as low as 37 percent back in December of 2017. This time, even with the hysteria of impeachment added to the menu, not so much. What I think this tells us is the voters are no longer jolted into dropping their support for Trump by a media that has cried wolf nearly once too often four years. In the past, the media could gin up enough hysteria to drive down Trumpâs approval numbers, at least until the public figured out it was all fake news. In fact, in the Rasmussen daily tracking poll, the most accurate poll of the 2016 presidential election, shows Trumpâs job approval rating has not only climbed from 45 to 49 percent over the last four days, his approval rating is four points higher than Barack Obamaâs was on this same day during his failed presidency. Obviously, these numbers can change, but we are now in the second week of Ukraine Hoax Hysteria, so as these numbers stand today, they are worthy of note. One conclusion you might make from them is that time is not on the side of the media and Democrats, is not on this side of this absurd impeachment inquiry. The plan, obviously, was to blitzkrieg the public into backing impeachment, which would force Republicans to go along with public opinion. For days and days and days we were hit 24/7 with screaming headlines and secret testimony that resulted in damaging (and selective) leaksâ¦ There is just no question the media and Democrats thought they had learned from the mistakes of the Russia coup and the plot to destroy Brett Kavanaugh: 1) Move fast, 2) hide your accuserâs (the whistleblowerâs) true identity, and 3) do as much as possible in secrecy. Trump, though, outsmarted them by releasing the transcript of his call with the Ukrainian president, which none of his enemies expected him to do because they were sure it was a smoking gun. Well, it wasnât, but watching the media roll out their game plan as though the president had not released the transcript is more than a little amusing. I mean, now that weâve seen the transcript, stories, like this, that were obviously written two weeks ago under the assumption Trump would never give up the transcript, actually make me laugh out loud. Trump is also outsmarting the Democrats and the media by refusing to cooperate with what he correctly refers to as a kangaroo court. Good grief, this so-called whistleblower, who we already know is a registered Democrat, who we already know colluded with Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) to create the complaint, who we already know benefited by a sudden Deep State rule change to facilitate his complaint, who we already know is a crony of Joe Bidenâs(!!!), wants to testify in secret â which is the stuff of banana republics. This is not a legitimate inquiry, not even close. Somehow the media and Democrats came up with something that is even more of a partisan witch hunt than the Russia Hoax, and I just donât see the American people seeing something so toxically partisan and perversely secretive as legitimate. Furthermore, if Democrats actually had the goods on Trump, if the media actually had the goods on the Orange Bad Man, they wouldnât have to play all these games in secret and spread all these lies. If anything, Trumpâs remarkably steady approval rating show us the public is in wait-and-see mode. Democrats might be consolidating their own voters to push up the polls backing impeachment, but the public at large appears to be waiting for the evidenceâ¦ And since there is none, Trump is smart to obstruct and delay, smart to treat this coup with the contempt it deserves, because the longer the public is forced to stare at this Potemkin Impeachment, the more they will see it is based on bluff, hysteria, media bias, a desire to meddle in the 2020 election, and stark-raving fear of what the upcoming Inspector General reports are going to say about the Obama administrationâs appalling, illegal, and unprecedented spying on Trumpâs 2016 campaign. Follow John Nolte on Twitter @NolteNC. Follow his Facebook Page here.

articles.title: Trump Campaign Rolls out âWhereâs Hunterâ T-Shirts
articles.subtitle: President Trumpâs re-election campaign rolled out âWhereâs Hunter?â T-shirts after the president slammed Joe Biden and his son at the Minneapolis,Â Minnesota, rally Thursday evening, ultimately asking the crowd, âWhereâs Hunter?â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Trump laid into Biden and his son Hunter throughout his rally on Thursday, specifically for Bidenâs questionable business dealings in China and Ukraine. Bidenâs role in the firing of a Ukrainian prosecutor investigating Burisma Holdings â a natural gas company that his son sat on the board of, taking in tens of thousands of dollars a month despite a lack of qualifications for the position â has been under the spotlight in recent weeks. âJoeâs son Hunter got thrown out of the Navy and then he became a genius on Wall Street in about two days,â Trump told the crowd.Â âWhatever happened to Hunter? Where the hell is he?â âWhereâs Hunter?â he asked. âHey fellas, I have an idea for a new T-shirt,â Trump added. âLetâs do another T-shirt: âWhereâs Hunter?ââ That night, Trump campaign manager Brad Parscale unveiled the shirt. âGet your Whereâs Hunter t-shirt NOW!Â Made in USA (not Ukraine or China),â he wrote. âNo Prior Experience Requiredâ:  Trump also took aim at the Bidensâ ties to China and once again asked, âWhereâs Hunter?â âAnd then they go to China â¦ and Hunter, whoâs not too smart â¦ he goes in, he has a meeting and walks out with $1.5 billion, billion with a B, $1.5 billion,â Trump said. âNow think of it, whereâs Hunter?â he asked. âHunter, you know nothing about energy, you know nothing about China, you know nothing about anything really. Hunter, youâre a loser,â Trump said. âWhy did you get $1.5 billion, Hunter?â The Biden campaign has been testy over the media coverage of his involvement in China and Ukraine, sending a blistering letter to New York Times executive editor Dean Baquet for running an op-ed by author and Breitbart senior contributor Peter Schweizer. Deputy Campaign Manager and Communications Director Kate Bedingfield accused the Times of spreading âa baseless conspiracy theory advanced by Rudy Giulianiâ and ârelegated to the likes of Breitbart, Russia propaganda, and another conspiracy theorist, regular Hannity guest John Solomon.â âThis leaves us with a critical question: are you truly blind to what you got wrong in 2016, or are you deliberately continuing policies that distort reality for the sake of controversy and the clicks that accompany it?â she asked, demanding a public response. AÂ TimesÂ spokesperson responded to the scathing letter,Â assuringÂ the Biden campaign that it will âcontinue to cover Joe Biden with the same tough and fair standards we apply to every candidate in the race.â The Biden campaignÂ warnedÂ Democrat rivals to refrain from repeating the âdiscredited liesâ ahead of next weekâs presidential debate.

articles.title: WATCH LIVE: Pentagon Leaders Brief Reporters on Syria, Other Developments
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: Pentagon chief Mark Esper and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark E. Milley will brief reporters at 12 p.m. ET. They will address the latest developments in the Middle East.

articles.title: Red State Democrats Facing Anti-Impeachment Protests Back Home
articles.subtitle: Republicans are poised to make impeachment an albatross for Democrats, particularly in red states where the move would nullify those who voted for President Trump.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: Democrats have felt bolstered in recent days by polls showing public support for impeachment is rising. But most of the rise in support is from Democrats, Trump and Republicans are now beginning to fight back. On Wednesday, the White House sent a letter to House Democrats slamming the impeachment inquiry as an âillegitimateâ and âpartisanâ effort to undo the 2016. âThe President cannot allow your constitutionally illegitimate proceedings to distract him and those in the Executive Branch from their work on behalf of the American people,â White House Counsel Pat Cipollone wrote. And at a campaign rally Thursday in Minneapolis, Minnesota, Trump called it a âwitch huntâ and âinsane,â and warned an attempt to overthrow him would produce backlash at the ballot box. House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) shared with Republican lawmakers this week an internal poll that showed that in 95 battleground districts, 67 percent of independents viewed impeachment as politically motivated. The poll found that a Republican candidate who opposes impeachment leads a pro-impeachment Democrat 50 percent to 42 percent in the poll. It also found thatÂ in districts that Trump carried in 2016 that are currently held by Democrats, the Republican candidate holds a 54 percent to 38 percent lead. Red state Democrats back in their home states for two weeks are coming face-to-face with constituents unhappy about their support for impeachment. The New York Timesâ Daily podcast recently followed Rep. Elissa Slotkin (D-MI), a vulnerable Democrat in a red district who came out in favor of an impeachment inquiry, to three town halls, where she was confronted by upset constituents. Attendees shouted âNot true!Â  We didnât ask for that,â âFake news,â and âDo your job,â at the town halls. Slotkin told them, âIâm going to wait for facts,â and âlook at them judiciously.â One attendee asked her why she signed an op-ed that came out in support of an impeachment inquiry before the facts were out: âIf youâre waiting, why did you send the op-ed?â One attendee told Slotkin that she liked her at first, but âwhen you fell off the cliff for me was when you joined the coup against our president.â That comment was greeted with agreement from others.  The internal House Republican poll found that 68 percent of voters in battleground districts say Democrats should be more concerned about addressing issues such as health care and the economy. Throughout the country, House Democrats in red districts are facing anti-impeachment protests from Arizona to New York:  At a recent event for Rep.
