Haley Stevens (D-MI), anti-impeachment protesters were removed from the line for one of her events so that supporters could sit in front, according to Deputy Press Secretary for the Republican National Committee Mike Joyce.       As of now, 224 Democrats support impeachment or an impeachment inquiry â more than the 208 majority needed in the House to formally vote on opening an impeachment inquiry or to pass articles of impeachment. Republicans have called on Democrats to hold a full vote on opening an impeachment inquiry, which wouldÂ afford Republicans powers such as the ability to subpoena witnesses. Currently, the inquiry has been conducted behind closed doors. Democrat groups are hoping to sway public opinion via their closed-door inquiry. Politico reported this week that a Democrat-aligned digital group ACRONYM is launching a $1 million ad campaign in battleground states focused on impeaching Trump. The ads will first run in five states with 2020 electoral votes up for grabs â Arizona, Michigan, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, and could expand nationwide.  Follow Breitbart NewsâÂ @Kristina_Wong.

articles.title: Bernie Sanders on Remaining in 2020 Race: âIâm Not a Quitterâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: In a sit-down interview with CNN, 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) discussed remaining in the race despite suffering a heart attack, saying he feels âreally goodâ now. Sanders was asked if he thought about dropping out of the race following the heart attack, to which he simply replied, âNo.â âYou know, when you hear the word âheart attack,â youâre thinking of somebody lying on the ground in terrible pain. Wasnât the case, OK? The day I woke up after the procedure, no pain, zero pain. No pain right now. I feel really good,â Sanders said. âWe have had significant success in kind of transforming the dialogue in America,â he later added. âMany of the issues that I talked about four years ago â¦ that were considered radical then and are kind of mainstream today. Many of my Democratic opponents are saying today what I said four years ago. Weâve struggled really hard to get to where we are right now, bringing millions of people together in the fight for justice, and Iâm not a quitter.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Trump Joins Streaming Platform Twitch to Broaden Rally Viewership
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump has joined the gamer-centric, livestreaming platform Twitch, which is owned by Amazon, broadening the online reach of his rallies ahead of the 2020 presidential election.
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: President Trumpâs Twitch channel currently features video clips from his Minneapolis rally on Thursday, including the presidentâs full hour-and-forty-five-minute appearance before the live crowd atÂ Target Center in downtown Minneapolis. The channel also features a promotion for the presidentâs upcoming rally in Dallas set for October 17. President Trumpâs rallies are also available to stream on YouTube, through the presidentâs official channel. So far, the presidentâs Twitch channel has garnered nearly 46,000 followers since reportedly going live earlier this week. Democratic presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders also uses Twitch, having joined the platform earlier this year. Twitch launched in 2011 and was primarily targeted at the gaming community. Amazon acquired the service in 2014 for a reported $970 million, after an overture from Google fell through. The platform is still geared predominantly towards young viewers, andÂ is now the most popular live streaming site in the U.S., according to a study from Qwilt, a company that provides video caching services to content creators. The site hosts live gaming and esports streams as well as lifestyle channels devoted to cooking, travel and other topics. Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Camille Paglia: Using Puberty Blockers on Children âIs a Crime Against Humanityâ
articles.subtitle: Using puberty-blocking drugs on pre-pubescent children in order to stultify their sexual development âis a crime against humanity,â said Camille Paglia, professor of humanities and media studies at the University of the Arts in Philadelphia. She offered her remarks on Tuesdayâs edition of Dennis Pragerâs eponymous radio show while discussing her latest book,Â Provocations: Collected Essays on Art, Feminism, Politics, Sex, and Education.
articles.author: Robert Kraychik
articles.content: Paglia highlighted left-wing denial of the biological origins of sex, including left-wing framing of sex as an arbitrary and subjective social construct. âThese ideas arenât based on any actual study of biology,â she said. Paglia noted much of the news mediaâs ambivalence towards the aforementioned experimentation on children: I think that experiments of unproven drugs â drug protocols â on children is a crime against humanity, and it should not be tolerated. It amazes me there is hardly any media attention to this matter. I think the future will look back with surprise and shock at the ethical indifference of the major media right now in the United States to this going on. It is simply not right. These drugs have not been fully tested, and weâre using children as experiments? Boys forever are going to have, in adulthood, a childâs size penis? I cannot believe that this is happening without protest. âDonât imagine that the child knows his or her future identity at age three, or ten, for that matter,â added Paglia. âFlash-freezing a childâs development through the introduction of drugs â pre-puberty, on and so on â seems to me, should be recognizably, not just wrong, but horrific.â LISTEN:  Paglia reflected on her own gender dysphoria, speculating on how her maturation may have unfolded differently had she been exposed to ubiquitous contemporary left-wing characterizations of sex as a purely social construct: If all of this was in the air when I was young, I would have become absolutely convinced that I was really a man, and I think I would have probably been vulnerable to that fantasy until my mid-twenties, probably. â¦ And completing my massive 700-page book Sexual Personae, in a sense, exorcised that. â¦ Right from the start, in 1990, I was describing that book as a transgender construction. Itâs a voice. Itâs an other self. Iâve never felt female, but I donât feel male, either. â¦Â I would have been obsessed. âI feel that â and Iâve said this publicly â prescribing puberty blockers to children is a violation of human rights,â determined Paglia. Follow Robert Kraychik onÂ Twitter.

articles.title: Biden Campaign Warns Democrat Candidates: Do Not Repeat âDiscredited Liesâ About Hunter
articles.subtitle: The Biden campaign is warning any presidential candidate who âcalls themselves a Democratâ to refrain from repeating âdiscredited liesâ about Joe Biden (D) and his son Hunter during the next presidential debate.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The Biden campaign is taking an aggressive stance in an effort to dismiss the mounting questions and concerns surrounding the Bidensâ business dealings in both China and Ukraine. The latter has become a particular point of interest in recent weeks, following President Trumpâs phone call with Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky. Democrats say Trump âpressuredâ Ukraine to investigate his potential rival, Biden, who played a key role in the firing of a Ukrainian prosecutor who was investigating Burisma Holdings. Hunter Biden served on the board, making $83,000 per month, despite a stunning lack of qualifications for such a position. The former vice president wanted the prosecutor fired and threatened to withhold $1 billion in aid,Â bragging about his ultimatum last year. âI said, Iâm telling you, youâre not getting the billion dollars. I said, youâre not getting the billion. Iâm going to be leaving here in, I think it was about six hours,â Biden said during an appearance at the Council on Foreign Relations in 2018. âI looked at them and said: Iâm leaving in six hours. If the prosecutor is not fired, youâre not getting the money. Well, son of a bitch. He got fired,â he boasted. The Biden campaign, however, is warning fellow candidates to refrain from taking a shot at the Bidensâ business dealings in China and Ukraine, and specifically the role that Hunter played. A Biden aide warned anyone who âcalls themselves a âDemocratââ from pushing the âdiscredited lies.â If they choose to do so, they âwould be making a profound statement about themselves,â the aide said, according to Bloomberg. âAides to some of the other candidates in the debate say they do not expect their candidates to shy away from repeating their public criticisms,â Bloomberg reported. However, Bidenâs Democrat rivals have largely refrained from talking about the Bidensâ questionable business dealings, focusing on party-approved impeachment talking points instead. The aideâs warning follows the Biden campaignâs blistering letter to New York TimesÂ Executive Editor Dean Baquet. Deputy Campaign Manager and Communications Director Kate Bedingfield, who penned the letter, laid into the Times for running an op-ed by author and Breitbart Senior ContributorÂ Peter Schweizer. She also accused the Times of spreading âa baseless conspiracy theory advanced by Rudy Giuliani.â Bedingfield wrote: This debunked theory speculates that then Vice-President Biden somehow did anything reportedly inappropriate in successfully ridding Ukraine of a corrupt prosecutor, Viktor Shokin, who theÂ TimesÂ itself thoroughly explained at the time was derelict and the target of an international effort for removal. âWhat was especially troubling about theÂ TimesâsÂ active participation in this smear campaign is that prior to its reporting on the subject by Ken Vogel,Â this conspiracy had been relegated to the likes of Breitbart, Russia propaganda, and another conspiracy theorist, regular Hannity guest John Solomon,â she added, ultimately demanding the Times to âpublicly answer for these failures in reporting on this pressing issue fairly.â A spokesperson for the Times said the outlet will âcontinue to cover Joe Biden with the same tough and fair standards we apply to every candidate in the race.â âWeâre happy to sit down with Biden advisers anytime to discuss news coverage,â the spokesperson added. The president torched the Bidens during his rally in Minneapolis, Minnesota, Thursday evening, asking the crowd, âWhereâs Hunter?â âJoeâs son Hunter got thrown out of the Navy and then he became a genius on Wall Street in about two days,â Trump said. âBy the way, whatever happened to Hunter? Where the hell is he â¦Â Whereâs Hunter?â âAnd then they go to China â¦ and Hunter, whoâs not too smart â¦ he goes in, he has a meeting and walks out with $1.5 billion, billion with a B, $1.5 billion,â he continued. âNow think of it, whereâs Hunter?â âHunter, you know nothing about energy, you know nothing about China, you know nothing about anything really. Hunter, youâre a loser,â he added. âWhy did you get $1.5 billion, Hunter?â

articles.title: Ana Navarro Erupts When Challenged by Rand Paul over Maduro, Socialism â âDonât Mansplain Me!â
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Fridayâs broadcast of ABCâs âThe View,âÂ Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) battled guest co-host Ana Navarro over socialism. Navarro said, âYou talk about Venezuela in your new book. I get a lot of political ads from the Republican Party. Donald Trump has tweeted this. Many have tweeted this. If you vote for Democrats, they will turn the United States into Venezuela. Do you think thatâs a fair statement to make?â Paul said, âWell, if you vote for a socialist, you might get socialism.â Navarro shot back, âCome on. Donât do that. Maduro is not a socialist. Heâs a corrupt, murderous thug who is starving his people.â Paul said, âThatâs not true.â Navarro yelled, âThatâs not true? Maduro is not a thug and murderer who is starving his people?â Paul said, âThey voted for socialismâlet me finish.â NavarroÂ interjected, âI canât let you finish. If you are going to say Maduro is not a murderer, thatâs a damn lie. I have got a bunch of neighbors and friends who know this. Donât do this to me. Donât mansplain. Iâm a 47-year-old woman.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: U.S. Ambassador to EU Sondland to Sit for Deposition in Trump Impeachment Inquiry
articles.subtitle: Gordon Sondland, the U.S. ambassador to the European Union, said through his attorney that he will honor the Democrats request for a deposition in the ongoing impeachment effort, despite the Trump administrationâs announcement that it would no longer cooperate in the probe.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: âAfter consultation with Committee Staff, his testimony is now scheduled for Thursday, October 17,â Sondlandâs lawyer, Robert Luskin, said in a statement to NBC News on Friday. âAmbassador Sondland has at all times acted with integrity and in the interests of the United States. He has no agenda apart from answering the Committeesâ questions fully and truthfully,â Luskin said in the statement. âNotwithstanding the State Departmentâs current direction to not testify, Ambassador Sondland will honor the Committeesâ subpoena, and he looks forward to testifying on Thursday,â Luskin said. âThe subpoena was issued hours after Sondland was ordered by the White House not to appear for a scheduled deposition with the Democrat-led House committees leading the impeachment probe,â CNBC reported. CNBC reported on the text messages that connect Sondland to Trumpâs call with the Ukrainian president where the president spoke about efforts to investigate corruption in the country, including Hunter Bidenâs controversial involvement with an energy conglomerate while Joe Biden was vice president. According to the report: Sondlandâs text messages with other U.S. diplomats were released last week after they were given to those House panels by former U.S. special envoy to Ukraine Kurt Volker during his own deposition. In a Sept. 9 exchange, Bill Taylor, a senior U.S. diplomat in Ukraine, told Sondland: âI think itâs crazy to withhold security assistance for help with a political campaign.â Sondland responded: âBill, I believe you are incorrect about President Trumpâs intentions. The President has been crystal clear no quid pro quoâs of any kind. The President is trying to evaluate whether Ukraine is truly going to adopt the transparency and reforms that [Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky] promised during his campaign.â The White House legal team also sent a letter to House Democrats that laid out the reasons the administration would not cooperate with the various committees looking into Trumpâs alleged misdeeds. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter

articles.title: Report: Elizabeth Warren in Contact with Andrew Gillum, Sparking Rumors of a Potential VP
articles.subtitle: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) has been in contact with radical leftist and failed gubernatorial candidate Andrew Gillum (D), sparking rumors that the presidential hopeful is considering him as a potential running mate.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Warren has been in contact with Gillum â the radical leftist who lost Floridaâs gubernatorial race to Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) last fall â according to the Daily Beast: And for several candidates, including at least one in the top tier, former Tallahassee Mayor Andrew Gillum is on speed dial. Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), in particular, has been in contact with Gillum over the past several months, multiple knowledgeable sources told The Daily Beast. While the Warren campaign says that the vice presidential rumors are âbaseless and not at all true,â sources who spoke to the Daily Beast said that their relationship is reminiscent of the search process a candidate typically goes through in order to find the right running mate: One source briefed on the communications said the two Democrats have been in contact over the course of the campaign and that there is a âstrong impressionâ that Gillum is a possible vice presidential contender for Warren, who has risen in recent months to become a frontrunner in the 2020 primary, the source said. âIf youâre trying to win Florida, I would be courting Andrew and thatâs whatâs happening,â a second source familiar with the conversations said. Gillum rose to the national spotlight after challenging DeSantis in Floridaâs close gubernatorial race last year, earning the support of celebrities like pop sensation Rihanna and rap star Sean âDiddyâ Combs. Despite a strong backing from Hollywood, Gillum lost. DeSantis narrowly squeaked out a win in the Sunshine State, besting Gillum by less than half a percentage point, or less than 325,000 votes. Gillum largely campaigned on many of the far-leftâs go-to narratives, such as Medicare for All, gun control, and increased taxation â three issues that particularly resonate with Warren. As Breitbart News reported in July, Gillum is utilizing hisÂ private non-profit in an effort to register 1 million voters and ultimately flip Florida blue. His use of the private non-proft is of interest, as Gillum previously decried the use of âdark moneyâ in politics. By using his private non-profit for such an effort, he can âcan disclose much less financial data, including the sources of donationsâ: Gillumâs use of the nonprofit, calling itself Forward Florida Action, is notable given the Florida politicianâsÂ warningÂ last February about the influence of âdark moneyâ in his own race for governor, referring to entities that obscure their donors.Â  Gillum is deploying his nonprofit for the voter registration drive instead of utilizing his political committee, Forward Florida. â¦ The change came after theÂ Tampa Bay TimesreportedÂ in May that the FBI had subpoenaed records related to his 2018 gubernatorial campaign. Â  This after Gillumâs time as Tallahassee mayor was tied to an FBI probe into city hall corruption, a federal investigation thatÂ involvedÂ undercover FBI agents going on trips with Gillum. Like Warren, Gillum has called for Trumpâs impeachment and has remained a voice for the far-left flank of the Democrat Party. Gillum subtly addressed the reports of his conversations with Warren in a tweet on Thursday. âMany of my friends running to beat @realDonaldTrump call me often â about one thing: how to win Florida,â he wrote, plugging his voter registration drive:

articles.title: Voter to Democrat Lawmaker: âWhistleblowerâ Complaint akin to â13-Year-Old Girls Gossipingâ
articles.subtitle: Some constituents in Democrat-controlled congressional districts have expressed dismay at their lawmakersâ support for the impeachment probe into U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content: Vulnerable freshmen Democrats in the House representing Republican-friendly regions, in particular, met at least some opposition to their support for the impeachment investigation in recent weeks. Some constituents even expressed support for Trumpâs criticism of former Vice President Joe Bidenâs alleged links to corruption in Ukraine. That was the case at the marathon stretch of six town halls last Saturday for swing-district Rep. Sean Casten (D-IL), Politico acknowledged on October 6. During one of those town halls, an unnamed female âraised her voice after Casten criticized Trumpâs [July 25] phone call with the Ukrainian president,â Politico reported Thursday. The voter told Casten the âwhistleblowerâsâ complaint about the call âlooks like a bunch of 13-year-old girls gossiping about the person they donât like.â In response, âCasten held firm in his criticisms of Trumpâs conduct â often sounding like a liberal Democrat who hails from a blue district, rather than a lawmaker trying to placate both sides,â Politico noted. The news outlet described Casten as a âdie-hardâ supporter of the impeachment inquiry. In 2018, Casten became the first Democrat to hold the congressional seat of theÂ Sixth Congressional District of Illinois as part of a nationwide Democrat sweep of suburban districts. Hillary Clinton narrowly won Castenâs district in 2016. During the July 25 call, Trump attempted to improperly leverage U.S. aid to Ukraine in return for it investigating Joe Biden and his son Hunter, the âwhistleblowerâ claimed. Trump and Unrkainian President Volodymyr Zelensky have denied the âwhistleblowerâsâ allegation, which triggered the impeachment inquiry. The U.S. president has accused White House hopeful Biden of engaging in improper dealings with Ukraine while serving as vice president. A video ad from Trumpâs re-election asserts that Biden threatened to withhold $1 billion in aid to Ukraine unless the eastern European country fired a prosecutor investigating an energy company. Hunter Biden served on the Ukrainian companyâs board at the time. Internal pollingÂ indicatesÂ a storm is brewing for vulnerable Democrats in key congressional districts. Polling by the National Republican Congressional Committee (NRCC) shows most voters do not consider the Trump-Zelensky phone call an impeachable offense. A recent Fox News poll, however, shows a record 51 percent of respondents support the impeachment and removal of Trump.

articles.title: Judge Jeanine: CIA âAttempting a Coup Against the United States Presidentâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Trent Baker
articles.content: During Fridayâs âFox & Friends,â network host Jeanine Pirro weighed in on the anonymous whistleblower complaint against President Donald Trump over his phonecall with Ukraineâs president. Pirro said the whistleblower wanting to testify against Trump in writing behind closed doors is further evidence of the CIA âattempting a coup againstâ Trump, questioning why the whistleblower wants to remain anonymous. âWho is this guy?â Pirro asked. âNumber one, he is a CIA person, OK? What weâre experiencing right now is the CIA, an intelligence agency, attempting a coup against the United States president. And that is what is going on here. This is intelligence agencies trying to take out a president.â She continued, âThe bottom line is, who is he afraid of? They always try to make themselves victims. Everybodyâs a victim. You know, I was a prosecutor for 150 years. Every criminal I ever tried was a victim. Youâre not a victim. You need to come out. You know, Barack Obama, I was just reading this morning, he fired whistleblowers. Now in this administration, weâre not even entitled to know who they are.â Pirro went on to slam the whistleblower, describing the complaint as ânothing more than hearsay.â âThe best evidence is the transcript,â she declared. âThe president was open, he was willing and transparent.â Follow Trent Baker on TwitterÂ @MagnifiTrent

articles.title: Report: More Possible âWhistleblowersâ Have Reached Out to Lawmakers
articles.subtitle: Additional so-called âwhistleblowersâ have reportedly reached out to congressional investigators in the wake of the House Democrats launching an impeachment inquiry that was sparked by a partisan CIA officerâs mischaracterization of President Donald Trumpâs telephone call with the leader of Ukraine.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: According to a Daily BeastÂ report published Friday, lawmakers on Capitol Hill are currently working to determine the credibility of their accounts. It is unclear what these individuals are alleging or what departments they work in. Mark Zaid, the activist attorney representing the so-called âwhistleblowerâ at the center of the impeachment probe, told the Daily Beast that he anticipates more government employees will come forward with allegations of wrongdoing committed by the Trump administration. âThere are clearly numerous whistleblowers out there and many people who possess firsthand relevant information who could come forward, and I expect some will,â Zaid predicted. âOne knowledgeable source said that the daily accumulation of revelations about Trumpâs willingness to use U.S. foreign relations for his personal political benefit has prompted more people to approach Congress,â the Daily Beast reports. âInvestigators are using the soon-to-expire congressional recess to vet the accounts theyâre getting.â Speaking to the Daily Beast, House Intelligence ChairmanÂ Rep. Adam SchiffÂ (D-CA) refused to comment on the veracity of the news outletâs report becauseÂ âpeople can reverse-engineer who whistleblowers are.â Schiff, whose conduct amid the impeachment probe has received the formal condemnation ofÂ 109 Republican congressmen, previously made false statements regarding his panelâs contacts with the initial so-called âwhistleblower.â Not only has Schiffâs credibility been called into question, but so has the so-called âwhistleblower.â The Washington Examiner reported Thursday that the officer, said to be a registered Democrat, worked with then-vice president Joe Biden while serving in the White House. Equipped with only secondhand information, the officer alleged President Trump pressured Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky to look into allegations of corruption against Biden and his son, Hunter. Both presidents have denied any pressure was applied and the White House published a transcript of the world leadersâ call to dispel allegations of wrongdoing. âThere was no blackmail,â ZelenskyÂ toldÂ reporters this week when asked about the July 25th call. âWe are not servants. We are an independent country.â

articles.title: FNCâs Wallace Questions Gingrichâs Criticism of Trump Impeachment â âThis Is the Exact Opposite of Unconstitutionalâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Fridayâs broadcast of Fox News Channelâs âAmericaâs Newsroom,â âFox News Sundayâ anchor Chris WallaceÂ called out former House Speaker Newt Gingrich (R-GA)Â  for criticizing the impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump. During an earlier appearance on Fox News, Gingrich accused House Speaker NancyÂ Pelosi (D-CA) of carrying out âan unconstitutional coup dâÃ©tat, an effort to use the power of the Congress to change the outcome for the American people.â Wallace said, âIâm a little surprised at Speaker Gingrich, who I greatly respect.Â This is the exact opposite of unconstitutional. The Constitution specifically says that impeachment is left to Congress with very little statement as to how they want to conduct it. And in fact, I think I remember that Newt Gingrich did an impeachment effort, led an impeachment effort against Bill Clinton in 1998. Was that an effort to overturn an election? No, he was investigating stuff.â He added, âWe may find out that there is some there-there â thereâs no there-there, but to call it unconstitutional or an effort to overturn an election, thatâs a reach particularly for somebody like Newt Gingrich who was involved in the last impeachment effort.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Chinese State Media: Western China Has Made âRemarkable Progressâ with Concentration Camps
articles.subtitle: The Chinese government went on the defensive through its propaganda arms Thursday as the United States imposed restrictions on communist officials believed to be involved in gross human rights abuses against its citizens.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: âMost Westerners have never been to Xinjiang,â the Global Times reported on the Chinese governmentâs response to the U.S. State Departmentâs move: Almost everybody knows that U.S. policy always regards Muslims as heretics â U.S. President Donald Trump issued the infamous Muslim travel ban soon after he took office. The border wall that the Trump administration promotes has showcased the countryâs real attitude toward minority groups. How could they really care about the rights of Muslims living far away in Xinjiang? U.S. governmentâs moves concerning Xinjiang are going against the betterment of the situation in Xinjiang as well as vital development and prosperity in the region. This shows that adding more Chinese entities to the blacklist and visa restrictions on Chinese officials are obviously geopolitical moves by the U.S. Xinjiang has made remarkable progress, with people enjoying human rights based on peace and stability. Having been through severe terrorist and extremist activities, Xinjiang has successfully protected the lives of numerous people and peace has returned to the region. It has avoided the fate of becoming another Chechnya. As Breitbart News reportedÂ last summer, victims of human rights abuse from around the world met with Trump at the White House as part of theÂ U.S. State Departmentâs Ministerial to Advance Religious Freedom, including Jewher Ilham, who shared the plight of her father, a Uyghur scholar sentenced to life in prison in 2014 for speaking out against the Chinese communist government. Ilham told Trump about the estimated one million or more Uyghur Muslims that the regime has rounded up and put in âre-education camps,â where evidence exists of torture and organ harvesting. âThere was no such freedom for Uighurs in China â not at the school where my father was a professor, not in public, not even in a private house,â Ilham said. âInstead there are signs on the street reminding Uighurs that they are not allowed to be visibly Muslim.â On Wednesday in an interview with the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS), U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo slammed the Chinese government for its human rights abuses. âThis is not only an enormous human rights violation, but we donât think itâs in the best interests of the world or of China to engage in this kind of behavior,â Pompeo toldÂ PBS. âThe Chinese Embassy in Washington said in a separate statement this week that allegations of human rights abuses are âmade-up pretextsâ for interfering in Chinese affairs,â the Global Times reported. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter.

articles.title: WSJ: Blame Environmentalists for California Blackouts, Wildfires
articles.subtitle: TheÂ Wall Street Journal has blamed environmental regulations and mandates for California wildfires â and for the blackouts this week that are aimed at preventing them.
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: Pacific Gas and Electric Co. (PG&E) cut power to hundreds of thousands of customers in Northern California this week as a precaution amidst hot and windy weather. Last year, the company was blamed for the Camp Fire â the deadliest in the stateâs history â after a faulty power line was blamed for starting a brush fire that spread rapidly and destroyed the town of Paradise in mere minutes. TheÂ Journal editorial board declared Thursday (and in print on Friday) that âopposition to logging and prescribed burns in Californiaâs forests,â as well as a litigious culture that makes it more difficult to hire tree-trimmers, have left the state with additional fuel for fires â a situation exacerbated by severe droughts that only recently ended. In addition, theÂ Journal argued that green energy mandates have cost PG&E money that could have been spent on safety: Two dozen or so wildfires in the past few years have been linked to PG&E equipment, including one last fall that killed 85 people. PG&E under state law is on the hook for tens of billions of dollars in damages and has filed for bankruptcy. For years the utility skimped on safety upgrades and repairs while pumping billions into green energy and electric-car subsidies to please its overlords in Sacramento. Credit Suisse has estimated that long-term contracts with renewable developers cost the utility $2.2 billion annually more than current market power rates. Earlier this week, theÂ Los Angeles Times editorial board also blamed poor management of vegetation for the wildfires. However, it also blamed housing construction near forests, and the effects of climate change. Hundreds of thousands of customers were affected by the blackouts in Northern California, though power had been restored to most customers by Friday morning, according to a report by Bay Area public radio station KQED. Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Peopleâs âWomen Changing the Worldâ Honors Greta Thunberg, Elizabeth Warren, Megan Rapinoe
articles.subtitle: Greta Thunberg lost out on the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday but the 16-year-old Swedish climate-change activist can take some consolation in People magazine naming her on its annual list of âWomen Changing the World.â
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: The celebrity magazineÂ has published its annual list recognizing women âwho are making the world a better place.â This yearâs honorees are a whoâs who of left-wing starlets, including Greta Thunberg as well as Megan Rapinoe and other members of the U.S. Womenâs National Soccer Team. People also recognized three Democratic presidential candidates â Kamala Harris, Elizabeth Warren, and Amy Klobuchar. This yearâs list of honorees doesnât include any politically conservative or even anti-establishment Democrats like Tulsi Gabbard or Marianne Williamson, focusing instead on left-wing politicians, activists, and Hollywood celebrities. People praised Thunberg for âfighting for the planet.â The teen activist recently appeared at the United NationsÂ Climate Action Summit in New York, where she excoriated world leaders, saying, âYou have stolen my dreams, my childhood, with your empty words.â âPeople are unaware how big this crisis is,â the teen activist is quoted saying in People. But, âwe are not doomed unless we choose to be. My hope is that we can fix this crisis in time.â Rapinoe and her teammates were recognized for their âchampioning of equal pay.â After winning the womenâs World Cup this year, the teamÂ filed a lawsuit against the U.S. Soccer Federation alleging gender discrimination. Rapinoe has publicly advocated for equal pay to her male soccer counterparts. She has also repeatedly bashed President Donald Trump, saying that she would refuse a visit to the White House. People honored Sen. Warren (D-MA) for her achievements in âchanging the political conversation.â âFor a long time women have been shut out of the process, devalued, told to be quiet,â Warren said. âWeâre not doing that anymore.â Sen. Harris (D-CA) was also honored for shaking up politics.Â âEvery position I went for, people said, âItâs not your time.â Thatâs where I derive eternal optimism: the ability of the American people to see what can be, even if theyâve never seen it before,â Harris said. Despite accusations from ex-staffers who claimed that she was a verbally abusive boss, Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN) was also spotlighted for her achievements. Captain Marvel starÂ Brie Larson was also on this yearâs list, in recognition ofÂ Â âspeaking up about injustices and lack of diversity in the film industry.â Peopleâs list also includes Oprah Winfrey, and actresses Taraji P. Henson, Evan Rachel Wood and Zoe Saldana. Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Stocks Jump Higher on Report of a Partial China Trade Deal
articles.subtitle: The major stock indexes surged higher Friday on signs that the U.S. and China may have reached âpartial dealâ on trade issues.
articles.author: John Carney
articles.content: President Donald Trump said that âgood things are happeningâ in the trade negotiations. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said the talks were productive. Reports, citing anonymous sources, say a partial deal has been reached. Stocks rallied on the news. The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 420 points at around a quarter past two oâclock Friday. âWarmer feelings than in recent past, more like the Old Days,â Trump tweeted. âI will be meeting with the Vice Premier today. All would like to see something significant happen!â  In a briefing to reporters about potential sanctions on Turkey, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin declined to provide details about the negotiations but said the two days of talks had been âproductive.â Bloomberg News reported on Friday afternoon that the U.S. and China âreached a partial agreement Friday that would broker a truce in the trade war and lay the groundwork for a broader deal that Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping could sign later this year.â Bloomberg, citing anonymous sources, said that the agreement was tentative and would involve China making âagricultural concessionsâ and the U.S. providing âsomeâ tariff relief.

articles.title: Donald Trump Readies Possible Sanctions Against Turkey
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump prepared possible sanctions against Turkey on Friday, warning the country against further violence against the Kurds in Syria.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âThe president is concerned about the ongoing military offensive and the potential targeting of civilians, civilian infrastructure, ethnic or religious minorities,â Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said to reporters at the White House. Mnuchin confirmed that Trump would sign an executive order authorizing âvery significantâ sanctions against Turkey but that no sanctions would be leveled at this time. Trump continues to face bipartisan criticism from the foreign policy establishment for not taking action after Turkey began waging war on Monday against the Kurds near their border. The president said he was also concerned about Turkeyâs ability to detain Islamic State (ISIS) fighters. âThe president wants to make clear that it is imperative that Turkey not allow a single ISIS fighter to escape,â he said. Mnuchin said that the Department of Defense and the State Department would continue to monitor the Turkey military action for any humanitarian violations. âThese are very powerful sanctions; we hope that we donât have to use them, but we can shut down the Turkish economy if we need to,â he said. Currently, members of Congress are discussing leveling their own economic sanctions on Turkey in response to their military incursions into Syria, but it is unclear whether Trumpâs announcement will satisfy them.

articles.title: Bikers for Trump Endorses Ralph Abraham for Louisiana Governor
articles.subtitle: Bikers for Trump endorsed Rep. Ralph Abraham (R-LA) for Louisiana governor Thursday, touting him as an âexperienced leaderâ with âconservative values.â
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: Bikers for Trump and Bikers for Trump of Louisiana endorsed Rep. Abraham for governor as voters will soon vote in the October 12 election Louisiana jungle primary for governor. âWe are excited to announce that Bikers for Trump and Bikers for Trump of Louisiana stand in support of Ralph Abraham to be the next Governor of the great state of Louisiana,â Dale Herndon, the national director of Bikers for Trump said in a press release Thursday. âRalph will use his conservative values in Louisiana to support President Trump,â Herndon added. âRalph is a family man, an experienced leader in his community, a Congressman for the 5th district in Louisiana and is exactly the kind of candidate Bikers for Trump of Louisiana is proud to endorse,â Herndon concluded in his statement. Abraham said Thursday that Louisiana Bikers for Trumpâs endorsement was âmaybe the coolest endorsement yet!â  Abraham has fought for President Trumpâs America First agenda while in Congress and on the campaign trail. This Tuesday, he proposed H. Res. 620, a resolution that, if passed through the House, would remove House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) and expel her from the House of Representatives. The Louisiana Republican called Pelosiâs impeachment inquiry a âvicious crusadeâ against President Trump, and, therefore, Pelosi must be expelled from the House and her role as the leader of the House. AbrahamÂ saidÂ in a statement Tuesday: Nancy Pelosiâs vicious crusade against our lawfully-elected President is nothing more than a politically-motivated witch hunt and it must be stopped. She has disgraced the peopleâsÂ House and weaponized the Speakerâs gavel for her partyâs political gain.Â House Democrats spent nearly three years obsessed with election meddling only to dwarf any such efforts with their own deceitful plan to nullify the 2016 election and prevent President Trump from winning in 2020. I have introduced a resolution calling for her to be expelled from the House and for the Speakerâs Office to be vacated. Rep. Abraham, who is running for Louisiana governor,Â toldÂ Breitbart News SundayÂ that Democratsâ impeachment âinsanityâ has âenergizedâ Louisiana Republican voters ahead of the gubernatorial election. Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: Watch: Jane Fonda Arrested at Climate Change Protest
articles.subtitle: Actress and left-wing activist Jane Fonda was arrested on Friday during a protest on the steps of the U.S. Capitol building after moving to the area to facilitate her protests.
articles.author: Warner Todd Huston
articles.content: Fonda was detained along with 16 others for unlawfully demonstrating on the East Front of the U.S. Capitol,â according to Capitol Police Department spokesperson Eva Malecki.  Fonda was demonstrating over climate change with a group calling itself Oil Change International. âI will be on the Capitol every Friday, rain or shine, inspired and emboldened by the incredible movement our youth have created,â Fonda wrote on Thursday. âI can no longer stand by and let our elected officials ignore â and even worse â empower â the industries that are destroying our planet for profit. We cannot continue to stand for this,â Fonda added. The actress most famous for giving aid and comfort to the enemy during the Vietnam War also said that she would be participating in these âfire drill Fridaysâ for several more months in Washington D.C., to which she said she has relocated âto be closer to the epicenter of the fight for our climate.â â11:00 oâclock every Friday morning come get arrested with me or choose not to it doesnât matter,â said the activist actress many detractors call âHanoi Jane.â  According to ABC News, Fonda moved to Washington D.C. to spend the next four months protesting for a larger government response to climate change. In a recent interview, the aging actress said she was inspired by children such as Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg. âTheyâre saying, âCome on, you know, youâre taking our future away from us. We need â we need you to support us.â And so grandmas unite,â Fonda told ABC News Liveâs The Briefing Room. âI want to stand with them and raise upâ¦ their message. This is â this is seriousâ¦ This is a crisis, unlike anything that has ever faced humankind.â âI think every single human being has to say, âWhat can I do to put this at the forefront?'â Fonda added. â(With) everything thatâs going on in the news, well, we have to fight our way through that and find ways to get climate change in peopleâs minds.â âWhat weâre facing is so important and so urgent, it doesnât matter. Those â those things donât even matter,â Fonda concluded. âThis is the future. This is whether weâre going to survive.â While praising the kids for their work on climate alarmism, Fonda also told the L.A. Times that it is time for âthe grandmasâ to step up. âLook what the students did. We donât want to just go silent,â Fonda said. âThey still have the torch, but the grandmas are taking it now and continuing it right up until the key thing, which is next November.â Follow Warner Todd Huston on Twitter @warnerthuston.

articles.title: Rep. Max Rose Perverts American Justice System: Democrat Claims Trump Must âProveâ He Is âInnocentâ on Impeachment
articles.subtitle: Rep. Max Rose (D-NY) said Friday that President Donald Trump should âproveâ his innocence regarding the impeachment charges Democrats have levied against him.
articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.content: Rose â a freshman Democrat that represents Staten Island and parts of Brooklyn, New York â said Friday that President Trump is the sole person to blame after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) started an impeachment inquiry into him. During his travels throughout Staten Island on the campaign trail, Rose has brushed off his support for impeachment, suggesting that he did not want to back impeachment of Trump. Rose pinned the blame on President Trump, claiming that he forced Democratsâ hand on impeachment. The Staten Island Democrat suggested that President Trump has to âproveâ his innocence, rather than have Democrats prove that he committed an impeachable offense during his call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. âI do not want to be here. This is the last thing I want to be doing,â Rose said.Â âBut no one is to blame but the president. The president says he is innocent, so all we are saying is âprove it.â But that is not what they are doing. They are not cooperating, and we need toÂ get to the bottom of it.â Democrat Rose also blamed Republicans for going âdeaf, mute, and blind whenever allegations against the president are brought up.â Roseâs comment mirrors those of Democrats during the Senate confirmation of then-Supreme Court Justice nominee Judge Brett Kavanaugh. In September 2018, Sen. Mazie Hirono (D-HI) refused to say whether Kavanaugh was presumed innocent. Hirono instead said that his accuser needed âto be believed.â Roseâs rhetoric on impeachment has appeared to have shifted dramatically. Last month, the New York Democrat wrote an op-ed in which he urged Democrats to focus on their agenda. âWe are in danger of losing the trust of the American people if we choose partisan warfare over improving the lives of hardworking families,â he claimed. Roseâs message mirrors other vulnerable 2020 Democrat representatives such as Rep. Susan Wild (D-PA). Wild said last week that moderate Democrats need to ensure that impeachment does not âovershadowâ their legislative agenda. Rose also slammed former Vice President Joe Bidenâs son, Hunter Biden, and his position on a Ukrainian oil company, Burisma. âIt was the wrong decision for Hunter Biden to be on that board. In no way, shape, or form should someoneâs public service benefit their family,â However, he quickly pivoted toward attacking President Trumpâs family. Rose said: But if we are going to question Hunter Biden, we should also question Donald Trump Jr. and the way his companies have benefited, and not just Donald Trump Jr., but the other guy â the one who is even less impressive. Whatâs his name again? Eric! Thatâs right, Eric. New York Republicans have moved to highlight Roseâs shifting positions on impeachment. Jessica Proud, a top New York GOP operative who worked for Roseâs opponent in 2018, said, âStaten Island is Trump country.â âThey are very resistant to the notion of leftist elitists in Washington who are perpetually offended by everything. They view this as just an attempt to get Trump out, and I donât see how it is going to serve Rose,â she said. âIt cuts right to the heart of the brand he is trying to create for himself, that is going to go to Washington and not join the partisan fray. It puts him squarely in the Democratic camp,â Proud added. Sean Moran is a congressional reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter @SeanMoran3.

articles.title: âCatastropheâ Star Rob Delaney to Trump: âRot in Hell Nazi C**tâ
articles.subtitle: Amazon Primeâs CatastropheÂ star Rob Delaney did not mince words after watching President Donald Trumpâs rally in Minneapolis last night, describing him as a âNazi cuntâ who deserves to ârot in hell.â
articles.author: Ben Kew
articles.content:
Delaney made the comments in response to a part of Trumpâs speech where he derided leaders in Washington for allowing large numbers of Somali refugees to move into the state of Minnesota. âFor many years, leaders in Washington brought thousands of refugees to your state from Somalia,â Trump said, prompting boos from the crowd. â[They did this] without considering the impact on schools and communities and taxpayers. âI promise you as president I will give local communities a greater say on refugee policy and put in place enhanced vetting and responsible immigration controls,â he continued, prompting widespread applause from his supporters. âSince coming to office, I have reduced refugee resettlement by 85 percent,â Trump added. âAnd as you know, maybe especially in Minnesota, I signed an executive order that no refugees will be resettled in any state without the expressed written consent of that city or that state.â

However, Delaney was left unimpressed by giving states and local communities the right to determine their resettlement policies, simply saying: âRot in hell nazi cunt.â  The 42-year-old actor-comedian is well known for his hatred of the president and First Lady Melania Trump, also comparing her to a Nazi. A fervent socialist, Delaney is an active supporter of Bernie Sandersâs presidential campaign and a member of the far-left Democratic Socialists of America. Living in London, the Deadpool 2Â starÂ has also taken an interest in British politics and has previously endorsed the widely considered anti-semite Jeremy Corbyn, who currently serves as the leader of the Labour Party. Follow Ben Kew onÂ Facebook, Twitter atÂ @ben_kew,Â orÂ email him at bkew@breitbart.com.

articles.title: âWhistleblowerâ Attorney Was Informant who Scuttled Trumpâs Nominee for CIA Watchdog
articles.subtitle: Andrew Bakaj, the attorney representing the so-called whistleblower at the center of the impeachment movement targeting President Donald Trump, previously was a whistleblower witness whose public allegations scuttled the confirmation of the Trump administrationâs nominee for CIA inspector general.
articles.author: Aaron Klein
articles.content: Bakajâs original complaint against Trumpâs nominee was filed with the office of the Inspector General for the U.S. Intelligence Community. The IG at the time was Chuck McCullough, who is currently working at Bakajâs three attorney law firm representing the so-called whistleblower. Like Bakaj, the so-called whistleblower against Trump also filed his âDisclosure of Urgent Concern formâ with the IG for the intelligence community, albeit with the new IG, Michael Atkinson. Bakaj founded the Compass Rose Legal Group, which is representing the central so-called whistleblower on the matter of Trumpâs phone call with the Ukrainian president. Bakaj confirmed that his law firm is also representing âmultiple whistleblowers in connection to the underlying August 12, 2019, disclosure to the Intelligence Community Inspector General.â Bakaj previously interned for Hillary Clinton and did work for other Democrats. At the CIA, Bakaj helped to develop a whistleblower reprisal investigation program. Breitbart News reported that a search of Bakajâs Twitter account finds rabid anti-Trump posts such as repeated advocacy for Trump cabinet members to invoke the 25th Amendment of the Constitution to remove Trump as president over claimed competency issues. Missing from major news media coverage of Bakaj and his high-profile clients is that he was one of two former CIA employees who went public as whistleblowers to contradict the testimony of Christopher Sharpley, Trumpâs CIA IG nominee. As part of the confirmation process, Sharpley testified to Congress in October 2017 that he was unaware of the existence of pending complaints filed against him alleging he and others may have retaliated against CIA workers who lobbed allegations of misconduct at the agency. The exchange came when Sen. Dianne Feinstein (D-CA) asked him about published reports of pending complaints against him. âIf there are complaints, if there are investigations out there, Iâm unaware of it,â Sharpley replied. The published reports referenced by Feinstein originated with an investigation from the Project On Government Oversight (POGO), which first revealed the allegations against Sharpley just before the Feinsteinâs questioning. Feinstein read at length from POGOâs article and even entered the POGO piece into the Congressional Record. The POGO is financed by billionaire George Sorosâs Open Society Foundations as well as the Open Society Policy Center. As part of its recommended resources for whistleblowers, POGO promotes the Compass Rose law firm as well as Whistleblower Aid. Sharpley said it was possible he might not know about complaints due to a process that gives confidentiality to government whistleblowers but claimed to have been unaware of the filings. Thatâs when Bakaj and another ex-CIA employee, Jonathan Kaplan, stepped in and went public by sending letters to the Senate saying that Sharpley was one of the CIA officials listed by name in pending complaints that they both filed in 2014 and 2015. Â Bakaj said that his security clearance had been suspended and that was placed on administrative leave as part of alleged retaliation for an internal CIA complaint alleging wrongdoing. It was also reported that the Department of Homeland Securityâs inspector general had asked to interview Sharpley on the pending complaints prior to his testimony leading to some lawmakers questioning his sincerity in denying knowledge of the complaints from Bakaj and Kaplan. CIA spokesman Ryan Trapani told reporters, âMr. Sharpley has had a sterling 5-year career at CIA and there have never been any findings of wrongdoing or misconduct of any sort by Mr. Sharpley during his tenure here.â The complaint from Bakaj alleged a conflict between the CIAâs IG office and the Office of the Intelligence Community Inspector General. Like the current so-called whistleblower against Trump being represented by Bakaj, the attorneyâs own complaint involving Sharpley was filed in 2015 as an âUrgent Concernâ form with the IG for the Intelligence Community. After his nomination stalled in the Senate over the issue, Sharpley eventually resigned from his position. In the 2017 case against Sharpley during the confirmation process, Bakaj was represented by Mark Zaid, who is senior counsel with the Compass Rose Legal Group where Bakaj now works. Zaid in 2017 co-founded Whistleblower Aid, a small nonprofit that blasted advertisements around D.C. actively seeking whistleblowers during the Trump administration. Kaplan, the other ex-CIA employee who went public against Sharpley, was represented by Whistleblower Aid itself. Whistleblower Aid took public credit for Sharpleyâs downfall:  The avalanche of news media reports about the so-called whistleblower clients of Bakaj and Zaid fails to inform the public that at the beginning of Trumpâs presidency Zaid co-founded Whistleblower Aid. The group is heavily tied to far-left activist organizations and Democratic politics. In his twitter profile, Zaid describes himself as a ânon-partisanâ attorney âhandling cases involving national security, security clearances, govt investigations, media, Freedom of Information Act, & whistleblowing.â Zaidâs twitter profile doesnât mention that he co-founded Whistleblower Aid. That detail is also not mentioned in Zaidâs bio on his attorney website. This even though Whistleblower Aid has been actively helping the first whistleblower also being represented by Zaid by setting up a GoFundMe page seeking to raise funds for the purported whistleblowerâs defense. The page already brought in some $210,066 with a goal of raising $300,000. Whistleblower Aid was founded in September 2017 in the wake of Trumpâs presidency to encourage government whistleblowers to come forward. The group did not sit around waiting for whistleblowers. Upon its founding, Whistleblower Aid actively sought to attract the attention of Trump administration government employees by reportedly blasting advertisements for its whistleblower services on Metro trains, using mobile billboards that circled government offices for 10 hours a day, and handing out whistles on street corners as a gimmick to gain attention. When Whistleblower Aid was first formed, the main banner for the mission statement of its website contained clearly anti-Trump language. âToday our Republic is under threat. Whistleblower Aid is committed to protecting the rule of law in the United States and around the world,â read the previous statement which can still be viewed via the Internet Archive Wayback Machine. That part of the mission statement received attention in the conservative media. The sentence âtoday our Republic is under threat,â has since been scrubbed from the website.Â  The mission statement now only reads, âWhistleblower Aid is committed to protecting the rule of law in the United States and around the world.â Speaking to the Washington Post just after Whistleblower Aidâs founding, John Tye, who co-founded the organization with Zaid, claimed, âThis is not a partisan effort,â and then went on to express seemingly partisan alarm about Trump. Tye continued, âAt the same time, yes, the rule of law starts with the office of the president. Like many other people, we are definitely concerned about things that are happening in the administration. The decision to fire [FBI Director] James Comey. The lack of transparency. A lot of people have questions about whether this administration respects the rule of law.â Far-left ties, Democrat links Zaid doubles as Executive Director and founder of the James Madison Project, which says it seeks to promote government accountability.Â  The Project features on its four-person advisory board John Podesta, who led Hillary Clintonâs 2016 presidential campaign, served as Chief of Staff to Bill Clinton and founded the Soros-funded Center for American Progress pushing a progressive agenda. Whistleblower Aid co-founder Tye himself is a whistleblower. He is a former State Department official who went public in 2014 about U.S. government electronic surveillance practices. Tyeâs bio on Whistleblower Aidâs website brandishes his work for far-left groups. The bio reads: Mr. Tye has worked at the Southern Poverty Law Center, Avaaz, and also Southeast Louisiana Legal Services as a Skadden Fellow. He was on the board of directors of the American Civil Liberties Union of Louisiana. The Southern Poverty Law Center is known for its anti-conservative stance and controversially publishes a âhate mapâ listing groups that warn about radical Islam such as Jihad Watch, the Clarion Project, the Center for Security Policy. On that same âhate mapâ are racist extremist organizations like Global Crusaders: Order of the Ku Klux Klan and United Klans of America. Tyeâs other former employer, the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU), is financed heavily by billionaire activist and Democratic Party mega-donor George Soros and is known for its hyper-partisan liberal activism. Avaaz, a radical group where Tye served as campaign and legal director, describes itself as a âglobal web movement to bring people-powered politics to decision-making everywhere.â The group has repeatedly engaged in anti-Israel activism. Channeling the mantra of radical community organizer Saul Alinsky, Avaaz says it aims to âorganize citizens of all nations to close the gap between the world we have and the world most people everywhere want.â Avaaz was founded in 1997 by the Soros-funded, partisan MoveOn.org organization and by the Soros-funded Res Publica activist group. Tax forms from Sorosâs Open Society document donations to Res Publica specifically earmarked for support to Avaaz. Res Publica oversees Avaaz activism. The same year that Whistleblower Aid was founded, Avaazâs former general counsel and campaign director, Ian Bassin, in 2017 formed United to Protect Democracy. The latter is a grouping of former top lawyers for the Obama administration working to utilize legal advocacy methods to oppose Trumpâs policies. Bassinâs United to Protect Democracy works in partnership with the Brennan Center for Justice, located at NYU School of Law. The Brennan Center is heavily financed by Sorosâs Open Society Foundations and is the recipient of numerous Open Society grants. Aaron Klein is Breitbartâs Jerusalem bureau chief and senior investigative reporter. He is a New York Times bestselling author and hosts the popular weekend talk radio program, âAaron Klein Investigative Radio.â Follow him on Twitter @AaronKleinShow. Follow him on Facebook. Joshua Klein contributed research to this article.

articles.title: Schweizer & McLeod: Hunter Biden Helped China Acquire âStrategically Sensitive Assetsâ
articles.subtitle: Hunter Bidenâs Chinese investment firm assisted Chinaâs acquisition of âstrategically sensitive assetsâ in the United States, according to a New York Post op-ed by the Government Accountability Instituteâs Peter Schweizer and Jacob McLeod.
articles.author: Rebecca Mansour
articles.content: Schweizer and McLeod provide further details on the investments former Vice President Joe Bidenâs son, Hunter Biden, facilitated via his Chinese-backed investment firm. In 2013, less than two weeks after accompanying his father on an official visit to Beijingâand despite his lack of pertinent expertiseâHunter Biden secured $1 billion (later raised to $1.5 billion) from the state-owned Bank of China for his newly formed investment firm, Bohai Harvest RST (BHR). This was in addition to the first-of-its-kind deal the Chinese government awarded Bidenâs private equity firm Rosemont Seneca in the recently formed Shanghai Free-Trade Zone, a deal that allowed the firm to focus on international acquisitions. âWith the backing of the state-owned Bank of China, one of the countryâs âbig fourâ financial institutions, BHR had access to the types of deals that most Western firms only dreamed of, including IPOs of state-owned companies,â Schweizer and McLeod write, noting that Bidenâs firm âinvested in strategically sensitive assets in both China and the United States.â They write: In December 2014, BHR became an âanchor investorâ in the IPO of China General Nuclear Power Company (CGN), a state-owned nuclear company involved in the development of nuclear reactors. Not only is CGN a strategically important company in China, it was also facing legal scrutiny in the United States. In 2016, CGN was charged with espionage by the Justice Department for stealing US nuclear secrets. As a âcross-borderâ investment fund, Bohai Harvest was interested in making deals outside of China. In 2015, BHR acquired Henniges Automotive, a Michigan-based producer of vibration-dampening equipment, alongside Chinese military contractor Aviation Industry Corp. of China (AVIC). Given the military applications of Hennigesâ technology, the deal required federal approval. Like CGN, AVIC was suspected of stealing US technology for its purposes. Not long after the Henniges deal closed, AVIC debuted its new J-20 fighter â incorporating designs allegedly stolen from the USâ F-35 program. Schweizer and McLeod conclude by asking, âDid the Chinese give favorable treatment to Hunter Biden to curry favor with his vice-president father? The American public deserves to understand what exactly Hunter Biden was doing overseas and the extent of then-Vice President Bidenâs involvement.â The timing of Hunter Bidenâs business deal is particularly problematic. His father was negotiating U.S. policy with China at a time when the regimeâs behavior had become increasingly menacing to U.S. allies in the region. Vice President Bidenâs kid-gloves treatment of China during that tripâa fact which was widely criticized by U.S. allies at the timeâalso raises questions in light of the lucrative business deals his son secured just two weeks later. Bidenâs BHR focused on strategic energy and defense projects, including U.S. companies specializing in technology used by our military, as Breitbartâs Haris Alic reported: In 2015, BHR and the Aviation Industry Corporation of China (AVIC) â an aerospace and defense conglomerate owned and operated by the Chinese government â madeÂ a $600 million bid to purchase Henniges, a Michigan-based automotive company. The sale required approval from the Obama-Biden administrationâs Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS), as AVIC was a subsidiary of the Chinese government and Henniges produced âdual-useâ anti-vibration technology with U.S. âmilitary applications.â CFIUS, which isÂ made up of representatives from 16 different federal bodies including the Departments of State, Treasury, and Defense, isÂ requiredÂ to review any transaction with national security implications. When the AVIC and BHRâs bid was first announced, alarm bells went off in certain sectors of the defense industry.Â In particular, many noted that AVICÂ was âreportedly involved in stealing sensitive data regarding the Joint Strike Fighter program,â which it later âreportedly incorporated â¦ into Chinaâs J-20 and Jâ31 aircraft.â Despite the national security concerns, CFIUS approved the deal with AVIC, purchasing 51 percent of the company while BHR took ownership of the other 49 percent. Upon purchase, an industry newsletterÂ statedÂ the deal was the âbiggest Chinese investment into US automotive manufacturing assets to date.â The acquisition of foreign technology is a key component of Chinaâs aggressive âMade In China 2025â (MI2025) strategy to overtake the United States economically and militarily by dominating key technologies of the future (i.e. artificial intelligence, robotics, electric vehicles, 5G telecommunications, etc.). A 2017 report by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce explained the role private equity firms like Hunter Bidenâs play in this strategy. The Chinese government âis injecting state funds into private equity to fund foreign acquisitionsâ of companies with technology identified as a priority for MI2025, according to the report. In his extensive report last February on Chinaâs âwhole-of-stateâ strategy for global dominance, Florida Senator Marco Rubio also notedÂ the communist regimeâs reliance on âintellectual property acquisitionsâ to achieve its ambitions. âChina is becoming a significant shareholder in U.S. industries, and is selectively targeting those with strategic implications,â Matt Stoller and Lucas Kunce wrote in The American Conservative last June. Their analysis exposes the extend to which China has co-opted Wall Street against the longterm interests of the American economy and national security. For example, they write: Jennifer M. Harris, an expert in global markets with experience at the U.S. State Department and the U.S. National Intelligence Council, researched aÂ recent explosionÂ of Chinese strategic investment in American technology companies. She found that China has systematically targeted U.S. greenfield investments, âtechnology goods (especially semiconductors), R&D networks, and advanced manufacturing.â Hunter Bidenâs attorneys told ABC News last June that Biden still sits on BHRâs board and owns a minority stake in the fund. At his campaign rally in Minneapolis yesterday, President Trump called out Hunter Bidenâs business dealings with China while his father was negotiating U.S. policy with the communist regime. âBiden allowed China to rip off America for eight years as vice president,â Trump told the crowd. âAnd Barack Obama let him just rob us blind, and we are not doing that anymore. Those days are over. The Bidens got rich, and that is substantiated, while America got robbed. Thatâs what happened. Sleepy Joe and his friends sold out America.â The House Democrat impeachment inquiry has brought renewed interest in the sweetheart deals Hunter Bidenâs private equity firm secured while his father was vice president, as detailed in Schweizerâs 2018 bestsellerÂ Secret Empires. Democrats allege that President Trump attempted to coerce the Ukrainians into investigating corruption charges against former Vice President Biden during a July phone with his Ukrainian counterpart. The allegation centers aroundÂ Hunter Bidenâs lucrative dealings with a Ukrainian oligarch-owned energy company at a time when his father was mediating U.S. policy towards Ukraine. The natural gas firm Burisma Holdings paid Hunter Biden over $50,000 per month for his work as a board member, despite his total lack of experience in Ukraine or the energy sector. Just a few months prior to landing this Ukrainian deal, Hunter Biden had been dishonorably discharged from the U.S. Navy Reserve for testing positive to cocaine use. A Ukrainian corruption probe into Burisma Holdings was scuttled in 2016, when Vice President BidenÂ threatenedÂ to withhold $1 billion in U.S. loan guarantees to the country if the Ukrainian government did not fire the prosecutor who launched the corruption investigation. Withholding the loans would have thrown the former Soviet republic into insolvency at a time when it was fending off attacks from Vladimir Putinâs Russia. Both Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky denied the Democrats claim that Trump delayed military funding to Ukrainian in order to pressure Zelenskyâs government to investigate the Bidens. The Trump White House has refused to cooperate with the Democrat impeachment inquiry, declaring it a âpartisan and unconstitutionalâ investigation. Rebecca Mansour is Senior Editor-at-Large for Breitbart News and the host of Breitbart News Tonight on SiriusXM Patriot channel 125, which broadcasts live weeknights from 9:00 p.m. to midnight Eastern (6-9:00 p.m. Pacific). Follow her on Twitter atÂ @RAMansour.

articles.title: Jane Fonda Takes Break from Acting, Moves to Washington to Become Climate Activist
articles.subtitle: Actress-activist Jane Fonda said she is taking a break from her Netflix comedy series Grace and Frankie and is moving to Washington, D.C. in order to be at the center of the so-called climate change battle.
articles.author: David Ng
articles.content: The two-time Oscar-winning star said she wants to see fossil fuels phased out over 30 years and wants the government to stop leasing permits for fossil fuel development on public lands and waters. The 81-year-old Jane Fonda was arrested Friday after she and a group of fellow sign-wielding agitators refused to move fromÂ the steps of the U.S. Capitol building where she was participating in her âFire Drill Fridaysâ protest for the environment. In a recent interview, Fonda said that she convinced Netflix to give her four months off before shooting the final season of Grace and Frankie. âWell, I went to Ted Sarandos whoâs the [chief content officer] of Netflix, and I asked him if he could give me a year off,â she told the Los Angeles Times. âAnd he tried and couldnât because of the contracts. I mean, thereâs a lot of actors in the mix. And so four months is what I could get. And then when we finish, itâll be a longer season because itâs out last season. Then Iâll come right back.â Fonda said she is moving to Washington âto be at the epicenter of the fight for our climate,â in a statement on her official website. âEvery Friday through January, I will be leading weekly demonstrations on Capitol Hill to demand that action by our political leaders be taken to address the climate emergency we are in. We canât afford to wait.â  The Netflix star said she was inspired by young people, including 16-year-old Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg. âI mean, I knew about Greta, I didnât know she was on the spectrum. And I really didnât know what Aspergerâs meant,â Fonda told the Times.Â âOn the spectrum, if they are interested in something, they have a laser focus on that and whatever the denials and rationalizations the rest of us indulge in, that doesnât come into play with her.â Fonda also talked about her feelings about President Donald Trump.Â âI did not expect it would be this bad. I didnât,â she said. The Klute actress also said she called Jared Kushner, who is the presidentâs son-in-law and advisor, about environmental issues. Fonda said that Kushner told her to speak to his wife, Ivanka Trump. âAnd so I called her And she said, âIâll see what I can do.â Nothing,â recalled Fonda. On her website, the actress says, âI will be on the Capitol every Friday, rain or shine, inspired and emboldened by the incredible movement our youth have created. I can no longer stand by and let our elected officials ignore â and even worse â empower â the industries that are destroying our planet for profit. We can not continue to stand for this.â Follow David Ng on TwitterÂ @HeyItsDavidNg. Have a tip? Contact me atÂ dng@breitbart.com

articles.title: Mexican President AMLO to Nancy Pelosi: Pass USMCA Already!
articles.subtitle: Mexican President AndrÃ©s Manuel LÃ³pez Obrador told Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) on Friday to pass the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which awaits a vote in the Democrat-controlled House of Representatives.
articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.content: President Donald Trump announced the USMCA one year ago, after extensive negotiations with both Canada and Mexico. The trade deal will replace the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), which Trump has long criticized and which he promised to replace. The new deal includes terms more favorable to U.S. businesses and workers, and is one of the most significant economic and foreign policy achievements of the Trump presidency. While Democrats have spoken favorably about the USMCA, they have also suggested changes to the agreement. They are also reluctant to acknowledge Trumpâs success and to approve anything for which he will later take credit. Obrador, known also by the acronym AMLO, told reporters Friday that he had sent a letter to Pelosi urging her to pass the USMCA. âThereâs agreement, and I took the opportunity to send Mrs Pelosi a letter explaining that itâs in the interest of the three peoples, the three nations, that this deal is approved,â he said, according toÂ The Hill. Republicans also pressed the House Speaker to stop stalling. When Pelosi posted a subtweet â a tweet that attacks someone without using their Twitter handle â targeting Sen. Joni Ernst (R-IA), Ernst fired back about the USMCA:  A poll in February showed that Americans wanted Congress to pass the USMCA âby a nearly four-to-one margin.â Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News. He earned an A.B. in Social Studies and Environmental Science and Public Policy from Harvard College, and a J.D. from Harvard Law School. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. He is also the co-author ofÂ How Trump Won: The Inside Story of a Revolution, which is available from Regnery. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak.

articles.title: Former Ambassador to Ukraine Tells Congress: Trump Pressured State to Remove Me
articles.subtitle: Former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Marie Yovanovitch on Friday told House Democrats pursuing the impeachment inquiry that President Donald Trump pressured the State Department to remove her from her post because he had âlost confidenceâ in her.
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content:
In written testimony prepared for her deposition in the Democratsâ impeachment inquiry, Yovanovitch declared that she was âabruptlyâ told to return to Washington in late April. Yovanovitch served as the American ambassador to Ukraine from August 2016 through May 20, 2019. She now serves as a State Department fellow at Georgetown University. In her written remarks, obtained by the Washington Post and other news outlets, the former ambassador noted that she met with U.S. Deputy Secretary of State John Sullivan to discuss âwhy my posting ended so suddenly,â adding: He said that the President had lost confidence in me and no longer wished me to serve as his ambassador. He added that there had been a concerted campaign against me, and that the [State] Department had been under pressure from the President to remove me since the Summer of 2018. He also said that I had done nothing wrong and that this was not like other situations where he had recalled ambassadors for cause. I departed Ukraine for good this past May. Yovanovitch testified before House Democrats pursuing the impeachment inquiry despite the White House indicating earlier this week it would block all officials from testifying. In a letter to House Democrat leaders, the White House dismissed the probe as unfair and âillegitimate.â The Trump administration attempted to block her deposition, prompting House Democrats to issue a subpoena for her appearance that ultimately compelled her to testify, the chairmen of the House panels leading the impeachment probe said in a joint statement. On Tuesday, the State Department ordered U.S. Ambassador to the European Union Gordon Sondland not to testify, prompting House Democrats to subpoena him. U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo the following day vowed that his department would fulfill its legal obligations in responding to the impeachment inquiry. Pompeo noted, however, that the State Department would take its cues from the White House Citing people familiar with the matter, the Wall Street Journal reported in early October that Trump ousted Yovanovitch âafter months of complaints from allies outside the administration, including his personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani, that she was undermining him abroad and obstructing efforts to persuade Kyiv to investigate former Vice President Joe Biden. â The former ambassador denied those allegations in her written remarks, saying: [F]ictitious is the notion that I am disloyal to President Trump. I have heard the allegation in the media that I supposedly told the Embassy team to ignore the Presidentâs orders âsince he was going to be impeached.â That allegation is false. I have never said such a thing, to my Embassy colleagues or to anyone else.
