Next, the Obama administration did not ask me to help the Clinton campaign or harm the Trump campaign, nor would I have taken any such steps if they had.

â¦

Although I understand that I served at the pleasure of the President, I was nevertheless incredulous that the U.S. government chose to remove an Ambassador based, as best as I can tell, on unfounded and false claims by people with clearly questionable motives. The former ambassador said she had âminimal contactsâ with Giuliani. The âwhistleblowerâsâ complaint fueling the impeachment inquiry mentions Yovanovitchâs ouster as an example of what the leaker described as the U.S. presidentâs abuse of power. According to the âwhistleblower,â Trump attempted to coerce Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky into investigating allegations of corruption against Biden and his son, Hunter, in exchange for aid during a July 25 call. Trump and Zelensky have denied the allegations. A partial transcript of the calls released by the White House cites Trump as telling Zelensky the former U.S. ambassador is âbad news.â

articles.title: Watch: Trump Supporter Calmly Reacts to Protester Spitting in His Face During Interview
articles.subtitle: A supporter of President Donald Trump reacted calmly after a protester spit in his face on Thursday night during a TV interview.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: Vice News was interviewing Dave Carlson, a salesman in Minnesota who attended the presidentâs political rally, when an unknown protester spit in his face. Carlson winced, turned slightly, and replied, âOh nice,â and chuckled. The Vice News reporter reacted in shock while another protester apologized for what happened as Carlson wiped the spit off of his face. A second protester approached him to explain why it happened: âThatâs not how people really feel; thatâs f*cking disrespectful, but on the other hand, that shit is disrespectful as f*ck that too,â he said, pointing to Carlsonâs hat. Watch:

articles.title: Trump Jr. Blasts Mediaâs Treatment of Hunter Biden â âDouble Standardâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Fridayâs edition of âBrian Kilmeade Show,â President Donald Trumpâs son Donald Trump Jr. criticized the mediaâs âdouble standardâ on Hunter Biden, the son of 2020 presidential hopeful former Vice President Joe Biden,Â Ukraine business ties. Trump said, âLook at what they tried to do to me for three years. I mean, these clowns tried to put me in jail for three years because I took an unsolicited phone call. You know, the double standard is pretty sick, Brian. Iâve talked about it for a long time. We can play one way, or we can play another way, but weâve got to be playing the same game. The reality is this: If Donald Trump Jr. flew on Air Force One with my father,Â the president,Â to China and came back with $1.5 ânot $1.5 billion, just $1.5âweâd solve the fake news media problem because their heads would explode.â He continued, âThere is a double standard. If Donald Trump Jr. had a no-show gig on a corrupt Ukrainian oil company while my father was in charge of the issues over thereâ¦ minor details. Iâve never been in energy or oil. Minor details. I donât speak Ukrainianâ¦You think the press would have a problem with that, Brian?â He added, âI had the media camped out in front of my apartment for two years. They donât even try to find this guy to even get a comment.â He concluded, âItâs not fair. Itâs not a level playing field. And, so we have to fight fact accordingly.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: SAF Asks SCOTUS to Intervene in Illinoisâ Ban on Non-Resident Concealed Carry
articles.subtitle: The Second Amendment Foundation (SAF) is asking the Supreme Court of the United States (SCOTUS) to intervene against Illinoisâ ban on concealed carry law for non-residents.
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: SAF posits that Illinoisâ âban on concealed carry by non-residentsâ deprives non-Illinois residents of their Second Amendment rights, in effect denying âvirtually all Americansâ¦of their full Second Amendment rights while in the state of Illinois.â SAF founder and Executive Vice President Alan Gottlieb said: This is a case that literally begs for Supreme Court attention. When the Court ruled in the 2008 Heller case that the Second Amendment protected a fundamental right, it was clear that this right belongs to everyone, not just the residents of an individual state. The Seventh Circuit held in Moore v. Madigan that the carrying of firearms in public for self-defense is a fundamental right, but under existing Illinois restrictions, that right has been limited to Illinois residents and citizens from only four other states. On December 11, 2012, Breitbart News reported the Seventh Circuit ruling that brought concealed carry to Illinois. Judge Richard Posner wrote the courtâs Majority Opinion, saying: We are disinclined to engage in another round of historical analysis to determine whether eighteenth-century America understood the Second Amendment to include a right to bear guns outside the home. The Supreme Court has decided that the amendment confers a right to bear arms for self-defense, which is as important outside the home as inside. SAFâs pursuit of a SCOTUS review is joined by the Illinois State Rifle Association (ISRA), Illinois Carry, and nine private citizens. AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: FNCâs Neil Cavuto on Shepard Smithâs Exit: Iâm a Little Stunned and a Little Heartbrokenâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Fridayâs broadcast of Fox News Channelâs âYour World,â host Neil Cavuto reacted to the departure of his colleague Shepard Smith. Cavuto said, âIâm a little stunned and a little heartbroken. I donât know what to say.â He continued, âWow, a better newsman you probably cannot find â a bigger, more emotionally connected to humankind you cannot find. So, Shepard, I donât know what the heck youâre planning to do or where you go, but I just know youâll be great at doing it, and you deserve the best that life has to offer. Iâm sorry if Iâm a little shell shocked her.â Reporter John Roberts said, âIâm just trying to compile my thoughts too. I walked out here to do the hit and suddenly got hit by a subway train. Holy mackerel.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Nancy Sinatra: Trump a âClear and Present Danger to Our Country and the Worldâ
articles.subtitle: Singer and actress Nancy Sinatra boasted of her prediction of what would happen if âignorantâ Trump became president, lamenting his right-leaning Supreme Court nominees, accusing him of starting a war, and declaring that he should be impeached and removed due to the âclear and present dangerâ he poses to âour country and the world.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content:
âTwo things I knew would happen if ignorant @realDonaldTrump was âelectedâ â 1/ he would stack the Supreme Court and 2/ he would start a war someplace, anyplace,â Nancy Sinatra wrote to her 218k Twitter followers. âHe is a clear and present danger to our country and the world,â she added. â#ImpeachAndRemove.â Two things I knew would happen if ignorant @realDonaldTrump was "elected" â 1/ he would stack the Supreme Court and 2/ he would start a war someplace, anyplace. He is a clear and present danger to our country and the world. #ImpeachAndRemove â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) October 11, 2019  It remains unclear why the âThese Boots Are Made for Walkinâ singer emphasized âelected,â as Trump fairly won the 2016 election, surpassing the 270 Electoral College threshold with 304 electoral votes to Hillary Clintonâs 227. Sinatra has been a longtime advocate for Trumpâs impeachment, calling for his removal during his first year in office in 2017. âThe truth is we should get that son of a bitch @realDonaldTrump out of our White House,â Sinatra wrote in 2017, using the hashtag âMuellerTime,â indicating that she counted on the Mueller report to sink the president. However, the report found no evidence of collusion or conspiracy between the Trump campaign and Russia. The truth is we should get that son of a bitch @realDonaldTrump out of our White House.#ImpeachTrump #MuellerTime https://t.co/sNZEPoZQhL â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) September 23, 2017  Keep digging.#ImpeachTrump https://t.co/mwcFuDl7K9 â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) November 4, 2017  I still can't believe this happened to our great country.#ImpeachNow @realDonaldTrump https://t.co/QtitFpdkNk â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) December 31, 2017  She continued to remain a strong voice for impeachment the following year, fantasizing about impeaching Trump first and indicting him later: Yeah? Okay, so we'll impeach him first and then indict him.#ImpeachTrumpNow â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) September 7, 2018  The âSugar Townâ singer asked House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) to consider impeachment earlier this year and has since upped her impeachment ante on social media: #Impeachment
Please start the conversation. @SpeakerPelosi https://t.co/YzKnY4wjMT â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) April 24, 2019  IMPEACH! https://t.co/Tf1DUFB9Zw â Nancy Sinatra (@NancySinatra) September 8, 2019

articles.title: Greta Thunbergâs Cause Could Have Cost Her Peace Prize: No Science to Connect ClimateÂ Change to Conflict
articles.subtitle: Greta Thunberg, the 16-year-old Swedish girl who has become the international face of the youth climate change movement, has been passed up by the Peace Research Institute in Oslo for the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: Thunberg was a bookmaker favorite to win the prize, and her almost 3 million Twitter followers also were hopeful she would win for her attempt to convince world leaders that the United Nations is correct in its estimation that man-made climate change could lead to mass extinction. But the prize committee disagreed. It chose Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, who put in place a peace process to finally end a 20-year conflict with neighboring Eritrea. But the Washington Post reported Thunbergâs cause may not be the right vehicle for a peace prize, and then tried to make the case that it should be. According to the report: Henrik Urdal, the head of the Peace Research Institute of Oslo, omitted Thunberg from theÂ Nobel Peace Prize shortlist he publishes.Â He explained his decision to the Washington Post, saying there âisnât scientific consensus that there is a linear relationship between climate change â or resource scarcity, more broadly â and armed conflict.â The link between climate change and conflict is hotly debated. But climate change scholars say that while there isnât a straightforward relationship,Â there is a recognition that climate change adds to stresses in regions that could spark political instability and conditions that could foster conflict. The Pentagon has called climate change aÂ âthreat multiplier.â The prize has gone to environmental champions before. In 2007, the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) and former vice president Al Gore won âfor their efforts to build up and disseminate greater knowledge about man-made climate change, and to lay the foundations for the measures that are needed to counteract such change.â In 2004, it was given to Wangari Maathai âfor her contribution to sustainable development, democracy and peace.â In 1970, it went to Norman Borlaug, sometimes called the âfather of the green revolution.â Urdal told the Post that those awards could be a thing of the past because of what Alfred Nobel hoped the prize would represent. âIn his will outlining the prize, Nobel wrote that the recipient should be someone who has advanced the âabolition or reduction of standing armiesâ â which some have interpreted as requiring a direct connection to peace and conflict,â the Post reported. âIf you make it too broad, it becomes a bit meaningless,â Urdal said. The Post then checked in with a politics professor at the University of Oslo, who called Thunberg a âwild cardâ nominee. âThe link between climate change and conflict is still âquite tenuous at this point,â she said in the Post report. âEveryone sees flooding can cause conflict, migration and so on, but this is no way well established as a security policy issue yet.â The Post also speculated that it could have been poor timing for Thunberg since the committee puts together its shortlist of nominees at the end of January â before the teen made a splash with her transatlantic sail from Europe to New York on a solar-powered racing yacht and her fiery speech at the United Nations calling out adults for failing to address climate change. On Friday when the announcement was made Thunberg was in Denver with other teens who skipped school to protest climate change. Follow Penny Starr on Twitter

articles.title: Watch: Leftists Protest Donald Trump Jr. with âNo KKK, No Fascist USAâ Chant
articles.subtitle: GAINESVILLE, Florida â Left-wing activists congregated outside of the University of Floridaâs University Auditorium ahead of Donald Trump Jr.âs appearance on Thursday, marching and chanting, âNo Trump, No KKK, No Fascist USA.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Dozens of students gathered outside of the University Auditorium to protest Donald Trump Jr. and Kimberly Guilfoyleâs appearance, marching across campus and chanting âNo Trump, No KKK, No Fascist USAâ in unison. Several of the protesters made their way into the University Auditorium, reserving seats specifically to heckle Trump and Guilfoyle. They, at times, shouted, âbullshit,â âNazi scumbag,â âfuck you,â and, âYou put children in cages.â Trump supporters â more than once â drowned out their cries by shouting, âUSA, USA, USA.â âLet them get it out of their system. Itâs all good,â Trump said amid their interruptions.Â âThatâs what weâre facing. You guys have a decision.â âThe difference between the sides are â Iâll still come here,â he continued. âBecause as my father said in 2016, heâs going to be the president for all Americans, not just those who agree with him.â

articles.title: College Students Protest Donald Trump Jr.: âIâll Grab Ya Daddy by the P*ssyâ
articles.subtitle: GAINESVILLE, Floridaâ Protesters gathered at the University of Florida (UF) ahead of Donald Trump Jr. and Kimberly Guilfoyleâs appearance at the university on Thursday, marching outside of the venue and holding signs reading âFUCH U NAZI BITCHâ and âIâll Grab Ya Daddy By The Pussy.â
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Trump and Trump campaign senior adviser Kimberly Guilfoyle spoke at the University of Florida on Thursday evening, hosted by theÂ UF student governmentâs ACCENT Speakers Bureau. Leftist students on campus expressed outrage over their appearance and planned protests ahead of the event, marching across campus to stand up against âNazisâ and âwhite supremacy.â Activists participated in interactive chanting: âWhen black lives are under attack, what do we do?â women on the megaphones asked. âStand up, fight back,â the crowd shouted back. âWhen trans lives are under attack, what do we do?â the women asked. âStand up, fight back!â the crowd continued. Protesters eventually moved to another side of the auditorium in order to âfaceâ Don Jr. and chanted, âWhose streets? Our streets!â The activists held signs reading, âI am angry,â âDonât spread hate,â and âDrain the swamp of white supremacy. Go back to Russia.â One activist held a puppet of a uterus, while another held up a bright pink sign featuring cartoonish depictions of President Trump. It read, âIâll Grab Ya Daddy By The Pussyâ: Breitbart News Breitbart News Breitbart News Breitbart News Breitbart News Breitbart News Breitbart News Olivia Yoh, a senior at the university, stood with the campusâs Republican group, countering the protesters with a cutout of the presidentâs face with the caption âNo collusionâ: Breitbart News âPeople are mad heâs coming here, because they feel like itâs a campaign event,â she told Breitbart News. âBut honestly, we just view it as free speech, and weâre happy to have him come here to finally have someone who shares our views on campus.â When asked if the number of people against Trumpâs appearance outnumbered those in favor, she said, âI think that the Democrats are much more outspoken about it, whereas Republicans are feeling kind of silenced by it.â

articles.title: Ben Stiller Accuses Trump of Spreading âHate, Fear, and Divisionâ About Refugees
articles.subtitle: Actor Ben Stiller went after President Donald Trump in a Twitter rant in which the Zoolander star said heâs deeply disturbed âto see the president encourage antipathy towards, and fear of #Refugees.â
articles.author: Jerome Hudson
articles.content: âSpeaking as a citizen, itâs extremely disturbing to see the president encourage antipathy towards, and fear of #Refugees at his rally. I know that most people in Minnesota are proud and supportive of Americaâs leadership in helping the 70 million displaced people in the world,â Stillerâs screed began. âItâs clear that false narratives about the danger of resettlement, that have no statistical evidence, and claiming that vetting is not extreme or rigorous enough, stoke the flames of division, and appeal to our lowest instincts. Itâs not true,â Ben Stiller said. âOur country is made up of immigrants and refugees, and we have always welcomed them in a safe, and beneficial ( if not perfect) way for all involved. This is the message our president needs to spread. Not hate, fear and division,â theÂ Saturday Night LiveÂ alum concluded.   Stillerâs rant referenced comments President Trump made during his rally in Minnesota on Thursday night, in which he said âI promise you as president I will give local communities a greater say on refugee policy and put in place enhanced vetting and responsible immigration controls.â âSince coming to office, I have reduced refugee resettlement by 85 percent,â Trump continued. âAnd as you know, maybe especially in Minnesota, I signed an executive order that no refugees will be resettled in any state without the expressed written consent of that city or that state.â Stiller, who rarely publicly chimes in on political issues, has served since last year asÂ Goodwill Ambassador for UNHCR, the United Nations Refugee Agency. TheÂ Tropic ThunderÂ star was among the celebrities who slammedÂ President Trumpâs reported use of the word âshitholeâ to describe several countries during anÂ Oval Office meeting last January. Stiller added his name to those who praised Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanahughâs misconduct accuserÂ Christine Blasey Ford ahead of her testimony beforeÂ the Senate Judiciary Committee last September.  âRespect to Doctor Ford for standing up and telling her story. For my family, my daughter and people who value the truth, you are a hero and on the right side of history,â Stiller said. Jerome Hudson isÂ Breitbart News Entertainment Editor andÂ author of the bestselling book 50 Things They Donât Want You to Know.Â Order your copy today. Follow Jerome HudsonÂ on TwitterÂ @jeromeehudson.

articles.title: Illegal Alien, Freed into U.S., Gets Life Sentence for Murdering Jared Vargas
articles.subtitle: An illegal alien who was twice freed into the interior of the United States has been sentenced to life for brutally murdering 20-year-old Jared Vargas.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: On Friday,Â 20-year-old illegal alien Ernesto Esquivel-Garcia from Mexico was sentenced to life in prison for murdering Vargas in June 2018 after being convicted of first-degree murder in August, as Breitbart News reported. On the Angel Familyâs Facebook page, Justice for Jared Vargas, they celebrated the life sentence of the illegal alien who took their loved oneâs life. âLife!!!â the Angel Family posted. A photo memorial of 20-year-old college student Jared Vargas, a loving brother to his twin and little sister, who was murdered by an illegal alien in June 2018. (Photo via Facebook) Vargas, a cybersecurity student at the University of Texas at San Antonio, was found murdered by Esquivel-Garcia on June 18, 2018, when firefighters arrived at the scene of an apartment set ablaze. Prosecutors said the illegal alien had brutally strangled and stabbed Vargas to death before setting his body on fire in the apartment complex.Â Throughout the trial, Esquivel-Garcia and his attorneys had used a defense and smear against Vargas to justify the murder, claiming that the illegal alien killed Vargas in self-defense because he believed that he was under threat of being sexually assaulted. The murder occurred after Esquivel-Garcia had been twice released from police and federal custody back into the U.S. and was only given a voluntary deportation order despite having a criminal record. In March 2017, the illegal alien was arrested for drunk driving and was eventually turned over to the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agency. Though he was placed into deportation proceedings, an immigration judge allowed him to post bond, and he was released back into the interior of the country. In May 2018, a month before Vargas was murdered, Esquivel-Garcia was again put into ICE custody and local police custody but was able to post bond and be released back into the U.S. with only the promise that he would self-deport. Esquivel-Garcia is eligible for parole in 30 years, and if ever released on parole, he will be deported by federal immigration officials to Mexico. Jared Vargas leaves behind his twin brother, in college, and a little sister, in high school, as well as his parents and countless loved ones and friends. AÂ GoFundMe pageÂ has been set up in his honor to help his twin brother and little sister in their schooling. John Binder is a reporterÂ for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Donald Trump Announces Future âSubstantial Phase One Dealâ with China
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump announced a âsubstantial phase one dealâ with China on Friday after continued negotiations with the vice premier of China that began on Thursday.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: The president spoke about the future deal during remarks with reporters in the Oval Office at the White House after a meeting with Vice Premier of China H.E. Liu He. âWeâve come to a very substantial phase one deal,â Trump said, noting that it would soon be written and signed by both parties. The president said that China had agreed to $40 billion to $50 billion in agricultural purchases, as well as an agreement on intellectual property and financial services. âThatâs the largest order in the history of agriculture,â Trump said. He said he was âexcitedâ that farmers would experience a big economic boost as a result of the deal. âTheyâre going to have to buy more land,â he said, questioning whether farmers could even produce enough agricultural products. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said that they had also reached an agreement surrounding Chinaâs currency after the United States labeled the country as a currency manipulator. Trump said that the deal was still âsubject to getting written,â but Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin confirmed that theÂ scheduled tariff hike from 25 percent to 30 percent on October 15 would not take place as a result of the agreement. Trump said he would likely sign the potential deal with President Xi Jinping at the APEC summit in Chile in November. âI donât think it should be a problem getting it papered,â Trump said, referring to the agreement. U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said the Chinese technology Huawei was not part of the deal and would be dealt with separately. The stock market jumped over 500 points on Friday in reaction to the news but closed at 315 points. Lighthizer confirmed the scheduled December 15 tariffs would remain in place for now. âThereâs plenty of time to make that decision,â Lighthizer said. Trump said that it was possible that phase two and phase three part of the deal would happen afterward. âCongratulations on the 70thâ Trump said, referring to the Chinese Communist party in China celebrating their 70th anniversary. He described the military parade and event âamazing to watch.â The Vice Premier thanked Trump for his congratulatory remarks about the Chinese governmentâs anniversary and expressed optimism about the future talks between the two countries. âWe have made substantial progress in many fields, and we are very happy about it,â Liu said. Liu also presented Trump with a letter from Xi Jinping to the president who took it out of the envelope and showed it to reporters. âWeâre working on enforcement right now,â Trump said, noting that the deals would be written and set for the signed agreement in November. âWe think that China wants it badly and we want it also,â he said. Trump said that the deal might signal a future âlove festâ with China andÂ the Vice Premier said that the deal would bring âpeace and prosperity to the world.â âItâs beyond a trade deal,â Trump said.

articles.title: Donald Trump Questions Shepard Smithâs Ratings After Announced Departure
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump questioned why Fox News anchor Shepard Smith on Friday announced his sudden departure from the network.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: The president appeared not to have prior knowledge of the news. âIs he leaving?â Trump asked. âOh, thatâs a shame.â He did not respond to questions from reporters of whether he pressured Smith to leave the network. âIs he leaving because of bad ratings? Tell me, I donât know,â Trump said. âIâm assuming heâs leaving because of bad ratings.â Smith ended his 3:00 p.m. show, bidding farewell to viewers, noting he asked to be let go from the network. âRecently I asked the company to allow me to leave Fox News and begin a new chapter,â Smith said. âAfter requesting that I stay, they graciously obliged.â The president has a history of expressing ire at Smithâs reporting of the news on the Fox News channel but did not celebrate his departure. âI wish him well,â Trump said.

articles.title: Fact Check: Pete Buttigieg Falsely Claims Trump Is Making Housing Harder for Homeless Transgenders
articles.subtitle: Democrat presidential hopeful Pete Buttigieg falsely claimed during CNNâs equality town hall on Thursday that under President Donald Trump, Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is making it harder for transgender youth who are homeless to find shelter.
articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.content: The remark came after Buttigieg, who is the mayor of South Bend, Indiana, was asked about whether bullying that causes suicide should have legal ramifications. âI believe itâs one of the things that could help,â Buttigieg said. âThere are still states â I live in one of them â that donât have hate crime legislation.â âAnd we need to make sure that our legislation reflects our values as a country and the insistence that nobody be singled out or harmed because of who they are,â Buttigieg said. He continued: But thatâs just the beginning of what weâve got to do for LGBTQ youth. We know that LGBTQ youth are much more likely to experience homelessness, which is one of the reasons why we need to invest more in youth homelessness in general and do the opposite of what this president is doing, which is allowing rules to go forward that would actually make it harder for transgender youth to access homeless services. âThat is just wrong, and it will end in my administration,â Buttigieg said. In fact, while the HUD rule â posted in spring 2019 â does allow for shelters to make decisions based on privacy and safety, it specifically states that discrimination based on âsexual orientation and gender identityâ will not take place: This proposed rule provides that grant recipients, subrecipients, owners, operators, managers, and providers (Shelter Providers) under HUD programs which permit single-sex or sex-segregated facilities (such as bathrooms or temporary, emergency shelters and other buildings and facilities with physical limitations or configurations that require and are permitted to have shared sleeping quarters or bathing facilities) may establish a policy, consistent with state and local law, by which such Shelter Provider considers an individualâs sex for the purposes of determining accommodation within such shelters and for purposes of determining sex for admission to any facility or portion thereof. The proposed rule permits Shelter Providers to consider a range of factors in making such determinations, including privacy, safety, practical concerns, religious beliefs, any relevant considerations under civil rights and nondiscrimination authorities , the individualâs sex as reflected in official government documents, as well as the gender which a person identifies with. The proposed rule does not dictate a required basis for making determinations other than that they be consistent with an overall policy. The proposed rule continues HUDâs policy of ensuring that its programs are open to all eligible individuals and families regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. Buttigieg joined eight other Democrat candidates at the marathon town hall, including Sens. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), Kamala Harris (D-CA), Cory Booker (D-NJ), and Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), as well as former HUD Secretary Julian Castro (D), former Vice President Joe Biden (D), former Rep. Beto OâRourke (D-TX), and Tom Steyer (D). Follow Penny Starr on Twitter.

articles.title: Watch: Ocasio-Cortez Says Dreams of Motherhood âTaste Bittersweetâ Due to Climate Change
articles.subtitle: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) said during a speech at the C40 World Mayors Summit in Copenhagen that her dreams of motherhood now âtaste bittersweetâ due to climate change.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: The freshman lawmaker delivered a speech at the summit this week and emotionally declared that her dreams of motherhood âtaste bittersweetâ because of climate change and the impact it will have on âour childrenâs future.â âI speak to you not as an elected official or public figure. But I speak to you as a human being,â she began. âA woman whose dreams of motherhood now taste bittersweet because of what I know about our childrenâs future and that our actions are responsible for bringing their most dire possibilities into focus,â she continued, audibly holding back tears. âI speak to you as a daughter and descendant of colonized peoples who have already begun to suffer,â she added, citing the thousands of Puerto Rican lives lost due to Hurricane Maria, which she described as a âclimate change powered storm.â She said her grandfather died in the aftermath along with others, all becauseÂ âthey were living under colonial rule, which contributed to the dire conditions and lack of recovery.â Dozens of C40 mayorsÂ called for a âGlobal Green New Dealâ to address the mounting environmental concerns. âAs mayors our first priority is to protect the safety of our citizens,â C40 chair, Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo, said.Â âIt will soon be four years since the Paris Agreement was signed in our city.â âWorld leaders met in New York just last month and once again failed to agree anything close to the level of action necessary to stop the climate crisis,â she continued. âThere is no other solution but a Global Green New Deal to be the pivotal instrument to win this race against the clock. All decision-makers must take responsibility in making it a reality,â she added. This is far from the first time the socialist lawmaker has painted a dark picture of the future over concerns related to climate change. She told viewers during a live video on social media in August that she wants to âperhaps have one less childâ due to the looming threat. âEven now, you know, when you put climate change on top of that, I know that I want to perhaps have one less child than I thought I would maybe have,â she explained. âI think having a mixed family is part of my personal planning. But itâs really hard, and I donât think sometimes that older generations understand how much weâre taking this into account,â she added:

articles.title: Donald Trump Surprises Little League Champions with Ride Home on Air Force One
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump surprised the 2019 Little League World Champions on Friday by inviting them to fly home aboard Air Force One.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: The Lousiana Eastbank All Stars team visited the White House on Friday, appearing with the president for a picture. The president surprised them by inviting them to fly home with him, as he has a scheduled rally in the state on Friday evening. Pictures of the team soon emerged on social media.

articles.title: Pentagon Chief on Decision to Move Troops in Syria: âWe Put the Safety of Our Soldiers Firstâ
articles.subtitle: Defense Secretary Mark Esper said Friday the Trump administration decided to pull back less than 50 U.S. troops from northern Syria in order to make sure they were not caught in a pending fight between Turkish and Syrian Kurdish forces.
articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.content: âWhen Turkey notified us of an imminent military operation, we relocated a small contingent of less than 50 special operations soldiers out of the immediate zone of attack,â he said. âThis decision was made to ensure that American troops were not caught up in the fighting between Turkish and Kurdish forces.â âThe safety of our men and women in uniform remains our top priority,â he added. Esper said Turkeyâs decision put the U.S. in a tough situation, given that Turkey is a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) ally. He said: The impulsive action of President Erdogan to invade northern Syria has put the United States in a tough situation, given our relationship with our NATO ally Turkey, who has fought alongside the United States in the past, and the Syrian Democratic Forces who helped us destroy the physical caliphate of ISIS, and the safety of U.S. military personnel. He said, âRather than get pulled into this conflict, we put the safety of our soldiers first, while urging Turkey to forego its operations and working hard with us to address their concerns through the development of a security zone along the border.â Despite the administrationâs decision to take U.S. troops out of a pending military clash, critics have attacked the administration for âabandoningâ the Syrian Kurds, who the U.S. armed to defeat the Islamic State (ISIS) in Syria. Critics have accused the Trump administration of âgreen-lightingâ a Turkish incursion into northern Syria, where the Kurds had staked out a semi-autonomous region during the Syrian civil war. The Turks, who consider the Syrian Kurds to be terrorists and an existential threat, have long wanted to move against them in Syria. Esper said the U.S. had tried to prevent any pending attack, but that ultimately Turkey decided to make a move. He and other senior national security officials have adamantly denied that the administration gave Turkey the green light. âWe oppose and are greatly disappointed by Turkeyâs decision to launch a unilateral, military incursion into northern Syria,â he said. âThis operation puts our SDF partners in harmâs way, it risks the security of ISIS prison camps, and will further destabilize the region.â âFrom the president on down, we have communicated with the Turks on this issue,â he said. âI spoke with Turkish Defense Minister Akar yesterday to express our strong opposition to Turkeyâs actions, and reiterated the damage this is doing to our bilateral relationship.â He also said the U.S. was not abandoning the Syrian Kurds. âTo be clear, we are not abandoning our Kurdish partner forces and U.S. troops remain with them in other parts of Syria,â he said. âWe remain in close coordination with the Syrian Democratic Forces who helped us destroy the physical caliphate of ISIS, but I will not place American service members in the middle of a longstanding conflict between the Turks and the Kurds. This is not why we are in Syria,â he said. âWe will continue to work with members of the defeat ISIS coalition and the Syrian Democratic Forces to ensure the defeat of ISIS,â he said. In addition, he said the Syrian Defense Forces have transferred two ISIS terrorists to U.S. custody who were involved in the kidnapping and murder of U.S. and U.K. citizens in Syria. He said they were being held in a safe and secure location in the U.S., but outside of Syria. Follow Breitbart Newsâs @Kristina_Wong.

articles.title: MSNBCâs Wallace on Shep Smithâs Fox News Departure: âVery Sad News for the Truth Todayâ
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Pam Key
articles.content: On Fridayâs broadcast of MSNBCâs âDeadline,â anchor Nicolle Wallace discussed Shepard Smithâs departure from Fox News. Wallace said, âThatâs Shep Smith in my view, the most important voice at Fox News. He took apart Donald Trumpâs Uranium One scam, he was an important voice for truth in front of an audience that needs it desperately.â She continued, âVery sad news for the truth today.â Follow Pam Key on Twitter @pamkeyNEN

articles.title: Report: Democrats Privately Urging Pelosi to Hold Impeachment Inquiry Vote
articles.subtitle: Some House Democrats are privately calling on Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) to hold a vote to formalize the impeachment inquiry to undermine Republican criticism that the process is illegitimate, Politico reported this week.
articles.author: Edwin Mora
articles.content: So far, Pelosi has refused to schedule a vote, arguing that the Constitution and House rules do not require the lawmakers to do so. Meanwhile, the White House and its Republican congressional allies contend that such a vote is necessary to legitimize the inquiry per the recognized standards of previous impeachment efforts. Politico reported: Some Democratic lawmakers and aides have begun to say privately â and, to a lesser extent, publicly â that the House should just vote to formalize the inquiry, robbing the GOP of its main talking point. â¦ Though a small but growing chorus of Democrats has started urging a vote simply to undercut this GOP talking point, others say that nothing will stop Trump and his supporters from claiming Democratsâ efforts are unfair and inconsistent with past impeachment procedures. They say the party shouldnât take the White Houseâs bait, arguing that the presidentâs defenders will simply find other reasons to not comply with the inquiry. The âprivateâ debate on whether or not to hold a vote âis threatening to cleave Democratsâ unified frontâ in favor of impeachment, the news outlet added. Rep. John Yarmuth (D-KY) publicly called for a vote, telling Politico,âIf Nancy asked me, I would say sure, letâs have a vote. Everybodyâs on record, so theyâre not going to vote any differently. Whatâs the danger in having a vote to formalize it?â House lawmakers voted to allow an investigation into whether to impeach President Bill Clinton and President Richard Nixon. Republicans have pointed to those votes as evidence that Democrats are acting in an unfair and illegitimate manner. Politico noted: Democrats have long argued that they donât need a vote to launch formal impeachment proceedings, even if that had been the practice in prior presidential impeachment processes. In fact, House lawyers backed by Pelosi have made that argument in a succession of court cases seeking evidence to support their impeachment inquiry, and proponents of that position worry a formal vote would undercut their legal claims. Similarly, Democrats are worried that a near-term floor vote would drive away a handful of Republicans who are wavering over whether to support impeachment proceedings. A party-line vote would hand the White House another talking point, they argue: that impeachment is a purely partisan effort by Democrats. In a letter to Pelosi and the House chairmen pursuing the impeachment inquiry, the White House said the Democrats were conducting a âconstitutionally invalidâ and âillegitimateâ impeachment probe that absolves lawmakers of âtaking political accountability.â The White House said it would not cooperate with the ongoing âpartisanâ impeachment investigation. Although the letter stopped short of explicitly calling on Pelosi to hold a vote, it all but dared the Speaker to do so. Most of the 235 members of the House Democratic Caucus support the impeachment probe, but there are still eight who did not, as of Thursday afternoon, a tally from the New York Times revealed.

articles.title: All Eyes on Louisiana: Gubernatorial âJungle Primaryâ First Election in Nation Since Impeachment Inquiry
articles.subtitle: All eyes are focused on Louisiana, where Donald Trump will hold a rally on Friday night and the stateâs voters will go to the polls in a âjungle primaryâ on Saturday.
articles.author: Michael Patrick Leahy
articles.content: The primary pits incumbent Democrat Gov. John Bel Edwards against Republican Rep. Ralph Abraham (R-LA) and Republican businessman Eddie Rispone. Edwards has been hovering in recent polls just a few points under the 50 percent majority he will need to avoid a November runoff election against Saturdayâs second place finisher. Abraham and Rispone have been jockeying for the second spot, with both registering between 20 percent and 25 percent in recent polls. President Trump has been attacking Edwards vigorously in recent days, portraying him as another Democrat in lockstep with the impeachment inquiry announced two weeks ago by Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-CA). On Tuesday, White House Counsel Pat Cippolone sent a powerful letter to Pelosi, calling the inquiry an illegal and unconstitutional violation of the presidentâs due process rights. For his part, Edwards has attempted to deflect the presidentâs attacks while avoiding a direct confrontation, as The Advocate reported on Friday: Hours before President Donald Trumpâs planned rally in Lake Charles Friday, Gov. John Bel Edwards said voters should not take cues from the âpartisanshipâ of Washington, D.C., and touted his working relationship with the president on the eve of the open primary election in the governorâs race. Edwards, the only Democratic governor in the Deep South, responded to Trumpâs Twitter missives against him, noting he has long held a pro-gun stance and saying Trump doesnât know him or Louisiana. âI donât think Louisiana should be taking its inspiration from the partisanship of D.C.,â he said in a half-hour-long press conference at SOWELA Community Technical College in Lake Charles. âI think Washington, instead, should take inspiration from the bipartisanship of Louisiana.â The Washington Post noted that Edwardsâ efforts to avoid a runoff may fall short: As the only Democratic governor in the Deep South, John Bel Edwards appeared to be doing everything necessary to win a second term in Louisiana, a state whose populist Democratic roots seem to fray a bit more each year. Edwards signed some of the nationâs most restrictive abortion laws . He cozied up to President Trump, scoring an invite to a state dinner at the White House. And in a state with a robust Catholic population, Edwards aired television ads showing him shaking hands with Pope Francis. But all that still might not be enough for the governor to win his reelection battle outright on Saturday, as Trump holds an 11th-hour rally to boost support for the two leading GOP challengers. Early voting results suggest that the impeachment inquiry has created massive increases in Republican and Independent turnout, as Breitbart News reportedÂ on Sunday: Early voting in the October 12 âjungle primaryâ between incumbent Louisiana Gov. John Bel Edwards, a Democrat, and two Republican candidates ended on Saturday, and the turnout is massive, particularly among Republicans and Independents. âAs of last night, 374,190 Louisianians either early voted by person or by mail in ballot (340,480 in person, and 33,710 mail in ballots). To put this number in perspective, this is the highest early voting turnout EVER for a non-Presidential election, and is the second highest early voting turnout EVER (only the 2016 Presidential election has seen a higher in person + absentee voting turnout with 531,555 early votes),â Louisiana-based JMC Analytics reported on Sunday. âRepublican turnout volume is up 84%, while Independent turnout is up 80% and Democratic turnout is up 36%,â JMC Analytics concluded. On election eve, the question of whether Edwards will surpass the 50 percent margin needed to avoid a runoff remains in doubt. The outcome is likely to be determined by Republican turnout on election day. Historically, about 80 percent of all votes in the gubernatorial jungle primary are cast on election day. Should Edwards fail to reach 50 percent, Republicans are expected to rally around the second place finisher in the November runoff, whether it be Abraham or Rispone. That possible Republican consolidation in a potential November runoff election may be easier for Abraham than Rispone, since Abraham has focused his campaign attacks on Edwards, while Rispone has criticized both Edwards and Abraham.

articles.title: ***Live Updates*** Trump Holds Louisiana Rally
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump will hold a Friday evening rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana, a day before the stateâs gubernatorial jungle primary. Governor John Bel Edwards (D) needs to get more than 50 percent of the vote against Republicans Rep. Ralph Abraham (D-LA) and Eddie Rispone to avoid a runoff.
articles.author: Tony Lee
articles.content: Stay tuned to Breitbart News for live updates. All times eastern. â 9:56 PM: Trump says the âpath to victoryâ in 2020 begins tomorrow in Louisiana. He again urges voters to get their friends and neighbors to vote Republican before the Florida-LSU showdown. Another electric rally in the books for Trump. 9:45 PM: Trump, ripping Democrats for supporting open borders, says Mexico has done more for a secure border than Democrats. He points out that every Democrat at one debate raised their hands for giving free health care to illegal immigrants. Trump says no wonder illegal immigrants want to come to America after hearing things like that. Trump says Democrats want to ârob the American taxpayer to fund socialism for the entire world!â He says in everything he does he remembers he is not the president of the world but the president of America. âWe reject globalism,â Trump says. âWe embrace patriotism.â Trump mocks NYC Mayor de Blasioâs failed presidential run and willingness to fine people for using âillegal alien.â He says the radical leftâs attack on free speech goes hand in hand with their desire for open borders. He also accuses the left of not caring about election security because they do not support Voter ID. Trump then says whatâs happening in California is a âdisgraceâ and rips Democrats for supporting sanctuary cities. Trump going into his standard lines about how Democrats are for open borders and âblatant corruption.â He says Republican are for âworkersâ and âthe American dream.â 9:40 PM: Trump says the âtwin disastersâ of NAFTA/Chinaâs entry into the WTO âransackedâ millions of manufacturing jobs from Louisiana. 9:35 PM: Trump says Republicans in Louisiana have asked him to go to other states like Michigan because Louisiana will âhave your backâ in the general election. Trump says âAmerica is booming like never beforeâ and talks about the millions of people off of food stamps and the record-low unemployment rates. Trump touts his administrationâs energy accomplishments and says anti-energy Democrats will âannihilateâ Louisianaâs economy. 9:31 PM: Trump calls each of the Little Leaguers to get on stage with him. Trump: âYou donât know what the word choke means.â Kids thrilled to be on stage with Trump. 9:30 PM: Trump now praising the Lake Charles Little League champs. Trump says he always watched Japan win the World Series and then suggest the Japanese had guys who looked like they were 18. He goes off on a story about a 12-year-old Little Leaguer who was throwing 100 mph. What? 9:25 PM: Trump praises Sen. John Kennedy (R-LA) and Rep. Bill Cassidy (R-LA) and invites them on stage. Kennedy says Trump âloves Louisiana like the devil loves sin.â Trump talks infrastructure and theÂ Calcasieu Bridge. 9:15 PM: Trump says John Bel Edwards wonât protect the Second Amendment if Washington Democrats pressure him. He says a Republican will win the gubernatorial race if it goes to a runoff. Trump asks Rispone and Abraham to get on stage with him. 9:10 PM: Trump says Bernie was trying to hit a baseball today but âthere was just not a lot of bat head speed.â He says âget better.â 9:07 PM: Trump says he needs Louisiana voters to âsend a loud and clearâ message to Democrats by voting against John Bel Edwards. Trump ripping him for increasing taxes after promising not to do so and then reminisces about his 2016 Louisiana victory. 9:01 PM: Trump says Democrats are âscammers and con artistsâ who are âperpetuating hoaxes and witch huntsâ because they canât beat him at the ballot box. He says they are pursuing an âinvalid, unconstitutional, and bullshit impeachment.â Crowd erupts. Trump: âThank God we have a thing called social media.â He says it helps him âget the word out.â He calls the impeachment inquiry one of the âgreatest con jobs everyâ that should never be allowed to happen to another president. Trump says other nations, looking at the impeachment inquiry, look at America and âthink weâre all crazy.â He now again rips âNervous Nancyâ and âShifty Adam Schiffâ for their impeachment shenanigans. âI used to think she loved the country,â Trump says. âNancy Pelosi hates the United States of America.â Trump says Pelosi would not be pursuing impeachment if she loved the country. 9:00 PM: Trump rips the Democrats and the fake news media, says âtheyâre partners.â He says they would be calling for his kids to be thrown in jail if they made deals like Hunter Biden and then adds, âbut weâre here and theyâre not.â Trump again rips Democrats and the media for coordinating talking points on everything from the âmanufactured crisisâ at the border to Russia and says, âthatâs the real collusion.â Trump says the Democrats and the media have been trying to defeat him for three years and they are trying to âsabotage,â âdeceiveâ andâ hurt voters.â Trump mocks the New York Times for winning the Pulitzer Prize for stories that got the Russia collusion hoax wrong. 8:55 PM: Trump says his âWhereâs Hunter?â line from last nightâs rally became the hottest thing in the whole country. Trump: âThe fake news is always covering up for Joe Biden.â  8:50 PM: Trump says they are battling the unholy alliance âofÂ corrupt Democrat politicians, Deep State bureaucrats and the fake news media.â Trump says the TV ratings will tank when he is not president. He says the fake news media will endorse him for ratings and Trump asks if Americans want âthe fake Pocahontasâ as president of âSleepy Joe,â whose son âknows nothing about energy.â  Trump now ripping Hunter Bidenâs corrupt business dealings with Ukraine and China. He says Hunter âdoesnât even know what a gasoline tank looks like.â 8:45 PM: Protesters interrupt after Trump accuses the fake news media like NBC of trying to find veterans who are unhappy and making them âstarsâ to hurt the Trump administration. Trump says all of the nationâs gains are put to risk by Democrats who have gone âcompletely insane.â He says Democrats have waged a ânon-stop battleâ for three years to âoverturn your voteâ and âoverturn the results of the most spectacular election in the history of our country.â He accuses Democrats of selling the country out, opening borders, and bogging the country down in endless wars.  8:41 PM: Trump says âweâve ended the war on American energyâ and the United States is the top producer of oil and gas anywhere on the planet. Trump rips Democrats who want to get rid of oil and natural gas. He mocks Democrats who want to go to wind. âI canât watch LSU and Florida because there is no wind today,â Trump says. 8:38 PM: Trump takes the stage. Trump asks Louisiana voters to vote against a âliberal Democratâ who has sold them out. Trump references the LSU-Florida game at Death Valley and says he wants them to enjoy the game but not if they do not vote first. He urges voters to vote first and then enjoy the game so they donât feel guilty. 8:20 PM: Rally starting a bit late, but Trump should soon be on stage.  7:50 PM: Trump makes news after landing in Louisiana:   7:45 PM: Not the Undertakerâs Death Valley, but all eyes will be on Death Valley under the lights tomorrow evening to see how good Joe Burrow and LSUâs offense really are against Floridaâs vaunted defense as election results come in after the polls close.    7:30 PM:

articles.title: Washington Examiner: Two Adam Schiff Staffers Worked with âWhistleblowerâ at White House
articles.subtitle: TwoÂ former National Security Council staffers that worked with the so-called whistleblower in the Obama and Trump administrations now work for House Intelligence Chairman Adam Schiff (D-CA), according to a report.
articles.author: Breitbart News
articles.content: The Washington Examiner states: House Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff recruited two former National Security Council aides who worked alongside the CIA whistleblower at the NSC during the Obama and Trump administrations, theÂ Washington ExaminerÂ has learned. Abigail Grace, who worked at the NSC until 2018,Â was hired in February,Â while Sean Misko, an NSC aide until 2017, joined Schiffâs committee staff in August, the same month the whistleblower submittedÂ his complaint. The whistleblower was an NSC official who worked with former Vice President Joe Biden and who has expertise in Ukraine,Â theÂ Washington ExaminerÂ has reported. A career CIA analyst with Ukraine expertise, the whistleblower aired his concerns about aÂ phone conversationÂ between President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to a House Intelligence Committee aide on Schiffâs staff. He had previously informed the CIAâs legal counselâs office. Click here to read the rest of the report.

articles.title: Watch Live: Donald Trump Rallies Supporters in Louisiana
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump will rally with supporters in Louisiana on Friday, as he continues to campaign for re-election.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: The president is also rallying Republicans to vote in the race for Louisiana governor. Trump is scheduled to begin speaking at 7:00 p.m. CDTÂ inÂ Lake Charles, LA. âI will be in Louisiana tonight (Love it!) to get Republicans to vote for either of our two great Republican Candidates and force a runoff with John Bel Edwards, who has done a really poor job of tax-cutting, car insurance cost (worst in USA), and is suspect on your Second Amendment!â he wrote on Twitter Friday morning. Livestream courtesy of Right Side Broadcasting Network.

articles.title: Trump to Replace Kevin McAleenan at Department of Homeland Security
articles.subtitle: Acting Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Kevin McAleenan will be leaving his position as the head of the agency, President Trump announced Friday evening.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: In a series of posts, Trump announced that he would be replacing McAleenan next week after the former Customs and Border Protection Commissioner had served as head of DHS since April. Trump wrote: Kevin McAleenan has done an outstanding job as Acting Secretary of Homeland Security. We have worked well together with Border Crossings being way down. Kevin now, after many years in Government, wants to spend more time with his family and go to the private sectorâ¦. âCongratulations Kevin, on a job well done,â Trump continued. âI will be announcing the new Acting Secretary next week. Many wonderful candidates!â  McAleenan posted that he would âwork with the White House and DHS leadership teams on a smooth transitionâ as he exits DHS:  As Breitbart News has chronicled for months,Â  McAleenan had defied the Trump administration on multiple fronts, including most recently providing an interview to the Washington PostÂ in which he attacked Trumpâs âZero Toleranceâ policy at the southern border and said he refused to call border crossers âillegal aliens.â For the structure at DHS, Breitbart News exclusively reported accounts in which administration sources said McAleenan had implemented a personnel agenda that sought to protect the bureaucratic allies of former DHS Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen. In a New York Times report last month, McAleenan was accused of telling federal immigration officials to ignore Trumpâs orders at the U.S.-Mexico border. McAleenan, in June, was accused of having leaked raids scheduled by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agency in order to sabotage and stop the plan. The ICE raids would have arrested hundreds of illegal aliens who had already been ordered deported. John Binder is a reporterÂ for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Report: Shepard Smithâs Exit Could Spark Fox News âExodusâ
articles.subtitle: Longtime Fox News Channel Shepard Smithâs unexpected departure could be the start of an âexodusâ at the news network, according to one staffer.
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: Smith announced during Fridayâs edition of his weekday programÂ Shepard Smith Reporting that today would be his final broadcast at the network. Smith, known for his critical coverage of President DonaldÂ Trump, said in a statement: Recently I asked the company to allow me to leave FOX News and begin a new chapter. After requesting that I stay, they graciously obliged. The opportunities afforded this guy from small town Mississippi have been many. Itâs been an honor and a privilege to report the news each day to our loyal audience in context and with perspective, without fear or favor. Iâve worked with the most talented, dedicated and focused professionals I know and Iâm proud to have anchored their work each day â I will deeply miss them. According to CNN, staffers inside Fox News were âopenly weepingâ over the news of Smithâs departure and said some âwere here and have stayed here solelyâ due to the anchor. âDonât be surprised if thereâs an exodus,â the staffer continued, before adding, âFox hasnât just lost Shep today.â Smith joinedÂ Fox News in 1996 and covered major news stories for the network for over two decades. In a statement,Â Fox News president and executive editor, Jay Wallace, said Smith will leave his post as chief news anchor and managing editor of the outletâs breaking news unit. Wallace said in a statement: Shep is one of the premier newscasters of his generation and his extraordinary body of work is among the finest journalism in the industry. His integrity and outstanding reporting from the field helped put FOX News on the map and there is simply no better breaking news anchor who has the ability to transport a viewer to a place of conflict, tragedy, despair or elation through his masterful delivery. We are proud of the signature reporting and anchoring style he honed at FOX News, along with everything he accomplished here during his monumental 23-year tenure. While this day is especially difficult as his former producer, we respect his decision and are deeply grateful for his immense contributions to the entire network. Smithâs departure comes as President Trumpâs relationship with Fox News continues to deteriorate. On Thursday, the president knocked Smith in a pair of tweets that were critical of a Fox News poll that found a record 51 percent of voters support his impeachment and removal from office. The presidentÂ tweeted: Whoever their Pollster is, they suck. But @FoxNews is also much different than it used to be in the good old days. With people like Andrew Napolitano, who wanted to be a Supreme Court Justice & I turned him down (heâs been terrible ever since), Shep Smith, @donnabrazile (who gave Crooked Hillary the debate questions & got fired from @CNN), & others, @FoxNews doesnât deliver for US anymore. It is so different than it used to be. Speaking to reporters ahead of his rally in Louisiana, President Trump questioned whether Smithâs exit from Fox News was prompted by his ratings. âIâm assuming heâs leaving because of bad ratings,â the president said. âI wish him well,â he added.

articles.title: Trump: Nancy Pelosi âHates the United States of Americaâ
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump on Friday declared during his Lake Charles, Louisiana, re-election rally that House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) âhates the United States of America.â
articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.content: âNervous Nancy, I used to think she loved the country,â President Trump began. âShe hates the country, she wouldnât be doing this to the country if she did,â the president continued, in reference to her support for an impeachment inquiry. âNancy Pelosi hates the country, hates the United States of America,â he added.  Pelosi recently unveiled an impeachment inquiry against President Trump after a partisan CIA officer filed a so-called âwhistleblowerâ complaint alleging that the president pressured Ukrainian PresidentÂ Volodymyr Zelensky to look into allegations of international corruption against former Vice President Joe Biden and his son, Hunter Biden. In recent days, the so-called âwhistleblowerâ was outed as a registered Democrat, who worked with Biden during the Obama administration. Both President Trump and Zelensky have denied any pressure was applied to probe into the Bidens and the White House released a transcript of the world leadersâ July 25th call to illustrate no wrongdoing occurred. âThere was no blackmail,â the president of UkraineÂ toldÂ reporters when asked about the call this week. âWe are not servants. We are an independent country.â

articles.title: Court Rules Ohio Ban on Down Syndrome Abortions Illegal
articles.subtitle: A federal appeals court panel affirmed a lower courtâs ruling that blocked Ohioâs law banning abortions performed because of a prenatal diagnosis of Down syndrome.
articles.author: Dr. Susan Berry
articles.content: A panel of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ruled, 2-1, that the Ohio law violated the Supreme Courtâs 1973 decision in Roe v. Wade, specifically by disregarding whether the fetus is viable at the time of the abortion. In the majority opinion, Judges Bernice Bouie Donald, an Obama appointee, and R. Guy Cole, a Clinton appointee, affirmed the lower courtâs ruling and noted the stateâs argument that the decision in Roe v. Wade âexpressly rejected the claim that the right to abortion is âabsoluteâ and therefore entitles a woman to obtain an abortion âfor whatever reasons she alone chooses.ââ The state said the intention of Ohioâs law was to prevent discrimination against children with a disability; hence, its name is the Antidiscrimination Law. The judges said, however, that 20 years later in Planned Parenthood v. CaseyÂ the Supreme Court upheld Roe, affirming that â[t]he womanâs right to terminate her pregnancy before viability is the most central principle of Roe v. Wade.â âIt is a rule of law and a component of liberty we cannot renounce,â the judges said. Senior Judge Alice Batchelder, a George H.W. Bush appointee, dissented, however. She affirmed the stateâs interest in fighting discrimination against those with disabilities. Batchelder also cited Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomasâ statement that an abortion law in Indiana âand other laws like it promote a Stateâs compelling interest in preventing abortion from becoming a tool of modern-day eugenics.â Batchelder continued: Ohio enacted the Antidiscrimination Law, H.B. 214, to counteract such eugenicist practices concerning the prenatal Down Syndrome population. The law prevents a physician from performing an abortion when the physician knows the abortion is sought not because the woman did not intend to become pregnant, but because the child in the womanâs womb tested positive for Down Syndrome. In 2017, former Ohio Gov. John Kasich (R) signed the bill into law that prohibited abortion in the case of unborn babies with Down syndrome. The following year, Judge Timothy Black, an Obama appointee, said, âFederal law is crystal clear,â and he struck down the law. âIt violates the right to privacy of every woman in Ohio and is unconstitutional on its face,â he stated. According to Cleveland.com, a spokesman for Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost said the office would ask the full Sixth Circuit Appeals Court to hear the case. Susan B. Anthony List President Marjorie Dannenfelser expressed disappointment with the panelâs ruling. âDiscrimination abortions have no place in any modern, inclusive society,â she said in a statement. âOhio lawmakers acted on the will of the people in creating a safe haven for unborn children with Down syndrome, and two years later they are still fighting to implement the law.â Dannenfelser added that when the Supreme Court declined to review a similar Indiana law, the Court âleft open the question of whether the Constitution allows states to protect unborn children from the eugenic practice of discrimination abortion and made clear they welcomed further consideration by the lower courts.â âUrgency is growing for the Supreme Court to weigh in on this question so these precious children can be protected from lethal discrimination,â she said.

articles.title: Donald Trump: Hunter Biden Couldnât Recognize a Gas Tank
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump continued attacking Joe Bidenâs son Hunter Biden on Friday, during a political rally in Louisiana.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âHe doesnât know what a gasoline tank looks like,â Trump said, explaining that Bidenâs son knew nothing about energy despite earning up to $83,000 a month for sitting on a board of a corrupt energy company in Ukraine. Trump also ripped Hunter for leaving China with $1.5 billion in investments from the bank of China despite knowing ânothing.â He also mocked the news broadcasts for repeatedly saying that Trumpâs claims of corruption were âtotally unsubstantiatedâ â¦ at Bidenâs request. âItâs not unsubstantiated, he took a fortune out of Ukraine, knew nothing, took a fortune out of China,â he said. He expressed skepticism that Hunter Biden was able to get $1.5 billion in Chinese investments because they thought he was a good investment. âFor a guy to walk in from off the street with no experience, a bad track record, just got thrown out of the navy, and he walks away with $1.5 billion?â Trump said. Trump commented that the âfake newsâ would never allow any of his children to do the same thing. âCan you imagine if Don Jr. or if Eric Trump, or beautiful Ivanka â¦ can you imagine if they walked out with $1.5 billion?â Trump asked. âThey wouldnât say âtotally unsubstantiated.â They would say, âWhere is the nearest cell?â Trump commented that Hunter Biden continued to be absent from Bidenâs campaign. âBy the way, whereâs Hunter?â Trump said, recalling his speech on Thursday night at a rally in Minnesota. He noted that his campaign made his question into a t-shirt that was selling in record numbers.

articles.title: Donald Trump: Oprah Used to Like Me â And the Key Lime Pie at Mar-a-Lago
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump on Friday recalled the time when Oprah Winfrey liked him before he was elected president.
articles.author: Charlie Spiering
articles.content: âOprah used to be a really big friend of mine, she used to go to Mar-a-Lago, a place I have in Palm Beach,â Trump recalled during his rally in Louisiana on Friday night. âShe loved Mar-a-Lago, she loved the key lime pie,â as the crowd chuckled. Trump added, âNo, so do I. She loved the key lime pie.â âShe used to go. She loved me until I decided to run for office,â Trump recalled that Winfrey and former President Barack Obama campaigned for Stacy Abrams in the state of Georgia, but that she still lost to Brian Kemp in the race for governor. Prior to being the president, Trump frequently praised Oprah as an entrepreneur and a successful television host. âI think Oprah is great, I love her, sheâs a friend of mine,â Trump said during an interview with Piers Morgan in 2011. âI think sheâs an incredible woman, a beautiful woman.â  In 1988, a much younger Trump even teased a run for president during an appearance on Oprahâs show.  In 1999, Trump even suggested that Oprah could be his Vice President if he ran for president.

articles.title: Gabbard: âWould Be a Poor Decisionâ to Allow VPâs Son to Sit on Ukrainian Energy Board
articles.subtitle: null
articles.author: Ian Hanchett
articles.content: During an interview with Hill.TVâs âRisingâ on Friday, 2020 presidential candidate Representative Tulsi Gabbard (D-HI) stated that the perception of Hunter Bidenâs seat on the board of a Ukrainian energy company is concerning, and allowing a VPâs son to sit on such a board âwould be a poor decision to make.â Gabbard said, âI donât know what went into that or how he got hired or why or what influence there was used, if any, but I think the perception is certainly a concern.â Co-host Krystal Ball then asked Gabbard if she would allow her vice presidentâs son to be on the board of a Ukrainian energy company âif that was in his portfolio?â Gabbard responded, âI think that would be a poor decision to make.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.title: Trump to Louisianans: Democrat Gov. Will Not Protect 2nd Amendment
articles.subtitle: During his rally on October 11, 2019, President Donald Trump warned Louisiana voters that Democrat Gov. John Bel Edwards âwill not protect your Second Amendment.â
articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.content: National Review reports that Edwards is in a âjungle primaryâ on Saturday, in which he is running against two Republicans. He has to get at least 50 percent of the overall vote to hold his position as governor. Trump told voters that both of the Republican candidates â Ralph Abraham and Eddie Rispone â are committed to protecting the Second Amendment. But he made it clear that Edwards cannot be trusted to protect Louisianianâs gun rights. Trump said: John Bel Edwards, when it gets close, and they start calling from Washington, and Schumer and Pelosi call, âWe want you to get rid of the Second Amendment,â heâs 100 percent going to drop the Second Amendment. Youâre not going to have the rights that you have or anywhere close. He added, âJohn Bel Edwards will not protect your Second Amendment.â AWRÂ Hawkins is an award-winning Second Amendment columnist for Breitbart NewsÂ and the writer/curator ofÂ Down Range with AWR Hawkins,Â a weekly newsletter focused on all things Second Amendment, also for Breitbart News. He is the political analyst for Armed American Radio. Follow him on Twitter:Â @AWRHawkins. Reach him directly atÂ awrhawkins@breitbart.com. Sign up to get Down Range atÂ breitbart.com/downrange.

articles.title: Trump: âLooks Like Bernie Lost His Chanceâ in 2020 Race
articles.subtitle: President Trump held a rally inÂ Lake Charles, Louisiana, on Friday to stump for Republicans ahead of the stateâs gubernatorial election.
articles.author: Hannah Bleau
articles.content: Trump remarked on the state of the 2020 presidential race, declaring that Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) âlost his chance.â âJohn Bel Edwards was a superdelegate for Crooked Hillary Clinton,â Trump said. âAnd he supportedââ Trump began, before mentioning Sanders, who underwent a heart procedure after suffering a heart attack last week. âBy the way, looks like Bernie lost his chance,â Trump said. âBernie was hitting a baseball today to show how strong he was. There just wasnât a lot of bat head speed.â Trump was referencing the video the socialist senator and presidential hopeful posted to Twitter on Thursday. âPlayoff baseball comes to our backyard,â Sanders wrote alongside the video featuring himself swinging a bat:  Trump did, however, wish Sanders well. âBernie get better fast. But Bernieâ get better fast,â Trump said, remarking that it was âthe only time Iâve ever said anything good about him.â âBut boy did they take advantage of him four years ago, and he let them do it,â Trump continued. âYou canât do that. You canât let people take advantage. He figured âIâll wait four years.â Thatâs a little bit tough.â Trump predicted that when Sanders â who has fallen to a distant third in recent national polls â inevitably drops out, supporters will flock to Warren, and that will âunfortunately be the end of Sleepy Joe.â âBut it looks like when Bernie gets out â which seems inevitable â when Bernie gets out, it looks like those will go to your radical leftist Elizabeth Warren,â Trump said, sparking boos. âAnd that will, unfortunately, be the end of Sleepy Joe,â Trump continued, adding that he would âmost likeâ to run against him, quickly noting that he does not really have a strong preference. âWhoever it is, just get them out there,â Trump added. âLetâs get this thing going.â

articles.title: Trump Introduces Little League World Series Champs at Rally
articles.subtitle: President Donald Trump welcomed the winners of the Little League World Series on stage at a âKeep America Greatâ rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana, on Friday evening.
articles.author: Katherine Rodriguez
articles.content: âIâd like to welcome the winners of the 2019 Little League World Series Championships,â Trump said. âLook at these handsome kids. It drives me crazy how good looking they are.â âThey won! Theyâre the whole deal; theyâre number one in the world,â Trump said, adding that he got so used to watching Japan win and it would always âbe a bit controversial.â âBut this year, you have the world champions â Little League â from Louisiana,â Trump said to cheers in the audience. The president then read each of the names of the players one by one, congratulating them on their big win. âSo congratulations to Will Andraide, Gavin Berry â come on up here kids â Jeffrey Curtis, Ryan Darrah, Derek Delatte, Marshall Louque, Connor Perrot, Ryder Planchard, Egan Prather, Reece Roussell, Alton Shorts, Peyton Spadoni, and Stan Wiltz.â âThank you all for the support,â one of the players said. âSo whereâs this big pitcher?â Somebodyâs gonna make a lot of money representing this guy.â âYou ready for the major leagues someday?â Trump asked the pitcher, to which the pitcher modestly said, âyes.â Trump firstÂ welcomed the team, the Louisiana Eastbank All Stars, on Air Force One earlier in the day after a planned visit to the White House.

articles.title: WatchâTrump: âMexico Helps Moreâ to Stop Illegal Immigration than Democrats
articles.subtitle: President Trump says the nation of Mexico is helping the United States more to stop illegal immigration at the U.S.-Mexico border than elected Democrats.
articles.author: John Binder
articles.content: During a rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana on Friday night, Trump slammed Democrats for failing to work with his administration to stop illegal immigration, and he thanked Mexico for its cooperation and putting troops on the Mexican side of the border. Trump said: On issue after issue, Democrats have put the needs of foreign citizens ahead of our own citizens. We protect borders of other countries, but we donât protect our own borders. But I want to thank Mexico â¦ 27,000 Mexican soldiers are on our border and you see the numbers, they plummeted â¦ all because the Democrats wouldnât approve simple changes to what we call the loopholes. âSo Mexico has helped us more at our border than the Democrats,â Trump said. âHonestly, theyâre terrible.â Trump said it is no wonder that foreign nationals flood the nationâs border when every leading 2020 Democrat â including Joe Biden, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), and Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) â has promised to provide free, taxpayer-funded healthcare to all 11 to 22 million illegal aliens, a program that would cost anywhere between $23 to $66 billion every year. Trump saidâ And then you wonder why they come to America. Why wouldnât they come? Free healthcare, free education, free everything â¦ the Democrat vision of America is to rob American taxpayers to fund socialism for the entire world. If you donât want Democrats to raid your healthcare, steal your money, overcrowd your schools, and overwhelm your communities, then you have only one choice, you have to go out tomorrow, vote Republican. Get John Bel Edwards the hell out of office. As Breitbart News has reported, Trump has negotiated deals with Mexico to increase border controls on the Mexican side of the border to stop illegal aliens from crossing into the U.S. The most notable is Trumpâs âRemain in Mexicoâ policy that ends the process by which border crossers are released into the interior of the country and instead returned to Mexico, preventing mass asylum fraud. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: WatchâTrump: Democrats âCheat Like Hellâ by Encouraging Voter Fraud
articles.subtitle: President Trump says elected Democrats are continuing to âencourage foreign interferenceâ in American elections with their opposition to national voter ID laws.
articles.author: John Binder
