articles.content: During a rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana on Friday evening, Trump said Democrats support voter fraud and oppose voter ID laws because âthey cheat like hellâ in national elections by getting non-citizens to vote. âThe radical Democratsâ assault on American freedom and American citizenship will now end,â Trump said. âDemocrats also continue to encourage foreign interference in our elections by refusing to support a simple and beautiful thing called voter ID.â âIf you want to go out and buy groceries, you need identification â¦ the only thing you [donât] need identification is to vote â the most important single thing youâre doing,â Trump continued. âYou know why, because they cheat like hell, thatâs why,â Trump said. In contrast, Trump said only American citizens must be allowed to vote in elections and that this should be supported through national voter ID laws that protect the integrity of American citizensâ votes. âWe believe only American citizens should vote in American elections and thatâs not whatâs happening,â Trump said. âYou go out to California and you see whatâs happening, itâs a disgrace. The voter abuse, itâs a disgrace whatâs happening in California.â Trump went on to say: In everything I do, I never forget that I am not president of the world, I am president of the United States of America. We reject globalism and we embrace patriotism. We believe that every American citizen, no matter their background, deserves a government that is loyal to them. The Democrat Party and the radical Left are trying to abolish the distinction between citizens and non-citizens. In many cases, people that come into our country illegally â¦ they were treated better than our Vets â¦ not anymore. As Breitbart News has reported, voter fraud is widespread across states like California, Texas, and Florida, according to experts. In Texas, for example, there are roughly 95,000 noncitizens on the voter rolls. Likewise, in California, expert Eric Eggers has detailed how the stateâs enormous illegal alien population is likely being facilitated to vote through the stateâs ballot harvesting policy. John Binder is a reporter for Breitbart News. Follow him on Twitter atÂ @JxhnBinder.

articles.title: Trump: Democrats Pursuing âUnconstitutional Bullshit Impeachmentâ
articles.subtitle: The radical Democrat politicians are corrupt and âtheir candidates are terrible,â President Donald Trump said during a rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana, on Friday.
articles.author: Amy Furr
articles.content:
âWeâve been living through this so-called âinsurance policyâ because they know weâre putting a stop to their pillaging and their plundering and their hoaxes,â Trump said, referring to text messages sent between former Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) employees Peter Strzok and Lisa Page in which they discussed stopping him from becoming president in 2016. âThe radical Democratsâ policies are crazy, their politicians are corrupt, their candidates are terrible, and they know they canât win on Election Day so theyâre pursuing an illegal, invalid, and unconstitutional bullshit impeachment,â the president concluded. On Wednesday, Breitbart News reported that 2020 presidential candidate and former Vice President Joe Biden accusedÂ Trump of obstructing justice and violating his oath of office. âYou know, to preserve our constitution, our democracy, our basic integrity,â Biden said, âhe should be impeached. Thatâs not only because of what heâs done. To answer whether heâs committed acts sufficient to warrant impeachment is obvious.â âItâs no joke. Heâs shooting holes in the Constitution, and we can not let him get away with it,â Biden concluded. However, President Trump defended himself against the Democratsâ calls for impeachment on Wednesday by tweeting that he did nothing wrong: Only 25 percent want the President Impeached, which is pretty low considering the volume of Fake News coverage, but pretty high considering the fact that I did NOTHING wrong. It is all just a continuation of the greatest Scam and Witch Hunt in the history of our Country! â Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 9, 2019  On Thursday, Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) echoed the presidentâs statements by saying that Democrats were using impeachment as a political campaign: This isnât impeachment. This is a political campaign. Democrats know they wonât win a REAL campaign, so they are:
-Abusing House procedures

-Hiding the truth from the American people Theyâre just making the rules up as they go along. â Rep. Jim Jordan (@Jim_Jordan) October 10, 2019  On Wednesday, Jordan wrote on Twitter that Democrats were âso busy âstriking while the iron is hotâ that they didnât even have a vote to start their crazy impeachment proceedings!â âOr maybe they didnât want to go on record for the American people. President Trump is right to call them out for this biased & unfair process,â he concluded.

Heâs never [been] my favorite, but if heâs the guy to beat Trump, I was like, letâs not kill him. Because if heâs the one â but I must say, my confidence that he can beat Trump is waning. He looks like a depreciating stock to me.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett

articles.content: During an interview with Fox News Radio on Friday, Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Lindsey Graham (R-SC) praised Trump legal team member and former Representative Trey Gowdy (R-SC), but cautioned that âit wonât matter if the president wonât listen to him.â Graham said, âHeâs a smart lawyer, but it wonât matter if the president wonât listen to him. Hereâs the argument I would be making right now: Whatâs going on in the House, youâre shutting out Republicans in an impeachment process.â Graham later added, âWell, the president, in many ways, is his own best defender. In many ways, heâs his own worst enemy.â Follow Ian Hanchett on TwitterÂ @IanHanchett
